We can tackle any problem, Big or Small from the Independent Retailer to the Multi-National Corporations.

We have carried out numerous projects from Inception to Launch for a number of “Blue Chip FMCG Companies” some of which are listed within the FTSE 100 Index.

Description: How the company was set up
Dianthus Medical Limited was established in 1999 by Dr Adam Jacobs, who has over 14 years experience working in the medical writing industry. Initially, Adam worked by himself, but as his list of satisfied clients grew he started recruiting other staff to help meet the demand, taking on the first in 2001. The company has continued to grow gradually since then, and there are now 10 of us. See staff profiles <staff.php> for more details of the current team.
It is our philosophy to grow the company slowly, ensuring that any expansion is sustainable and does not impact on the stability or the personal touch that our customers have come to rely on.

Parent Company: Omnicom
Description: The new office in Burj Dubai Square has already created a buzz in the advertising industry for the details involved in developing an environment that maximises the creative potential of the 200 professionals who are bringing new levels of creativity to the market. 

'We want our agency to be recognized as the centre of communications excellence for the Middle East and North Africa. A place where advertisers turn to, for great campaigns and where talented advertising people come to develop bright careers,' explained Ramzi Raad, Chairman and CEO of TBWA\RAAD. 

'Knowing that the industry is driven by young people, we have really thrown all the conventions out of the window with our new office. It has all the elements and details necessary to provide both the best creative positive and pleasant atmosphere in which we can work to create disruptive campaigns - and our premises are ideal for doing just that!'


Now in its eighth year (2009), TBWA\RAAD has ensured that its new offices at Burj Dubai Square contain a range of features to maximise the creative environment of the agency. A range of attractive features for everyone includes an indoor basketball court and indoor garden. Staff can also play pool, bar football or chill out on massive beanbags while brainstorming on the latest campaigns. A cafeteria that offers a delicious range of healthy foods enables staff to have the right energy to keep up the pace on their active working lifestyles as well. For those who want to learn more, a library is available to expand their knowledge. 

TBWA\RAAD is also partnering with the best advertising education institute in the world - the Miami Ad School - to take on the brightest and best students. Currently TBWA\RAAD has two interns and is looking to increase numbers while taking part in the Greenhouse in-agency learning program, which provides lessons and tutelage from within the agency. 

The offices also include dedicated Project Rooms - given over to projects and campaigns where branding around specific campaigns is laid out over the long term to develop and innovate the brand. 

TBWA\RAAD's sister agencies, TEQUILA\MIDDLE EAST and TBWA\RAAD\PR, exclusive affiliate of KETCHUM, have offices on the same floor, making it the most advanced integrated agency in the region. 

The office can be found on the 6th floor of Building One of Burj Dubai Square.

Description: Telecoms PR specialists

Temono is a B2B communications services company for the wireless telecoms industry. We specialise in wireless telecoms and all our clients are in this industry and no other.
We believe that to effectively communicate with the telecoms media and analyst communities the key is knowledge of the technologies, issues and market dynamics that drive the industry.
For this reason all of our consultants are highly knowledgeable within the mobile domain, knowing their OFDMs from their HSDPAs and their BREWs from their MIDPs.


Temono delivers full-service PR and marketing consultancy. We provide our clients with the complete range of external communications tools to raise awareness amongst external stakeholders, whether they be prospects, clients or industry peers. The core services which we offer include:

Description: Champollion is a young firm, owned and run by a team of experienced professionals. Between us, we have presented, directed and produced television news and current affairs programmes. We have staffed the newsrooms of intelligent broadsheets and popular tabloids, and written for a host of weekly and monthly magazines. We have held jobs in the headquarters of political parties and in Parliament, working closely with MPs from all sides, from the Prime Minister down. We have had senior responsibilities in very high-profile campaigns, including general elections, on the most controversial topics. And we have successfully managed front-page issues for clients ranging from blue-chip global businesses to tiny charities.

Since the summer of 2005 we have been building our own culture, a supportive and enterprising environment, choosing to work with people and issues we really care about. We offer a tailor-made service, shaped by the demands of our clients, in contrast to the one-size-fits-all attitude of many other firms. We provide high-level strategic advice, as well as the ability to deliver practical output, with an unrivalled appreciation of public policy issues, for organisations large and small. We have full command of all the relevant communications disciplines, with a proper understanding of how they relate to each other. Above all, we are proud of our values, our clients and our work.

The range of specific services we offer to support our clients include:

media management - from strategic guidance to a comprehensive press office service that includes drafting statements, briefing journalists and managing interventions in all forums of debate
  
media & message training - with experienced professionals, role-plays recorded as real by TV cameras for review, and disciplined message drilling
  
media monitoring & analysis - much more than a press cuttings service, an insider's appreciation of what the latest news really means
  
stakeholder relations - opinion formers' surveys, focus groups, contact-building programmes and sustained communication plans
  
reputation management & corporate communications - planning and implementing ways of promoting an organisation's strategic position or presenting a digestible narrative about its everyday work
  
public affairs - if you want an agency that promises privileged access to decision-takers then kindly look elsewhere - what we promise is a sophisticated understanding of how Parliament and Whitehall really work and help in presenting your case there
  
policy analysis & forecasting - staying ahead of current thinking in public policy debates, knowing what lines of argument will emerge from government, think-tanks, pressure groups and others across the political spectrum
  
bespoke event organisation - from press conferences and policy seminars to weekends away, a professional one-stop-shop service that takes care of every detail

company-note:
Description: Consumer Focus is the new statutory consumer body created from the merger of the National Consumer Council, Energywatch and Postwatch.


Thursday, 7 August 2008 
The new body being set up by the government to fight for the rights of consumers will be called Consumer Focus.
Consumer Focus will start work on 1 October. It will be formed through the merger of the National Consumer Council, energywatch and Postwatch, creating a more powerful consumer champion, with stronger statutory powers and a wider remit.
Consumer Affairs Minister Gareth Thomas said: "One body, rather than three, means a stronger voice fighting for consumers. It means a joined up and co-ordinated approach to tackling problems, rather than the old fragmented system."
"These difficult economic times make Consumer Focus even more important. I'm sure it will campaign hard for better deals for consumers and do all it can to help people through this period of uncertainty."

Description:  Research International France has been in existence since 1952. It is wholly-owned by the Research International Group. Research International France is one of the leading full-service market research agencies in France. 
Specialisms 

As a pioneer among research agencies in France, the company has wide experience in all types of studies - as much in qualitative as in quantitative. Some areas of particular expertise are: 


Innovation and the New Product Development process 
Branding and Communication (PubliTest our advertising pretest has been developed in RI France) 
Consumer Understanding and Strategy 
Category Marketing and Channel Management 
Customer Satisfaction 
Business Measurement
Clients 

Research International France works for a large number of local and international clients in sectors including: 


Food 
Cleaning products 
Finance / insurance 
Personal products 
Telecomms / IT / New Media 
Industrial 
Public services ,li>Transport 
Automotive 
Luxury goods
Facilities 

Research International France has permanent field centres in Paris, Lyon and Lille. We have a CAPI fieldforce and 90 CATI stations for telephone interviewing. For qualitative research there are a number of rooms equipped with video systems and one way mirror. 

Data Processing 

The company uses the Quantum package - Quancept and In2itive are the main vehicles for CATI/CAPI. Other softwares such as Quanvert, Excell or SPSS are widely used for post-analysis.

Description: The Crocodile is an award-winning B2B marketing agency focused on influencing customer buying behaviour and generating qualified opportunities. We recognise that the best B2B marketing strategies no longer stop at the door of the sales department. We think marketing works best when it shares the commercial objectives of the business – and can make a measurable contribution. 

We specialise in: 

- Creating response through impactful, data driven campaigns integrated across multiple channels 

- Initiating meaningful conversations with customers through a mix of high value content, social media and PR 

- Representing brands online by developing clever and engaging digital assets and communications 

- Nurturing prospects and customers using automation technology to converge and convert response into sales intelligence 

In a B2B world that’s rapidly changing, fragmenting and delivering new and enticing communication options, The Crocodile helps clients develop and deliver clear strategies that effect the greatest change in customers’ buying behaviour – and generate qualified, measurable opportunities.

Description: Sport & Sponsorship 
Bell Pottinger Sport & Sponsorship is one of the UK’s leading agencies specialising in sports and entertainment sponsorship. Our experience is in delivering strategic, creative and implementation services for brands and rights holders in all forms of sponsorship around the globe. We work in partnership with our clients’ marketing teams to deliver high profile, hugely impactful and tightly-focused campaigns that generate maximum value from sponsorship investments, forged through relationships with rights holders, suppliers and excellent contacts with sports, consumer, business and trade media in the UK, Europe and globally. 

Our strategic and creative thinking is second to none, and we provide an extensive range of tactical services that can be quickly personalised to meet the needs of each individual client, including media relations, all aspects of event management and digital marketing.

To find out more about how we can help manage this complex issue, please contact Susan McMahon , the Managing Director of Bell Pottinger Sport & Sponsorship.

Description: About Us 
Upward Curve PR is an ethical communications agency dedicated to promoting social, environmental and economic issues. 
We are passionate about what we do, bringing together extensive experience and a can-do attitude to provide our clients with the help and advice that they need. 
Upward Curve PR has a strong ethical stance which influences how we work on every level. 
We look after our team members, offering individual training programmes, broad personal development opportunities and flexible working. 
We also make sure that we 'give back' to the not for profit and public sectors in which we operate; providing pro bono communications support for smaller charities unable to afford consultancy fees, speaking at industry events and offering free training. We also adopt a 'charity of the year' which we support financially and through pro-bono support.
With experience of communicating a wide range of issues to many different audiences, we have unparalleled knowledge of the sectors we work in. From housing, education and healthcare to transport, regeneration and recycling.

Description: L’équipe de direction.
Meanings est dirigée par Bruno Scaramuzzino et Manuel Lagny, directeurs associés et par Marc Saint-Ouen, directeur général. Céline Labat, DGA, est en charge du développement. Côté Digital Meanings, c’est Éric Lemoine qui tient la direction générale. Quant à notre petite dernière, Meanings Event, elle est dirigée par Béatrice de Cambolas.

Les patrons d’équipes. Ou plutôt, les patronnes…
L’agence est organisée autour de cinq équipes opérationnelles, capables de répondre à 360 degrés aux besoins de communication de nos clients. Autrement dit, chez Meanings, il n’y a pas les consultants d’un côté et les « experts métiers » de l’autre. Lorsqu’on vous présente une équipe, c’est la vôtre dans la durée. Avec une directrice conseil (ou un directeur conseil) qui s’appuie sur 5 à 6 collaborateurs, l’un venu des études, l’autre de la presse, le troisième du digital, son voisin des RP, de la com publique ou encore du consulting…
Cette organisation en équipes projets ultra mobiles et compactes vous offre deux grands avantages : elle vous assure une plus grande efficacité dans la mise en œuvre de vos projets et elle vous simplifie la vie.

Nos patron(ne)s : Stéphanie Gravière, Virginie Marchal, Sandrine Mohr, Valentine Baud et Antoine Barbier-Bouvet.

Vincent Junier est notre Directeur de création.

Description: We have an outstanding track record of helping organisations address their most important business challenges with communications.

When communication matters, our clients use our experience and expertise to advise on issues affecting decisions, valuation, change and reputation.

Founded in 2002 in Munich and London, we have built an international network of 11 offices across eight countries. The merger with Capital MSL in January 2015 strengthened our London-hub and added offices in the Middle East. Our success is built upon the quality and creativity of the 140 strong team, a large number of whom have significant operational experience in industry, finance, politics and the media. We use this expertise and our long-standing networks to deliver results-driven consultancy to management teams and their advisers.

We pride ourselves on our enduring relationships with clients and those they communicate with: the key stakeholders in media, industry, finance and politics.

As a member of MSLGROUP, we have the ability to draw upon the expertise of some of the world’s leading strategic communications firms to support our clients wherever required.

Description: - Sparkler is a consumer insight and brand strategy consultancy.

- We work with a host of blue chip clients including the BBC, Sony, Sainsbury’s, Kraft, Microsoft, LOVEFiLM, Nokia, eBay and Universal Music. And have just been announced winners of the 2011 MRS Best Agency award.

- Our expertise lies in understanding the fast-evolving interplay between consumers, digital media and brands; and helping our clients develop strategies for success. We call this ‘3D thinking’.

- Market research, both qualitative and quantitative, is the start point for much of our work, providing the platform for projects including brand and business development, brand positioning, marketing strategy, communications strategy and creative development.

- We are constantly innovating - finding new ways of engaging and involving consumers; harnessing the potential of emerging digital technologies; and using design via SparklerStudio to bring findings to life.

Parent Company: Edelman
Description: Edelman to Acquire Award-Winning Agency DABO & CO
PUBLISHED APRIL 12, 2015

 75
 
 0
SHARE
MAIL
PRINT
SAVE TO FOLIO
Edelman, a leading communications marketing firm, today announced its plans to acquire independent communications agency DABO & CO.

The combination of Edelman’s United Arab Emirates operations with those of DABO & CO will create a new leader in the Middle East communications industry. Together, they will meet the demand of clients and brands for increasingly integrated communications marketing and business solutions. In addition to providing economies of scale, the new operation will encompass 150 employees with a broad range of expertise from corporate to marketing to digital. The agency will offer creative, planning, research and event management capabilities across the region.

“Globally Edelman looks to invest in firms that are committed to reshaping the focus of the communications marketing industry, and DABO & CO demonstrates this vision through its highly creative, client-centric approach,” said Matthew Harrington, global chief operating officer, Edelman. “As the industry develops in the Middle East, this partnership will position us to create engaging and innovative communications programs that support our clients’ needs.”

Edelman UAE opened its first office in Abu Dhabi in 2008 and is now the fastest growing operation in Edelman’s global network. Its award-winning team of over 85 consultants across Abu Dhabi and Dubai has secured its position as one of the leading communications marketing firms in the UAE. With a broad array of expertise covering Corporate, Digital, Technology, Health and Consumer, as well as Research and Analytics through Edelman Berland, Edelman works for many of the UAE’s leading organizations and numerous multinationals.

“This is a classic partnership where the whole is greater than the sum of its parts,” said Robert Holdheim, CEO – South Asia, Middle East & Africa, Edelman. “Edelman’s leading position as a full service agency complements DABO & CO’s creativity, excellent reputation in consumer communications and strength in events and experiential marketing. Add Edelman’s regional and global strength and you have a combination that we feel will be hard to beat.”

Over the past 10 years, DABO & CO has grown rapidly to become a full-scale, highly creative communications and experiential marketing business ranked by the Holmes Report as one of the 10 fastest growing firms in Asia Pacific in 2013. Its impressive roster of clients and innovative approach to integrated client solutions has ensured its excellent track record and award-winning reputation. Co-founded by Camilla and Lucy d’Abo, the Dubai-based agency has more than 60 staff and represents many of the world’s leading brands.

“We are excited to partner with Edelman as we believe this acquisition will unite two of the leading players in the market to create a regional powerhouse,” said Camilla d’Abo, managing partner, DABO & CO. “It will provide enormous opportunities to leverage the strength of the Edelman network and intellectual capital, combined with our award-winning creativity and commitment to exceptional levels of client servicing. Not only will our existing clients benefit greatly from this, it also constitutes a compelling proposition to brands seeking a new integrated approach in the region.”

“Edelman’s belief in integrated communications entirely mirrors our own,” added Lucy d’Abo, managing partner, DABO & CO. “Over the pa

Description: As a global leader in brand consulting and design, Landor helps clients create agile brands that thrive in today’s dynamic, disruptive marketplace. Our work enables top brands—from Barclays to BMW and Tide to Taj—to stand for something while never standing still. 

Landor’s branding services include strategy and positioning, identity and design, brand architecture, innovation, naming and verbal branding, research and analytics, environments and experience, engagement and activation, and digital and social media. 

Founded by Walter Landor in 1941, Landor pioneered many of the research, design, and consulting methods that are now standard in the branding industry. Today, Landor has 27 offices in 21 countries, working with a broad spectrum of world-famous brands. Clients include Barclays, Bayer, BMW, BP, Diageo, FedEx, GE, Intuit, Kraft Foods, MillerCoors, Procter & Gamble, Samsung, Singapore Airlines, and Taj Group. 

Landor is a member of the Young & Rubicam Group network within WPP, the world's largest marketing and communications firm. 

We currently have 27 offices in 21 countries around the world. For more information, please visit us at www.landor.com and follow us on Facebook and Twitter. #landor

2 hour interview
1 hour - face to face with a panel of five - Richard Patient (MD), Matt Harmer (CCO), 3 Team Leaders, Deborah Paterson (OD)
They will ask them a question around business development 'how do you find new property clients or business?' Description: 
Hello. 
We're MARS London. The shopper marketing agency. 

We're shopper obsessives. 
Who they are. Where and when they shop. And most importantly why and how they shop. 

We make it our job to understand how shoppers behave all the way along their shopping journeys. Like all good stories – at the start, the middle and the end ...and often into their happy ever (or sometimes never) afters.

Understanding shopper behaviour is only part of the story. Knowing how and where to talk to them is critical. And we pride ourselves in our ability to connect with shoppers everywhere. We do this through hard-focus in our channel planning and activation ability and the specialist output of our brilliant creative people. 

We have a simple, collective approach for everything: 

Do fewer things brilliantly. 

And to get there, we try and take the most direct route (even if it’s not always the easiest). And we do this by looking out for each other, no matter what. 

MARS London Europe was created through the coming together of global agency power-house US Shopper Marketing #1 Agency, MARS. Our European head office is in London but we work all over Europe and across the world with our friends and colleagues throughout our network. 

We're obsessed about Shoppers. 
We’re MARS London. 

We share a set of common values that drive our success, all built on our collective approach to do fewer things, brilliantly. To get where we want to go we take the most direct route.
And we do this by looking out for each other, no matter what.

It's a culture that breeds positive results for our clients too, as we consistently create and implement powerful campaigns that directly influence shoppers' behaviour.


We make it our job to understand how shoppers behave all the way along their shopping journeys, so we can help influence them next time they shop. But understanding shopper behaviour is only part of the story: Knowing how and where to talk to them is critical and we pride ourselves in our ability to connect with Shoppers everywhere, whether traditional retail environments or across emerging digital spaces.

Central to our approach is our Shopper's Journey™ tool, a proprietary methodology for identifying insights and activating brands against them.

Description:  


Continuing our commitment to bring sales and marketing intelligence to the global marketplace, MarketOne opened our European-based operations headquartered in London, England on May 1st of 2002. Our London organization services our clients’ European-based operations with a local presence and extends MarketOne’s reach into new markets. 

The Managing Director of our UK operations is Enrico Brosio. Brosio, a multi-lingual Harvard MBA, brings an extensive background in building and managing tele-discovery operations to MarketOne. In selecting London, MarketOne has been able to tap into a multi-lingual workforce, versed in technology, that understands the unique selling etiquettes and relationship building-styles found in different cultures. 

Initially, the London office was staffed with veteran MarketOne sales analysts and managers, chartered to train new employees and execute programs based on MarketOne’s proven methodologies. In doing so, MarketOne further increased its ability to run programs focused on European markets, while replicating the same high quality deliverables our clients had come to expect. Many of the analysts we sent to the London office have stayed, becoming a permanent part of our European operations. 

MarketOne International, LLP is located in Chiswick, west of London, and is conveniently located near the M4 and Heathrow Airport, and is a short walk from the Chiswick Park and Gunnersbury tube stations. 

  

Last updated July 1, 2004 | ©2004 MarketOne International, Inc. | Sitemap


View Directions & Map

Tel: +44 (0) 870 220 2700
Fax: +44 (0) 870 220 2701

	

www.marketone.com


International Sales Analysts

MarketOne helps the world's largest technology companies expand their markets.  We seek sales and marketing professionals who understand national and international business environments. You will become part of a team chartered to develop these markets through direct contact with executives at specific target companies across Europe.  MarketOne has an impressive client list, which includes leading technology companies such as IBM, Unisys, and Siebel.

Current openings:
"	2 UK positions                      (ref NL290)  
"	1 German position 	   (ref NL291)
"	1 Dutch position 		   (ref NL292)

We are looking for candidates to be based in our London offices with very good experience of the UK, German, and/or Dutch markets with native fluency in the local language.  Successful candidates will have a minimum 3 years' experience in inside/outside sales, field research, account management and/or consulting.  You must be articulate, able to write concisely in English, have proven experience of successful outbound calling work, and be eager to engage top-level executives over the phone.  A background in technology markets is strongly preferred.  Undergraduate degree required / post graduate degree preferred. 

MarketOne offers full time, and part time project based opportunities and attractive compensation plans.  Join MarketOne and align yourself with the world's hottest tech companies.

Please send your applications in confidence quoting reference number 111 to:

Description: Wind River, a wholly owned subsidiary of Intel Corporation (NASDAQ: INTC), is a world leader in embedded and mobile software. Wind River has been pioneering computing inside embedded devices since 1981 and its technology is found in more than 500 million products.

As devices become smarter, they have more impact on the way we work, play, and live—from mobile phones that have evolved into always-on content delivery platforms, to medical devices that seamlessly integrate with patient management systems, to avionics and defense systems that enable pinpoint control and unparalleled safety. The challenge for developers is to keep the innovation flowing so that devices continue to get faster, more reliable, and more secure, while remaining affordable.

Wind River offers the industry's most comprehensive device development portfolio. Our solutions are hardware-agnostic, so you can deploy on multiple architectures, including Intel, Freescale, PowerPC, ARM, MIPS, and others. And our products are supported by outstanding professional services and customer support, hardware integration expertise, and a thriving partner ecosystem.

We're uniquely qualified to help you master the challenges of building smart, connected devices.

Description: Personne à contacter : René RIERA, Directeur Ressources Humaines - Secrétaire Général  de la CEFI / email : rene.riera@ cefi.caisse-epargne.fr

Société : Caisse d’Epargne Financement
Caisse d’Epargne Financement est la filiale du Groupe Caisse d’Epargne spécialisée dans le crédit à la consommation. Dans un contexte de développement de son activité (nouveaux produits, nouveaux partenariats en France et à l’étranger), Caisse d’Epargne Financement recherche de nouvelles compétences qui participeront à sa dynamique et son déploiement. 
Poste : Directeur communication 
Type de contrat : CDI 
Fonction : Top Management / Direction Générale 
Localisation : Paris 
Mission :
Rattaché au Directeur Général, nous créons le poste de directeur communication.
- Vous définissez et élaborez la politique communication (interne, externe et institutionnelle).
- Vous mettez en œuvre la stratégie communication.
- Vous organisez, coordonnez la mise en œuvre des actions et planifiez l’activité.- Vous gérez et suivez le budget.
- Vous créez et améliorez les processus.
- Vous contribuez à la bonne diffusion de la stratégie et des valeurs de l’entreprise. 
Expériences/compétences demandées :
Vous avez exercé des responsabilités similaires pendant une durée de 5 à 10 ans minimum.Vous êtes titulaire d’un diplôme supérieur en communication de niveau Bac + 5.Vos qualités rédactionnelles sont reconnues. Vous savez faire preuve de pédagogie, d’un esprit facilitateur entre la politique et les collaborateurs et d’un sens aigu de la communication.

Description: 21/08/08 - L'agence One intègre Lowe Groupe France
Le réseau Lowe Worldwide a procédé au rachat de 100% de l'agence française One, spécialisée en CRM, promotion, Web et nouvelles technologies. A l'issue de l'opération, dont le montant n'a pas été dévoilé, One forme, aux côtés de l'agence Lowe Strateus, les deux entités du nouveau Lowe Groupe France. Le nouvel ensemble, qui compte désormais quelque 230 collaborateurs, est codirigé par les managers des deux agences et présidé par Eric Zajdermann. Ce dernier explique : "L'opération nous permet de compléter notre offre en marketing services par l'acquisition d'une agence". Elle permet en outre de renforcer l'expertise du groupe sur les secteurs de la distribution, de l'automobile et le secteur banque-assurance. One compte notamment parmi ses clients la MAAF, la SNCF, Lancia, le CIC, Iveco, Conforama, Vulcania, Conforama et le Groupe La Poste. L'intégration de l'agence au sein du réseau Lowe lui permettra de répondre à ses besoins d'internationalisation et d'intégrer des compétences publicitaires. L'agence One a été créée en 1986; ses co-managers sont Christophe Renaudineau, Pierre Grimaldi et Jean-Marc Aimé.

Description: 
The National Exhibition Centre is the busiest exhibition centre in Europe, staging more than 180 exhibitions each year, ranging from world-famous public shows such as Crufts Dog Show and Clotheshow Live to international trade exhibitions like IPEX and Spring Fair, Birmingham. 
Up to four million people visit the centre each year. With 21 halls totalling 200,000 square metres (two million square feet) it is also the biggest exhibition centre in Britain and seventh largest in Europe. The NEC is renowned for large-scale international trade fairs, but also has an active interest in helping smaller specialist shows develop, providing advice, support and essential services to organisers.

The flexible, flat-floored, interconnected halls offer endless possibilities for all types of exhibitions and events, complemented by extensive conference and banqueting facilities. The award-winning catering team operate restaurants, cafes and bars throughout the centre, serving meals with quality, imagination and style.

Description: StickyGinger is a boutique agency based in Dubai, specialising in art, design, fashion and lifestyle. This cross section of areas stems from and leads back to one thing.

Passion.

We don’t call ourselves a creative agency. (After all, everyone else seems to). We’re different and we offer a different perspective when it comes to PR. We understand that each brand is unique and therefore all associated visibility and messaging needs to be too.

There really is no such thing as ‘standard PR’ as PR should never be standard. It should be eccentric, elaborate and exciting. It’s the WOW factor that gets you noticed within your market and audience. Who wants to blend in with the crowd? At StickyGinger, we believe that you should never follow, but lead.

Co-founders of StickyGinger, Lucy Freeman and Kiera Purdue set up the agency to answer the ever-growing needs of the Middle Eastern market; that of a team that not only understands how, when and where to expose a brand and its offerings effectively in the market by using varied communication in innovative and creative ways – but to be exquisitely and unashamedly passionate about what we do.

StickyGinger felt that the creative communication market was being handled in a generic and nameless way - and this was something we wanted to change. As an agency, we want to make sure that every person we speak to knows us by name, who we are and how we take our coffee (skinny decaf cap with wings, if you’re interested) and we want to know the same about them. Working closely with the media and collaborative partners requires real relationships, rather than virtual ones, which means that our ‘databases’ are built on strong ties and not paid-for lists; something we pride ourselves on.

StickyGinger specialises and works only in sectors which excite and impassion us – meaning that we basically love what we do, and do what we love – which makes for an extremely effective working environment, and we believe and can prove that it shows in our work.

Why the name ‘StickyGinger’? 

We’re still working this one out. Answers on a postcard please.

Description: Legal PR - media relations that work for your organisation
As the legal profession becomes increasingly competitive and client focused, law firms, barristers chambers and legal associations are realising the benefits that a strong media profile can have on their standing in the marketplace - in relation to their clients, potential clients, peers, staff and other stakeholders.
Good media relations involves ensuring that the external perception of your organisation is an accurate perception. We work with our legal clients to develop effective media relations programmes across the legal PR spectrum - from reporting your firmwide financial results, business development plans and news of lateral hires, to positioning lawyers and barristers as 'thought leaders' in their individual areas of specialism.
Working closely with clients to pre-agreed commercial objectives, we proactively identify media opportunities, putting forward key spokespeople from your organisation to deliver powerful and insightful comment.
Given our experience of working with legal stories and across every legal discipline, together with our excellent journalist contacts, we are particularly adept at raising your profile within the national and broadcast media and trade press most important to you and your clients.
In time, we can markedly boost the media profile and perceived standing of your organisation.
Our Legal PR offering includes:
PR strategy and planning 
Media relations programmes aligned to your wider marketing and business development goals 
PR perception audits 
Media training - for fee earners and marketing staff 
Internal communications 
Article writing 
Preparing winning awards entries 

Dispute PR - winning the battle in the court of public opinion
Dispute PR is about managing the impact of media interest when conflict situations arise. Damage at the hands of the media can have serious and enduring effects on the standing of a company or individual and therefore needs to be carefully managed.
High profile disputes that are likely to result in litigation require sensitive media handling: it is vital that early action is taken so as to preserve your reputation and the reputation of your clients at a time of vulnerability.
Often, organisations are slow to identify the attendant dangers of potentially high profile disputes. Pyrrhic victories are won in the court of law while reputations can be lost in the court of public opinion, leaving those involved damaged and facing the prospect of having to rebuild their public profile. Dispute PR can help avoid this situation and give you the advantage in terms of public perception.
The Byfield Consultancy has extensive experience in managing the media in times of dispute, working closely with the client's legal team, to seamlessly dovetail media activity into the legal strategy.
We are acutely aware of the need for contempt avoidance, understand the legal process and, importantly, the legal status of information and documentation.
With a wealth of experience in Dispute PR, the Byfield Consultancy can help.
Our Dispute PR offering includes:
Media impact assessment 
Development of PR strategy aligned to legal strategy 
Pre and post-trial media positioning 
Through-trial media handling 
Spokesperson media training 
Internal communications 
Managing reputations; managing issues
The forthcoming implementation of the Legal Services Bill promises to revolutionise the way legal services are delivered, making the legal professio

Description: 3 Monkeys
Total staff 45
Staff turnover 2008
Five per cent
Training budget per head per year
£2,100

If there is a rumble in the jungle, it is from the stampede of people who want to work for 3 Monkeys. This troupe enjoys a creative, family-friendly workplace, with chief monkey Angie Moxham cultivating a strongly nurturing environment for talent to develop and grow. 
Monkeys are appraised annually and given a monkey manager to help them achieve objectives and stay mentally and emotionally fit for their roles. MD and cheeky monkey Annabel Dunstan says: ‘There is praise and encouragement at every turn. Every single one of us is given the support and opportunity to flourish and produce the best possible work in an environment that is inspiring, creative and passionate.’





LONDON OFFICE: 020 7440 2410

Sectors include: financial services, environment, IT, telecoms, retail, public sector, travel, food & drink.

MONKEY BUSINESS IS UK’s BIGGEST PR MOVER FOR 2007
3 Monkeys Communications is the biggest mover in the PR and Communications industry, according to an annual report issued in April 2007.
Industry bible PR Week’s hugely influential ‘Top 150 PR Consultancies’ issue singles out the company, praising it for a ‘staggering 354 per cent’ fee income rise, to £1.3m up to Oct 2006 – while predicting a 2007 fee income of £2.5m.
It features 3 Monkeys in its Top 10 Performers list, describing its position at 121 as ‘the biggest jump by some distance in the Top 150’, adding that the firm ‘plans to open an office in Europe and expand the newsroom, which already boasts a team of four ex-journalists who have good relationships with media contacts.’
3 Monkeys employs 30 people in its offices in Central London and Oxfordshire, and lists Scottish Widows, Royal Mail, W Hotels, Scania and Darbys among its clients.
Founder Angie Moxham said: ‘The last 12 months have been fantastic for us, from working with local clients such as Darbys Solicitors in Oxford and getting them National media exposure, to helping launch a pan-European truck driver competition for Scania.
‘The company was founded in 2003, and in 2005 we won PR Week’s New Consultancy of the Year, so this latest accolade shows we’re continuing to move rapidly in the right direction.’
Activity over the previous 12 months also included raising the media profile of actress Hayley Hunt, the ‘Scottish Widow’ in the TV ads; launching the stunning W hotel in the Maldives; and creating internet phenomenon ‘Wilfing’ (What Was I Looking For?) for moneysupermarket.com, which appeared in newspapers and on websites across the world within days.
3 Monkeys was also one of just two new agencies to win a place on the highly competitive PR roster for Royal Mail.
Angie added: ‘It really was a stonking year, and we’re now looking for new clients who want to work with us and raise their profile across the media.’

Description: Digital at the CoreDigital at the Core

We at Havas Media Middle East always put our clients first and foremost in all the work we do. Building client relationships and their brands in the region is central to our passion for excellence. So in this rapidly changing communications world, flexibility and clarity in our service offerings are essential for our clients’ needs to be met, delivered and go beyond their expectations. Our three simple business units of Planning, Buying and Digital succinctly meet these demands through strategic integration and by always placing digital at the core..

Media PlanningMedia Planning:

Our Planning Teams are responsible for the strategic decisions made on behalf of each of our clients. As stewards of their accounts, they are the client’s most direct point of contact and are responsible for making sure our clients’ needs are met, both from a management and media perspective. The Planning Teams are also the key contacts between Havas Media Middle East and our Creative and Advertising Agency partners.  When appropriate they fully participate in those areas of strategic development that are shared between the organisations, particularly consumer analysis, audience targeting and messaging strategy. 

Our Media Planning teams drive Havas Media’s proprietary working process, uncovering, addressing and solving key challenges at hand. At Havas Media we believe that communication strategy is an integral part of a brand’s business model, recognising that creative communications solutions act as a multiplier for marketing communications results. Therefore, we implement a unique planning approach that addresses the core business issues of your brand in key areas: Market, Brand, Consumer, Message and Media.

Media BuyingMedia Buying:

Our Media Buying teams are responsible for negotiation and managing all buys. However, at Havas Media Middle East, their role is much more hands-on than simply executional. Given the dynamics of today’s marketplace, our teams are trained to make strategic communications choices on a daily basis. For this reason, we ensure that buyers are as immersed in the underlying strategies of their client’s businesses as the planning teams. 

From working with our Buying and Planning Departments simultaneously, our clients receive the benefits of known industry leaders working on their business, as well as the leverage and efficiencies of consolidated buying clout. In addition to our focus on cost efficiency, we are committed to creating value in all our media buys through a combination of proprietary tools and technology and through deeper activation and engagement. At Havas Media Middle East, we leverage insights and learning across the agency, and we emphasise a tailored buying approach to your specific client needs, taking each client to market separately in order to ensure each client receives their due value.

With an ever evolving marketplace, we frame our negotiations and collaborate across all disciplines to ensure that every investment benefits the pricing overall. The goal of every construct is to create flexibility and fluidity. We work collectively with clients, planning teams and other mediums to ensure we execute a cohesive buy that delivers the appropriate target, provides efficiencies and goes above and beyond in securing integrations that build and enhance our clients' brands.

Description: Advisory Services 

We offer strategic counsel across a range of major business issues including: 

Corporate and Business Unit Strategy 
Competitive strategy at the corporate and business unit levels remains a top priority for CEOs and lies at the center of our client work. Parthenon brings together some of the most capable strategists and a wealth of accumulated experience to leverage our clients’ capabilities, assets, and relationships. Our proprietary Full Potential Paradigm™ has helped CEOs understand the most critical components of their strategies, and has pushed them to define, measure, and improve upon them. 

Profit Improvement 
One of Parthenon’s differentiating strengths is its rigorous attention to fact-based analysis. The goal of profit improvement strategy is to enhance the performance of a core business through this fact-based approach. By strategically identifying, prioritizing, and implementing both cost reduction and revenue enhancement opportunities, Parthenon has substantially increased profitability for many clients. Specific profit improvement initiatives include pricing optimization, sales and marketing effectiveness, sales force optimization, and process improvement. 

Merger and Acquisition 
From its earliest days, Parthenon recognized the importance of merger and acquisition strategies in increasingly competitive and dynamic market environments. Over its history, Parthenon has helped companies to screen, target, and transact major multi-billion dollar strategic mergers and acquisitions. A significant part of our work in this area involves an intense analytical review of synergy opportunities. Our work often runs from the inception of target analysis through due diligence and post-merger integration. Parthenon has become the strategic advisor of choice to investment firms both for the acceleration of a merger-and-acquisition process and for the assurance of maximum post-merger value creation. 

Innovation and Growth 
In 1999, Parthenon formalized its capabilities for innovation, ideation, and new growth strategies. Two overriding trends - major disruptions in technology and shifts in consumer behavior from transaction-oriented buying to “experienced-based” buying - have caused companies to contemplate the importance of new product development more than ever. In many cases, companies have decided to affect complete transformations of their businesses. Through forward-looking trend identification, new customer behavior analytical tools, “brain walking” workshops, and scenario-based thinking, Parthenon has worked with clients to generate innovative ideas and higher proportions of revenue growth from step-out businesses. 

Private Equity 
Parthenon has always demonstrated a commitment to and expertise in working with leading buyout, venture capital firms, and other investor groups. We have a dedicated group of professionals who work solely in private equity situations and this group brings together a valuable mix of background experience in operations, marketing, accounting, law, and strategy consulting. In this area, we work with a select group of top performing firms on private equity related issues such as investment opportunity due diligence, portfolio company performance, firm investment strategy, and operating strategy.

Description: contact@narratives.fr

Narratives Santé, agence de conseil en communication <communication-sante.html>, a été créée pour répondre à la problématique spécifique de la "Medical Education". Résolument ancrée dans l'imaginaire et la créativité, Narratives Santé vous propose les services d’une équipe de dessinateurs, de scénaristes, de coloristes et de créateurs multimédias capables de vous offrir la plus grande diversité graphique, dans les domaines de l'édition traditionnelle et de l'édition numérique. 
Narratives Santé s’associe à des personnalités du monde médical pour donner à ses « aventures » toute la rigueur et la pertinence scientifiques qu'exigent les thèmes abordés.
 
La bande Dessinée de communication 
La Bande Dessinée, fer de lance de la communication dessinée, est un outil puissant à utiliser pour vos programmes de formation, vos actions de sensibilisation, l'éducation et l'information des patients et de leur entourage.
Elle contribue au dialogue avec le patient et fait appel à une approche émotionnelle et psychologique capable d'influencer le comportement du médecin, du pharmacien et du patient. La lecture d'un album demande une participation active du lecteur. Elle garantit une forte attention et donc une meilleure compréhension et mémorisation du message.
La bande Dessinée associe, dans un même espace, trois moyens d'expression : l'image, le dialogue et le récit. Cette performance permet d'expliquer avec subtilité, les maladies, les pathologies ou les mécanismes les plus complexes. 
Elle est donc idéale pour véhiculer un message clair et compréhensible de tous, quel que soit le niveau culturel ou social du lecteur. 
Ses vertus pédagogiques en font un allié efficace pour résoudre tout problème de communication. Ses différents styles graphiques permettent de traiter chaque sujet selon sa tonalité spécifique, en fonction du message qui doit être véhiculé. 

La Bande Dessinée de communication :
facilite la dédramatisation des sujets délicats ou impliquant,
favorise la lecture et la mémorisation,
concrétise les notions abstraites ou les mécanismes complexes,
clarifie et personnalise les messages difficiles,
capte l'attention d’un public plutôt indifférent aux discours classiques,
obtient des taux exceptionnels de mémorisation des messages,
suscite la sympathie et renforce le caractère empathique de l'image.
améliore la prévention, l'observance et sensibilise les patients et leur entourage à une surveillance accrue des risques de santé.

Description: JM is a contract and permanent recruitment company providing IT people in the the financial sevices environment, largely investment banks + software, law and technology companies

Careers @ JM

At JM we are proud of our ability to recruit and retain talented recruitment professionals. Our current senior team of 10 people has, on average, been with JM for 7 years, with many joining JM early in their careers. We set very high standards in what we look for and expect from our people, and that is reflected in the service we deliver to our discerning list of clients.
 
Anyone considering applying to JM should share our passion for quality of service and delivery. In return we can offer: thorough training (both through formal courses and through working with some of the best people in our industry), an established client base, regular performance reviews and a competitive remuneration scheme. 

We currently have vacancies for:

Consultants
To work within our permanent or contract recruitment businesses. We look for at least 18 months’ experience, with a consistent delivery track record and evidence of having developed at least one strong client relationship. 

Resourcers
We look for a good degree and around 6 months’ commercial, post-graduate experience.

In all recruits we look for an intellect, a good analytical mind, a strong work ethic and well-developed interpersonal skills, with a strong desire to ‘go the extra mile’ for clients and candidates.

If you would like to find out more get in touch with either:

Louise Smith, Director, JM Search and Selection 020 7251 7302 Louise.Smith@jmpeople.com or

Julie-Anne Brooks, Director, JM Contracts 020 7251 7328 Julie-Anne@jmpeople.com

UPDATE - 28/05/09:
Brands2Life
Total staff 62
Staff turnover 2008 Ten per cent
Training budget per head per year £2,000-£2,500

Perhaps the best testimony to Brands2Life is the fact nearly half its staff members joined as graduate trainees – and never left. ‘All staff have had a pay rise every year they have been here and everyone from account manager upwards has had a bonus every year since we formed nine years ago,’ says co-founder Giles Fraser.
The agency invests strongly in benefits, including childcare vouchers, working from home, share ownership in the company, private healthcare, free dental care, external mentoring and exchange programmes. All staff are entitled to a two-month sabbatical after four years of service.
Social events are also well-represented, with football teams, quizzes and nights out. ‘Staff say the company feels like a family and there are many examples of staff helping each other out outside work, such as painting each other’s flats,’ says Fraser.
Staff are given quarterly reviews and their objectives are linked to in-depth roles. Training and development plans are tied into these objectives.
Brands2Life came 23rd in The Sunday Times 100 Best Small Companies to Work For, and has been accredited by the CIPR, The Holmes Report, Marketing magazine and, of course, PRWeek.

Description: OFFICES IN NEW YORK, HONG KONG, LONDON
Brief history of mergermarket
mergermarket, part of The Mergermarket Group, is an unparalleled, independent M&A intelligence tool used by the world's foremost financial institutions to originate deals. It provides proprietary intelligence on potential deal flow, potential mandates and valuations via the world's largest group of M&A journalists and analysts who have direct access to the most senior decision-makers and corporates. 
Incorporated in December 1999 by founders Caspar Hobbs, Charlie Welsh and Gawn Rowan Hamilton, it has since become the fastest growing business in its sector. As well as expanding its coverage across Europe, Americas, Latin America and the Asia-Pacific region, the company continues to launch ground-breaking products and services. 
In August 2006 The Mergermarket Group was acquired by the Financial Times Group, publisher of the Financial Times newspaper and FT.com. FT Group is a division of Pearson plc, the international media group.

L'agence
Depuis plus de 20 ans, Aromates s’est imposée comme un véritable centre de réflexion et d’actions au service de ses clients. Pour mieux servir les entreprises et les institutions qui lui font confiance, notre agence a choisi de rester indépendante et de réunir, autour d’elle, tous les ingrédients nécessaires à l’accomplissement de ses missions. Au fil des années, Aromates est parvenue à s’imposer, non seulement comme agence conseil, mais également comme acteur des marchés sur lesquels elle opère. C’est ainsi qu’elle est à l’initiative de nombreuses manifestations devenues incontournables sur ses différents secteurs d’activité. 

Aromates est membre de Syntec Conseil en Relations Publiques, syndicat français des agences de Relations Publiques. Peu à peu, l’agence a créé des liens durables avec de nombreuses agences indépendantes à l’international, notamment en Europe et aux Etats-Unis. 

Entourée des meilleurs spécialistes, et des acteurs clés de ses domaines d’activités, Aromates propose à ses clients des solutions élaborées avec une vision éprouvée par les réalités du terrain. Relations médias, affaires publiques et événementiel, sont le cœur de la réponse apportée par Aromates aux enjeux et attentes de ses clients.

Description: 15 ans d'experience le groupe proteines fonde par jean michel gilibert et christophe thomassin, reference en matiere de sante grand  public ; agroalimentaire, pharmaceutique, l'hygiene de la beaute.........

Effectif total : 90

Domaines d'expertise 
. Stratégies de communication santé des produits de grande consommation
. Stratégies de communication corporate et communication sensible
. Prévention et gestion de crise
. Actions de santé publique
. CRM et coaching santé
. Relations média
. Service consommateurs 
. Internet et santé on line

Philosophie 
 A la fois philosophie et méthode, ''Healthing Ways'' concentre notre vision et notre expertise exclusives sur la santé. Une santé plus que jamais au cœur des préoccupations du consommateur-patient-citoyen.
Omniprésente et plurielle, elle n'est plus seulement curative mais s'inscrit dans tous les actes de la vie quotidienne : l'alimentation tout d'abord avec ses dimensions nutrition et sécurité, puis l'hygiène et la beauté, mais également, progressivement, l'habitat, les loisirs, l'énergie, les transports… Attitude de vie et préoccupation sociétale, la santé est aujourd'hui un enjeu politique majeur.

Protéines, acteur unique de la santé grand public, développe des stratégies de communication fondées sur une connaissance approfondie et globale des enjeux de santé d'aujourd'hui et de demain.

Dans un contexte en forte mutation, l'agence accompagne les Entreprises dans la définition et le pilotage de leur Attitude Santé : politique produits et innovation, image corporate, communication grand public et prescripteurs, communication interne, prévention et gestion de crise.
Nos réflexions et nos actions sont articulées autour d'une méthodologie éprouvée : la méthode Healthing Way ® pour une politique cohérente et durable.

Agence indépendante

Description: 12 Dec 2014 11:41 JB:

Cognito - met with Simon Morrow (SAM - been there 5 years) and Viv Hsu (Director, Digital & Social Media - joined last year. Ex-Grey, London)

Cognito London
Integrated Comms Consultancy, specialising in PR, Marketing and Digital/ Social - 20 staff, £2m t/o, Privately held. Flat structue. (Cognito Global offices in NY, LA, Boston, Sydney, Singapore and London -  £7m t/o.) 
Footprint in the early business was FS and Tech, now much more of an integrated comms consultancy.  
Profitable, well run, growing business. On a huge "upward curve". Appreciate they need to do more to enhance their brand to the market. Viv described Cognito as "the best kept secret in the industry".
Company strategy to deliver a full service Integrated Campaigns/ Solutions to clients. Acting as true advisors/ consultants to their clients.
Rebranded last year (2013) and since then made some key/ strategic senior hires with new practice areas. They have brought with them lots of new business.
These include:
- New MD.
- Viv joined from Grey London.
- Director from Brunswick (and ex-journalist).
- Director from Goldman Sachs to lead their new Asset Man practice.
- New Senior Director in NY.
- Another junior hire (AE level) tbc.
Clients sectors include FS/ Banking, Treasury, Investments - Clients include: EuroBank, Derivative firms, Bloomberg, Bank of New York and Asset Management firms as well as some smaller clients.
Cognito value their employees - honesty & openess, loyalty and rewards staff for hard work and delivery.

People who would suit Cognito (general character traits): 
- Smart/ Natuarlly Bright (with strong academics - Oxbridge/ Russell Grp Uni/ good grades). 
- Curiousity and interest in how the world works & the comms industry.
- Collaborative/ Team player - helpful/ hands-on approach.
- Ambitious
- Have Personality & interests/ passions outside of work: debating/ societies/ voluntary work etc.

Cognito like:
Can do types - sharp, dynamic, flexible types.
Need to bring energy, enthuisasm and ambition to the interview. Desire & drive.

*INT TIP - look at the Cognito client case studies and then draw experience that’s relevant.

Current needs:
Sit at SAE/ AM level - 2 to 4 years would be ideal - with FS/ Politics/ Big client work or Big Projects experience.

Description: People are no longer satisfied with simply "hearing" a brand's message; now it's the actual experiences we have with a brand that define its relevance—emotionally, socially and when it's time to buy. That's why Momentum Worldwide helps brands imagine, create, curate and manage their Total Brand Experience. 

From the screens you watch, to the registers you pay at, to your Facebook, to your actual conversations, to the concerts you go to, we put brands there in a way that’s different and entertaining. We integrate sponsorship, shopper, design, technology, social, promotions, PR, digital and entertainment and more – in a total brand experience for the modern consumer. 

Quite simply, our job is to help brands flourish – and we do this as one global agency (within the IPG family of agencies) with more than 30 offices around the world – all of us working together, eager to invent, challenge the norm and set the world on fire. 

To make that possible, we hire people who are ravenous for ingenuity and impatient with the status quo. We like good people, and we like really thrilling people. When those two things come together it’s a talent experience for the books. The biggest asset we have is our talent, and we take that seriously. 

Part of the IPG agency network, we have over 30 offices on six continents with more than 2,000 amazingly talented people in our family working together. And, it’s kind of awesome to be a part of a company working with some incredible brands, including American Express, Coca-Cola, Mondelez, Microsoft, Walmart, William Grant & Sons and more. 

Why not join us? You could be a member of a growing team of people who love to imagine, concept, create, sculpt, sing, emote and dream in the interests of our clients and communities. We think it’s a special kind of calling. You should answer.

Description: 
La CCI Région Nord de France a retenu Profile PR pour la gestion de ses relations presse nationales afin d’optimiser la visibilité médiatique de ses actions menées en faveur du développement économique, l’accueil des entrepreneurs. Christophe Pelé, deux étoiles Michelin, délègue aussi la gestion des RP de son restaurant La Bigarrade (Paris 17ème) à l'agence. Wanzl, acteur du chariot libre service a retenu l’agence pour l’accompagner dans sa stratégie RP en France, avec pour mission de développer la visibilité médiatique de la marque tant d’un point de vue corporate que produit. Enfin, Profile PR gère pour le compte d’Expo Nantes Le Parc, les relations presse des salons « Habitat Durable & Energies Renouvelables » et « Habitat Déco » qui se tiendront conjointement du 8 au 11 novembre à Nantes avec plus de 60 000 visiteurs attendus au total.

Description: 
Fi Agladious

Fi started Strategic Analytics in March 2003 with co-founder Rod Horne and has over 18 years consulting experience.

He achieved a First Class in Electronic Engineering from Cambridge University and an MBA from London Business School.

After starting his career in Engineering in Media (BBC and Pearson) Fi went on to gain 9 years experience with Mars & Co Consulting – with extensive experience of managing projects for leading organisations such as Xerox, Pepsico, Diageo, Suez and Total Elf fina and was MD of Intiqua UK – an IT and CRM consulting company.

Description: Celsis International plc provides value enhancing products and services to the pharmaceutical, biopharmaceutical, personal care and beverage industries through its three business areas; rapid detection systems, analytical services and in vitro technologies. The company is listed on the London Stock Exchange (CEL.L). 

Using proprietary technology, the rapid detection business is the world leader in the provision of diagnostic systems for the rapid detection of contamination. It works in close collaboration with many of the world's leading pharmaceutical, personal care and beverage companies, ensuring the safety and quality of products bound for consumers. The Laboratory Group provides outsourced analytical testing services to pharmaceutical and biopharmaceutical companies to ensure the stability and chemical composition of their products. In Vitro Technologies (IVT) supplies in vitro testing products and services to the pharmaceutical and biotechnology industries to improve the drug discovery and development process and reduce its cost.

Description: Thinkfarm creates direct, engaging campaigns and marketing communications for people like Sony, Nokia, Orange, Virgin, The Rolling Stones and Agent Provocateur. We build stories that can be told in whichever media channels will hit clients' target audiences square on and trigger a reaction. It may achieve a business goal, entertain, educate or further the interests of a cause. Our clients choose to work with us because we are experienced. We do more than service a brief; we interrogate it, turn it upside down, take an audience's viewpoint and challenge the obvious routes of thinking. We develop strategies and produce work to deliver hooked and barbed communications that not only make an impact on people but stick around to keep servicing our clients' objectives.  Experienced creative thinkers, marketing strategists, producers, designers and media experts, we've all spent years working through our crafts. We know how to get the best out of our network of specialists covering many areas of production and our approach makes sure that everyone works to deliver clearly defined goals. We offer a collaborative and rewarding experience. We're not afraid to express our opinions to the extent of openly challenging a point of view. Our portfolio is as broad as the industries in which our clients operate. Every project brief is unique - each piece of work reflects our drive to deliver against a client's need in communicating with their target audience.

Description: What we do
Awareness Research
Anecdotal research is often the rule of thumb to determine many organisations' awareness levels. We believe organisations should pursue several measures of awareness spanning key audiences.

Business-to-Business (B2B) Public Relations
Communication is king when it comes to an organisation's reputation and brand. 

Media Relations
Promoting your organisation via the media remains a highly effective way of reaching key audiences and building the brand.

Customer Reference Programmes 
represent a valuable marketing strategy. On an entry level, they can be in the form of case studies which act as sales and educational tools to communicate the capabilities of an organisation to existing and prospective customers. 

Sponsorship
Is a strong marketing vehicle but all too often is not maximised.

Description: Delivering the right experience for your customers is essential for developing your brand and enhancing your business.

Our job is to ensure you do this.

We develop and establish clear, innovative, strategic and functional digital plans and experiences across channels to ensure your customers have unique and memorable experiences across all of your digital touchpoints.

Our core areas of focus and expertise are;

Social media strategy, campaign development and community management
Website design & development
Digital content design
App design and development
Digital channels deliver the best, most effective and measureable brand experiences. Digital channels are scalable, can be optimised, and deliver the best ROI for your spend. We are committed to ensure all of our creative ideas and thoughts deliver this value to your business.

We love how fast-paced, ever changing, exciting and innovative these platforms are. We are committed to staying ahead of the latest ideas and technologies, constantly researching, learning and developing new and fresh ideas for our clients.

We take our work seriously and we know that you can only be truly creative when you’re having fun! We enjoy out work and we enjoy working with our clients. This is the key to success.

We’d love to hear from you so drop us a line and let’s see if we can help you make a difference to your business.

Description: Ruder.Finn France enseigne la communication santé

Février 2006 — L'agence Ruder.Finn est chargée de l'enseignement de la communication santé au CELSA - Paris IV Sorbonne dans le cadre du cursus de dernière année du Master de Communication des Entreprises et des Organisations Internationales. La première intervention a eu lieu fin novembre et s'inscrit dans une série de trois cours. Ont été successivement abordées lors de cette première conférence, les spécificités de la communication santé, les différentes problématiques de communication liées à la vie des entreprises et des produits pharmaceutiques ainsi que les techniques de relations publiques et de relations presse. Ce cours était donné par Mai Tran, Directrice de l'agence, pour la partie théorique et par Frédérique Impennati, Consultante senior, pour les études de cas.

Weber Shandwick, cabinet conseil en gestion des opinions, membre du groupe Interpublic, recherche en CDD, pour son bureau parisien, un ou une : Consultant(e) confirmé(e) Communication Corporate Description du poste - Accompagnement de deux clients dans le domaine des services B-to-B - Contact senior auprès des clients : compréhension des objectifs et des enjeux clients / marchés, traduction en recommandations stratégiques et tactiques, conseil permanent, force de proposition, animation des réunions clients, reporting… - Suivi opérationnel : relations presse (identification d’opportunités médias, calendriers rédactionnels, préparation / suivi d’interviews, monitoring, audits, analyse des prises de parole…), événementiel (salons, séminaires, conférences clients / décideurs / médias, points presse…), rédactionnel (communiqués, dossiers de presse, tribunes libres, présentations), partenariats… - Encadrement d’un consultant junior - Gestion administrative et budgétaire - Reporting direct au Directeur du pôle Corporate / Crise / Affaires Publiques Profil recherché - 2 à 4 ans d’expérience en agence conseil en relations publiques - Très bonnes capacités écrites et orales - bilingue anglais - Familier(e) des enjeux B-to-B - la connaissance des marchés de l’immobilier d’entreprise et du droit des affaires serait un plus, ainsi qu’une certaine sensibilité à la communication de crise - Rigueur, autonomie - ce poste demande à la fois une grande aptitude au niveau opérationnel et une réelle aisance sur le plan stratégique - Polyvalence : new biz, crise, affaires publiques, international (Weber Shandwick Worldwide est l’un des premiers réseaux de relations publiques dans le monde avec 122 bureaux dans 75 pays, sur les 5 continents) Dates - Remplacement congé maternité du 13 mars au 1er novembre 2006 - A l’issue du CDD, une évolution vers un CDI est envisageable Contact Merci d’adresser votre candidature à : Vanessa Verron vverron@webershandwick.com

Welcome to The Boston Consulting Group (BCG), London.  We are the UK office of a global management consulting firm specialising in strategy consulting.  Reflecting London's cosmopolitan environment, BCG's office is staffed by a wide mix of nationalities: British, American, Malaysian, Dutch, German, South African and Australian. At any one time, there will be in excess of 20 different nationalities working here.

The environment is informal, creative, and collaborative. We are a diverse group; multinational, multicultural and drawn from widely differing academic and commercial backgrounds. But what we share are high standards of achievement, excellent analytical and interpersonal skills and insatiable curiosity. We hope this website helps you to understand our business and environment and inspires you to consider a career with BCG in London.

Description: RS Consulting — for market research that gets results. 

We provide incisive understanding of your customers and markets and offer expert guidance, so your decisions are clearly informed. The advice we offer and the approach we take is always built around your needs. Of course we have access to all the latest tools and techniques, we’re a full service agency, but knowing how to get to the heart of any complex business problem is where we stand tall 

With truly global coverage spanning Europe, the Americas, APAC and EMEA, we can reach whoever you want to listen to. We are long-term trusted advisers to the UK Government, established partners with the world’s largest technology companies and strategic consultants to some of the world’s most forward looking industrial players. 

We always research with care, present with creativity and offer clear actionable recommendations to help address your issues. It’s our people who make the difference.

Description: Parme Communication a pour mission de concevoir et gérer des programmes de communication globale, adaptés aux petites et moyennes structures ainsi qu'aux filiales de grands groupes.

L’agence de relations presse, marketing et communication Parme Communication a décroché les relations presse de la société Dictymatec, qui développe et intègre des solutions d’éditique sécurisées et de protection de la propriété intellectuelle des entreprises.

Chargé de communication senior H/F spécialisé NTIC B to B
Lieu : Boulogne Billancourt 

Contexte :
Parme Communication est une agence de communication, avec une forte expertise dans le domaine des nouvelles technologies informatiques.

Spécialisée depuis sa création dans la conception et la gestion de programmes de relations presse, l'agence accompagne également ses clients dans leurs autres actions de communication (rédaction de documents institutionnels, de témoignages clients, création de sites web, conception de publicités, organisation d'événements…) et dans leurs projets marketing (conception de documents commerciaux, rédaction de fiches techniques, gestion de campagnes d'e-mailings et de télémarketing, organisation de séminaires clients/partenaires…).

Pour accompagner son développement, Parme Communication recrute un Chargé de communication Senior H/F spécialisé NTIC B to B

Missions : 
- Elaboration et mise en œuvre de la stratégie de communication des clients qui vous seront confiés
- Gestion des programmes de relations presse, incluant la rédaction de communiqués sur des offres techniques
- Coordination, selon les opportunités, des projets marketing et communication des clients (rédaction de documents marketing, refonte de sites web, organisation de séminaires, campagnes d'e-mailings…)
- Prospection active 

Profil :
Vous avez une très forte expertise technique des nouvelles technologies B to B (+ de 5 ans) et une expérience confirmée dans la communication et le marketing (+ 7 ans).
Autonome et rigoureux, vous aimez le travail en équipe et faites preuve d'excellentes qualités rédactionnelles comme relationnelles.
Dynamique et proactif, vous aimez le contact et êtes orienté résultats.

Votre expérience, en agence high-tech ou chez un éditeur informatique, fait de vous un élément directement opérationnel dans un secteur exigeant en constante évolution.

Contact :
Envoyez votre candidature à l'attention de Nathalie Weinryb,

Description: NHS London is the Strategic Health Authority for London. It is one of the ten strategic health authorities established on the 1st July 2006 to lead the local NHS areas identified as a result of "Commissioning a Patient-led NHS".

NHS London is responsible for ensuring that the capital's health services deliver world-class care by:

developing and implementing our strategy for health and healthcare in London; 
holding local organisations (see below) to account for the quality of the care which they provide; 
ensuring capacity through the development of the workforce, technology and buildings.
NHS London manages the performance of 31 primary care trusts, 24 acute trusts, 6 mental health trusts and the London Ambulance Service. The 11 foundation trusts (comprising 7 acute foundation trusts and 4 mental health foundation trusts) in London have greater freedom to manage their own affairs and improve services.

90TEN Healthcare www.90ten.co.uk <http://www.90ten.co.uk>
90TEN are an independent specialist healthcare communications agency based in South London, who specialise in healthcare, NHS, nutritional and pharmaceutical sectors. They are a full service healthcare consultancy whose services include qualitative and desk research, media and public relations, med ed and KOL development, issues and crisis management, patient and medical writing, design and branding and public affairs and government relations.
Their objective is simple but effective: to deliver award winning, targeted and creative solutions to meet clients’ objectives, resonating with stakeholders, healthcare professionals, patients and the media.
Being an independent, boutique agency, they offer a fantastic working environment, invest a lot in their staff and encourage creativity. Their unique approach has been recognized throughout the industry by the numerous awards they have won over the years, and they were finalists in last years Communiqué awards for Best Small Consultancy.
Therapeutic areas range form cardiovascular disease to haematology, from hepatitis to oncology and from ophthalmology to urology, and they have a very impressive client list including: NHS, GSK, Wyeth, Pfizer, Unilever and Alpro Soya.
