Description: Our approach builds off my experiences gained in sales, marketing and general management at P&G, Pepsico and Barilla and whilst working closely with many of the world’s major retailers as Managing Director at dunnhumby (Tesco & Kroger), Chief Executive & Chairman at emnos (Carrefour, Metro, Morrisons, Waitrose, DSG, Boots, British Airways, British Gas) and as a senior adviser to Boston Consulting Group and a range of innovative marketing solution providers


I am an admirer of the way Tesco created huge shareholder value, growing from the number 2 grocery retailer in the UK to the second most profitable in the world.

Central to their success was a customer centric business purpose & philosophy, an organisation that was marketing led with the necessary capability to fully leverage “big data” and an ability to move quickly from strategy to execution using innovative retailing solutions and brand partnerships that were designed to help customers get what they want, at good prices, by reducing queue times, with helpful staff and a loyalty programme designed to say thank you.


We have distilled the key elements of this approach into a series of steps & solutions that can be reapplied by any business seeking to grow profits and achieve competitive advantage.

• For Retailers & Service Providers
We help retailers, brand owners and service providers to leverage data and create value by engaging more effectively with their customers, shoppers and consumers
Our start point is to help leadership teams create business goals, strategies, plans and measures that are customer centric.
We help to create the necessary in house or out sourced customer insight & data management capability to ensure customer data informs all key business decisions.
We ensure “customer engagement” delivers value in 3 key ways all of which are measurable and therefore manageable :
value : how much customers spend with our clients and how frequently they shop
commitment : how much “share of wallet” customers spend with our clients
advocacy : what they say about our clients via research and via their social networks
We do this across all retail channels – in store, online, mobile and in all business sectors
We work with world class service providers to provide tailored solutions, where required, for data management, advanced analytics, digital & mobile marketing, instore w-fi, content, customer loyalty & CRM
• For Fmcg brand owners
We help fmcg brand owners to leverage “big data”, to better understand shoppers and to work with retailers to achieve “Perfect Stores” (as measured by range, distribution, display, availability, pricing & promotions) and so achieve significant growth in sales, profit and share.


Company Size
1-10 employees

Founded
2012

strategy & consulting, "big data", customer insight, analytics, digital, mobile marketing, content, loyalty, CRM

Description: Ebay’s UK office is set in an idyllic riverside setting in Richmond, South West London. The PR and community team is headed up by Richard Kanareck (ex Red Consultancy) and is a really friendly, tight-knit unit. 
The brands image is structured around a marketing mix, this involves relationship management, internet marketing, PR and brand management divisions whose direction is guided by a strategic marketing manager.

The role within this team is as the new Senior PR manager and is considered a critical role in driving forward their consumer awareness. They are looking for a somebody at Associate Director level with good media relations, big brand experience and has the ability to move this extraordinary brand forward. They are seeking a candidate who is not only an exceptional PR professional but can communicate well with the corporate side of the organisation, is a strong leader and has an understanding of the bigger strategic picture. 

The plans for their future campaigns are exciting and innovative as they are looking for bolder, engaging PR. You would not only need to manage the vast amount of publicity the brand manages but generate publicity with your own creative influence.

Description: We help insight teams and marketing teams to dig deep into consumer behaviour, and more specifically shopper behaviour. We have identified that when in shopper mode i.e. in front of a supermarket shelf, or in a local pub, purchasing behaviour radically alters.

Our team camps out with families across the world, and captures insights into their everyday lives. They can be with drinkers in South East Asia one week, and testing frozen food on Berliners the next.

We also talk to store managers, retail buyers, bar owners, to understand the whole channel. Whatever the sales environment we endeavour to understand the nuances and the dynamics of what makes one brand overcome another. When we do in-depth work in situ the results are never less than revelatory.

Description: 28/06/2012 -
Terre de Sienne a discrètement lancé un fondation au début de l'année. Rencontre avec son président, Jean-François Le Rochais.
L'année de ses cinquante ans, Jean-François Le Rochais, président de l'agence corporate Terre de Sienne, ne s'est pas acheté une résidence secondaire ou une automobile de luxe. Il a préféré créer une fondation, la fondation Terre de Sienne, inaugurée le 2 janvier 2012. Une rareté dans l'univers des agences de communication.
Mais Jean-François Le Rochais n'en tire pas argument. Il se fait discret sur le sujet, redoutant qu'on puisse penser que son agence, qu'il a créée en 1995 et qui emploie aujourd'hui 35 personnes, va se faire de la publicité sur le dos de la fondation.
Mais en même temps, il ne dédaigne pas faire preuve d'exemplarité dans un secteur souvent taxé de superficialité: «Si tout cela pouvait faire des petits dans les agences...», lance-t-il.
Placée sous l'égide de la Fondation de France, la fondation Terre de Sienne s'est donné comme mission de «préserver la Terre et (de) favoriser le bien être de l'Homme» avec trois champs d'intervention: l'habitat, l'alimentation, la connaissance.
Son but est de soutenir des actions terrain écoresponsables mais aussi des campagnes de sensibilisation auprès des consommateurs et des leaders d'opinion. Son budget, 500 000 euros sur cinq ans, sera alimenté par le versement par l'agence Terre de Sienne d'un minimum de 10% de ses bénéfices.
En juillet, les équipes de la fondation sélectionneront avec la Fondation de France des actions à soutenir parmi les dossiers qui lui seront présentés. Une campagne d'appel aux dons pour La Voix de l'enfant est aussi en préparation.

Description: Agence de Relations Presse & Publiques  Dix consultants expérimentés au service des entreprises pour faire parler d'elles dans les médias.  Plus de 20 ans d'expérience en communication "institutionnelle", "sociale" et "produit" au contact quotidien de plusieurs centaines de médias écrits, radios, TV et Internet.		
CONFIEZ-NOUS VOS RELATIONS PRESSE VOUS ENTENDREZ PARLER DE VOUS ! 		
Vous voulez bénéficier d'une stratégie personnalisée qui privilégie les résultats par rapport aux moyens?  Vous trouvez normal de recevoir un reporting détaillé adapté au rythme et à l'importance de vos campagnes presse?  Vous savez que le ciblage et le suivi personnalisé des journalistes sont la garantie de vos retombées?  Vous êtes convaincu que les résultats d'une campagne peuvent se mesurer		

L'AGENCE BORACAY A ACQUIS SES LETTRES DE NOBLESSE EN MEDIATISANT 		
Des hommes de communication, leurs agences de publicité et leurs plus belles campagnes  Des entreprises internationales et PME dans le domaine du luxe, de la maison, de la mode, de la beauté, de la santé, du tourisme et de la gastronomie...  Des entreprises nationales dans la distribution, l'immobilier de placement, les réseaux téléphoniques ...  Des sociétés spécialisées dans les différents types de distribution : Commerce Traditionnel, GD, Franchise, VPC, Internet mais aussi Vente à Domicile...  		
LES 7 POINTS CLES DE LA MISE EN OEUVRE DE VOTRE COMMUNICATION AVEC LES MEDIAS  Comprendre la stratégie marketing de votre entreprise pour y définir la place des relations presse  Choisir avec vous les angles de communication traités dans les communiqués ou dossiers de presse en fonction de votre actualité et des attentes des journalistes  Etablir un planning de communication vers l'ensemble des médias selon leur calendrier rédactionnel et les temps forts de votre entreprise (lancement de produits, nouveaux marchés...)  Sélectionner au travers de notre fichier de 40 000 journalistes (mis à jour quotidiennement) les cibles privilégiées : professionnelles, spécialisées ou grand public, dans les différents Médias (Presse, Radio, TV, Internet) pour optimiser les résultats de votre campagne de presse...  Mettre en place et suivre votre campagne de presse à travers :  - la rédaction, la réalisation et l'envoi de communiqués et dossiers de presse  - l'organisation de conférences de presse, déjeuners, débats, tables rondes, voyages de presse, dégustations, défilés, ouvertures de magasins, lancements de sites Internet  - le suivi de l'ensemble des journalistes pour s'assurer de la bonne perception de votre message  - la remise d'un reporting régulier.  - le suivi quotidien des demandes des journalistes (shopping, visuel, interview, témoignage...)  - la pige des retombées presse  Réaliser un "press book" sur support papier, audio et/ou visuel, CD ou Internet pour une diffusion sur votre intranet  Mesurer les résultats du plan de communication presse par une évaluation qualitative et quantitative des retombées obtenues.

•	We hold market-leading positions in Technology, Entertainment, Guitar, Creative, Sport and Auto sectors. 
•	We attract more than 50 million monthly global unique users to our websites, which include techradar.com, gamesradar.com, bikeradar.com and musicradar.com. 
•	Future sold more than 24 million magazines last year, that’s 45 magazines every minute. Our most well-known print brands include T3, Total Film, Cycling Plus and Official Xbox Magazine. 
•	We deliver over 100 digital editions, and have sold over three million products powered by our own app-creation software, FutureFolio. 
•	Future exports or syndicates over 200 publications to over 90 countries, making us the UK’s number one exporter and licensor of magazine content. 
•	Future is currently Consumer Digital Publisher of the Year for both the Association of Online Publishers and the Professional Publishers Association.

Description: Make history with us.Viadeo, réseau social professionnel international, recherche des talents.
Nous comptons aujourd’hui plus de 45 millions de membres et sommes leader en France et en Chine. Face à cette audience : 400 collaborateurs , répartis dans une douzaine de bureaux dans le monde, sont mobilisés pour vous aider à développer votre réseau, améliorer votre visibilité et identifier les meilleures compétences. 
150 postes sont créés en 2012 dans nos différents départements métier. Prenez contact avec nos équipes de Recrutement (par le biais de notre Groupewww.viadeo.com/groups/viadeocareers) et participez à l’aventure Viadeo.
Dans le cadre de notre développement et pour renforcer le Département Communications & PR, nous recrutons un PR/Communications Manager France et Europe du Sud. (H/F) basé à Paris. 
En collaboration avec l’équipe Communication Groupe, vous déterminerez et déploierez le plan de communication externe local, dédié à la France, l’Italie et l’Espagne.
Vos missions :
Pilotage de campagnes de communication globales
Coordonner et animer les agences de presse pour véhiculer les messages Corporate, Produit et grand public en France. 
Superviser le déploiement de la stratégie de communication via les équipes locales en Espagne et en Italie. 
Identifier les événements auxquels Viadeo doit s’associer (salons, forums, conférences, etc.) et organiser notre participation en Europe du Sud. 
S’assurer de notre présence continuelle et dynamique sur les réseaux sociaux. 
Etre garant de l’image de la marque Viadeo. 
Manager un team member.
Production et animation de supports de communication externes en France et en Europe du Sud
Administrer et mettre à jour le site et le blog Corporate. 
Conduire une veille permanente sur l’écosystème des médias (traditionnels et sociaux). 
Gérer, avec des agences et/ou ressources internes, la création d’outils de communication.
Enfin, vous serez responsable des outils de KPIs pour mesurer et améliorer nos actions de communication. 
Nous recherchons un pro de la communication, à l’aise sur les leviers de RP, médias sociaux, événementiels et brand image; capable de sortir des sentiers battus pour initier des opérations originales.
Les compétences et qualités suivantes sont recherchées :
Une formation Bac+4/5 (spécialisation communication/ RP). 
7 ans d’expérience minimum acquise en entreprise ou en agence. 
Une excellente connaissance du paysage médiatique. 
Une appétence en faveur des nouveaux médias (Web, mobile, social media) ; un réel intérêt envers le marché des réseaux sociaux 
D’excellentes facultés de communication, tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit. 
Un anglais courant et idéalement une maîtrise de l’italien ou de l’espagnol, pour travailler au sein d’une équipe internationale et multiculturelle. 
Un vrai sens de l’organisation pour mener à terme des projets d’envergure, bonne culture geek, ouverture d’esprit et gout pour le fun@work afin de faciliter le travail en équipe.
Motivé ? Rejoignez-nous ! Envoyez votre CV à hrmarketing@viadeo.com ou postulez dès maintenant avec votre profil Viadeo.

Description: BPG Maxus is one of the leading media planning & buying specialists and a market-pioneer in digital media solutions. 

In 2010, BPG Media formed a strategic alliance with Maxus – GroupM’s Global Media Agency of the Year – to become BPG Maxus and to offer best-in-class media solutions to our rich client portfolio. Maxus operates in 57 markets globally, and through the resources of GroupM, serves clients in over 130 markets worldwide.

BPG Maxus recognizes the power of ideas and innovation. Our people are firm believers that great media ideas can stimulate consumers to create and then distribute content in a big way. In the new age of communication, BPG Maxus is helping our clients choose the best channels and marketing models from a wide range of services:

Consumer Insights
Media and Market Research
Media Strategy and Data Analysis
Planning and Buying
Digital and Social Media
Mobile Media
Branded Content and Product Placements
Out of Home Media
Media Marketing Consultancy
Relationship Media
At BPG Maxus, we build deeper relationships between consumers and brands; creating more valued communication for businesses and consumers. We call this Relationship Media. The Relationship Media approach is combining very creative communications planning with sophisticated data analytics to deliver bespoke media solutions that will find new ways to excite customers about your brand.

To help us navigate this new world we have developed 5 simple principles.

Principle 1: Relationship Media is rooted in a deeper understanding of who we’re speaking with, understanding the what, how and why of consumer behavior.

Principle 2: Relationship Media means understanding how elements interconnect and reinforce to build a conversation over time. We build relationships by designing longer-term conversations with consumers; knowing what to say, when.

Principle 3: Relationship Media asks us to build communication that invites consumer participation, giving consumers the chance to pick up and play with brands.

Principle 4: Relationship Media requires a greater focus on building loyalty, crafting communication that exists as powerfully after the moment of purchase as before it.

Principle 5: Relationship Media asks us to reinvent traditional marketing and agency timelines, balancing a longer-term vision for media usage with short-term course correction.

great location in a brand new development on the river, open plan office looking out onto river, subsidised gym next door, company socials, wonderfully friendly and supportive environment, Alex the COO is a funny approachable and memorable guy who "runs the office with an arm aorund the shoulder", growing company who have doubled in size in last few years, growth is organic with all RDs starting as REs, meritocratic environment where everyone is rewarded for good work.

Branding Science: Brand Research & Consultancy: 
With offices around the world, we can partner with global Brand teams and their affiliates through the various challenges coming along the brand life cycle. 
We combine creative thinking, innovative methodologies and strong market expertise, to uncover insights with a practical and commercial orientation. 
This means that the inspirational commercial insights we bring will help directly the brand strategy and ensure that the resultant actions are implemented and embedded across the organisation.

We have a library of knowledge about frequently asked questions such as “ how to deal with advertising clutter” and “advertising in a recession”. We routinely review academic and industry expertise, and add good insights to BrandScience’s own experience for a 360o view.

market research, marketing insights, branding, pharmaceutical industry, consultancy, workshops, communication, positioning

Description: Leo Corporate, rebaptisée Vae Solis, prend son indépendance

L’agence Leo Corporate, lancée dans le giron du groupe Leo Burnett en 2000, a basculé le 1er janvier dernier dans l’indépendance suite à un MBO. La totalité du capital de l’entité, qui se rebaptise de fait Vae Solis (« malheur à celui qui va seul », en latin), appartient désormais à Arnaud Dupui-Castérès, qui en assure dorénavant la présidence, - il était jusqu’à présent directeur général de Leo Corporate. Vae Solis emploie une trentaine de personnes et compte parmi ses principaux clients : le CNRS, le CNES, Bouygues Immobilier, Merial, Roche ou encore Orange. Très axée "conseil", l’offre de l’agence s’articule autour de quatre principales disciplines : la communication interne, le conseil en stratégie d’information, les affaires publiques, et la prévision des risques et gestion de crise. L’équipe prévoit d’ores-et-déjà d’ouvrir des bureaux à Bruxelles, Genève et Londres. Elle va, par ailleurs, continuer à partager les locaux de la filiale du groupe Publicis, à Boulogne-Billancourt. Plus de détails dans le CB News N°909 paru ce matin.

Description: NewEdge is a dynamic innovation consultancy bringing a fresh approach to growing business and brands through upstream and downstream innovation. 

Our clients often tell us that our approach to innovation is unlike other innovation consultancies. Perhaps it’s our focus on opportunities rather than ideas, or the way we blend the disciplines of research, strategy and design. They are an employee engagement specialist, found in the following PR Week article:

O2 internal work for Engage EnEngEngagecomms

Hannah Marriott 6 Sep 2007
O2 has handed a UK-wide internal comms brief to employee engagement specialist Engage Group.
Engage Communications manager Linda Apeles said the London-based agency would ‘help create a fresh new suite of communication channels to engage O2’s people in new and compelling ways’.
The agency’s ideas include using web 2.0 technology to reach the company’s 12,000 staff who work in call centres, shops and the company’s Slough headquarters.
The company is keen to demonstrate its commitment to its employees. It ranked fifth in The Sunday Times’ ‘Best Big Companies to Work For’ poll.
Engage is O2’s first full-service internal comms agency. Prior to bringing in Engage, O2 had an agency that only worked on its employee magazine. O2 dec­lined to reveal the name of this agency.

Description: La pluralité des compétences de MINISTÈRE va permettre à l’agence HAVAS 360 de renforcer son expertise et d’élargir son savoir-faire sur la globalité des problématiques digitales de ses annonceurs : consulting – création des écosystèmes - construction de sites - plans de lancement et d’activation - social media - e-commerce avec une spécialisation particulière sur les enjeux CRM/e-CRM.

MINISTÈRE compte parmi ses principaux clients le groupe LACTALIS avec, entre autres, la gestion de sa plate-forme relationnelle « Envie De Bien Manger », les marques Lactel, Bridélice et Galbani, LVMH avec les marques Le bon Marché et Château Cheval Blanc, les laboratoires EXPANSCIENCES avec la marque Mustela, Carrefour (site e-commerce de plusieurs enseignes)…

Une nouvelle offre au sein d’HAVAS sera mise en place avec la création d’un pôle d’excellence digitale représenté par MINISTÈRE pour une gestion centralisée des problématiques digitales des clients d’HAVAS 360.

En terme de développement MINISTÈRE a, par ailleurs, l’ambition de se positionner sur les appels d’offres digitaux majeurs du marché.

MINISTÈRE intègrera les locaux d’HAVAS dès le 15 septembre 2015  pour le déploiement immédiat des synergies avec HAVAS 360 et, à moyen terme, avec les autres agences du HAVAS VILLAGE.

HAVAS 360 poursuit ainsi sa stratégie entamée depuis deux ans et renforce son positionnement « la plus digitale des agences intégrées – la plus intégrée des agences digitales » avec cette opération de croissance externe.

Description: Over the past 20 years, bluemarlin has evolved from a UK packaging design firm to an international brand agency with offices in Europe, America, and Asia.
This growth has been organic, fuelled by continuous investment in our people and the commitment to producing brave, stimulating creative work.
Through our network of studios, we provide clients with a uniquely global level of service encompassing creative agility, commercial nous, cultural awareness and round-the-clock resourcefulness. Integrated, cross-functional teams work with clients from start-to-finish on every project; a seamless process which ensures our brand and packaging design solutions are feasible and that delivery matches intent.
Bluemarlin remains fiercely independent, treasuring its freedom and autonomy. Committed to entrepreneurship, curiosity and adventure, this independence allows us to make decisions for the primary benefit of our core stakeholders: our clients.
Driven by wonder and respect for the world around us, for the cultures that thrive within it, and for the ideas that transform it, bluemarlin continues its journey towards a better future in which design innovation leads to the balance of profit and planet and the improvement of people's lives.
To braver days ahead.

Description: Neo@Ogilvy is Ogilvy & Mather's global media agency  <http://www.neoogilvy.com/>and performance marketing network. Neo delivers marketplace foresight to some of the world’s most innovative and respected brands, as both a “digital-first” lead agency or part of a networked 360° solution.
Our team consists of more than 800 employees across 40 worldwide offices working to put innovation and accountability at the heart of every engagement. With a mandate to drive measurable results while creating the future, Neo applies a data-driven strategic approach and cutting edge technologies across all digital disciplines (including paid and organic search, display, video, mobile, social media, affiliate marketing, etc.) and traditional channels.
The Neo offering is uniquely positioned to help clients take advantage of “The New Dialogue of Performance,” with marketing dollars delivering results against both sales and branding objectives. This includes an innovative planning process to leverage “of the moment” data, the targeting precision and buying power of one of the world’s strongest digital networks, an advanced analytics offering and one of the most sophisticated data processing environments in the industry.
We’re passionate about building brands, driving business results and keeping our clients informed with the latest marketplace foresight from the confluence of media, data and technology. To learn more about our work and how your company can take advantage of the new dialogue of performance, visit www.neoogilvy.com <http://www.neoogilvy.com/>.

Description
L’image d’une entreprise, d’une institution française ou internationale est décisive pour sa crédibilité et son développement.

Image Sept assure le conseil en stratégie de communication, pour valoriser l’image de ses clients :
- en identifiant et mettant en valeur les thèmes porteurs,
- en sensibilisant les relais d’opinion,
- en les assistant dans l’organisation et la gestion des contacts institutionnels et médias. 

Elle fait bénéficier ses clients internationaux de sa connaissance des réalités politiques, économiques et culturelles de la France.

Pôles de compétences : 
Communication de crise
Reconnue pour sa compétence dans la gestion de la communication de crise, Image Sept a mis en place les outils et procédures indispensables pour gérer et anticiper les situations critiques.
Cela lui permet d’assurer des interventions ponctuelles pour tous les types de crise (économique, sociale, environnementale, juridique…) et de tenir un rôle d’alerte sur les événements (industriels, financiers, environnementaux ou sociaux) auxquels l’entreprise et ses dirigeants peuvent se trouver brutalement exposés.

Communication sociale 
L’image sociale est une composante de plus en plus importante de la perception globale de l’entreprise, en particulier en France.
Image Sept travaille en étroite relation avec les directions des ressources humaines de ses clients, afin de gérer et d’anticiper les éventuels risques sociaux et de les aider à valoriser leurs innovations sociales.

Media training et coaching
Image Sept dispense des formations pragmatiques et concrètes à la communication et aux relations presse, qui se fondent sur l’alternance de conseils techniques et d’entraînement à l’expression orale, notamment par des exercices videos.
Cette formation se déroule au siège d’Image Sept, dans un studio TV dédié.

Affaires publiques 
Image Sept a mis en place un département spécialisé dans la communication en direction des responsables politiques : membres du gouvernement, cabinets ministériels, députés et sénateurs, présidents des exécutifs départementaux et régionaux, élus locaux et grandes associations d’élus (AMF, ADF, ARF…), grandes institutions européennes (Parlement, Commission…).
Conseil dans la stratégie de sensibilisation des pouvoirs publics aux enjeux de ses clients, Image Sept les accompagne dans l’organisation et la gestion des contacts avec les responsables institutionnels concernés.
Lors de l’examen par le parlement de textes relatifs à leur secteur d’activité, Image Sept assiste également ses clients pour tout ce qui concerne le domaine législatif (veille, suivi de projets de loi, interventions législatives…).


Communication financière 
L’image d’une entreprise sur les marchés financiers a un impact direct sur sa capacité de développement et d’investissement : elle doit pouvoir générer la confiance grâce à ses résultats, sa solidité financière, ses perspectives de développement, sa pérennité. C’est pourquoi la communication financière fait partie intégrante de sa stratégie globale.
Image Sept accompagne les entreprises dans :
- la construction de leur perception par les marchés (synthèses de notes d’analystes, études de perception, benchmarking des concurrents) ;
- la définition du contenu et de la structure du discours (communiqués de presse, présentations, élaborations de Q&A…) ;
- la gestion des relations avec la presse et la communauté financière (analystes, gérants) lors des évènements récurrents (CA, résult

company-note:
Description: News:

21.05.07 J.Frost - 22-23 people: 2x partner, 2x director, 7x senior consultant, 7x consultant, 3x researcher. Developing new business area: regeneration, recruit grads through their own internship scheme. V. Flat structure
06.07 - AD Laura Montgomery accepted offer from Fishburn Hedges, to start in August.
09.07.07 - AM Jessica Frost accepted offer from Open Road, to start in August.

08.08.07 PRW - FH has swooped for Lexington Communications lobbyist and former Conservative Party staffer Laura Montgomery.
19.10.07 PRW - Liz Kendall, former special adviser to ex-health secretary Patricia Hewitt joins as the agency attempts to win more business in the fields of healthcare and life sciences. She is currently working at the agency on a freelance basis.
15.02.08 PRW Feature - on agencies that would be attractive in mergers/acquisitions in 2008:  Public affairs agency with a fee income of roughly £4m last year and around 30 staff. Has been playing hard to get. Unlikely to forego its name and even less likely to join a big marcoms group.
22.02.08 PRW - confirmed they are working for the biotech body, Agricultural Biotechnology Council (ABC), at the centre of a front-page GM foods expose in The Guardian newspaper.  Lexington director Emma Cerrone said Lexington advised ABC on 'all aspects of external comms'.
15.04.08 PRW - Lost out on Lloyds Pharmacy pitch to Insight PA.  APCO also pitched.
01.05.08 PRW - Lexington is understood to be opening a public affairs shop in the north of England.  Headhunters are said to have been contacting senior PROs at northern agencies in the hope of hiring an MD for a Manchester branch of the lobbying outfit.  Lexington is believed to be looking to take advantage of a property boom in the area, offering planning support to regional developers.
01.05.08 PAN - Ruth Greenwood leaves Lexington for E.ON UK where she joins as a Senior PA Executive.
01.08.08 PAN - Winner of PAN ‘Newcomer of the Year’, Craig Jones has joined Lexington from the Charity, 4Children.  He joins as a Senior Consultant.
15.09.08 PRW - The Energy Retail Association has appointed Lexington Communications to handle its public affairs and PR. Mike Craven's agency won a five-way pitch for the business, which was previously held by Four Communications.
10.10.08 PAN - Opening Manchester Office with senior hire.  Paul Boyfield - PPS Group’s Manchester office head will lead the new venture.
17.10.08 PRW - Lexington Communications has hired Damian Collins, MD of Influence Communications, as senior counsel. Influence Communications is part of M&C Saatchi.

****************************************************INTERNAL USE ONLY - DO NOT SEND TO CANDIDATES*******************************************************

Lexington Communications

General:

Independent, traditional public affairs agency.  Straight up strategic public affairs, not very creative, quite hard-nosed political gurus.

Flat structure: research consultant, consultant, senior consultant, associate director, director, partner.

Culture & offices:

·	Intellectual.  Have to let them go down to see if personalities will clash or not.  They are quite serious, like very professional, driven people.
·	Offices are light and airy, bordering on cold though.  Nice reception area with a TV and purple everything (corporate colour).

Services:

·	·	Crisis Management
·	Government & Public Affairs
·	Strategic Communications & Media Relations
·	Bid Support & Competition Policy Assignments
·	Campaigns
·	Winning Planning Permission
·	Advocacy Training
·	Design Production

Selling Lexington to people:

·	Variety.  In client accounts - will take on a property or health focused person and let them slowly expand into other areas, in fact they actively encourage this.
·	Strategic PA.  A lot of board level interaction with clients.  Lexington consultants must be robust enough to stand up to CEOs - equally, you will get to consult to a very senior level.
·	Independent.  PRWeek (Feb 2008) identified them as a company that would be desirable for a marcoms agency to buy.  They have plans to remain independent for at least the next 5 years.  This also means equity at director level.
·	Retention.  Clients - have had BA for 10 years.  Sarah Doyle is bright, something’s kept her there for 10 years, and they do have relatively high consultant retention.
·	New business.  Take it quite seriously, will let consultant level people get involved.  Although realistically, it’s more the senior level where all this happens.

Key criteria for candidates:

·	Intelligence.  Have to stand up to intellectual challenge; they are quite tough once they are actually through the door at interview.
·	Understanding.  Politics, not as bothered about media unless that is their background.  If they have not got extreme political depth, they will not get far.  Unless they are coming from a PR background, then obviously the focus is different, and they will likely be coming from a health PR background - specific knowledge here must be strong, Sarah Doyle will grill.
·	Professional enthusiasm.  For politics.  Not too enthusiastic.  They are quite reserved.

Grad CVs:

All researcher level candidates must have experience working in Westminster with an MP, preferably for around 6 months plus.  This is in order to show that depth of knowledge regarding the inner workings of Westminster that you just won’t get from a politics degree.

Recruitment at Lexington:

Approach either Emma Cerrone or Sarah Doyle, pretty interchangeably.  Sarah tends to be more willing to discuss what is going on, but is in the office less regularly than Emma.  For health focused candidates, approach Sarah; for media and property Emma or Wyn.

They will nearly always see good candidates on spec and think they get a high calibre of candidate from us; don’t send them people with weak academics.  If they do have a specific brief out, it will be associated with one of their levels or broad practice areas, not usually client specific. (i.e. - property, health or media focused.)

Lexington are more harsh on candidates from an agency background, as they expect more, especially in terms of political depth.  They are flexible on background though and will look at in house people.

Their reputation and heritage is very left wing, so always keen to get someone with good Tory contacts and understanding.

Sending candidates to Lexington:

·	Can call to sell candidates in, but just an email works just as well, as the directors spend a lot of time out of the office on their Blackberrys.
·	Make a note of political activity outside of work - they like to see people are engaged.
·	Include education.
·	If they are specialised, note whether they want to remain so or expand - and into which sectors, make it relevant to their mainstream - transport, media, financial, food.

Interview Process:

Usually 3 stages, unless they are pushed for time, in which case there will be 2.  Always meet a director (or Matt, their associate) at first stage.  2nd or 3rd stage will involved meeting both partners.  Usually meet two people at each stage, but have been known to do a 2nd or 3rd stage with both partners and a director.

Lexington use personality testing at 2nd stage and the test is about 5 minutes long and will generally be taken just before they go in.  Presentations are commonplace at either 2nd or 3rd stage:
·	Researcher - will ask them to prepare a research document - either on policy or an MP profile.  Examples will usually be given along with the task.
·	Consultant - task may be research or strategy based and they will typically only ask for one A4 page worth of work.  Will be to test their approach to a policy issue.  Might be with regard to a new biz pitch.  The candidate will be expected to present the task. See examples in “interview prep” folder.
·	Senior consultant and above - likely to be a presentation - any format of the candidate’s choice - PowerPoint or just plain talking with a handout.  Will likely to be to do with how the candidate can see taking business forward with Lexington or a strategy piece on a specific scenario.

Key People:

·	Mike Craven & Ian Kennedy - founding partners.  Interviews with them are tough; they challenge the candidate’s political knowledge in particular.  Not massively warm but will get on well with likeminded people (i.e. business friendly, politically astute professionals.)
·	Emma Cerrone - director [media, property, agribusiness & FS] - again, quite cold at interview, very picky with regard to political depth of candidates.  Will be relatively frank with feedback.  Usually involved if candidate has anything to do with property or media.
·	Sarah Doyle - director [healthcare] - been there since she was a researcher, 3rd person in.  a bit nicer than Emma at interview
·	Wyn Evans - director [comms & property] - nice guy, not a tough interviewer although will ask hard questions.  Usually strikes great rapport with candidates, is definitely the warmest of the lot.
·	Matt Holmes - associate director [financial & general] - nice, friendly, but quite to the point.  Taking more active role in recruitment, will often do first rounds for researchers and the consultant level.

Offers from Lexington:

·	They like to think that they are conservative with offers, but will stretch for the right person.
·	Will get into a bidding war if they think the person is worth it, but have backed off when candidates have had a couple of other offers coming in.

Approximate salary bands:

·	Trainee - £18k, might stretch to £22
·	Consultant - typically £25-35k
·	Senior Consultant - £35-55k
·	Associate Director - £50 plus
·	Director - £ probably 6 figures, but not sure

Benefits:

·	Pension 3% matching
·	25 days holiday plus extra half day for birthday
·	£200 activity budget
·	10% bonus (company performance)  paid end of October

Previous placements with Lexington:

·	Apr 08 - Abigail Stapleton - SAE from Weber Shandwick (on £27k, offered £33k, got £35k)

Previous offers [fallen through] from Lexington:

·	Mark Saxon - AD from Shire Health - placed with Hanover (better op)

Description: LEWIS PR offers Leads United internationalisation
Leads United 
Increase in scale thanks to take-over
Aartselaar, 28 October 2009 - Leads United, a communication consultancy agency from the Antwerp area, has today signed a contract for take-over by LEWIS PR, an international full-service communication agency, specialising in social media and PR campaigns. The LEWIS PR Group, with 38 offices worldwide, is a real international player with a large number of international clients. 

Following the take-over, all shares will come into the hands of LEWIS PR. The present management of Leads United will from the office in Aartselaar, continue its responsibilities as before, based on the existing strategy.

The combination of Leads United and LEWIS PR will lead to a comprehensive solution for Global PR with various target groups on a worldwide scale. This take-over means a considerable increase in scale for Leads United and implementation of its 2006 strategy: internationalisation.

The Antwerp communication agency has already been on the Belgian market for 16 years and with its 16 staff is one of the top Belgian communication agencies. Leads United serves national and international clients in different sectors. The team specialises in Internal Communication, Media Relations, Crisis Communication and Online Communication. Together with LEWIS PR's Dutch office, offering similar services with 22 staff, Leads United is a strong and balanced Benelux formation.

The Leads United brand will continue to exist for the time being. 

"We are pleased with today's announcement" says Dian Wahlen, Managing Director of Leads United.  "By merging with LEWIS PR we have implemented one of our strategic objectives, namely internationalisation. This offers a challenging arena for our clients, a bigger critical mass,  wider career prospects for our staff and financial stability for the organisation. Leads United and LEWIS PR share a common vision and our respective services are fully complementary. LEWIS PR fits in perfectly with our corporate culture and vision for the future, which will make the integration to run smoothly. Thanks to our united forces we expect to be able to position ourselves even better on the worldwide market. We are pleased to be able to direct our growth further with the help of the extra opportunities that the LEWIS PR Group offers us."

"This is an important step for LEWIS PR in Europe and in particular for Benelux. Leads United has a fantastic reputation in this region," says Yvonne Van Bokhoven, VP Western Europe at LEWIS PR. "LEWIS PR has already been in the Benelux for over 9 years and has 25 staff. With the experienced team of Leads United in Belgium on board we are a very strong Benelux team, one of the best in the sector at the moment. We are therefore convinced that this acquisition will enrich all those involved."

About Leads United
Leads United, ( www.leadsunited.com) a communication consultancy agency operating in the Benelux countries, has a clear goal in view: to bring and maintain the brands, ideas and activities of our clients to the attention of the right target groups. Leads United was set up in 1993 and at present has 16 staff. The core business includes media relations, internal communication and crisis communication. For each of these disciplines Leads United has developed specific expertise in the field of social media (blogging, RSS feeds, podcasts, wikis, videocasts, etc.). Leads United has its own training institute,

Description: Please enter ALL candidates who work for misc MPs here so we can keep them in one place, regardless of whether they are Westminster or Local Government based.




LABOUR - NEWS
07.01.08 PRW - Gordon Brown has appointed Brunswick Group chief executive Stephen Carter as his chief of strategy.  Carter, former chief executive of Ofcom, will be the Prime Minister’s principal special advisor at 10 Downing Street.  He will be in charge of political strategy communications and research and the policy unit at Number 10.
18.01.08 PRW - The Labour Party's head of press and broadcasting, Jo Murray, is to join Fishburn Hedges as associate director.  
01.03.08 PRW - Prime minister Gordon Brown has hired the campaigns and comms director from consumer group Which? Nick Stace to be his special advisor on strategic communications.
27.03.08 PRW - Long-serving Brown aide Spencer Livermore previously helped with most of Brown's key speeches - but he left Downing Street.  Currently Brown's chief speech writer is former Treasury civil servant Beth Russell, although the PM has inc­reasingly been relying on his close friend Colin Currie - a doctor by trade - to draft his speeches.  Carter is understood to have made tentative contact with a trio of Tony Blair's speech writers - Peter Hyman, David Bradshaw and Phil Collins - to see if they are interested in ret­urning to Number 10.
28.03.08 PRW - new head of press and broadcasting. Press officer Roger Baker has been promoted up to the role, replacing Jo Murray who moved to Fishburn Hedges earlier this year.
31.03.08 PRW - Fleishman Hillard hired a senior Labour Party press officer, Tim Nuthall.  He will join the agency's Brussels office after three years at the Labour Party press office.
03.04.08 PRW - Former MD of London radio network LBC Mark Flanagan has been named head of digital comms, with a brief to overhaul Prime Minister Gordon Brown's lacklustre web strategy.  He will go head-to-head with Tory digital guru Rishi Saha in the run-up to the next election.
22.05.08 PRW - Gordon Brown's latest digital comms moves have been widely panned by bloggers and PROs, who claimed his web outreach 'smacks of gimmickry and desperation'. Despite reams of coverage in the nationals for this online version of prime minister's questions, well-known bloggers have criticised the moves as too little too late.
12.06.08 PRW - Number 10's chief press officer will be filled by the head of news at the Foreign and Commonwealth Office (FCO) while the former is on maternity leave.  When Emily Hands leaves her job in July, long-standing FCO head of news Tom Hoskin will take over in her absence.  Gordon Brown's top media handlers are Mike Ellam and special adviser on press Damian McBride, both former Treasury aides.
26.06.08 PRW - Gordon Brown's outgoing political secretary Fiona Gordon is teaming up with a Labour press officer, Steve McCabe, in a new political consultancy service.
26.06.08 PRW - Gordon Brown's chief speechwriter has resigned, prompting the Prime Minister's top advisers to scour Whitehall in a 'desperate' bid to find a replacement.  Beth Russell, one of Brown's most trusted aides, will return to the Treasury in late July.
02.07.08 PRW - Gordon Brown has been hit by another exit from his comms team, with head of strategic communications Martin Sheehan becoming the latest senior figure to quit Number 10.  Sheehan will join Portland PR, becoming an associate partner at the agency.

Description: Désormais, le bureau de Paris est indiscutablement un acteur de choix pour traiter les opérations domestiques et internationales d'envergure. Description: Lancé en 2008, MobPartner est un pionnier mondial de l’affiliation mobile. La plate-forme met en relation des annonceurs, qui diffusent des campagnes en échange d’actions, et des affiliés qui mettent à disposition leur inventaire publicitaire en échange de revenus. Pour les annonceurs, c’est un modèle sans risque puisque ils ne payent qu’en fonction des actions réalisées (CPA = coût par action). MobPartner propose principalement trois actions : des téléchargements, des inscriptions ou des ventes.

Maurice Lévy, président du directoire de Publicis Groupe, a annoncé, mercredi 27 septembre, plusieurs nominations importantes à la tête de l'entreprise. Fabrice Fries, quarante-six ans, rejoint le groupe en tant que secrétaire général. Direction juridique, audit et contrôle interne, direction des ressources humaines groupe et France, reporteront directement à Fabrice Fries. Fabrice Fries (Ecole normale supérieure, ENA, conseiller référendaire à la Cour des comptes) a été membre du cabinet de Jacques Delors, à Bruxelles. De 1995 à 2003, il a occupé diverses fonctions au sein des groupes CGE puis Vivendi Universal. Par ailleurs, Jean-Yves Naouri, actuellement senior vice-président de Publicis, devient directeur général adjoint - opérations Groupe. Enfin, Jean-Michel Etienne, directeur financier du groupe, est nommé directeur général adjoint - finances Groupe. 



COMMUNICATION FINANCIERE. Le réseau AMO, qui fédère des agences de PR et de communication financière du groupe Havas en Europe (dont Euro RSCG C&O à Paris), vient d'être élu «réseau de communication financière de l'année» par The Holmes Report, le rapport mondial édité chaque année par Paul Holmes et qui fait référence sur le marché des agences corporate & PR. Ce rapport souligne sa présence dans de nombreuses transactions boursières importantes de ces derniers mois parmi lesquelles Mittal Steel/Arcelor, Abbey National/Resolution, Invensys Building Systems/Schneider Electric et Cadbury Schweppes/Dr Pepper. Les derniers articles sur AMO 


EDF a porté son choix final sur l’agence Euro RSCG C&O, filiale d’Havas, mettant un terme à l’appel d’offres initié en avril dernier et portant sur la globalité de son budget en communication estimé à 60 M€. Euro RSCG C&O, en charge de la communication institutionnelle depuis 2003, met ainsi également la main sur le volet commercial pour une durée de quatre ans, au détriment de Publicis Conseil, agence sortante mise à l'écart la semaine dernière. Cette dernière figurait en short-list aux côtés d’Ogilvy & Mather, finaliste, Callegari Berville Grey, DDB Paris et M&C Saatchi. Avec, entre autres, Orange (BtoB), RATP et maintenant EDF, l’agence présidée par Laurent Habib aura décroché quelques uns des plus importants budgets remis en compétition cette année.

Description: Analytics is not what you think it is.

A common misconception of analytics is that it is just another word for insights, or a general term that wraps up numerical data of any kind, that it is just a planning tool, or someone who is digital.

For progressive advertising minds it is anything but this. Analytics, when implemented correctly, provides a rigor that upholds an agency, it helps write the brief, inspires the creative, sells the work, wins the pitches, finds the new business, drives the innovations, improves client relationships, creates revenue, informs agency strategy, measures efficiency and is the unsung hero of award winning work.

What was once digital became social, which became mobile and is now data. All of them the latest thing we must all have. But data is not new, it is just knowledge and we have always had that. What is new is the amount of knowledge we have and the skill is pulling all the knowledge sources together and finding the one golden nugget no other agency can find, visualizing it into a simple thought and making it the seed of great work. Analytics is old, applied analytics is new.

The two most important words in the above copy are “progressive advertising.” For agencies to survive and prosper they must start to see the true value of analytics and how it can be the differentiator between the best and the rest.

I am always happy to talk to anyone about my view of analytics and advertising.


I have worked on developing and evaluating creative as well as writing digital strategy for MSN, Visit London and now for many clients, including Cadbury, Skoda, Orange, Nokia, Visa, Toyota, Weight Watchers, Kerry Foods, Giffgaff, Think Money, Abu Dhabi Commercial Bank, Cushelle and charity projects across the Saatchi Saatchi Fallon group.

My role is a client facing and it has helped to win pitches and sell in work through ensuring we are rigorous in our desire to produce agenda changing creative.

NEWS
01.02.07 PAN - Simon Elliott appointed MD (total 5 MDs)
15.05.07 S.McKee - LLM were taken over in 2005 by FD, then FD bought by FTI (re-brand in Feb ’07).  Usually never go over 21 people, so there have been quite a few lay offs in the past.  Direction has changed towards Corporate Communications.
03.07.07 PAN - Jon Mendelsohn is to leave his director job at FD-LLM.  Mendelsohn co-founded what was originally known as Lawson Lucas.  His exit from FD-LLM will leave just one of the founding trio - Ben Lucas - still with the agency Mendelsohn has a 6 month notice period at FD-LLM, which he intends to honour.
02.08.07 PRW - Partner, Ben Abbotts has resigned. About to take a senior role at a rival lobbying firm, he’s weighing up 2 agency offers (Good Rel­ations & The Policy Partnership?)
24.08.07 PRW - Last week, LLM appointed Christopher Cuddihy, private secretary to skills minister Phil Hope, as a senior account manager.
30.08.07 PRW - Lee Findell (joined FD-LLM nine months ago as vice-president in its issues management department) leaves for Fishburn Hedges.  He is the 4th senior staffer to walk out this year - following the departures of Craig Leviton, Jon Mendelsohn and Ben Abbotts.
03.10.07 PRW - David Abrahams is quitting public affairs altogether and will take a policy-focused role at Ofcom, working within its investigations team.
01.11.07 PRW - David Cracknell, political editor of The Sunday Times, resigned to take the helm at PR agency Financial Dynamics’ troubled public affairs arm.
12.12.07 PAN - FD-LLM has made a brace of high-profile recruits in a month when Ben Lucas, the only one of three co-founders still with the agency, has gone part-time (to enable him to become a director of a new think-tank focusing on public service reform) and account director Parna Taylor has left.  Recruits include ex-Gordon Brown aide Tony Pilch, who joins this month as SV-P.  United Utilities last month pulled its PA business out of FD-LLM and handed the work to Fleishman-Hillard.
02.05.08 PRW - FD-LLM has been left reeling by the shock resignation of its chairman David Cracknell.  FD group CEO Charles Watson said FD-LLM was now being run by MDs Fiona Mason, Simon Elliott and co-founder Ben Lucas. He confirmed a direct replacement was not being sought.  PA sources suggested that Cracknell's move from journalism into a senior agency management position was ‘too big a job' for a first role in public relations.
17.10.08 PRW - The LLM brand is to disappear from the public affairs world after 11 years, as FD-LLM changes its name to FD Public Affairs.
17.10.08 PRW - hired Henry Goodwin, a former aide to shadow cabinet minister Alan Duncan.  Senior VP Sean McKee has quit the agency after seven years without another job lined up; Fiona Mason said McKee was taking a career.
09.01.09 PAN - Fiona Mason has quit FD-PA

Description: BrainJuicer® Group PLC is a thriving international marketing consultancy founded in 1999. BrainJuicer specializes in helping clients with their innovation programmes, focusing on ideas, insights, concepts, communications and customer and employee satisfaction measurement. Description: 25 people as of 08/01/13

Media Agency of the Year: Goodstuff Communications
campaignlive.co.uk, Thursday, 13 December 2012

Judging Media Agency of the Year proved harder this time round than in recent years, as more shops have a good case to make about creativity, rather than simply new-business growth and planning and buying prowess. 

There was a noticeable step up in innovation and strong strategic thinking, which, when it all came together in the blender, meant Campaign took a while to thrash out which agencies impressed the most this year.

Against that backdrop, it was Goodstuff Communications that was the overwhelming winner. The agency won two categories at the Campaign Media Awards and three at the Thinkbox TV Planning Awards for its work with Virgin Media and Ann Summers. Its Dr Martens campaign also landed a silver at the Campaign Big Awards.

This would be impressive by any standard but, for Goodstuff, it is remarkable. It had only repositioned itself as a full-service media agency in September 2011 after seven years as a pure-play communications planning shop, yet went on to scoop awards for integrated media campaigns.

The agency has a dynamism that emanates from the passionate management team led by the founding partners Ben Hayes and Andrew Stephens, a strategist and suit who grew up together at Saatchi & Saatchi and Manning Gottlieb OMD before making a go of it themselves. The investment in new talent in 2011 also gave the agency fresh momentum this year. It hired the planning hotshot Simeon Adams, formerly a strategy director at Bartle Bogle Hegarty, and Mindshare’s operations director, Bobby Din, which complemented the strategy-heavy management team that also features the planning partners Simon Wilden and Paul Gayfer.

Goodstuff’s management has shown that it is not afraid to take risks. It has co-launched two joint ventures: Fifty6, a specialised unit in which Goodstuff provides strategy and creativity for Virgin Media alongside its buying shop Manning Gottlieb OMD, and BMB Media, a joint venture with the creative agency Beattie McGuinness Bungay, which has clients including Pretty Polly.

The result was that Goodstuff grew its business rapidly, winning eight new clients including Republic, AllSaints and Secret Escapes.

But it was Goodstuff’s strong heritage in comms planning, coupled with an ambition for thinking up big ideas, that made its work stand out. Its "introducing buffertising" campaign for Virgin Media through Fifty6 took Yeo Valley, Citroen and Magners ads and interrupted them on purpose to highlight that consumers wouldn’t put up with buffering on TV, so they shouldn’t put up with it online – promoting Virgin’s broadband offering in the process. At the Thinkbox TV Planning Awards, where the campaign won a gong, the judges agreed the planning was robust and impressive, and demonstrated complete understanding of platform crossover.

Goodstuff also created an award-winning campaign for Ann Summers this year. The shop wove a TV ad event into the season finale of The Only Way Is Essex, with competition-winners also starring in the film.

The agency has managed to play the investment game to its strengths by maintaining its independence despite Omnicom increasing its minority stake over time. Thus it has the best of both worlds: it has access to Omnicom’s back-end services and systems, but can trade independently with media owners.

For a diminutive agency, Goodstuff made as many headlines for all the righ

Description: We’re experts in consumer behaviour. 

For the past 16 years, we have analysed and interpreted consumer behaviour to help our clients engage with their consumers more effectively. We combine our clients’ data with our own in order to build an understanding that’s not only useful for informing future marketing campaigns, but also areas such as strategy and investment. 

We enhance our clients’ understanding of their customers and the habits of consumers across the UK. Using this data-driven insight it predicts consumer behaviour to inform future marketing campaigns, strategy and investment, and helps its clients to engage more effectively with consumers through targeted marketing that improves customer retention and increases market share. 

Our unique positioning has allowed us to introduce the UK’s largest viewing panel, delivering information from over 500,000 Sky homes that’s all anonymised and aggregated. This will help brands, advertisers and media partners understand their audience, measure how successful their TV advertising is, and reach their target audiences in a more effective manner. 

Our capabilities mean that we have an unmatched insight into the voice and habits of the UK consumer, and our clients to benefit from our expertise and experience. 

For more information, please visit www.skyiq.com

Data insight and analysis, Single customer view, Marketing database solutions, Consumer insight and viewing data, Digital capabilities - email, mobile, social

Description: 08 Sep 2008 10:26 MB:
Set up in 1998, the Alliance Against Intellectual Property (IP) Theft is a UK-based coalition of trade associations and enforcement organisations with an interest in ensuring intellectual property rights receive the protection they need and deserve. With a combined turnover of over £250 billion, our members include representatives of the film/TV and video, music, games, business software industries, branded manufactured goods, publishers, retailers and designers.
The Alliance is concerned with ensuring intellectual property rights are valued in the UK, and that a robust, efficient legislative and regulatory regime exists which enables these rights to be properly protected.

Description: 
Our Life Sciences practice serves pharmaceutical, biotech, medical devices companies.  The Life Sciences industry has been one of the fastest growing sectors of the economy over the past 20 years.  Today, however, the industry is facing unprecedented challenges to growth. Pharmaceutical product pipelines are not nearly as robust as they once were, pricing pressure has intensified in all segments of the industry and cost reduction has emerged as higher industry priority.

These issues have forced Life Sciences companies to be more creative to sustain growth and enhance profitability.  Key levers such as alliances in R&D, achieving marketing excellence, challenging the traditional sales paradigm, and more effectively managing the supply chain networks are becoming more common as these companies aim to grow and excel in this challenging environment.  We help our clients address these issues and we measure our success by the results they achieve.



Life Sciences
    Pharmaceuticals
    Biotechnology 
    Medical Devices

Working closely with you, we’ll discover, define and help express your unique proposition, so that it comes across clearly and consistently – internally and externally - wherever and however people experience your brand.

Description:  Who we are

Do you understand your customers? Do you know who they are and how to engage with them? Do you know how to reward and retain them?
We do.

Maximiles is a marketing specialist with over 14 years expertise in helping Europe’s biggest brands acquire, engage and retain their customers. Originally created as a provider of bespoke loyalty programmes, Maximiles continues to specialise in driving customer engagement through a number of different channels.
What we do

We create bespoke and off the shelf loyalty solutions that inspire businesses and consumers alike. We provide responsive panellists to the world’s leading market research companies. We plan and execute media marketing and lead generation campaigns across multiple channels, driving consumers to some of the world’s biggest brands.

We do all this and more.

Description: Independent, varied client base

Quintus Public Affairs is an independent political relations consultancy. Our success is founded on an understanding of the political decision making process combined with industry specific expertise.
Employing our specialist knowledge, our clients are able to anticipate changes and capitalise upon unforeseen opportunities. Our team nurtures a boundless enthusiasm for political history. This is combined with a broad ranging experience of contemporary politics, which allows us to forecast medium and long term trends and patterns in those public policies which are relevant to our clients’ interests. 
‘Successful business is increasingly becoming a political exercise.’ Philip Kotler, Harvard Business Review
The ability to respond quickly and in advance of changes in public government policy is vital to the success of any organisation, be it a business, a representative trade body or a charity. Informed planning, astute political awareness, tenacity in case making and first class communications skills are essential attributes for a public affairs programme. These are central to our approach.
‘I’ve come to the conclusion that politics is too serious a matter to be left to the politicians’ Charles de Gaulle

14/07/08 - Cohn&Wolfe et GCI Group fusionnent
RELATIONS PUBLIQUES. Les filiales RP du groupe WPP, Cohn&Wolfe et GCI, fusionnent sous l'enseigne Cohn&Wolfe. Initialement rattachée à Young&Rubicam, Cohn&Wolfe avait déjà repris sous sa marque les bureaux italien et espagnol de GCI, peu après le rachat en 2005 par WPP du groupe Grey, maison mère de GCI. Toutefois, la marque GCI subsistera à travers GCI Health, le nouveau réseau RP du groupe spécialisé dans le secteur de la santé. Cohn&Wolfe n'ayant pas de bureau en France, l'agence GCI (34 salariés et 3,8 millions d'euros de marge brute) se contentera donc de changer de nom. Ses principaux clients sont Dell, Gefco, P&G, Entreprise&Prévention, Energie&Avenir, British Airways et Amadeus.

Description: Ninah combines management consultancy, analytical rigor and marketing understanding to deliver not just insights but actionable insights and engage the organization to build consensus for change. Because of this approach most of our clients choose to work with us again citing long-term financial payback as the main reason. 


Ninah consulting helps companies identify the best marketing-driven growth opportunities – and how to make the most of them. We help them make the decisions that will deliver future success by identifying how changes to brand investment patterns will impact sales, market share and financial performance. 

We understand that successful businesses function as an integrated whole and we show how marketing decisions made now also affect other business issues such as product planning, sales force structuring or distribution. 

The work we do allows companies to see the commercial, corporate-cultural and organizational impact of decisions about the deployment of marketing investments. Our work allows senior management teams to make important investment decisions with increased confidence about the outcomes. 

Ninah Consulting is a Publicis Groupe company with offices in London, New York, Toronto, Los Angeles, Hong Kong, and Mumbai.

Specialties
marketing effectiveness, analytics, management consultancy, ROI, performance management, modeling, marketing, advertising, pricing, promotions, sales force optimization, segmentation, brand valuation, financial valuation, customer life time value

Description: Start Up in 2008.

Pete Digger rates this new consultancy VERY highly.  Won best new consultancy PR Week Awards 2008.


NEWS

11.12.07 PRW - 8 comms heavyweights have joined a new agency to be run by Michael Portillo's former press secretary Malcolm Gooderham.  The Ledbury Group aims to change attitudes towards brands or companies via ‘thought-leadership campaigns’. It has already secured Nestlé as a launch client.  The outfit will be run by Gooderham and Nick Bent, previously special ­adviser to Tessa Jowell at the Department for Culture, Media and Sport (plus 5 years at B-M).  8-strong panel of consultants will work on accounts, including: Teenage Cancer Trust Director of Comms, Lucy Jackson; Former Director of Comms & External Affairs at L’Oréal Esra Erkel-Paler; M&C Saatchi MD Damian Collins; Populus (polling firm) founder Andrew Cooper; Former Mail on Sunday editor Jonathan Holborow.
11.01.08 PRW - Google tops the first 'thought leadership index' compiled by recently formed consultancy The Ledbury Group and opinion research firm Populus. The index claims to reveal which businesses, individuals and not-for-profit organisations are recognised as 'thought leaders'.  Google takes the top spot ahead of Al Gore and Apple. The Carbon Trust is the highest ranking voluntary sector organisation - coming in fourth overall.
04.04.08 PRW - Anna Turley has been made deputy director of the independent think-tank the New Local Government Network; she comes from the Ledbury Group.

Description: Lightspeed Research (LSR) was founded in 2000 and is Headquartered in Warren, New Jersey. The company operates in North America, Europe, and Asia. LSR provides global online market research services, specializing in using the Internet as a data collection platform to provide research through building and maintaining panels subject to standards to ensure quality and representative sampling. 

Web and mobile technology combined with panels provide the foundation to support market research studies and specialty panels that range across industry sectors such as financial services, health care, business-to-business, automotive, family and more. LSR also provides custom panels to address specific client needs. In 2007, Lightspeed Research conducted over 20 million online surveys for clients. 

Lightspeed Research delivers valuable data to help clients make informed business decisions. With proprietary online panels throughout the world, our verified, engaged, and deeply profiled survey respondents can support research studies that vary in scope and complexity. Lightspeed Research’s expert Client Operations Team offers data collection services including survey design, sample management, programming, and reporting. The company has offices throughout the United States, Europe, and Asia Pacific. Lightspeed Research is part of Kantar, the information insight and consultancy division of WPP.

Specialties
Online market research, online panels, mobile research, research

Company Size
501-1000 employees

Founded
2000

Description: akkanto, formerly European Communication Strategies (CS), is a Brussels-based, independent communication consultancy that combines strategic advice with high quality and effective implementation. Our services span across a comprehensive range of communication expertise, including internal and external corporate communications, financial communications, public affairs, support to marketing, crisis communications, media relations and training. 

For both international and Belgian companies and organisations, akkanto consultants draw upon their extensive experience and knowledge to develop and manage tailored communication programmes to meet their clients' needs.

akkanto also specialises in fostering public-private dialogue on behalf of international companies with interests in Africa, with local stakeholders, national governments and international bodies, notably the Bretton Woods institutions.

Our vision
To be the reference on the Belgian/Brussels market for Strategic Communication Advice in Corporate Communication and Public Affairs, with proven added value for our clients, capable of responding to and anticipating their needs in Belgium, the EU, Africa and other selected markets, fast and effectively.

To be a leader in innovation, creativity, effectiveness and quality.

To attract top talent, providing an interesting and challenging environment for a team of engaged people, in which they find personal and professional satisfaction.

Description: About ohal

    Ohal is one of the world's leading research and insight consultancies measuring the effectiveness of marketing.

    Having pioneered the use of econometrics to measure the sales effectiveness of media and marketing activities for 40 years, Ohal specialise in bespoke, in-depth analysis and consultancy which enables marketers to achieve their brand objectives. Our consultants collate data from a range of sources and examine the details to extract valuable information that explains brand performance. Using this information we provide clients with the strategic and tactical advice necessary to optimise the ROI from all marketing activities and to maximise profitable sales.

Description: Nos trois pôles de compétence - Relations-presse, Internet, Edition/Publicité - travaillent en synergie pour vous apporter une force créative et une complémentarité de services indispensables à votre communication grâce à : 
une réflexion stratégique globale 
à partir de votre brief unique 
un conseil sur les meilleurs choix d'actions 
à mener en fonction de vos objectifs et de votre budget 
une unité dans les messages 
et dans la déclinaison de l'image de votre entreprise sur tous les supports 
un gain de temps et des coûts compétitifs 
grâce à la circulation entre les pôles des connaissances de votre culture d'entreprise 

Relations-presse & e-réputation
Nous sommes vos ambassadeurs auprès de la presse pour obtenir le maximum de retombées qualitatives dans l'ensemble des médias. En valorisant votre actualité, nous entretenons un échange permanent avec les journalistes pour les convaincre de la pertinence de l'information que nous rédigeons et leur délivrons afin qu'ils la relaient au sein de leur média.

Internet & e-marketing
Nous créons des sites Internet depuis 1997. Notre expertise repose sur notre capacité à structurer et hiérarchiser l'information en phase avec votre stratégie d'entreprise pour que votre site Internet et vos supports web (réseau sociaux, site mobile...) soient des outils complets de force de vente, porteurs d'image, relais de votre actualité, créateurs de mises en relation. Nous concevons le site pour optimiser le référencement naturel. Nous concevons des actions de fidélisation et de buzz pour développer la fréquentation du site et soigner votre e-réputation.

Identité & supports écrits
La création d'une identité forte et la mise en avant des aspects différenciateurs d'une entreprise est essentielle. Nous revendiquons une approche originale, distinctive, à l'image du nom de notre agence ainsi qu'une qualité rédactionnelle. Les supports écrits reviennent en force !

Description: All organisations need to be aware of how they interact with the communities around them - their "stakeholders". Stakeholders range from politicians and government officials to resident, patient and commuter groups.
Lyric understands the politics of people: we help bridge the gap, working for real and sincere engagement through fresh and effective communications.
What do we mean by fresh and effective communications? We've created community bodies (such as trusts or charities), repaired and started relationships from scratch with residents and local councils, enlisted members for community enterprises, trained in-house staff, run and written public consultations, and written environmental strategies that will have meaning to the local community.

Lyric's specialist area of communications is based on political relations and campaigning. And it and builds on that, going deeper. Lyric understands how important the "politics of people" are to every organisation. In today's political and social climate, you can't be genuinely effective without stakeholder consultation and liaison, without understanding the growing social role of social entrepreneurship and the need for organisational cultural change.
We work with clients to understand how they work with their stakeholders - throughout their organisation, from the ground up. We then work together to make the necessary changes. This way, there's no talk without action.
This is about engaging in a fresh and real way. It means that relationships are built on trust. And that brings hard-won - but long-lasting - benefits to all sides.

Lyric is very proud to work with the following organisations: 
Transport for London 
Network Rail 
BAA Heathrow 
BAA Southampton 
BAA Stansted 
DSB, Danish Railways 
Global Transport Knowledge Partnership, with the UK's Department for International Development and PricewaterhouseCoopers

Description: our work
Centre for Cities’ Work Programme 2008
Centre for Cities' purpose is to help improve the economic performance of UK cities, through our research and policy proposals. All of our work is designed to be relevant, accessible and useful to cities, business and the policy community. 
Since the Centre was set up in 2005, our work has included proposals for: city-regional mayors with financial powers over transport, housing and skills; improved transport connections between and within cities; greater powers for all local authorities to finance transport and housing investment; and enhancing the role of cities as drivers of innovation. Our annual report, Cities Outlook 2008, evaluated the economic performance of the UK’s main 60 cities. 
As the UK enters a period of slower growth, our 2008 research programme is focused on the economic prospects of our cities. We will be working with specific cities, including Bristol, Brighton, Cambridge, Hull, Sunderland and York. And we will aim to produce new solutions and fresh thinking on the challenges and opportunities that they and other cities face. 
We will examine three major themes of crucial relevance to building successful city economies: 
Business capital <index.php?id=5>
What are the drivers of business growth – and how can cities face the challenges of a globalised economy? Working with specific cities, we are developing practical recommendations for how cities can develop a competitive and diverse business base, with an emphasis on growth and high-value services. Our initial research will be on innovation in cities, the opportunities and threats of globalisation, and the future for financial services sectors in UK cities in an uncertain economic climate. 
Human capital <index.php?id=8> 
We are looking at how central government, cities, employers and training agencies can improve local labour markets. We’re arguing for a place-based focus to labour market policies, looking at how individuals can access jobs and training within city-regions. Our paper on <worklessness> examined the high proportion of city residents who are not in work. We have also published a report <index.php?id=540> on the impact of housing on city economies, and promoted the role of the private rented sector in a book <index.php?id=522> produced jointly with the Smith Institute. 
Physical capital <index.php?id=6>
We are developing policy proposals to help cities become denser, greener, and better-linked engines of growth. With the All Party Group on Urban Development, we have published a report <index.php?id=550> on how existing buildings in cities can contribute to carbon reductions. And we will publish further short reports on integrated urban transport and on climate change.

Description: We are a creative agency for modern service brands. Not just utilities and banks, but any brand for which the service of customers is critical. We don’t work in boxes but will use whatever channel, behaviour, or activity does the job in the best way we can think of. 

Our 5 core values: 

1. We’re Careoholics. We’ve learnt that successful service businesses depend on getting the small stuff right as well as the big stuff, so we care excessively about both. 

2. We’re independent. Which is another reason why we’re Careoholics. 

3. We care about the mission. We help our clients distil theirs into something that fires people up both internally and externally. 

4. We care about people at least as much as systems and channels - our people, people throughout the client organisation, people who influence, people in general. Because our experience with service brands has told us that if you don't get the people bit right, the rest doesn't matter. 

5. We care about being recognised, of course. So we were delighted to be recognised as Campaign's Direct Marketing Agency of the Decade in 2010. We wish for the same in 2020, Minus two words.

Description: 
Le Groupe Bach & Partenaires se dédie exclusivement aux relations avec les médias pour le compte d’entreprises de toutes tailles et d’institutions diverses. Cette option spécialisée correspond à une compétence professionnelle pointue: diffusion d'informations, gestion de crise, animation de partenariat médias.
 Le fait que Bach & Partenaires conserve ses clients les plus exigeants pendant plusieurs années, témoigne du sérieux et des performances des prestations rendues. La taille de l’agence, 14 personnes, est adaptée à sa spécialité. Indépendant à 100%, le groupe Bach & Partenaires a réalisé un CA net supérieur à 1.100.000 € lors de son dernier exercice.
 Le niveau mensuel de sa rémunération se situe entre 1.800 €, et 4.600 €, selon les missions.  


L'équipe 
L'équipe du groupe Bach & Partenaires est composée de 10 attaché(e)s de presse permanent(e)s. La moyenne d’âge est de 32 ans. 
Le profil de l’équipe est caractérisé par sa faculté d’adaptation et sa créativité, son 
 expérience de conseil, son niveau de 
production rédactionnelle, la puissance de ses contacts avec la presse et le souci de contrôle des résultats obtenus.

Description: RD:IR is a full-service Investor Relations consultancy based in London that is dedicated to providing the highest quality financial intelligence and capital market insight to public companies and their advisors.
RD:IR provides a wide range of IR services to IROs and company senior management in the UK and internationally which are all based on the underlying principle of achieving fair value for your share through the most effective marketing of your equity. We also offer a wide range of quantitative and qualitative research processes to participants in the global capital markets which help our clients understand better the worlds in which they operate.
RD:IR is already retained by over 450 UK and international public companies and we act for a wide range of financial intermediaries and organisations including stockbrokers, financial PR agencies, investment banks and a number of leading financial newspapers and magazines. Please see our Clients page <clients.html> for a list of some of our current clients.

Cline Davis & Mann Inc. is a full service pharmaceutical advertising agency providing a wide range of marketing, educational, media, and creative services directed at healthcare professionals, providers, and business-to-business targets.
