Description: CYBION joue un rôle de pionnier dans l'intelligence économique et stratégique sur Internet. La société a été créée afin d'aider les organisations publiques et privées à utiliser efficacement Internet en tant qu'outil de veille et de recherche d'informations. CYBION offre aux professionnels des prestations sur mesure pour aider à maîtriser l'information sur Internet 






POSTE : Suite à une diversification de ses activités (notamment après le lancement du média citoyen AgoraVox), l'entreprise cherche un directeur général délégué qui pourra seconder la direction actuelle. Vous prendrez en charge le développement de l'entreprise. Il est attendu de vous que vous puissiez aussi bien gérer les équipes, leur apporter un soutien opérationnel sur les trois pôles d'activités (formation, veille, études), et participer activement à la force commerciale. Vous suivrez les pôles d'activité de l'entreprise tout en étant force de proposition pour le développement d'autres activités. 

PROFIL : Vous avez complété une formation supérieure, par une spécialisation si possible en intelligence économique. Vous êtes un familier du secteur, et pourrez apporter autant une expertise qu'un carnet d'adresses. Vous avez acquis 5 ans d'expériences dans un poste similaire. Vous avez une excellente pratique des NTIC (côté technique) et en particulier des outils de veille et de recherche d'informations. 

Ceux qui sont intéressés peuvent envoyer leur candidature directement à cv@cybion.fr 


Pour toute autre candidature spontanée, merci d'adresser votre CV + lettre de motivation à cv@cybion.fr en précisant la nature du poste recherché.

Description: Our name reflects our approach. 

We’re a direct marketing agency for whom direct marketing is a way of thinking - not merely a channel. 

We believe that marketing communication needs to achieve two things - engage people emotionally and influence their behaviour. 

We’ve summed this up in two words - Moving People. 

To Move People you need to understand them better. So we always use people as our starting point to determine the approach we take and channels we use. 

We create communication that is integrated around people, letting them play a greater role in determining the right mix of channels and technology for them – rather than the other way round. 

This people-focused approach to marketing means that we can make brand experiences personal, human and valuable. Creating genuine brand engagement and delivering winning communication strategies. 

The result is creative work that is not only more insightful and compelling but also considerably more effective.

Our Team

We all have experience of supporting companies at every stage in their lifecycle (in other words we work on both growing and established businesses)

A UK B2B agency for technology companies, specialists in Public Sector technology


Mantis PR was created by two dynamic PR executives with a modern approach to delivering PR. What's modern about it? Just that we’re object driven. In other words, we start with your goals and aspirations and work back through the tools, resources and relationships that will help you succeed.
We're young enough, and flexible enough to tailor the way we work to your needs, but we’re experienced enough to know what works, and that is invariably attention to detail and strong, professional relationships.
We believe in the power of relationships with individual journalists, with ensuring your product or service fits their profile, and ensuring they always know what you're up to.
And here's another modern idea – we're prepared to base our fee on your success.


Services

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We'd like to introduce you to our services
We would like to meet with you to look at your needs, your market and discuss your PR aspirations. 

We will provide our credentials - a summary of why Mantis is qualified to work with you and how we can maximise support for your PR programme. Ideally, this will be a face-to-face meeting. We will then return to you within 14 days to share our ideas for your bespoke PR programme. 

How we charge
We work on a retainer and performance related bonus

Our retainer is paid monthly with our fee dependent on agreed objectives, activities and PR programme created 
Disbursements (telephone, postage, print, design, etc. additional cost) 
Free monthly competitor analysis, and daily industry news update 
Monthly bonus scheme applicable on all press coverage secured above agreed levels set in your PR plan

Description: 25/02/13 L'agence-conseil en communication Zmirov Communication a été choisie par le Comptoir national de l'or (vente et rachat de métaux précieux) pour gérer ses relations presse produits et corporate. Zmirov Communication a pour mission de développer la notoriété en ligne et hors ligne de la marque, auprès des consommateurs pour le rachat d'or usé et le conseil en achat or investissement, ainsi qu'auprès des entrepreneurs pour stimuler le développement de ses franchises. L'agence accompagnera également le Comptoir national de l'or dans ses différentes actions visant à valoriser son expertise et sa connaissance du marché de l'or.
03/12/2012
L'agence Zmirov Communication, chargée par la maison de cidres Ecusson de communiquer auprès d'une cible féminine à l'occasion de l'Épiphanie, a confié à la créatrice de lingerie fine haut de gamme Fifi Chachnil le soin d'imaginer un habillage glamour pour des bouteilles en édition limitée. Les bouteilles Ecusson rosé et Ecusson poiré à l'étiquette dessinée par Fifi Chachnil seront vendues chez les cavistes Nicolas durant le mois de janvier 2013.
15/06/2012
L'agence de RP Zmirov Communication complète son pôle digital avec l'arrivée de Guillaume Smanio (ex-Make me reach et Digiteka) au poste de chef de projet «social media marketing», de Lucie Quéval (ex-Co Working) comme consultante en e-RP, et de Nicolas Bouiguerourene en tant que community manager. Ce pôle proposera l'ensemble des stratégies de RP en ligne aux marques de l'agence et collaborera avec les agences Asap Communication et Living Room RP, créées par David Zmirov. Premier dossier: le dispositif français d'animation digitale de l'enseigne britannique Marks & Spencer, qui avait déjà confié à l'agence le lancement événementiel de son flagship des Champs-Élysées, puis ses RP produits et corporate.
16/09/2011
L'Office de tourisme de Tahiti et ses îles (ou Polynésie française) a choisi le pôle tourisme de Zmirov Communication pour la gestion de ses relations presse pour le marché français. L'agence aura pour mission de promouvoir dans la presse ce vaste ensemble situé en plein cœur du Pacifique, à travers ses paysages idylliques, sa faune et sa flore très riches, son histoire, ses traditions et ses produits, ainsi que les activités qu'il propose (écotourisme, sports nautiques, séjours d'exception). Zmirov Communication contribuera également à faire connaître les événements typiques de la Polynésie (Heiva I Tahiti, Hawaiki Nui Va'a, Tattoonesia...)
10/01/2012
L'agence Zmirov Communication s'est vu confier les relations presse de deux grandes marques de la distribution française. Pour Natalys, enseigne de puériculture de centre-ville, elle gérera la médiatisation des collections textiles et mobilier, ainsi que les différents services proposés aux consommateurs. L'agence accompagnera également les magasins de prêt-à-porter Gémo (groupe Eram) en relayant auprès des journalistes leurs récentes évolutions: collections renouvelées et enrichies, ouvertures de nombreux points de vente, nouvelle identité tournée vers la mode et la proximité client.

What precisely does “Business Development” involve at PSL? i.e. How do you go about searching for new clients? 
[Alex West] face to face presentations to new companies. Once we work with one brand team in a new client we then migrate laterally to other brand teams.

Who are PSL’s five biggest clients? 
[Alex West] All the usual suspects in Europe.  This role would very much have a European focus as discussed.

Is there any flexibility on Howard working from home? 
[Alex West] Limited – 1 day a week max

 To what extent, if any, would he be involved with the actual Market Research? 
[Alex West] Lots – he would be responsible for selling to new clients / existing clients, proposal writing and questionnaire development with and AD, delivering the presentation.

Description: We offer the full range of market research services as well as consultancy and design. 

But we are different. We strive for a level of excellence that keeps us ahead - and motivated to stay there. 

Our core expertise, which runs across everything we do, is understanding what motivates and distances audiences: how people connect with ideas, services, brands and communications – as well as why they don’t. 

Our mission is to speak for the target audience. We’re bold in how we do this. 

We take a 360 degree approach to all our research. We look at every problem from every angle, exploring how people think as much as what they think.

Description: iNHouse PR believes you should know exactly who will represent you. Who you meet will be who you deal with. We will happily come and base ourselves in your office - build effective relationships with your existing team and get to know what makes the organisation tick. Equally, we can work from our own offices, cutting your internal overheads and using our own infrastructure to get the job done. Either way you can be confident that your contacts will be the same people putting calls into journalists, preparing briefings for MPs or media training your key spokespeople - we will not hand your important campaigns to inexperienced staff that you've never met.
We can work as freelancers but without the employment red tape. We can come in when you are at your busiest without needing to be retrained or handheld each time - just call us when you need us and we'll get the job done. 
We are communications professionals; we develop and implement effective campaigns. We have experience of media relations and public affairs for clients of varied backgrounds - corporate, charities, not for profit, political and public sector. 



It is not unique for a PR firm to be based in London. Nor is it unique for a PR firm to claim to specialise in London. But what is unique is the experience in London that we have at iNHouse PR. This has led us to launch iNHouse LONDON. 
We are proud to have been the sole public relations provider to the Boris Johnson campaign for Mayor of London. For just under a year we have lived and breathed London. We submersed ourselves in London's issues and met with stakeholders, community leaders and London residents the length and breadth of the capital.
We learnt a huge amount on the journey with Boris and can confidently say that we have now advised on every major aspect of current policy in London. From Hammersmith to Havering, Hillingdon to Harrow and Ealing to Enfield, we know the issues that matter; from planning, waste management, the urban environment to crime and disorder, public transport, housing and many, many more. 
Now we want to use this knowledge to benefit your organisation. 
It has been our pleasure to work with Boris over the last 10 months. Why not see what we can achieve for you?
If you'd like to get in touch with our specialist London PR team email london@inhouse-pr.co.uk <mailto:london@inhouse-pr.co.uk>

Description: Maxus meeting Harry Davidson - Analytics side, 10.09.13

Client list on the website, effectiveness team in the UK, Martin Lawrence heads up effectiveness globally. Econometrics, web attribution. Try to supply what the clients want in the analytics space to add value. Work with third parties occasionally, but not much. Some clients go outside to malware brown directly, BT work with GFK. Data and analytics own p&l internally, function in analytics is to make money but do some stuff for free and work on pitches. D data and visualisation and dash boarding, tap out.
Don't use SAS, have bespoke econometric software
Commoditising visualisation, group M do that. Not so much on a Maxus level. 
Most clients looking at data in their own way,framework for dashboard but all service bespoke. 
Helen Coult deals with data part of talent acquisition. Nick baughn 
HD arrived in much 2012, was another stats guy, work was brilliant but didn't translate it. 
He left after HD left, senior econometrician came in, senior dashboard analyst joined in jan and another in August, looking for a junior analyst with 1-2 years, not fresh grads.
Analyst level - ability to think constructively about how to solve problems.
Technical with a larger team, multi skilled. History of econometrics for that role. Wants someone to have the ability to grasp how to apply what the results are. Small team who can talk to planners and buyers and find the results in the data to meet their targets. Have to be good at communicating. Senior guys are client facing, more junior present as part of a larger presentation. That may change. Team ATM, 4 people, one about to go on maternity leave. Give one yearers on the job training. Both client facing and technical very important. 
Would look at 2 yr ex, takes 5 mins to look at cv then ranks them. Have struggled to recruit people with 4/5 years exp, not the right sort of experience. 
Analytics in a media position : sell in analytics and media process. Got one 3/4 yrs ago, do a lot for them now. Maxus grew 80% last year, fastest growing media agency last year. Mediacom do 3 times more billings
4 soon to be 5 work across all clients separate function within the business was at bet fair prior to Maxus, doing analytics for them. 
He did economics at uni, was at bet fair before Maxus 
180 people, 100 joined last year. 
Background depends on role, for media econometrics. Media agency background best but saw a fab guy from British gas.
People who can think  in an economic way. Company values and perks, pace, passionate agile, lean in to change. Martin sorrel.describes them as fresher. Really exciting working at a young growing agency. Billed £300 million in 2012,  MEC mindshare £600millioon, mediacom a billionair. Lindsay Patton CEO. Average age is 25 26, grat nights out. Get involved in the team. Fe,male do well, women in marketing, marketing director. Lots of events for girls.

Description: UK & Brussels

Aspect is an independent communication management consultancy with a simple philosophy. We believe communication is a key determinant of business or organisational success. We believe communication should be designed, managed and evaluated with exactly the same professional approach as all other business disciplines. Everything we do is designed to help our clients meet their business objectives.
We recognize that the growing maturity of communication departments means our clients need expertise, counsel and direction, maybe even more than implementation support. Aspect approaches every brief with the professionalism and rigour that should be expected in modern business management.
Our team of experienced consultants drawn from across Europe recognizes that every company is different, every situation special, and all strategies specific. In short, we take a ‘grown-up’ consultancy approach, searching for the thoughtful yet practical solutions that business leaders need.

Our extensive experience, straight forward approach and passion to get things right means we deliver on our clients' business objectives.
Based in Brussels and London we work internationally for global and pan-European clients across a broad range of sectors, in three main areas of expertise: 
Organisational alignment communications <http://www.aspectconsulting.eu/index.php?page=organisational-alignment-communications> 
External reputation management <http://www.aspectconsulting.eu/index.php?page=external-reputation-management> 
Political communication support <http://www.aspectconsulting.eu/index.php?page=political-communication-support-2>

Description: 
Chris Speed
Operations Director

Chris is responsible for the operational management of iProspect’s media and data channels, including Paid and Natural Search, Affiliates and Lead Generation, Social Media, Analytics and Conversion Optimisation.
 
His digital marketing career began in 1999 when he co-founded an SEO agency servicing local SMEs. As the business grew, he branched out into Paid Search, web design and analytics. After leaving that business, Chris worked client-side for VisitBritain, where he ran global paid and natural search and web analytics across 45 markets.
 
Chris joined I Spy Marketing as its fifth employee in 2007, initially as Head of Paid Search, before taking on the role of Operations Director, working as part of the leadership team which drove the agency’s success prior to its acquisition by Aegis. A passionate sports fan, Chris’s dream client would be the Lawn Tennis Association and Wimbledon.

Description: Understanding What Matters
Autonomy Corporation plc (Nasdaq: AUTN; LSE: AU.) is the leading provider of enterprise software that enables organizations to automatically understand and harness information that is critical to their business. Enterprises of all sizes can automatically unify, manage and utilize the information stored on their systems and within the workforce to deliver competitive advantages such as reduced business cycles, accelerated productivity, and an increase in revenue.

This is achieved through Autonomy's ability to fully automate the processing of any type of unstructured information, ie. text, audio and video which, until now, has required manual intervention.

Autonomy is widely recognized as the market leader with best of breed technology by analysts such as Gartner Group, Forrester Research and Delphi and has benefited more than 1,000 global companies in both the public and private sectors. Global customers include Ford, Reuters, Deutsche Bank, BAE Systems, Sun Microsystems and public sector agencies including the U.S. Department of Defense, NASA and the U.K. Houses of Parliament.

Description: is a sister company to doctorsnet.co.uk. doing e marketing and e market research

Corinthian Court
80 Milton Park
Abingdon
Oxon, OX14 4RY
UK


Online market research is rapidly becoming big business as pharmaceutical companies embrace the technology and reap the rewards. Using our access to 153,571 doctors medeConnect offers an extremely accurate, fast, flexible and cost effective online market research service to the pharmaceutical industry
Online market research allows for virtually real time feedback and consequently real time decision making. An added bonus is that online research is not influenced by any outside factors such as interviewer bias.
Whether you simply want to drive doctors to a questionnaire on another site for fieldwork or develop an ad hoc campaign, medeConnect has both the knowledge and experience to carry out the brief.


Ad hoc/tailored
medeConnect offers a full range of services from questionnaire design and execution, to analysis and reporting. While it is all quantitative research, we can cover samples as small and targeted as 20-30 specialists to much larger surveys of 1,500 GPs.
It is all about tailoring the project to meet the client’s requirements. Flexibility is key to our online market research - clients can chose one or all of our services, simply picking from a menu of options. Some of the most popular uses for medeConnect research include:
Sending key marketing questions with rapid reporting to 100-1,000 GPs or 20-100 specialists. 
Marketing effectiveness assessment for an e-detail 
Representative-led detail follow ups 
Online advert testing and detail aids testing 
Campaign tracking – uptake/adoption over time. 
Regional analysis 
Click here to view our case studies >> <defaultpage121c0.aspx?pageID=103> 
Top  


Fieldwork
If companies already have their questionnaire prepared and online or have a study that requires scripting and hosting, medeConnect can facilitate both of these requirements. Doctors are either directed to a third party survey and then redirected back to receive the incentive automatically on the Doctors.net.uk website or alternatively to a survey hosted and scripted by medeConnect Healthcare Insight on behalf of the client. 
Deliverables for hosted and scripted studies can be tailored to a clients requirements, from a data export to full tabulations created from a supplied table specification

Description: Our expertise is public reputation management during times of corporate crisis or dispute. Our particular specialism is Litigation PR, a niche but growing segment of the PR industry.

Litigation PR is distinct from crisis and reputation PR in three particular ways:
close relationship between lawyer and PR 
understanding and avoiding contempt issues, across jurisdictions 
understanding pressure points peculiar to legal actions. 
In the absence of examination-in-chief, court room observers usually only hear the weakest version of a party's case. This adds a PR-dimension to UK litigation.
CFAs, by increasing the propensity for Class Actions have upped the stakes for corporate defendants, encouraging pressure to settle before trial. Our experience shows that targeted and sustained PR pressure, even if 'anonymised' and delivered through third parties, can encourage settlement.
Our Litigation PR services include:
Media risk assessment 
Political and/or PR strategies 
Settlement PR strategies 
Trial PR handling 
'Aftermath' management 
We do not act in jury trials, since by definition this would place us in contempt, while even in non-jury trials or tribunals we are cognisant of the Contempt of Court Act and its implications.
Our crisis and reputation management practice centres on rapid situation appraisal together with thorough identification of lines of command. We work at the direction of clients' lawyers, in close conjunction with client's senior management, their in-house PR and with Counsel. These mandates often require restraint rather than pro-active external engagement: knowing when to contain an issue is as valuable as understanding when to tackle, or indeed initiate, press interest.
Bell Yard takes client confidentiality extremely seriously, given the reputation-critical nature of the assignments we undertake. We treat all client mandates with the discretion clients require from their legal team and lawyers expect from their business associates.
Similarly, we are rigorous about avoiding potential client conflicts of interest. We consult carefully with clients about their perceptions of what would be a conflict and will undertake or decline mandates accordingly.

Description: William Reed Business Media Ltd has been providing market leading business information for 150 years. Since 1862, when the first issue of The Grocer magazine rolled off the printing presses, ours has been the authoritative voice of the UK grocery industry. The markets we serve are central to everyone’s life. They include food and drink, where our activities extend across manufacturing, retail, wholesale and hospitality, and, more recently, pharmaceuticals and cosmetics. 

Today, with the fifth generation of the Reed family running the company, we have an expanding portfolio of websites, newsletters, magazines, face-to-face and virtual events, exhibitions, conferences, data services and directories, across an international footprint. The Group has moved with the times and invested significantly in developing and improving brands and products. A number of successful strategic acquisitions throughout William Reed’s history have also boosted growth. 

Our success in these markets is based on providing high-value information and research, robust editorial content and innovative events and exhibitions, enabling our customers to succeed within their industries. The future promises exciting opportunities, with more investment in people and product development, greater deployment of new technologies and the prospect of further acquisitions.

Description: Juno Productions are a full service promotions and events company, who have a small focused key team based in central London. Our expertise comes in the fields of project management, sponsorship sourcing, event organising and marketing solutions.

We feel that as a combined effort we fulfil all of your criteria advertised in abundance, and we also have the added resource of our own offices to work from.  We have dealt with high-level corporates with brands such as, Sony, Orange, Variety, Goldman Sachs, UBS Warburg, Societie generale, IBM, BT, Miramax, London 2012, Rocawear, Dior, DTI to name but a few.

Juno feels that we can offer all the relevant service and maintain the desired work ethic paramount to this project from our own offices.  We also believe that having the ability to work from our own premises will inspire outstanding results, as we have access to all the data and contacts that would be beneficial in this field.  This will also allow yourselves to reduce costs and space requirements.

Below is a brief description of the senior members of the team who will be working on this project.

 

 
Emma Bewick ­ Director
 

As a student Emma worked with artists such as The Prodigy, Radiohead, Boy George, Neneh Cherry etc., with responsibility for technical production for
a variety of venues across the UK.   She was also responsible for scheduling
events, booking artists and raising sponsorship

 

Prior to graduation Emma was elected on a 6:1 majority to the post of Academic Officer representing the student body to the board of governors in all matters relating to courses and student welfare and raising the profile and awareness of various academic issues to the students. She also toured sixth form schools and colleges giving advice on choosing the right courses and how to survive your first college experience!

 

Post University Emma travelled extensively in-between freelancing as an engineer before becoming Event Director for the Pepsi Chart Show.  At Pepsi Emma bridged the gap between TV production, events and ITC regulations and ensured publicity was kept at a premium amongst audiences for the show, which included The Spice Girls, All Saints, Boyzone, Simply Red, Fun Loving Criminals etc. 

 

Whilst at Pepsi, Emma also assisted with the event management of London Fashion Week and took over as Director of the London Screenings. Within one year Emma had taken the London Screenings from a core attendance of 75 International film companies to over 2000 A-list film buyers, sellers, producers, directors, actors and associated industry partners. She created an international brand by producing a London Screenings VIP members¹ scheme enabling attendees to benefit from service supplier discounts at film markets and festivals worldwide.

 

Emma¹s role at London Screenings also included organising post screening premiere events and she has since become known as one of the major events organisers for parties at the Cannes Film Festival, the American Film Market and the Berlin Film Festival with guest lists including Sharon Stone, Christina Ricci, Leonardo Di Caprio, Lenny Kravitz etc. Emma has also continued to keep up with her music industry contacts and has arranged a number of music showcases and festivals within the UK and overseas.

 

Emma has been successfully running Juno Productions since June 2002.  This has enabled Emma to concentrate on projects that are fun, stimulating and challenging whilst allowing her to maintain a high

bcm is a technical B2B public relations agency that focuses on technology.

Description: As the Middle East and North Africa’s premier social media agency, The Online Project is a Jordanian based startup that develops and executes social media strategies for Fortune 500 companies and high profile organizations operating in the region.

Description: Behavioural data, customer information and feedback used to be difficult to access and capture. In some cases it still is. But consumer data, available in accessible form is more abundant than ever. And the volume is set to increase exponentially. 

Seeing meaning, providing direction and delivering advice based on a variety of sources are essential skills, needed now more than ever. 

This is where 2CV excel. Distilling insight from information is our business. Whether bespoke international ethnographic research, tracking study, digital anthropology or data science project, you'll find carefully collected information creatively analysed to provide critical meaning and direction. 

2CV put people at the heart of their offer. Not a sector specific expertise or a favoured methodology. 

We utilise every tool at our disposal, traditional and digital to get to the heart of the issue. Observing people from a number of vantage points as they work, rest and play gives us an unrivalled holistic view on the hearts and minds of consumers across the world. 

We operate from the heart of Europe, US and Asia. And in stark contrast to the increasingly mechanical, digital and virtual world we inhabit, we deliver from the heart, to the heart of your business. 

2CV - from the heart of people to the heart of business
Specialties
Qualitative Research, Quantitative Research, Analytics and Data Science, Ethnography

Description: Le monde change, le niveau de complexité augmente, le marketing est dorénavant intimement
lié à la créativité, la technologie, la data et la science. Comment nous définir maintenant ?
Agence digitale ? Customer ?
Nous avons choisi de nous caler sur une ambition : assurer le continuum d’expérience marque / client.
C’est pour cela que nous nous sommes organisés désormais comme une agence de CXM
(Customer Experience Management).

NOTRE VISION
Créer des expériences, développer la relation, connecter le point de vente, mettre
la data au service du commerce : autant d'enjeux sur lesquels nous oeuvrons au
quotidien pour développer le business de nos clients. Nous atteignons ces objectifs
grâce à notre approche propriétaire "Data Set / Mind Set", associant quanti et quali
au service d'une compréhension 360° des cibles. L'innovation est au coeur de cette
vision. Aussi, afin d'en promouvoir l'esprit au sein de l'agence, avons-nous décidé,
cette année, de nous rapprocher de façon durable de l'univers des start-up en étant
partenaire de Bpifrance ; nous y puisons la vérité de demain.

Communication Digitale : Écosystèmes digitaux, stratégie de communication on line,

dév. front / back, SEO / SEM, social media, applications, mesures.
CRM / Business Intelligence : Programmes PRM / CRM / Incentives, Stratégie de ciblage,
Data Intelligence, Business consulting.
Social Media : Défi nition de la SVP (Social Value Proposition) pour la marque, animation,
brand content, live from social, monitoring des performances, social CRM.
Retail Activation : Campagnes d'activation intégrées, activation in store, trade marketing.

Nespresso, Nestlé, Michelin, Opel, MasterCard, Maybelline New York, L'Oréal Luxe,

Description: Very difficult to get names in this company.

Avec 44 000 salariés et 50 filiales, Bristol-Myers Squibb se place au 9e rang des groupes pharmaceutiques mondiaux.

Présent dans une centaine de pays, Bristol-Myers Squibb s’est imposé dans des domaines thérapeutiques majeurs : maladies cardiovasculaires, virologie, oncologie, prise en charge de la douleur et neurosciences.

Conscient des attentes émanant des professionnels de santé, des patients et des pouvoirs publics, BMS est mobilisé autour d’une stratégie claire : centrer sa recherche sur des axes thérapeutiques prioritaires et en améliorer le taux de réussite, à chaque étape d’un processus de développement, qui s’étend sur plus de dix ans.

Bristol-Myers Squibb, entreprise solidaire, va plus loin que la prise en charge médicale. Sa Fondation aide, depuis 1977, tous les dispositifs d’accompagnement des malades, du Rire Médecin à l’ONU-SIDA. En interne, une gestion du personnel innovante contribue au développement des collaborateurs. A l’externe, Bristol-Myers Squibb s’engage par des actions concrètes à préserver l’environnement.

Description: LNG Capital is a European Credit alternative asset manager. Our investment process combines rigorous bottom-up fundamental research with an understanding of the prevailing macroeconomic environment.
LNG’s portfolio management team has worked together since 2002, and has received widespread recognition as pioneers of the European Credit Markets. They are supported by a robust operational platform that consists of multi-layered risk management capabilities, strong liquidity management and excellent standards of corporate governance.
LNG’s portfolio management team seeks to only invest in highly liquid credit and related instruments, a factor that allows us to remain nimble and dynamic in the face of changing market conditions. We begin our analysis by first examining the general macro-economic environment and global risk appetite, this initial analysis allows us to identify attractive sectors and companies within those sectors.
Once identified, each investment opportunity is subject to rigorous fundamental analysis, while technical market factors are always accounted for before the inclusion of any instrument into the portfolio by the investment managers. The incorporation of pre-determined entry and exit points for every trade is also key to our pre and post trade risk management process. Once included in the portfolio, each position is subject to stringent and on-going re-evaluation and analysis by our investment and risk management teams.
The portfolio managers have long been pioneers in the European credit markets, and have together forged a near 10-year track record of investment returns. This team was selected by EuroHedge for three award nominations, including best new fund and best credit fund for two consecutive years.

Description: NEWS

03.04.08 PRW - The DfID has appointed a temporary deputy head of news as part of its ongoing comms shake-up.  Charlotte Morgan has been seconded from the Department for Communities and Local Government and will maintain the newly created role for the next six months.  BBC political correspondent James Hardy is to join DfID as head of news, reporting to director of comms Paul Mylrea.  As well as looking to hire a permanent deputy head of news role, Mylrea is also seeking a head of the features team and new press officers.
08.09.08 PRW - Charlotte Morgan has been hired as the deputy head of news, along with Natalie Acton who is the new deputy comms director and head of strategic communications.  Morgan was formerly chief press officer and press secretary to Yvette Cooper, she has also been press secretary to David Milliband. Acton started her career at the Treasury; she also worked at No.10 before spending two years at Lewisham Council as assistant director of strategy and performance in children's services.

Description: Linstock Communications is a media relations and public affairs consultancy. We provide straightforward advice to clients who want timely and effective communications campaigns. We design and deliver media, political and stakeholder engagement programmes.

Description: Public Relations activity is an essential part of the marketing mix, ensuring that a company’s products and services are well communicated, understood and acknowledged in the marketplace.

The Creative Tank Public Relations division will plan, co-ordinate and implement effective PR strategies to meet a variety of business objectives from product launches to crisis management. Our network comprises specialist PR practitioners across both consumer and B2B focused media channels. 
Creative Tank have control PR for companies such as Harrods, Bose, Eden Project, B & W Speakers and Minipod Speakers


Online PR

We have the resources and contacts to successfully PR brands and product ranges online. We work closely with online titles to make sure that our clients are seen across all formats of the media.  We also have website promotion teams that will ensure your reviews are being read by the consumer entering associate key words to search engines.	


Corporate PR

Creative Tank's specialist public relations team specifically deal with the quality and nature of the relationship between your organisation and its stakeholders.
Corporate public relations is the reputation of the entire company. This area is concerned with enabling a company to succeed. 
We will generate a sound, effective and comprehendible flow of communication so that shared understanding is possible.


Financial PR

Creative Tank has a strong understanding of the financial media and financial markets as well as company full year and half year results, and investor relations.

The global financial and invisible industries market is growing in size and role, driven by a demand for corporate transparency and a thirst for information about business. 
Creative Tank focus on a clear communication of objectives, achievements and potential. We also specialise in AGM coverage including video broadcasts.

Description: 
Tequila = TBWA interactive = cellule web de TBWA  
Tequila = l'agence web du groupe TBWA, un des premiers groupes de communication sur Paris

(Textuel = cellule marketing de TBWA)


15/07/06 - Tequila : André Calisti arrive, Olivier Allardi part
André Calisti, 47 ans, précédemment directeur des ressources humaines chez Ogilvy One, rejoint Tequila (groupe TBWA) au poste de chief operating officer (COO). A ce titre, il prend en charge les RH de l'agence de marketing services et communication digitale (recrutement, formation, politique salariale, plan de carrière et talent management), son organisation et les volets process et qualité. Il reportera directement à Laurent Lilti, président. 
Ancien professeur de philosophie, André Calisti a été consultant auprès de cabinets ministériels, puis consultant en gestion des conflits auprès des établissements hospitaliers publics et privés. DRH chez debitel pendant dix ans, il a ensuite occupé ces fonctions chez OgilvyOne, où il a parallèlement intégré le comité de direction. 
Parallèlement et sans rapport de cause à effet, Olivier Allardi, 46 ans, Dg de Tequila, a quitté l'agence. Une décision qui n'est pas unilatérale, mais décidée d'un commun accord, sans conflit identifié entre les deux parties. Olivier Allardi travaille sur plusieurs projets professionnels, l'un autour du contenu, l'autre sur le sujet data/études, un troisième étant en cours de formalisation. Après un début de carrière chez l'annonceur, il a mené sa carrière en agences, successivement chez Rapp Collins (chef de projets), OgilvyOne jusqu'en 2001 (consultant, partner puis directeur commercial), Rapp Collins à nouveau de 2001 à 2005 (directeur commercial puis Dga), DraftFCB de 2005 à 2006 (Dg) et enfin Tequila où il était depuis 2006 Dg, plus particulièrement en charge du commercial.

2010 TBWA et Tequila sont la même agence

Description: L'agence-conseil en communication Grrrey annonce plusieurs recrutements. A la création ; Marine Azzouz, ex-Australie, trente-huit ans, arrive en tant que responsable du trafic et de l'achat d'art ; Virginie Kasse, ex-Devarrieuxvillaret, arrive comme conceptrice-rédactrice et Laurence Mence, vingt-sept ans, ex-Publicis Net, est nommée directrice artistique Interactif. A la cellule création interactive, Clément Jacquet arrive comme développeur multimédia. Philippe Citti, ex-Aressy & Associés, est nommé directeur technique. Enfin, Christine Buscailhon, ex-Everest, trente-huit ans, intègre l'équipe du planning stratégique au poste nouvellement créé de "data-planner". 

L’agence de marketing Services Grrrey ! prend la dénomination du réseau G2, au sein du groupe Grey, et se rebaptise G2 Paris. Si le nom de l’agence évolue, sa structure de direction reste inchangée avec Philippe Ceyrac à la présidence et Benoît Héry à la vice-présidence.
G2 Paris est désormais sous la double autorité de Pierre Callegari, président du groupe Grey en France, et de John Lynn, président de G2 Europe, "de façon opérationnelle", explique Philippe Ceyrac.
La signature ("l’agence méchamment efficace") et l’emblème de l’agence (le mouton) demeurent et G2 Paris lancera sous peu une nouvelle campagne de communication.

Description: In 1979, IMS introduced MIDAS, a worldwide data analysis service that enabled companies to access IMS databases directly from terminals installed in their own offices. (Mulitnational integrated data-analysis system)
MIDAS is a unique system that brings together healthcare facts and figures from around the world, providing the opportunity to examine multi-country markets in the most flexible and cost effective ways. 
 "The MIDAS system stores information gathered from virtually every prescription distribution channel, enabling us to offer our clients an invaluable source of insight into drug utilization, prescribing practices and drug effectiveness. It is therefore vital that our people are able to use MIDAS effectively in order to promote and provide an efficient service. We turned to e-Learning as a training mechanism in order to deliver consistent training to our widely dispersed sales force."

Description: WCG global MD Gail Cohen describes 2011 as a 'full-on' year in which the healthcare agency's London office gathered 'huge momentum'. With fee growth of 116 per cent and staff growth of 150 per cent, these statements are by no means exaggerations.
Cohen puts its success down to an integrated approach for healthcare comms. Traditional comms, issue management, content creation and online services are part of every campaign.
Clients also appreciate the agency's focus on data and analytics. 'We use them to plan campaigns, not as a post-mortem,' she says.
She adds: 'Organic growth has been massive and because we are independent we can be competitive and flexible when it comes to our prices.'
Plans for 2012 include continuing to invest in digital services, remaining competitive and staying positive.
At a glance 
Key clients Bayer, BMS, GHI, Merck Serono, Pfizer, ViroPharma
Significant hires Director Manu Field from Chandler Chicco Agency; director Sabrina Gomersall from Ogilvy Healthworld; group director Danielle Whitney on secondment from Merck Serono
Plans for the year ahead Grow talent; expand across clients' brands
Predicted fee income for 2012 £3.1m

The office has grown from around five people when it was established in May of 2008 to nearly 25 currently, having made several new hires already this year to support new business.
Christine Tadgell joined the WCG London team in May 2012 as managing director, bringing over 19 years of pharma experience in business strategy and operations.
In addition WCG hired creative designer Emanuel Zahariades and three new account associates to support the communications business: Justine Brodie (pictured), who recently graduated from Manchester University; Sarah Horgan, who brings over four years' experience in the cardiovascular field gained while working for the Irish Heart Foundation; and Valeria Kaplan, who joins from EMBO (European Molecular Biology Organisation). 
Gail Cohen, Global Practice lead at WCG said: “Hiring a diverse group of experienced, dedicated and highly capable people who consistently deliver excellent work that makes a real difference for our clients has been the simple formula to our growth and success to date.”

Description: We are a global, broad-based health care company devoted to discovering new medicines, new technologies and new ways to manage health. Our products span the continuum of care, from nutritional products and laboratory diagnostics through medical devices and pharmaceutical therapies. Our comprehensive line of products encircles life itself – addressing important health needs from infancy to the golden years.

Throughout our 100+ year history, Abbott people have been driven by a constant goal: to advance medical science to help people live healthier lives. It’s part of our heritage. And, it continues to drive our work. Today, 65,000 Abbott employees around the world share the passion for " Turning Science Into Caring." It's a commitment to focusing on what matters most: life and the potential it holds when we are feeling our best.

Abbott has sales, manufacturing, research and development, and distribution facilities around the world, close to where our customers need us to be. We are recognized for our global reach and our ability to serve our customers around the world.

Abbott prides itself on being recognized as a good place to work because we strive to provide an environment that enables employees to succeed. We have received numerous local, national and international distinctions for our commitment to workplace excellence. Our programs range from award-winning health care benefits to a variety of convenience and wellness services and long-term retirement benefits.

Description: Insert Planning and Buying

What we do
Clients and partner agencies appoint us to plan and buy insert campaigns in national press, magazines and third party distributions (third party inserts piggyback other non-competing companies’ direct mailings and product despatches). Whilst we are known as the short term kings when it comes to entry costs (which our clients love, of course) we are equally adept at planning laid-down campaigns, leading the strategy and analysing response data.

What’s different 
Whilst most ‘generalist’ agencies often plan from syndicated sources such as TGI/NRS, this is just a SMALL part of our approach – we also plan titles by distribution strength (which we break down into 5 categories) and their distribution efficiency by print format.

When it comes to direct response inserts, there is no substitute for the experience of having planned, bought and analysed results from thousands of campaigns – and there is no agency that can match our experience. We have learned from more than 200 clients and 850 different titles – we know when a higher cost per thousand will return a better ROI, and which distributions respond best (it’s often the least known/sexy media – that you may well not even know)

The end result is that we produce a campaign with a broader selection of media, optimum print format and the lowest entry cost, which delivers maximum ROI.

Did you know?
In 2012, we planned and bought inserts for 200+ clients – more than any other media agency in the UK. There is no other insert company that even comes close.

Description: Like many industries, the music industry is becoming more and more data driven in their decision making, and at Musicmetric we are actively driving this change. 

The company was founded in 2007 and launched a pioneering music analytics dashboard soon after, tracking trends for hundreds of thousands of artists on Social Media, Peer to Peer networks and textual references on the Web. 

Fast forward to 2013 and our product line and API’s cater to thousands in the industry; from our partnerships with Last.fm and Spotify to supply free stats dashboards to hundreds of thousands of emerging artists to our enterprise platform actively used by professionals in the music industry to manage the campaigns of major recording artists. 

The Musicmetric team is made up of experts in data analysis, data warehousing and software engineering sitting alongside seasoned authorities in the music industry – all with a shared passion for music.

Description: Interbrand France et le Groupe DDB France ont signé le 30 mars 2005 un accord en vue du rapprochement d’Interbrand Paris, leader en conseil et création de marque, et de Paris Venise Design, agence de design du groupe DDB France. 


Paris, le 11 avril 2005 - Interbrand Paris fusionne avec Paris Venise Design, filiale du Groupe DDB France. Cette nouvelle entité se positionne sur tous les métiers liés à l’expression des marques : identité visuelle, packaging, design, architecture commerciale. 

Le nouvel ensemble se situera parmi les trois premières entités du marché en France et renforcera ainsi la position du réseau Interbrand, leader mondial du branding. 

Pour DDB, cette opération revêt un intérêt stratégique qui se traduit par une prise de participation de DDB France dans le capital d’Interbrand France, Stéphane Ricou, Francesco Moretti, co-fondateurs de Paris Venise Design et Bertrand Chovet, directeur associé, conservant également leur participation au sein du nouveau Groupe Interbrand. 

Les 30 collaborateurs de Paris Venise Design, dont 15 créatifs, rejoindront les équipes d’Interbrand le 1er juillet 2005, et l’ensemble comptera alors une centaine de collaborateurs. Le Groupe Interbrand France sera alors dirigé par Jean-Baptiste Danet, entouré de Gérard Barrau et David Jobin (Interbrand), de Stéphane Ricou, Francesco Moretti et Bertrand Chovet. 

Paris Venise Design vient renforcer l’offre d’Interbrand en identité visuelle et créer une offre packaging avec la dynamique commerciale et la réputation créative qu’on lui connaît depuis plusieurs années. 

" Cette acquisition stratégique nous permet de compléter notre offre avec une équipe créative à forte valeur ajoutée et répond au besoin croissant de valoriser et différencier les marques de notre quotidien ", déclare Jean-Baptiste Danet, PDG d’Interbrand. 

Interbrand offre au développement de Paris Venise Design la force de son réseau international, la qualité de sa réflexion sur l’évaluation, la création et la valorisation de marque et un savoir-faire complémentaire notamment en matière d’architecture commerciale. 

" Une proposition de spécialistes à la fois plus pointue et plus élargie, privilégiant expertise stratégique et haute qualité créative, telle est aujourd’hui la force de notre union avec Interbrand. Une union qui s’inscrit dans la continuité de notre histoire au service de la marque ", expliquent Stéphane Ricou et Francesco Moretti, co-fondateurs de Paris Venise Design. 


En s’appuyant sur des compétences complémentaires en branding et expression de marque, développées de longue date par Interbrand et DDB France, cette fusion donne naissance à une offre élargie en termes de moyens, d’outils et de talents réunis en une même structure. 

" La valorisation d’une marque et son expression au travers du design d’environnement, de l’identité visuelle et du packaging sont stratégiques pour DDB et ses clients. A un moment où les marques doivent se renforcer pour plus de cohérence dans leur expression, plus de différenciation dans leur présence, plus de valorisation dans leur actif, le partenariat prend tout son sens. Il permet à Paris Venise et à ses clients d’accéder à une somme d’expertises uniques en France, associant valeur ajoutée et créativité remarquables ", souligne Xavier Romatet, Directeur Général de DDB France. 




*********************************************** 

A propos d’Interbrand 
Leader mondial en conseil et création de marques,

Description: Gilles LAMARQUE dispose d’une expérience de 15 ans dans la gestion des affaires publiques à Paris et à Bruxelles. Il compte parmi ses clients de grands groupes français et étrangers et plusieurs associations professionnelles. Il conduit par ailleurs des opérations d'accompagnement en management des affaires publiques. 

Responsable des affaires publiques de Renault à Paris et à Bruxelles pendant 7 ans en charge de la réglementation et des négociations communautaires, il a connu les grandes évolutions du secteur automobile : les restructurations du secteur, la prise en compte des phénomènes environnementaux et la poussée des sensibilités anti-automobiles, la globalisation du secteur, le dialogue avec les associations de consommateurs et d'usagers, l'adaptation aux exigences du développement durable, etc.

Précédemment responsable des affaires européennes chez Publicis, il a participé au positionnement du groupe sur les affaires européennes, à des appels d'offre de la communauté et a conseillé plusieurs entreprises et organisations dans leur réflexion institutionnelle.

Gilles LAMARQUE a débuté sa carrière au MEDEF où il était en charge des relations avec les pouvoirs publics locaux et du suivi de la décentralisation.

Description: Founded in Munich in 1985, Avantgarde is an owner-managed, global communications agency with a focus on experiential marketing.

Over 400 employees at 18 locations around the globe create outstanding brand experiences. Well-known brands have been putting their trust in our work and partnership for years.

Avantgarde is best defined as a strategic partner for integrated, long-term brand campaign planning. Our services inject excitement into brand experience, using all the relevant channels.
Avantgarde UK is located right in the heart of the City of London, recognised as the global capital of creativity and home to many big brand global marketing HQs. This brand savvy, experienced team delivers live brand marketing for a range of clients in the automotive, telecoms, travel, sports and leisure markets. We believe there is no substitute for the effect of human interaction in the creation of true brand fans.

About Holmes & Marchant
Set up over 40 years ago Holmes & Marchant is one of the most established agencies around.

- Evolution interne hiérarchique ou vers du management 

- Variété de projets et de clients. 

  - Conditions de travail et le bien-être au travail : 12 RTT, Conciergerie, salle de sport, participation, mutuelle, cantine, espaces de vie très agréable (snooker, babyfoot etc..) ambiance très collaboratif et non compétitif à l’inverse de nos clients. 

- Résultats et ambitions du groupe : +11% en 2015, ambition de doubler de taille en 2020, acquisition de Same Same but different et Zone Franche..

J’espère que cela vous apporte des éléments utiles.

La fusion des groupes Leo Burnett et D’Arcy est achevée. Le nouveau groupe Leo Burnett France, présidé par Jacques Bordelais, compte 250 collaborateurs. Il comprend : Leo Burnett Paris, l’agence de publicité et ses deux départements Leo BtoB et Leo Events; Leo Corporate dirigée par Arnaud Dupui-Castérès et Frédéric Toussaint; Arc, agence de marketing services, dirigée par Isabelle Battesti; Challenger House, dédiée aux marques challengers dirigée par Patrick Mercier et Media Book, agence de RP dirigée par Marianne Labadie. 

Challenger house

Le Gaulois et Eurofil dans l'escarcelle de Leo Burnett

L'agence Leo Burnett vient de remporter après compétition deux nouveaux budgets : celui de la marque Le Gaulois, appartenant au groupe LDC, pour laquelle les premières actions de l‘agence débuteront en télévision fin février. Et celui d'Eurofil, la marque d’assurance directe du groupe Aviva. 

Bien dans ma Vie" avec Leo Burnett

Leo Burnett va dorénavant signer les campagnes de "Bien dans ma Vie". Les premières actions de communication sont attendues en mars prochain. Créé en 2002, et racheté par Prisma Presse à Axel Springer France fin septembre 2007, ce mensuel féminin est orienté sur le bien-être, la santé et la psychologie.

Ligaris assurera la com de lancement du Dossier Médical Personnel
A l’issue d’un appel d’offres public, le groupement d’intérêt public en charge de la mise en place du Dossier Médical Personnel (GIP DMP) a confié le budget de communication de lancement du Dossier Médical Personnel au groupe Ligaris. Sur trois ans, le budget total se monte à 15 M€. CLM BBDO, Draft FCB, Publicis et TBWA ont également participé à cette compétition, lancée en juillet 2006.

Deux nouveaux budgets chez Ligaris
Au terme d'un appel d'offres réunissant TBWA Corporate, e-penser et NDC & Associés, Ligaris prend en charge le dispositif de communication 2007 de la Fédération de la formation professionnelles (mailing, annonces presse...). Par ailleurs, l'agence récupère la conception de la stratégie de repositionnement et la nouvelle signature d'Acome (télécom).

La Fédération de la Formation Professionnelle chez Ligaris
A l’issue d’une compétition qui a vu s’opposer e-pensee, NDC et Associés, TBWA Corporate et Ligaris, la Fédération de la Formation Professionnelle (FFP) a confie son dispositif de communication 2007 à Ligaris. Il s’agira principalement d’un dispositif en presse BtoB et marketing direct, qui verra le jour au deuxième trimestre.

Description: 

The restructuring of large companies is one of our core competences but we offer many other managerial skills. Our work is varied because it takes place in many different locations and for many different types of organisation. It can range from giving advice to a senior manager for a short period, managing a reorganisation over several months or taking full executive responsibility for an operational division. 

We have built strong partnerships with companies in most manufacturing, distribution and service sectors. Many of our clients are large multinational businesses but we also work for mid-ranking publicly-quoted, private companies and smaller organisations. Sometimes we are introduced to a business by the venture capital company that has invested in it. And the skills that we have acquired in the private sector are also appreciated by new clients in public and not-for-profit organisations. We have completed major reviews of costs, processes and people in large government departments, and restructured non departmental public bodies.

We look to recruit people who have the diverse skills and experience to get large companies to make improvements that will last. They have all been senior managers – some in international firms – and are used to getting the best out of processes and people. They have sound knowledge, fresh views on old problems, and the personal skills to get hard things done. They are not career consultants.

Some have special skills in financial/operational analysis, in organisational design and the supply chain, in manufacturing and operational controls, in managing projects, and in employee relations and employment law. They include a number of American, Dutch, French and German consultants, and several qualified employment lawyers – in the UK, France and Germany. This is a particular advantage in undertaking large restructurings.

Our consultants accept personal accountability for getting done what the client has asked us to achieve. They do not work in large teams. It defeats our objective of understanding thoroughly a manager’s perspective and providing excellent value for money.

Most consultants stay with us for a long time. It is rare for them to move to a competitor – more likely they will seek to refresh their skills in another managerial job.

Description: Raitt Orr & Associates Limited 
Raitt Orr & Associates is a medium-sized communications consultancy based in London. It is the only central London public relations organisation specialising in aid and development issues with expertise in, and experience of, Africa. For more than 20 years, Raitt Orr has provided services to African governments, UN agencies, international organisations, donor organisations and the corporate sector. Principal areas of focus for the company include government relations, corporate communications, trade and investment promotion and tourism promotion and representation.
Raitt Orr clients include the UN-affiliated University for Peace, Commonwealth Business Council, Kenya Airways and Japan Bank for International Cooperation, as well as Sasakawa-Global 2000.

Description: Fondée par Jean-Louis Aubert, ancien journaliste dans la presse informatique et Jean-Pascal Rozet, ancien Directeur de la Communication d’un grand groupe informatique, Clipping-traitdunion se positionne comme l’une des toutes premières agences de Relations Presse indépendantes en France. Notre mission est à la fois simple et complexe à mettre en œuvre : assurer la meilleure visibilité de nos clients dans les médias français et paneuropéens.
C’est la raison pour laquelle notre prestation est unique… 
des Relations Presse et rien que des Relations Presse !
L’agence est composée de 24 collaborateurs qui gèrent un portefeuille de 45 clients actifs appartenant à divers secteurs d’activités, professionnels ou grand public. Historiquement, nous possédons une excellente connaissance des acteurs du marché des nouvelles technologies, qu’ils soient constructeurs de matériels, éditeurs de logiciels, opérateurs de télécoms, sociétés de services ou des sites internet . Nous comptons également parmi nos clients prestigieux des entreprises de renom telles que Monster.fr, Webcarcenter.fr, Travelhorizon, Phytorestore ou Pergo.
Nos compétences reposent sur le respect de fondamentaux : un temps passé optimisé à des tâches opérationnelles qui consistent à créer et diffuser des informations pertinentes au bon moment, au bon format et aux bons journalistes. Ajoutons à cela un soupçon de créativité, d’audace, de ténacité, d’esprit critique et d’analyse à travers un vrai rôle de conseil en plus de la simple exécution des nos actions. 
Enfin, le dynamisme et la curiosité de nos attachés de presse leur permettent de rebondir et de saisir toutes les opportunités de prises de parole offertes quotidiennement par les médias.
Pour permettre, d’une part, à nos attachés de presse de s’exprimer et s’épanouir dans leur mission passionnante, et, d’autre part, de créer une vraie proximité avec nos clients, l’agence est structurée opérationnellement en binômes composés d’un attaché de presse senior et d’un attaché de presse junior. Ainsi, chacun de nos clients dispose d’interlocuteurs uniques, souples, réactifs et disponibles.
Parmi les autres particularités de l’agence, notons le rôle actif de ses dirigeants dans la médiatisation de leurs clients. En effet, grâce à une longue et riche expérience en matière de rédaction et de conseil acquises au sein d’entreprises et d’agences de relations publiques françaises et internationales, Jean-Louis Aubert et Jean-Pascal Rozet proposent une méthode unique et originale de formation et d’entraînement aux techniques de prise de parole auprès des médias. De même, la totalité des communiqués ou dossiers de presse rédigés au sein de l’agence passe par leur regard critique pour assurer une meilleure mise en perspective de l’information.

Hanson Search: Julie Jeantet

Signed terms



Créé en 1997, Actifin est rapidement devenu un des leaders français. 
Les raisons de ce succès : une approche innovante, une intervention à tous les stades de développement, un taux de fidélisation élevé

Une approche innovante :
Les investisseurs recherchent des sociétés garantissant une communication financière performante et assurant une bonne tenue de marché. Notre objectif consiste à agir concomitamment sur ces 2 leviers à la plus grande satisfaction de l’investisseur et de l’émetteur.
Une démarche en trois temps :
- définition d’une stratégie patrimoniale et boursière 
  (positionnement boursier, type d’actionnariat souhaité, objectifs moyens/cibles) 
- Mise en place d’une communication active : définition des messages, calendrier d’actions, 
  préparation des dirigeants…
- Marketing du titre : programme de prises de contacts collectifs et individuels…

Une intervention à tous les stades de développement :
Actifin intervient à tous les stades de développement et de financement de l’entreprise.
Ce savoir-faire, gage de sécurité et de pérennité, participe à la mise en œuvre d’une politique à moyen terme et à la cohésion de la communication.
Introduction en bourse > vie boursière > opération de marché… 

Un taux de fidélisation élevé :

Description: TishTash is a UAE-based marketing and communications agency.  One of the keys to our success and impactful delivery is that we focus on the audience.  We’re all humans (well, most of us) and we’re social beings, so it stands to reason that we’re inspired by relevant words and actions. When we get it right, we flourish. We never lose sight of this.

Our company is founded on a solid grounding in psychology and consumer behaviour, blended with years of international experience in marketing and communications.  We offer marketing strategy and planning, branding, campaign management, public relations, digital and social media marketing, CRM, and we also develop collateral, content and copy for communications of all shapes and sizes.

Our clients include a number of well-known companies in the region, both large and small, as well as private and government, B2B and B2C.  Our expertise particularly lies in FMCG, media, technology and the arts, but we have the know-how and potential to benefit any type of organisation.

Reference: TLJ12NA-REC-CON  
Full Description: 
Given the upturn in the IT contract market we are looking to hire 3 new Consultants into our team. We are a solid 8 year old company & right from the start we have been in the ERP market. We pride ourselves on our excellent database, & our open market structure which means you can recruit into any skills market & European country & client that you like. Probably the main benefit of joining us is the excellent commission structure-we pay 22% across your whole GP. So if you come in & do 2+ deals per month consistently every month at our average deal size then within 12 months you will have 16+ rolling contractors which equates to over 100k pa income! All you need to bring with you is a positive determined attitude, an ability to stay focused on your huge goals, a sense of humour, confidence, the ability to act now rather than over-analyse, self-discipline, energy, & ideally a second European language especially German, French or Dutch. If you are currently making good money elsewhere it is definitely worth you chatting to us to see how easy it is to start from scratch and get yourself up to a 6 figure income by this time next year. If you do then you will have a very different Christmas 2005 compared to Christmas 2004. Isn't it about time that you take that step to now join a company that has the structure in place that will finally allow you to realise your potential and make huge amounts of cash to allow you to enjoy a great life?! Then call us in confidence now

Description: CALYPTUS, anciennement Action Communication Finances est une agence de communication dont la spécificité tient à l'alliage entre le savoir-faire marketing et la technicité financière. 

12 personnes dans l'agence.

Des savoir-faire complémentaires : 
Dirigée par Philippe Calleux l'agence a pour vocation de mettre en oeuvre des programmes de communication dans le domaine financier et de développer des campagnes de relations publiques et relations presse, au bénéfice des entreprises, des institutions publiques et des associations.

La technicité financière a été acquise au fil de la collaboration avec de grandes banques et compagnies d'assurance, le sens du marketing et de la communication grand public dans les plus grandes agences de publicité.

La maîtrise de ces techniques de communication présente pour les entreprises et organismes faisant appel à CALYPTUS les avantages suivants :

Rigueur dans l'analyse des problèmes, 
Qualité de la synthèse, 
Caractère concurrentiel du positionnement, 
Cohérence de l'ensemble de la communication, 
Complémentarité des savoir-faire pour une adéquation des réponses.

La dimension internationale :

La communication ne peut se limiter à l'hexagone. Aujourd'hui, les entreprises de toutes tailles considèrent que le Monde est leur marché.

Sur le plan strictement financier l'activité ne se limite jamais à la place de Paris. Les road-shows se déploient en Europe et aux Etats- Unis. Et souvent, les candidats français à l'Introduction choisissent les places de Bruxelles ou de Francfort et même le NYSE et le NASDAQ.

Calyptus a développé un réseau de partenaires qui lui permet pour certains de ses clients de conduire des actions de Relations Presse et Relations Publiques dans de nombreux pays. L'agence a contribué à l'introduction de sociétés à l'EASDAQ ou à l'EURONM de Bruxelles.

Description: About Quadrangle Research Group Ltd

Quadrangle is an award-winning research and strategy business and one of the fastest-growing companies in the research industry. Our work centres around helping clients use insight and knowledge to grow value and improve performance. 

Founded in 1987 as a specialist in customers, brands and strategy, Quadrangle has made a unique 25-year journey from ‘pure’ strategic consulting to embrace both market research and data analytics. 

Today, we deliver the best of both worlds – a research skillset with a consulting mindset – to a prestigious, blue-chip client base. This includes the likes of Asda, British Gas, the Co-operative Group, HM Revenue & Customs, Honda, Jaguar Land Rover, Lloyds Banking Group, MasterCard, the Volkswagen Group and O2. 

Our aim is to be the reference business for the industry and, in 2010, we began a strategic partnership with Cranfield School of Management to help us attract and grow best talent. 

And, in 2012, we celebrated our 25th birthday.

Specialties
Market Research, Analytics, Fieldwork, Management Consultancy

Company Size
51-200 employees

Founded
1987

Our project work is diverse – spanning FMCG, pharmaceuticals, technology, retail, food and beverages‚ yet our focus is always the same to solve complex marketing problems in order to deliver commercial advantage to our clients.

TLE is a research and strategy company. While we’ve been around for 23 years it’s been the last two that we’ve seen a total transformation into a much more multi-disciplined, joined up global boutique. We’ve expanded our offering, added to our skills and opened in new markets – and we continue to. For a company of our size, we punch well above our weight and are proud to work with some of the world’s best companies on their most significant challenges.

Description: EVENEMENTIEL. Carré bleu marine, l'agence de communication événementielle de DDB Groupe France, se rebaptise DDB Live et se présente désormais comme " l'agence spécialiste de la communication live sous toutes ses formes ". A cette occasion, le groupe DDB révèle sa nouvelle identité visuelle internationale, conçue par Interbrand. 
19/09/2007

Anne Levesque rejoint Patrick Cauvin, Président-Directeur Général du groupe HUMAN LIVE en qualité de Directrice Générale Adjointe. 

Tout  en intervenant sur le développement, la gestion des clients et le management des équipes, Anne Levesque aura pour mission prioritaire d'accélérer les transformations initiées ces derniers mois par Patrick Cauvin, suite au rachat récent par ce dernier, de l'agence DDB Live au Groupe DDB. Ces transformations passent notamment par l'affirmation d'un positionnement unique du groupe sur la Communication d'Engagement.

 

Anne Levesque a commencé sa carrière en 1990 chez Auditoire. En 1994, elle rejoint l'agence Extension, puis en 1995 Tiquetonne Production Conseil, agence de communication événementielle, rachetée par le Groupe Altedia, en 1997. Fin 1999, elle intègre l'agence Lever de Rideau, en tant que Directrice de Clientèle Senior. En février 2004, elle est nommée Directrice du pôle Communication Evénementielle de l'agence Lowe Stratéus, où elle prend en charge le développement de l'activité événementielle et l'intégration de l'événementiel au sein des dispositifs de communication conçus pour les clients de l'agence de communication.

En 2007, elle rejoint Ligaris en tant que Directrice Conseil. Nommée Directrice Générale Adjointe de Ligaris Event et Ligaris Europe en 2009, elle pilote l'intégration de la filiale de Bruxelles, tout en poursuivant le développement de l'approche multi-canal au sein de l'agence et la gestion de grands comptes. En 2011, elle prend la direction de la business Unit « Contenus et Campagnes » tout en travaillant à une nouvelle organisation de l'agence. Au sein de cette agence rachetée à l'été 2012 et devenue Babel, Anne Levesque organise et co-dirige l'équipe de consultants et producteurs de la Direction des Programmes, qui conçoit et met en œuvre des stratégies de communication et des plans d'actions multi-métiers.

Description: Ciena Corporation is a leader in communication network 
infrastructure, associated software and professional services. We specialize in helping customers transition to service driven networks that fundamentally change the way they compete. With expertise in optical and Ethernet networking, Ciena combines software-programmable hardware, a common operating system, and unified service and transport management to enable our customers to adapt and scale with any emergent business model. Our solutions form the foundation of many of the largest, most reliable and sophisticated service provider, enterprise, government, and research and education networks across the globe. 

Many of the world’s largest network operators deliver services with Ciena network solutions; customers include AT&T, BT, Cable & Wireless, France Telecom, Korea Telecom, KPN, Qwest, Sprint, Swisscom, Tata Communications, Telecom Argentina, Telmex, Virgin Media and Verizon. 

Ciena serves numerous enterprises in the healthcare, finance, transportation and retail industries for real-time, latency sensitive applications such as disaster recovery/business continuity, SAN/LAN extension, data center consolidation and grid computing. 

Several national research and education networks, including SUNET, RENATER and JANET in Europe and Internet2 in the U.S. 

KEY OFFERINGS 
Carrier Ethernet Service Delivery: Intelligent devices that create low-touch, high-velocity access, backhaul and aggregation networks. 
Optical Service Delivery: Advanced platforms integrating OTN (Optical Transport Network), optical Ethernet, programmable ports, service-level management and software automation. 
Unified Management: A unified software solution focused on 
comprehensive service lifecycle control and proactive monitoring across a wide range of technologies and service types. 
Ciena Specialist Services: Professional services tailored to meet our customers’ specific goals.
Specialties
Network Specialist, Carrier Ethernet, Packet Optical Transport, Packet Optical Switching

Description: 
 Contacts presse : 
Thomas Hirsch 
Tél. : 01 49 67 33 97 
E-mail : thomas.hirsch@capgemini.com 
Capgemini signe un accord sur l’égalité professionnelle entre les hommes et les femmes en France 
Paris, le 8 décembre 2011 - Capgemini, un des leaders mondiaux du conseil, des services informatiques et de l’infogérance, et sa filiale Sogeti, ont signé ce jour avec cinq organisations syndicales (CFDT, CFE-CGC, CGT, CFTC, Force Ouvrière) un accord sur l’égalité professionnelle en France. Cet accord concerne l’ensemble des 20 000 collaborateurs du groupe en France qui comprend 25% de femmes. Il illustre un engagement fort du groupe au niveau mondial dans ses efforts sur la diversité et l’égalité des chances. 
La mixité des équipes est source de richesse, les parties signataires ont donc décidé d’engager des actions visant à accroitre la part des femmes dans les recrutements. Celle-ci est stable sur les 5 dernières années entre 20% et 23%. L’accord prévoit un objectif de 29% au bout de trois ans, en mettant en oeuvre des actions auprès des écoles et universités pour faire connaitre les métiers technologiques et les possibilités de parcours professionnel. Les cabinets de recrutement partenaires devront présenter systématiquement parmi leurs recommandations au moins une candidature féminine. 
La seconde partie de l’accord porte sur les parcours professionnels et l’égalité salariale. Il s’agit notamment d’accroitre le taux de promotion des femmes, en réduisant les freins à l’évolution (mobilité, accès à la formation, représentation des métiers). Parallèlement, un budget de 500 000€ a été dégagé dans le cadre de l’égalité salariale. 
La troisième partie de l’accord s’appuie sur la Charte de la Parentalité, signée par Capgemini le 13 mai 2011, recherchant les moyens pour mieux harmoniser vie professionnelle et vie privée. Il porte notamment sur la création d’un environnement plus favorable aux jeunes parents et aux femmes enceintes. Par ailleurs, un travail sur les préjugés sera lancé avec pour objectif de faire évoluer les représentations conscientes ou non. Une étude est menée avec l’IMS* sur ce sujet. Enfin des mesures concrètes sont prises sur la planification des réunions, l’aménagement des horaires, la rentrée scolaire. Un guide de la parentalité permettra de donner à tous les salariés une information complète sur ce qui est fait pour mieux concilier son activité professionnelle avec son rôle de parent. 
Des indicateurs permettront à la commission de suivi d’évaluer l’impact des mesures mises en oeuvre. Le Rapport de Situation Comparée (RSC) sera enrichi pour faciliter le travail des commissions égalité en lien avec les Comités d’Entreprise. 
*IMS-Entreprendre pour la Cité a pour mission d’accompagner les entreprises dans leur Engagement Sociétal. 
A propos de Capgemini 
Fort de plus de 115 000 collaborateurs et présent dans 40 pays, Capgemini est l’un des leaders mondiaux du conseil, des services informatiques et de l’infogérance. Le Groupe a réalisé en 2010 un chiffre d’affaires de 8,7 milliards d’euros. Avec ses clients, Capgemini conçoit et met en oeuvre les solutions business et technologiques qui correspondent à leurs besoins et leurs apportent les résultats auxquels ils aspirent. Profondément multiculturel, Capgemini revendique un style de travail qui lui est propre, la « Collaborative Business ExperienceTM », et s’appuie sur un mode de production mondialisé, le « Rightshore® ». 
Plus d’informations sur : www.capgemini.com 
Rightshore®

Description: Depuis sa création en 1950 et à chaque étape de sa croissance, notre entreprise s’est attachée à cultiver quelques fondamentaux qui me paraissent essentiels : la rigueur dans la gestion, le réalisme des projets, le sens du client et l’esprit d’innovation. 
Notre Laboratoire a également su mettre à profit ses deux grandes richesses : des savoir-faire distinctifs dans le domaine scientifique et technique, bien sûr, mais aussi le talent de nos équipes médicales, commerciales et marketing. 

Les Laboratoires Expanscience poursuivent leur croissance. Les clés de cette ambition ? L’innovation produit, le développement d’un portefeuille de marques fortes dans nos domaines d’activité et notre déploiement à l’international. 
Attachés à l’indépendance de notre Laboratoire, nous avons fait le choix d’une croissance organique, confortée par une politique active de partenariats scientifiques et commerciaux et laissant la place à des opportunités. 

Partenariat : le mot est important. Au-delà de nos ambitions de croissance, nous entendons avant tout respecter au quotidien l’engagement de service qui nous lie depuis longtemps avec l’ensemble de nos partenaires – prescripteurs, préconisateurs, distributeurs. 
Cet engagement est au cœur de notre action au quotidien. Car ce n’est pas la taille qui différencie les laboratoires, mais la façon dont ils traitent leurs clients. 

Jean-Paul Berthomé 
Président des Laboratoires Expanscience
