Description: ViiV Healthcare appoints Just:: Health PR 
Published on 12/04/12 at 02:08pm
ViiV Healthcare has appointed Just:: Health PR to work on an integrated political and public relations initiative that will engage politicians, healthcare professionals and patient groups.
ViiV specialises in developing and marketing HIV treatments, and is jointly owned by GlaxoSmithKline and Pfizer, who set up the standalone firm in 2009.
Just:: the London-based healthcare communications firm, has been awarded a brief to engage with the HIV community and policymakers, exploring options for service reconfiguration and building consensus about how to deliver world-class care.
Senior consultant Laura Chambers and new head of political relations Jon Spiers will lead the account. Chambers said: “We’re thrilled about this campaign, which will bring together voices from across the HIV sector to create a meaningful dialogue about how HIV services should look in the 21st century.”
Spiers said: “Given the financial pressures on the NHS and the ongoing debate around health service reforms, there couldn’t be a better time to think about how to deliver the best possible HIV services. It might not be easy or quick but it will be a hugely exciting challenge.”
More people are living with HIV in the UK than ever before and this year will see an estimated 100,000 people diagnosed with the disease in the country.
Thanks to advances in treatment and earlier diagnosis, HIV has become a chronic disease not an acute one, bringing a raft of new challenges including an ageing patient population and rising treatment costs.
Just:: works with a high number of pharma firms, including Allergan, Astellas UK, AstraZeneca, Bristol-Myers Squibb, Novartis, Pfizer, Sanofi and Shire, as well as a number of charity groups.
The team was established in 2006 and one of its first UK briefs was for Pfizer’s smoking cessation drug Champix.

Description: Kantar Worldpanel’s consumer panels, advanced analytics and tailored market research solutions provide High Definition Inspiration to our clients. 

We are the world’s leading provider of continuous, syndicated consumer panels and research solutions into shoppers’ purchasing and usage behaviour.  We provide valuable knowledge and actionable insight to help drive our clients’ businesses forward. 

We operate in more than 50 countries and have over 40 years’ experience in helping small and global companies alike – brand owners, manufacturers and retailers in predominantly all FMCG (fast moving consumer goods) markets. 

So, what is High Definition Inspiration? 

- Our fascination and curiosity about consumers, their behaviour, and their characteristics motivate us to think creatively and have the imagination to look between the lines and beyond the obvious. 

- Delving into what makes consumers tick enables us to see things in such sharp focus. 

- It means we can challenge and encourage our clients to view the world differently and consider the brave actions that can inspire more success for their business. 

- We create valuable knowledge 

Whilst at our heart we are a data-driven, quantitative research business, what makes us different is the ability of our people to make sense of a complicated world. 

What’s in it for me? 

- The opportunity to inspire success 

- The prospect of becoming an expert in the field of understanding consumer purchase and usage behaviour 

- The ability to apply hindsight, insight, foresight and advice to make a real difference to the way our clients see the world and the actions they take for their business 

- The exposure to an industry leading Learning & Development programme 

- The chance to be a part of a creative and fun environment with excellent opportunities to progress

Market research, account management, data, analysis, business development, client management

Description: RI Instore (formally RMS Instore) has over 30 years experience of delivering shopper research to both FMCG companies and retailers across most retail channels.

Our area of specialism is capturing, analysing and reporting back what’s happening in store at the point of purchase, to generate real insight as to how and why shoppers make decisions.

RI Instore use a combination of research techniques to understand what influences shoppers at the point of purchase and what drives the purchase decisions they make in-store. This complements the wider Shopper Action Quant & Qual in-store and online techniques.

In-store research has a number of benefits:
Immediacy – shoppers don’t have to remember what they saw / were thinking
in-store.
Reality – nothing can really replace actually seeing and feeling products, POS, the store environment etc.
Tapping into the shopping mindset. 
Being able to provide store specific data where required.

Quantitative research can take the form of short at-fixture interviews or exit interviews. These can cover a number of key in-store decisions and attitudes e.g. shopping missions, purchasing or response to new ranges / POS etc. Exit interviews are in general used to explore the whole shopping experience, whilst at-fixture interviews cover issues around product, fixture or category specific POS.

For a deeper understanding of the shopper mindset and behaviours, we conduct qualitative research in the form of accompanied shops, intercepts and in-store focus groups. These are either conducted alone or in conjunction with one or more of the following: quantitative research, Filmsolve, and / or Shopnographies which combine U & A understanding with actual purchase behaviour.

Description: BPG Possible was formed in 2010 as part of a joint venture between the BPG Group and Possible, the global digital company within WPP. Possible has over 18 offices and 1,500+ staffers across the globe with operations in the US, Europe, Asia, Middle East and Africa.

Possible is a global agency that creates meaningful and measurable interactive marketing. The agency group is made up of professionals across disciplines around the world who believe it’s not just what brands say that matters, it’s what they do. The agency believes that brands that create great experiences, and deliver the most value to their customers, are those that will succeed in the marketplace.

BPG Possible not only helps our clients communicate, but also facilitates the delivery of their brand promises, through innovative interaction ideas and flawless execution. We help clients measure and optimize the performance of everything they do because we feel that we are not just in the communications business, but the interactions business.

BPG Possible offers our clients strategic planning, analytics and consumer insights, integrated communications planning, digital ideation, online display advertising, search marketing, social media, direct and database marketing, infrastructure operations, web sites and microsites, multi-platform application development, lead automation, CRM/CMS and e-mail operations, data processes and management, measurement & optimization, web analytics, testing and optimization and dashboards.

Description: Founded in 1996 and developing strongly since 2003, FD France is a leading strategic communication consultancy specializing in media and investor relations, crisis management and public affairs in France ranking among the top French financial PR agencies . 
With a core team of over 20 senior consultants plus a highly educated support team FD France advises more than 40 major French and International corporations, governments and public administrations. In addition to offering comprehensive services in financial and economic public relations and investor relations, FD France has also a strong track record in devising strategic media campaigns raising the profile of managements and corporations in the French market and advising on market transactions, mergers and acquisitions and restructuring.
Based in Paris, the consultancy also provides advice on communications in Brussels, North Africa and Francophone Africa and has a strong experience in French and European government processes. FD France's communication experts help companies deal with the need to understand and communicate about Government and Commission interest in business issues as well as international institutions (IFIs)
Clients come from a variety of private or public sectors including technology and telecommunications, financial services, media, industry, transportation and public affairs. 
Expert IR and PR teams are made up of bilingual English and French senior consultants from varied backgrounds including journalism, banking, corporate communications and the French Government

Description: Teamspirit’s sole focus is the creation of the very best in financial services marketing and PR for our clients. We make brands stand out, get talked about and get results by integrating their unique story into digital communications, PR, advertising, events and direct marketing.
We’re proud to be part of Chime Communications <http://www.chime.plc.uk/>, giving us the worldwide access and support of the UK’s largest independent communications network.
 Set up by Scott Learmouth from Hanover. 

INFO FROM PRWEEK...
Learmouth will found Teamspirit Corporate & Business, which will offer ‘strategic advice, stakeho­lder mapping and relations, media relations, risk assessment and crisis and issues management'.
Fifty-strong Teamspirit is part of the Chime Communications group and its PR unit is two years old. It foc­uses on consumer PR and wanted to extend its remit 
in order to compete with agencies such as Lansons Communications, Penrose Financial and Polhill Communications.
Learmouth has a threemonth notice period to see out before moving to the new role. He said one of his first priorities in the new job would be hiring a team.
‘I have nothing but good things to say about Hanover, but I have been thinking about setting up my own agency for over a year now, and the chance to do so und­er the umbrella of Chime Communications was too good a chance to miss,' he added.

Learmouth joined Hanover as business development partner from City agency WMC three years ago (PRWeek, 11 March 2005). In addition to overseeing ‘company-wide business development activity', Learmouth was responsible for Hanover's professional and financial services team, with clients including Nat­ionwide, Mizuho and Celerant. Before that he worked at Lawson Dodd in a corporate role. He joins the Teamspirit group board.
‘This was the natural next step for Teamspirit and I am delighted we can now offer PR targeting both corporate and consumer audiences,' said Teamspirit chief executive Joanne Parker.
Current Teamspirit clients include Scottish Widows, Qatar Financial Centre, ICAEW, Prudential and Aegon Asset Mana­gement. 
Learmouth's current agency, Hanover, made headlines last year when it was drafted in to run a UK press office for the family of missing toddler Madeleine McCann (PRWeek, 20 September 2007). The brief ended after two months (PRWeek, 21 November 2007). ain article text here. You may paste from Word by using the 3rd icon in on the 2nd row

Description: Cambridge Display Technology (CDT) is the leading developer of technologies based on polymer light emitting diodes (P-OLEDs). P-OLEDs are designed for use in the latest generation of electronic displays and in lighting products, offering many advantages over the liquid crystal displays (LCDs) and plasma displays now used in flat panel televisions.

CDT is the originator of polymer based OLEDs and has a heritage with a direct line back to the original discovery of organic electroluminescence from polymers at Cambridge University.

Today part of the Sumitomo Chemical Group, CDT has seen significant investment in developing its expertise and infrastructure. It is a globally respected organization running collaborative projects with many of the global consumer electronics companies.

CDT supports its partners in their scale-up from materials know-how through to device development and manufacture, and has built an unrivalled knowledge of the practicalities associated with P-OLED technology.

CDT has made major technology advances by developing new materials with greatly improved performance, and the rate of progress is still growing. It supports all stages of the supply chain by working with partners in materials supply, printer and process development, device driver and backplane producers, to ensure that each stage is optimised for the best possible performance from the final display or lighting device.

20.03.08 PRW - The BBC's head of corporate affairs, John Dickie is to join London First, a body representing big businesses in London, as director of strategy and policy.  At the BBC he was head of political and parliamentary affairs.
22.11.07 PRW - A former journalist and Brunswick consultant is stepping into the top comms role at the BBC, which has suffered an annus horribilus in reputation terms.  From January, Ed Williams, currently director of corporate affairs at Reuters, will oversee the BBC’s comms strategy.
31.03.08 REG - Unconfirmed - BBC's English language news website is available in China for the first time.

John Shields, currently director of communications at the Department for Communities and Local Government, is set to join the broadcaster in September as head of comms for journalism.
29.08.08 PRW - The BBC's planning editor, Julian Bailey, is to move to Gavin Anderson where he will become a director.
10.10.08 PAN - Tina Stowell, currently head of comms at the BBC Trust, will start as the BBC’s new head of corporate affairs in January.  She was awarded an MBE in 1996 and is William Hague’s former head of office.

company-note:
Description: News

Client meeting Notes 24/07/15 AG and JE

They are starting to get lots of new business post election. They have had a lot of movement in previous years but seem to be more relaxed now. 
Content being a small/medium sized consultancy in London with 39ppl focussing on their core specialisms. 
Juliette joined their healthcare team recently who they are happy with. recently acquired a US office. Afilliate in Brussels that they share business with, 6 ppl there. Mark Watts heads it up, he's a Labour MEP. They do a lot of lobbying through trade bodies rather than directly as companies. SNP and Scotland is more important now. Business in FS seems to be growing both PR and PA and Crisis & Issues. 

At the end of September they may need someone at the Senior Consultant level which is where the need might be for them. Someone left their team recently who was a well connect Labour Lobbyist, did a lot with gambling clients. Generalists are preferred, flexible with no need for agency experience. In summary her approach is (brief candidates on this) "What you want to say, who you want to say it too, and why you want to say it". They don't want a pure PA person who only wants to do that, needs to be open to PR, they like bright quirky people from red brick unis. 

***************************************************** INTERNAL USE ONLY - DO NOT SEND TO CANDIDATES ***************************************************** 

Luther Pendragon

General:

Luther Pendragon is an issues management consultancy; not just public affairs or corporate communications, although these are both disciplines they practice.

“Issue management is a formal management process to anticipate and take appropriate action on emerging trends, concerns, or issues likely to affect an organization and its stakeholders.” 
(Issues Management Council, www.issuemanagement.org)

Partner, Amy Kroviak on Luther’s founding premise:

“The founding premise of our company was to focus on the critical issues that affect the performance and reputation of organisations and deliver communications strategies to tackle them; an approach that is all the more relevant today.” 
(Press release, 2005 MBO. www.octopuspe.com)

Founded in 1992, always been issues management, so are not typical Labourite PA agency that came out of the late 90’s.  Fiercely independent.  Robust business, always pitching, not worried too much about downturn - have spread their risk among private and public sector clients.  Don’t have much in the way of clients in the financial sector.

Flat structure: trainee consultant (internal title), consultant, senior consultant, associate partner, partner.

International partners: GPlus, a Brussels based communications company - work closely with them, helped them set up (MBO press release states Luther had a 15% stake in the company at the time).  Also have an affiliate in Washington, but I don’t know who.

Culture & offices:

·	Intellectual, but fun.  Rigorous.  Nice people, very warm and friendly despite being decidedly corporate.
·	Banter, definitely.  Debate may break out over current affairs - have TVs showing news on in the office.
·	Offices are notoriously hard to find first time.  Easiest to approach from Ludgate Hill, walk down from City Thameslink and turn right at Lloyds bank.  Spread across 3 floors, don’t sit in teams, completely mixed up in terms of levels etc, Partners sit with the consultants, 100% open plan (don’t sit in teams because each client team is different).

Mai
Parent Company: Omnicom

Description: 
Eric DENOYER </component/tmperson/single/174303> Directeur Général Patrick DRAHI </component/tmperson/single/178063> Président du Conseil d'Administration Angélique BENETTI </component/tmperson/single/178888> Directrice Contenu du Groupe Jean-Yves CHARLIER </component/tmperson/single/176641> Conseiller de l'Executive Chairman Eric KLIPFEL </component/tmperson/single/178887> Directeur marques, produits, marketing et service client grand public Thierry LEMAITRE </component/tmperson/single/156176> Directeur Financier Thierry PODOLAK </component/tmperson/single/165507> Managing Director B2B Eric PRADEAU </component/tmperson/single/178891> Directeur des activités de ventes et d'achats opérateurs Pascal RIALLAND </component/tmperson/single/154886> Directeur de la distribution François RUBICHON </component/tmperson/single/59112> Directeur Exécutif Ressources Humaines, Affaires Générales et Organisation Olivier URCEL </component/tmperson/single/178890> Directeur des Systèmes d'Information Jérôme YOMTOV </component/tmperson/single/170027> Secrétaire Général et Communication Externe








Mission

Au sein de la Direction de la Communication de SFR et rattaché à son Directeur du service de presse, vous participez à la définition et à la mise en oeuvre de la stratégie relations presse du groupe, sur les sujets "corporate" (développement durable, citoyenneté, fondation d'entreprise, ressources humaines, santé et environnement, gestion de crise sociale, service clients...). Vos principales responsabilités opérationnelles sont : - Assurer l'interface entre SFR et les médias sur les sujets couverts. - Etre le garant de l'image et de la stratégie de SFR auprès de ces médias avec lesquels vous nouerez des relations de confiance et de qualité pour valoriser pleinement l'activité et l'actualité de SFR. - Etre force de proposition de sujets de d'angles de traitement tenant compte des priorités stratégiques de SFR et des particularités des différents médias. - Recueillir et mettre en forme l'information de l'entreprise à destination des journalistes (rédaction des argumentaires des porte-parole, communiqués et dossiers de presse...). - Organiser les rencontres entre la Direction de l'entreprise et le presse (conférences, déjeuners...). - Répondre aux journalistes (porte parole au nom du service presse). - Assurer une couverture médiatique des événements de l'entreprise. - Analyser les retombées presse de SFR et de ses concurrents sur les sujets couverts.  
 
Profil

Professionnel confirmé des relations presse, ayant une bonne connaissance des autres métiers de la communication, vous justifiez d'une expérience de 5 années minimum dans des fonctions similaires ou comme journaliste. Doté d'un esprit d'analyse et de synthèse, vous possédez, en plus d'une parfaite connaissance des médias écrits et audiovisuels, d'excellentes qualités rédactionnelles et relationnelles. Créatif et autonome tout en ayant une bonne capacité à travailler en équipe, vous savez faire preuve de recul et d'initiatives pour faire face aux situations de crise. Votre

Description: The GoodWill Company - Directeur général 
Monsieur Antoine Rebiscoul est nommé directeur général de The GoodWill Company (Saatchi & Saatchi). Il est ainsi en charge de la création de la filiale de Saatchi & Saatchi, sous l'impulsion de Philippe Lentschener. 
Antoine Rebiscoul, 34 ans, ESSEC, 3ème cycle de sciences sociales et philosophie, a travaillé auparavant chez LVMH, Peat Marwick, IDRH. Il est également le fondateur du cabinet Bam.
Infos société (révisées le 22-02-2005) - The GoodWill Company est une nouvelle filiale indépendante de Saatchi & Saatchi consacrée à la valorisation des actifs immatériels (marques, innovation, positionnement stratégique, R&D, CRM, capitalisation sur la confiance des acteurs de marché...) et à l'intégration des "goodwill" dans la conduite opérationnelle des grandes entreprises. Au croisement de la publicité, de la finance, et du marketing, The GoodWill Company marque la convergence entre les métiers du conseil en stratégie et les métiers de la "visibilité" et de la publicité.

Description: Fin Public Relations Ltd, the new company formed by Alex Glover and Ivo Forde is a joint venture and associated company of Fin International which are together based in St. John Street in the City. Joining Fin PR also from WMC will be Tim Weller. The London office will initially be complemented by a Paris office and there are plans for development of a wider network of international representation. Fin International has a concentration of clients with well known names in the financial services arena and these will now be joined by clients from WMC such as Principal Global Investors, Sarasin Chiswell and Highland Gold for whom Alex Glover and Ivo Forde continue to advise. 
Alex Glover said, ”We have found a hugely complementary partner in Fin International who are well known for their integrated communications approach; we are enormously encouraged from our early workings with them that that this will greatly enhance our ambition to offer a wider and greater multi-disciplinary service to existing and new clients.”

Justin Mould, Managing Director of Fin International, commented, ”We have been looking to find a highly professional financial public relations partner for some time and, having successfully completed this search, we are most excited by the added value this will now bring to our integrated communications approach.” 
Alex Glover and his Fin PR team have moved to St John Street and may be contacted as follows: firstname.surname@fininternational.com <mailto:firstname.surname@fininternational.com>

Description: 35 people in London Office
Account Manager, Corporate - London.  Excellent salary and benefits

Pleon, the European communications company, creates and implements communication strategies and programmes for both private and public sector organisations.  We base all of our consulting around our in-depth understanding of business, politics and communications and are uniquely placed to devise compelling solutions that make a real difference to our clients' competitiveness and success.

Working as an integral member of our expanding corporate team, you will be involved in strategic planning, positioning and messaging, training programmes, change management, crisis management and reputation management.  This is an excellent opportunity to go beyond the traditional PR scope and work at the highest level with clients.  

It goes without saying that you are an accomplished communicator with outstanding interpersonal and project management skills.  You can influence key players and are respected for your consultation abilities, creativity and ability to manage very senior teams.  

Educated to graduate / post-graduate level, or equivalent, you will have proven agency and / or in-house experience.  We are particularly interested in hearing from individuals with an oil and petroleum or renewable energy background.

We have a formidable reputation as an employee-focused employer and opportunities for career development are excellent.  Additionally, paid learning and development opportunities will be identified with you.

To apply send your CV with a covering letter and details of your current remuneration via the 'apply' button below. Informal, confidential discussions are also welcomed by Susan Goldsmith, HR Manager, on 020 7479 5615.

Please note that only short-listed applicants will be contacted.

Description: L'agence PPR (WPP) s'implante en France 
COMMUNICATION. Professional Public Relations (PPR), agence du groupe Young & Rubicam (WPP) fondée en 1970 en Australie par Peter Lazar, poursuit son déploiement international. Après une implantation aux Etats-Unis en mars dernier, et au Royaume-Uni en décembre, l'agence réputée pour son agilité et son approche multicanal arrive en France. Deux transfuges de Burson-Marsteller I&E (WPP) prennent les commandes de PPR France: Frédérique Lenglen (précédemment directrice des stratégies de marque) au poste de directrice générale, et Marie-Laurence Augé (ex-directrice de clientièle) au titre de directrice générale adjointe. Prochains territoires investis courant 2014 par PPR: l'Allemagne et le Moyen-Orient.

Description: A&Z Design Consultants works across a broad range of sectors, both print and online, from FMCG, financial, technology, leisure to non-profit organisations. We focus on your business objectives, your target audience and competitors. We look at your visual assets: what you have of value to be protected and developed. In fact, in print, the amazing concept is communicated to its audiences in the form of a printed material or packaging etc, thus it is advisable to choose an experienced printer or paper engineer to handle the job, as the strongest ideas can lose its strength and even fail, if not supervised and reviewed by professionals.

Therefore, to ensure that the brilliant ideas as an end product, achieve its full potential, A&Z Design Consultants have a quality monitoring team – which includes in-house artworkers, print and production professionals who monitor and supervise external suppliers to ensure the final products are perfect and also meet the client's deadline.

Description: Basic Assessment for Candidates:

Do not bother sending people to PRO unless you can prove they are:

Corporate, articulate, relationship developers, leaders, personable, confident, impact making, assertive, able to learn and take on feedback, dedicated to rec, dedicated to financial sector, genuinely interested in PRO and the culture, are a little commercially minded, persuasive, can ask open ended questions and honest.


===================================================================================

Interview Process:

GRADS:

Pro:  Introduction to and first interview:


Finance Professionals are a great company to work for due to:
 
<http://www.pro-rec-org.com/financeprofessionals/>
 
a.         Earnings  in 3 years you should be into 6 figures - (I have a friend very much on his way to this)
b.         Progression - the company will progress you from resourcer to consultant in 6-12 months.  You can be leading a team in 2-3 years and owning equity.
c.         Training - They have won awards for training - see website. ( see also awards for best financial recruiter of the year and top 100 fastest growing companies)
d.         Reputation - They are prided and reputed upon their professional service and no-nonsense attitude.
e.         Style - This is a smart, sharp witted and cerebral environment.  This company will only deal with the best candidates and clients.
f.          Environment.  Very dedicated, motivated and single minded.  They want to be challenging Michael Page - (find out who they are).  These people enjoy working alongside each other and socialise in teams and as a company.
 
As if this isn’t a bad start, what makes them different?  
 
1.	They are constantly expanding, and have future international plans, but they prioritise the small office atmosphere that they have there. 
2.	Their expansion is not due to wide style selling, but having intelligent, selective and assertive people working for them. 
3.	They are a young and small to medium size company (know your dates!) and hence have still got an open structure, you will soon be making an active impact upon that culture.  You are visible there 
4.	They have great looking and very well located offices.  Being Holborn based they are near enough to the city and west end to meet all finance candidates they need to. 
5.	You can own equity in the company from an early stage. 
6.	You will genuinely want to spend time with these people after work. 
 



The Interview:
 
 
What to be prepared for:


The interview will be largely a discussion around the CV.  
They will want you to justify and impress them why you:

1.	Want to work in Recruitment
2.	Why you want to work in Finance Rec.
3.	Why Pro and no-one else.

You need to have good examples of where you have been:
	
a.	Resilient
b.	Motivated to achieve a goal
c.	Driven to see through a difficult situation.
d.	Holding together, leading and being part of a team.

You will probably have a role play based on:

a.	Pitching a candidate at a potential client.
b.	Convincing a client that you have a better candidate than they are dealing with at the moment.
c.	Convincing a candidate that they want to work with you exclusively.
d.	Being able to close a deal.  I.E. finding out exactly what person wants, finding out what will sway them from that.


Have lots of questions ready to ask them.  And close them at the end on the details:
	
1.	Do you think I can do the role?
2.	Do I fit the environment?

If there are any problems with eithe

Description: Actelion aims to discover or in-license and develop a steady stream of new products as revenue sources, based on first-in class small molecule compounds. In doing so, Actelion is focussing on innovative treatments for high-unmet medical needs, where Actelion’s new drugs can bring therapeutic advantage to patients and economic benefit for the community at large.



Pursue comprehensive life cycle and label expansion management
Actelion aims to develop products to their maximum potential by implementing comprehensive strategies of line extensions and new indications. For example, since gaining approval of Tracleer® in 2001, Actelion has continued to invest in further clinical trials to expand its use into new indications.

Maintain culture focussed on innovation 
Actelion has nurtured a culture focused on innovation throughout the organisation. It has encouraged technical innovation and implemented state-of-the-art technologies i.e. parallel chemistry, high-throughput screening, high-level information technology and computer modelling. 

A fully integrated approach to research, development and marketing is in place, which provides for an environment focussed on innovation. This enables Actelion to attract and retain the best employees and enable them to fully utilise their expertise to discover, develop and market novel drugs. Actelion’s management also encourages its scientists to publish their findings.

Build on its substantial experience in clinical development and regulatory affairs 
Actelion designs and executes its own clinical trials, which have led directly to the approval of Tracleer® in WHO Class III or IV pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH) and are currently managing around 25 clinical trials with more than 2,500 patients. Actelion aims to build on this experience to strengthen the clinical development of the product candidates and their potential commercialisation. 

Established global commercialisation infrastructure 
Actelion markets Tracleer® and Zavesca® itself, which has served as the foundation for the marketing of future products. By doing so, it retains the maximum value of these products for itself. This existing commercial infrastructure, including scalable distribution and post-marketing surveillance models, is the foundation for the future expansion of the company into larger markets. 

Develop products for hospital and general practice use
Actelion’s current products are treatments for diseases with limited patient populations, which usually have less development risk and commensurate returns. The company’s strategy is to increase returns by developing products for the hospital setting and eventually, additional products aimed to the general practice market. This challenges Actelion to develop and commercialise products for larger markets than it has previously served. 

However, it must continue to increase sales of current products like Tracleer® ,which to date has been the main source of the company’s revenue, in order to support the development of an expanded prodproduct portfolio. As Actelion expands its portfoli o it may seek to mitigate unnecessary risk by forming strategic partnerships or all i ance s with other pharmaceutical or biopharmaceutical companies at critical time points in select product development, when the company believe that the long-term value will be enhanced and risk significantly reduced.

Description: YouGov is an international, full service online market research agency offering custom research, omnibus, field and tab services, qualitative research, syndicated products and market intelligence reports.

Our unique fully integrated online model has a well-documented and published track record illustrating the accuracy of its survey methods and in turn the quality of its client service work. We can conduct research in all continents and our online model allows clients to get international results faster and more cost-effectively than traditional methods, with no compromise on quality. YouGov has offices in the UK, US, Europe and the Middle East. 

It is our goal to understand the world you live in, the sector you operate in, and your brand, enabling us to provide you with a live stream of continuous, accurate data and insight into what people are thinking and doing all over the world. Information which not only serves in tackling current issues facing your organisation but also aims to offer a comprehensive understanding of your organisation and its place in the world we live in today. 

The group operates an online panel of over 2.5 million respondents worldwide representing all ages, socio-economic groups and other demographic types which allows us to create nationally representative samples online and access hard to reach groups, both consumer and professional.

ETUDES. L'observatoire mis sur pied par Ipsos Insight et Hotwire fait apparaître le fossé qui sépare les consommateurs et les offres technologiques. Les attentes des consommateurs, face au triple ou au quadruple play (téléphone, TV, Internet et mobile), touchent au prix (pour 41% d'entre eux), suivi d'une demande de simplicité au quotidien (à 37%) et de simplicité de mise en œuvre du service (à 33%), alors que ces avantages utilisateurs n'ont jamais été présentés par les annonceurs étudiés. 


Millward Brown scrute les politiques français comme des marques

Hotwire PR est une agence et européenne de relations presse spécialisée dans les domaines de l'informatique et des nouvelles technologies. Le bureau français a été créé il y a 4 ans et se situe dans le second arrondissement de Paris. L'agence compte à ce jour des noms prestigieux parmis ses clients, et rassemble une équipe d'une dizaine de personnes. Le poste à pourvoir est une création. Le ou la candidate sera amené(e) à seconder le Directeur Général de l'agence sur différents points : - la rédaction de recommandation - le suivi et le contrôle de l'opérationnel des clients - l'accompagnement et la formation de l'équipe. Il ou elle devra également intervenir sur l'aspect conseil stratégique à destination des clients. QUELQUES CRITERES INDISPENSABLES - un longue pratique et une solide expérience du métier des relations presse - un anglais oral et écrit - une bonne connaissance des secteurs de l'informatique et des nouvelles technologie - dans la mesure du possible une expérience professionnelle à l'étranger - bonne connaissance de la presse informatique et économique française Le poste est pourvoir vers le mois de novembre 2006 et les entretiens se feront dans un premier temps au téléphone, puis au sein de l'agence, en anglais et avec deux membres de la direction. Adresser CV et lettre de motivation mail : compt30@yahoo.fr et contacter Anne Boisson au 06 87 55 42 37 Paris - Ile-de-France

Description: Dear Felice,

This morning I am very pleased and excited to announce the intended merger of Capital MSL and CNC - Communications and Network Consulting. The merger, which we hope to complete in January, will bring together two of the fastest growing strategic and financial communications consultancies of the last decade to create an international, fully integrated and client focused organisation of real scale, and with a broader range of talent and expertise.

The combined organisation will have 11 offices in 8 countries, including almost all of the world’s major capital markets.  As a result, it will be one of the largest strategic and financial communications consultancies in the world.  It will be a single global partnership, a principal upon which the success of both companies has been based, and will serve a range of ambitious organisations from small growing companies, to many of the world’s largest and best respected institutions. 

Capital MSL will be changing its name to CNC in due course, a change that not only reflects the merger but also the integrated range of corporate communications services that we provide, in addition to our historic expertise and knowledge of financial markets.

We strongly believe that organisations now require a much broader range of communications solutions to address their specific challenges.  From corporate and financial communications, through to public affairs, issues management and digital communications, we will be better placed than ever to advise on the increasingly complex communications issues that impact reputation, decision making, valuation and change. For more information please visit this link to view the press release <http://capitalmsl-news.com/2JRI-2U95-2LECC1-YPQ2-1/c.aspx> which we issued this morning.

​I look forward to the opportunity to discuss these developments in more detail.

Best wishes,

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
CNC - Communications & Network Consulting (key word here is “network”). CNC have never marketing themselves to date. Business has been built up through Richard & Christopher’s networks. Admits CNC brand ‘unknown’ in this country

Fourth largest leading strategic and financial comms consultancy - 150 ppl globally (50 in Munich; 50 in London)

CNC (German Fin Comms consultancy) Senior, board level clients. Strategic. Expensive but high quality, high value. Less listed work more big M&A deals. A market leader in Germany. Seen as similar to a Brunswick!

Original founders: Roland Klein (former Head of Comms/ Senior VP at Ericsson) and Christoph Walther (former Head of Comms/ Senior VP at DaimlerChrysler). Now works p/t.

Team: Senior Exec team made up of Roland, Christopher, Richard Campbell, Ben C.
CNC - Nick Bastin (Capital Managing Partner) and Oli Mann (MD CNC)
MSL - James Parsons, Claire Maloney (strat) on a mat leave

CNC much more of a high-end consultancy rather than an agency. Don’t do press office work.
Less micro-man more focused on execution and delivery of client work

Both CNC and Capital were bought up by MSL 3 years ago. CNC and Capital merger at the start of 2015 to bring together a combined International, integrated offering.

Description: We’re a creative communications business, helping you tell your story simply, in one clear voice, by whatever means works best.

We deliver the right practical solutions. In this way, we help our clients keep valuable conversations going with all sorts of people, from customers to shareholders to staff. Description: 08.02.08 : K Agency 360 lance K Développement Durable
K agency 360 a annoncé le lancement d'une nouvelle marque au sein du groupe : K Développement Durable (KDD). La nouvelle entité, constituée de dix personnes, est dirigée par Edwige Schaufelberger, Dg de KDD, qui conserve parallèlement ses fonctions de Dg de K Editing. KDD vise à "apporter une réponse éco-conçue et éco-réalisée aux problématiques de marketing services, dans une démarche de responsabilité sociale", a expliqué le groupe. Son offre s’articule autour de deux modules : le consulting (accompagnement, formation, conseil) et la campagne (création et réalisation de campagnes responsables : objets publicitaires biodégradables, papiers certifiés, rationalisation des tirages, utilisation de bâches recyclables, imprimeurs certifiés…).

Merz is a leading German pharmaceutical company with its own platform for clinical research and development.  Merz Pharma UK is a subsidiary of Merz Pharmaceuticals and is currently focused on treatments in both neurological and psychiatric conditions.	

Merz Pharmaceuticals is specialized in the research and development of innovative pharmaceutical products in the area of neurological, psychiatric and dermatological diseases. 
Merz Pharmaceuticals is a leader in the field of Alzheimer’s disease research and has developed the world’s first drug for the treatment of moderate to severe stages of Alzheimer’s disease. Merz Pharmaceuticals has also developed drugs for the treatment of Parkinson’s disease and depression.

Description: As a boutique consultancy practice you'll find us very different from the folks in the big four and we're quite proud of that. Digital media and marketing is all we do, and it's all our lead consultants have done for more than a decade. We're practitioners who now share our knowledge and skills with others. We enjoy working with a broad range of brands, media groups and agencies, rather than taking directorships inside one of those firms. Our emphasis is on the practical, and our approach is hands on. Along the way we’ll coach your leadership team to build their knowledge and intuition for their future digital strategies.
Our consultants typically achieve significantly more within much less time than a regular consultancy, and companies we’ve helped have gone on to change their behaviour, products, structures and brands. By helping leadership teams navigate the challenges of internet media, online marketing, web content and e-commerce, we’ve been able to unlock step-changes in their volume of customers and revenues, and in many cases, step-changes in their share price as well.
As the founder, my pledge is to work with you to create practical solutions to the challenges you and your team face; making the knowledge we create accessible and the learning transferable. You'll get plain speaking advice in a format you can use straight away. Typically we’ll also give you a wealth of other ideas along the way, all with the confidence that comes from working with people who've each had more than ten years in digital media and marketing. Because we’re independent of any agency or technology vendor, you’re also certain of impartiality - something critical when the direction of your business is at stake.
Whether it’s a new online media product, a monetisation plan for existing websites, the models for integrated digital marketing, or a strategic health-check for your business, we want to help you unlock the potential of your team and what’s already been invested.
And we want you to enjoy and value what we achieve together so much, that you’ll invite us back when you next reach a development challenge.

Description: The Truth about Shoppers 

Shopper Retail Insight (SRI) is a ground breaking approach to understanding shopper behaviour. For the first time you can now observe and understand what your shoppers actually do in store. Will they respond to promotions and new layouts? How do they handle products? Observe their interactions with store staff and the route they take through the store. 

The Real World not the Research World 

Shoppers behave differently when they are being researched. They know they are being followed or observed and consequently their actions are altered. SRI does not intrude on the shopper. It does its work without the shopper even being aware that it is there. The results and analysis you see are unbiased, objective and reflect what actually goes on in the real world. 

Pace, Volume and Quality 

Traditional research methods are constrained by physical boundaries. Issues like how many shoppers can be accompanied are well known barriers . SRI uses advanced technology in visual data analysis and consequently removes these issues. Projects involving vast quantities of detailed data are turned around in days not months. Shopper volumes are unrestricted and analysis is quality checked and audited.

Description: Insights into human nature. Respect for the customer. Creativity that inspires and surprises to generate sales. 

These concepts are Advertising 101 today, yet in 1949 they were the radical notions of three enterprising US ad men: Bill Bernbach, Ned Doyle and Maxwell Dane. 

Together they established a new creative mindset that transformed advertising and built some of the world's most recognisable brands. 

DDB's classic Volkswagen campaigns of the 1960s not only sold millions of VW Beetles at a time when bigger cars were in vogue, but helped build a brand that 50 years on is a global leader -and still relies on DDB for ideas today. 

Bill Bernbach's insights have stood the test of time. DDB, too, is a global leader with 200 offices in 90 cities around the world. 

DDB is one of the world's largest and most
awarded advertising and marketing networks and part of the Omnicom Group.

We work closely with 4 sister global companies Tribal DDB (Digital), Tracylocke (Shopper and Promotional Marketing), Rapp (CRM/Direct Marketing) and OMD (Media Planning and Buying).

Description: In their own words

“In life, in business, in Government, the only constant is change.”

At Portcullis Public Affairs, we know all about change - we’re constantly delivering it.

The success of your organisation today could rely on your understanding of how Government policy affects you.  The achievement of your future goals could depend on your ability to influence the policymakers. 

Your knowledge and experience could help to shape Government decisions.  Portcullis Public Affairs aim to bring your know-how to policymakers at the right time so that your position can be considered as policy is formed or changed.

For over 15 years, we have been helping people shape Government policy in this way.  And the key is information - from our clients, provided in precisely the right way to inform the decision-makers. 

If you are seeking to effect change or influence the nature of the debate, Portcullis has the expertise to enhance your Government relations to help you deliver those changes.

Portcullis Public Affairs operates to a detailed code of conduct that can be viewed by clicking at the bottom of this page.  All staff members are required to sign a copy of the code and it is prominently displayed throughout our offices.

General Background

Portcullis was established in 1991 by Chairman Charles Cockburn.

A small boutique agency currently made up of a team of 10, the company’s work comprises 75% healthcare public affairs, supplemented by clients in banking and financial services as well as other highly regulated sectors.

They are highly competitive in the field of healthcare public affairs, and are well regarded.

For the last ten years, the day-to-day operations of the company were handled by Managing Director Berkeley Greenwood, who left in late 2009 to set up his own small practice.

Portcullis hired Stephen Day early in 2010 to spearhead their new business drive into non-healthcare sectors, aiming to hit £1.5m turnover.  Turnover was £1.25m last year.

Charles would describe Portcullis as public affairs professionals.  They are more interested in what candidates know about doing public affairs than who they know.  They also reward loyalty.

?Key People

Charles Cockburn - Chairman
David Baxter - Financial Director
Stephen Day - Associate Director (from April 2010)

Main Services

Monitoring and intelligence gathering
Research and analysis
Political audit service
Advocacy
Event devising and implementing
Strategic planning and advice
Regular reporting
Coaching and training

Location

St James House, 13 Kensington Square, London W8 5HD
(Nearest underground station: High Street Kensington)

Portcullis’s offices can be found on the second floor.  The offices are open-plan, with break-out areas and rooms for client meetings.

A Small Sample Of Their Clients

Description: Our passion is discovering inspiring ideas that will make your business successful. We use an array of tools—most innovative and proprietary, some traditional—to understand your objectives, gain insights, and create ideas that bring the brand to life. Our services fall into two major groupings.

Brand Strategy: 
We can work holistically, going from research to a brand idea, or we can support you with specialized services, such as brand architecture and messaging strategies.

• Brand architecture
• Brand audit
• Naming
• Positioning
• Purpose & values
• Research & analytics

Brand Experience:
We use a highly collaborative approach to develop engaging experiences for your brand that range from identities and visual systems to digital and new-to-world, brand development.

• Brand management 
• Brand identity and design
• Digital service design
• Innovation
• Internal engagement
• Packaging
• Retail and branded environments

FutureBrand foresight days

A foresight day is your first step to creating the future for your brand and business

The FutureBrand team researches, visualizes, and facilitates an immersive workshop with your senior team.

We start with your business strategy, key competitors and our analysis of the codes, cues, and trends in the category.

We co-create believable ideas for brands, products and services that will dominate the category in five years once today’s trends have matured.

We then work with you to prioritize those ideas in an innovation plan based on your short, medium and long term business goals.

Description: Amaury Sport Organisation appartient au groupe de presse français E.P.A (Editions Philippe Amaury), propriétaire des titres l’Equipe, France Football, l’Equipe Magazine, Vélo Magazine, Le Parisien et Aujourd’hui en France. Le groupe s’est également développé dans l’audiovisuel, avec la création de l’Equipe TV, et dans les nouvelles technologies (www.lequipe.fr & www.leparisien.fr), au point d’être à ce jour l’un des acteurs majeurs du monde des médias français. 

De son côté, A.S.O., créée en septembre 1992, s’est spécialisée dans l’organisation d’événements sportifs de renom, tels que le Tour de France, le Dakar et le Marathon de Paris. Depuis quelques années, l’heure est à la croissance, A.S.O. ayant intensifié ses activités dans le cyclisme (Paris-Nice, Tour of Qatar, Tour du Faso) et abordé de nouvelles disciplines, comme le golf (Open de France, le plus ancien tournoi d’Europe continentale) et les sports équestres (créant pour l’occasion un événement annuel baptisé R.I.D.E : Rencontres Internationales des Disciplines Equestres).

Derrière la panoplie d’événements internationalement connus et reconnus, Amaury Sport Organisation s’est fixé pour objectif de créer et de mettre en œuvre dans la durée des compétitions de haut niveau, spectaculaires et inscrites dans le respect des valeurs éthiques du sport.

A.S.O. est une entreprise qui s’est organisée en « métiers » : de la conception des compétitions avec les instances fédérales et institutionnelles, en passant par l’élaboration de programmes de partenariat, la logistique, les médias, l’édition, Internet, les relations publiques, ainsi que la production et la commercialisation de programmes de télévision, A.S.O. maîtrise l’ensemble des compétences et des savoir-faire nécessaires à la livraison de compétitions de grande ampleur ou d’un format plus limité. Chacun de ces événements bénéficie d’une logistique et de moyens adaptés à sa position dans le calendrier sportif, avec le souci d’une qualité constante et d’une organisation irréprochable.

Description: Karen Earl Sponsorship
Gunpowder House 
66 Great Suffolk Street 
London SE1 0BL 
United Kingdom 
Telephone +44 (0)20 7202 2800 
Facsimile +44 (0)20 7202 2802

Karen Earl Sponsorship (KES) is one of Europe’s leading specialist sponsorship consultancies.

We guide clients through the entire sponsorship process from strategy to execution. We provide our clients with teams of specialists drawn from our four brand divisions, consultancy, sponsorship integration, event management and PR.

We’re big enough, with a staff of 30 sponsorship experts to cover all aspects of sponsorship, but we’re not so big that you’ll be lost in the crowd.

We pride ourselves on our delivery of award-winning sponsorship solutions for our clients. 

Since 1984 KES has been advising major corporations such as Coca-Cola, Whitbread, The Royal Bank of Scotland and Marks & Spencer on regional, national and international sponsorships.

We have enormous depth of experience across mainstream sports sponsorships plus some of the more unusual ones.

It`s not just sport sponsorships that we cover. KES is also well known for its community, arts, broadcast and entertainment work covering everything from film and book awards to the Notting Hill Carnival.

What makes KES different?  Unlike most sponsorship companies, we work totally sponsor-side. 

We don't represent rights owners and individuals, and we don't sell or broker deals. 

What we do, exclusively, is make sponsorship work for sponsors. No hidden agendas, no conflicts of interest. Just honest, impartial, expert advice - guaranteed.

Description: Biométrie/Medical Writing

Dans un secteur d'activité de plus en plus codifié et réglementé, il devient difficile de mettre en avant des avantages concurrentiels. Cependant, nous avons des valeurs fortes qu'il nous semble important de revendiquer... En voici quelques unes : 

 Nous ne sous-traitons pas la saisie des données afin de conserver la maîtrise complète du process 
 Malgré la mise en oeuvre d'une double saisie rigoureuse, il nous semble indispensable de ne rien laisser au hasard : c'est pourquoi nous effectuons systématiquement un audit de la double saisie, la vérification du critère principal et des événements indésirables pour 100% des cahiers d'observation, le contrôle de la cohérence entre la saisie en clair des événements indésirables et le libellé obtenu à partir du codage international 
 Une analyse statistique bien conduite est une analyse qui a été rigoureusement préparée : c'est pour cette raison que nous établissons, avant le démarrage de toute exploitation statistique, un Plan d'analyse détaillé (populations analysées, tests et modèles statistiques utilisés, modalités d'expression des variables, formes prévues des tables statistiques...) que nous soumettons au Promoteur pour approbation 


Nos prestations de Biométrie comprennent :

 Consulting en méthodologie statistique : définition du plan expérimental, validation des critères d'évaluation, détermination de la taille de l'échantillon, établissement de la randomisation 
 Saisie (double saisie indépendante), codage [classifications internationales] et contrôle de qualité des données (contrôle de la double saisie, audit de la base de données) 
 Data Management : édition automatisée des demandes de correction, audit-trail des modifications de données 
 Analyse statistique (logiciel SAS) : analyses exploratoires et de confirmation, méta-analyses 
 Gestion de données : importation et intégration de données externes quel que soit leur format 


Nous assurons la rédaction dans plusieurs langues de :

 Rapports statistiques, cliniques et intégrés au format ICH 
 Rapports d'expert 
 Notes d'intérêt thérapeutique 
 Brochures investigateur 
 Supports de communication médicale : articles, abstracts, posters

Description: Hi Marie

We’ve are undergoing a rebranding campaign, that I wanted to make you aware of. We will now be known as Blue Latitude Health. You will start to notice some changes on our website over the coming months e.g. new colours, banners, logos etc, so do keep an eye out for them! There is no structural change and we continue to operate in the same fields as before. 

Please make sure whenever you speak about us with candidates, you use the new name. Below is some information we would like you to share with potential candidates as you feel appropriate.

If you have any questions, please do ask away.

Kind regards

Priti


Blue Latitude Health
Blue Latitude Health is a new breed of creative marketing consultancy. We offer the vision of a consultancy with the creativity of an agency. 
Our combination of heritage, approach and capability gives us a unique perspective in healthcare marketing. It means we’re ideally placed to unlock the potential in products and services that save and transform lives.   
Founded in 2003 as a marketing consultancy with digital expertise, we now work internationally and regionally with some of the world’s most influential healthcare brands in the world. They come to us for forward thinking - a visionary outlook that’s redefining expectations of effectiveness. 
What we do 
From our consultancy background, we’re used to seeing marketing as part of the wider landscape. We provide value across the full panorama of our clients’ marketing challenges: 
·         Facilitating the organisational change that ensures alignment and ongoing success
·         Developing brand strategy that adds true value
·         Designing experiences to genuinely engage customers. 
Here are just some of the ways we help in practice:
·         Marketing Process development
·         Capability building and training 
·         Lifecycle management 
·         Positioning and messaging 
·         Multichannel strategy and planning 
·         Creative design and execution 
·         Service design and delivery 
·         User experience design and delivery 
·         Measurement and optimisation. 
And because we’re fully independent - owned and run by our founders - we’re not tied to any particular technology or third party suppliers. So we’re always free to do what’s best for our clients. 
Blue Latitude Heath is 50 strong and based in Central London.  For more information email us at hello@bluelatitude.net <mailto:hello@bluelatitude.net>

Kind regards

Priti

Description: Une stratégie de porte-parole et de défense du média écrit


Adossé au Groupe Hachette Filipacchi Médias, Interdeco a, depuis plusieurs années, développé une politique de partenariats entre éditeurs de Presse Magazine dans une logique d’optimisation de leurs recettes publicitaires. 
Ces alliances ont contribué à la création de pôles très puissants sur chacune des grandes cibles marketing, visant à conquérir des parts de marché en faveur du média magazine. 
Au service de cette politique, Interdeco Expert a déployé une batterie d’outils, qu’il s’agisse de mettre en évidence la corrélation entre la consommation des marques et la Presse Magazine, de prouver l’efficacité publicitaire de ce média ou d’innover dans le domaine du média planning. 

Afin d’accompagner ses éditeurs et de participer activement au redéploiement de la Presse Magazine, Interdeco a créé une organisation commerciale unique en son genre : 

- Internationale avec IGA et ses 16 bureaux dans le monde : IGA a pour vocation de conseiller les grands annonceurs mondiaux dans leur politique d’harmonisation publicitaire et de promouvoir leurs marques au plan mondial.

- Multilocale avec Interdeco France, Espagne, Italie, Pologne, etc. : Interdeco a exporté son concept de régie dans de nombreuses capitales européennes en créant ainsi un partenariat trés étroit avec les grands annonceurs au plan multilocal. 

- Régionale avec Interdeco Métropoles et ses 8 bureaux régionaux : Interdeco Métropoles décline la philosophie d’Interdeco au niveau des principaux grands bassins économiques français. 

- Transversale avec Interdeco Marketing Services : Proposer des solutions de communication transversales qui combinent Presse Magazine et nouveaux médias dans une logique de dialogue avec le consommateur, c’est le mandat d’IMS. 

Soit un dispositif unique sur le marché publicitaire mondial qui constitue une formidable opportunité pour Interdeco, partenaire incontournable des grands arbitrages plurimédias. 

Olivier Chapuis
Président du Groupe Interdeco




FONDAMENTAUX et CHIFFRES CLÉS
Une organisation fondée sur 3 grands principes :

- LA LOGISTIQUE COMMERCIALE : 300 commerciaux qui vendent des marques de presse, des cibles de consommation et le média presse dans son ensemble avec des outils de pilotages exclusifs de l’activité commerciale.

- LE PARTENARIAT : Une politique d’alliance ambitieuse avec de nombreux groupes de presse qui permet de proposer au marché plus de 80 titres et de mettre en place sur toutes les grandes cibles de consommation des dispositifs puissants et segmentants. 

- L’EXPERTISE : 3 millions d’euros sont investis chaque année dans les études sous trois angles essentiels : la promotion des marques, l’efficacité publicitaire et l’optimisation média. 


L'ORGANISATION


UNE ACTIVITE COMMERCIALE ORGANISEE AUTOUR DE 5 BUSINESS UNITS 
- Interdeco France 
- Interdeco Partenariats (Air France Média, Le Point Communication, Sport et Finances & Régies) 
- Interdeco Global Advertising (International) 
- Interdeco Métropoles (Régions et Paris) 
- Interdeco Marketing Services (opérations spéciales) 

UNE ACTIVITE CORPORATE QUI RASSEMBLE L’ENSEMBLE DES ACTIVITES D’OPTIMISATION COMMERCIALE 
- L’Expertise 
- La Qualité et le Corporate 
- La Communication 

UNE ACTIVITE BACK OFFICE QUI RÉUNIT 
- Les Ressources Humaines 
- Le Contrôle de Gestion 
- La Comptabilité 
- L’Administration des Ventes 
- Les Systèmes d’Information

Description: PROPOS DE COSSETTE COMMUNICATIONS INC. 
COSSETTE inc. offre une gamme complète de services de communication d'avant-garde à des clients de toutes tailles, y compris certaines des marques les plus prestigieuses au monde. Elle propose une offre de service intégrée, laquelle comprend la planification stratégique et les services de recherche, la publicité, la planification des canaux de communication et achats médias, la promotion des ventes, la réponse directe, le marketing direct et par bases de données, la gestion de la relation client, les solutions de marketing interactif et numérique, la communication organisationnelle et la gestion du changement, les commandites et le marketing d'alliance, le branding et le design, le marketing ethnique, les communications interentreprises (pratiques B2B), de même que la production imprimée et vidéo. COSSETTE compte des bureaux à Québec, Montréal, Toronto, Vancouver et Halifax. 
À PROPOS DE VISION 7 INTERNATIONAL 
Vision7 International (vision7international.com <http://vision7international.com>) figure parmi les 25 plus grandes compagnies internationales de communication au monde, avec plus de 1 450 employés au Canada, aux États-Unis et au Royaume-Uni. Vision7 International compte deux divisions : Cossette (www.cossette.com <http://www.cossette.com>), une agence entièrement intégrée qui occupe une position dominante au Canada et Esprit de Corps Communications (www.thisisedc.com <http://www.thisisedc.com>), un réseau d'agences spécialisées œuvrant à l'échelle internationale. Cossette ajoute de la valeur aux affaires de ses clients par son offre de nombreuses disciplines de communications totalement intégrées au sein d'une même équipe multidisciplinaire. Cossette compte des bureaux à Québec, Montréal, Toronto, Winnipeg, Edmonton, Vancouver et Halifax. Esprit de Corps est un réseau d'agences spécialisées de réputation internationale : Dare, Elvis, Paine PR, Optimum, Band & Brown, Brando, Rocket XL et Jungle Média. En plus de ses bureaux à New York, Los Angeles, et Londres, Esprit de Corps a aussi des opérations dans les principales villes canadiennes.

Description: Mental works est une web agency indépendante spécialisée dans les projets web et e-business à forte composante créative et technologique. 
Cumulant les atouts d’une agence de communication interactive et d’une SSII, Mental works est à même de répondre à tous vos projets pour bénéficier d’une présence web gagnante. 

L'agence, née de la fusion en janvier 2001 d'une SSII (info tools) et d'un studio de création multimédia (io-domain), dispose en interne des trois pôles de compétences indispensables pour assurer le succès des projets de sites internet (institutionnels, e-commerce, produits, marchands) ou d'applications métiers développées sur mesure (intranets, extranets): 

La complémentarité des métiers de l'agence s'exprime autour 3 pools dont bénéficie chaque projet :

• POOL CONSEIL 
• POOL CRÉATION 
• POOL TECHNIQUE 
En fort développement, l'agence a ainsi été classée à la 9e place en 2006 du classement FAST 50 des entreprises de la région nord. Le siège social est situé à Compiègne, au nord de Paris, dans un cadre de vie privilégié (accès par l'A1 à 45 min de Paris et à 1h30 de Lille). L'agence dispose d'un bureau commercial sur Amiens et d'une présence renforcée sur Paris (Levallois Perret) 

Notre équipe
Soudée, motivée et talentueuse, elle est composée de consultants, chefs de projets, webdesigners, intégrateurs et développeurs spécialisés et expérimentés. Les quatre directeurs associés, de par leur spécialité métier et leur complémentarité, assurent également des fonctions opérationnelles et restent au contact permanent des équipes. 

Notre méthodologie
La production est organisée en Business Units spécialisées par projets et technologies afin de garantir une qualité de suivi et d'accompagnement au fil des missions confiées à l'agence. 

Le suivi est assuré par le chef de projet tandis que les postes liés à la production s'enrichissent continuellement de la diversité des projets traités. La capitalisation des connaissances et le partage entre chaque collaborateur s'en trouve optimisé tout en faisant émerger des compétences pluridisciplinaires. L'expérience antérieure ainsi constituée bénéficie en conséquence à tous nos nouveaux clients. 

La rigueur, la réactivité et la qualité sont les 3 principaux critères qui résument notre engagement et notre ambition.

Description: Publicis entre dans le consulting de marques
Le groupe publicitaire français s'associe au cabinet indépendant Eurogroup pour créer la filiale Publicis Royalties, société dédiée au brand management, c'est-à-dire au consulting de marques, un domaine dans lequel le groupe de communication français était jusqu'ici peu présent. 
Baptisée Publicis Royalties, cette agence est créée en partenariat avec Eurogroup, qui en devient l'un des actionnaires minoritaires. Eurogroup, fondé en 1982, s'est imposé comme le premier cabinet de conseil en organisation et management indépendant français. Avec 470 collaborateurs, dont 400 consultants, il réalise un chiffre d'affaires de 72 millions d'euros en France.
Un trio associé au capital 
Aux confins des métiers du conseil et de l'audit et de ceux de la communication, Publicis Royalties réunit aujourd'hui une équipe d'analystes, de planneurs stratégiques et de designers. Elle est dirigée par un trio, associé au capital : David Jobin, directeur des stratégies, Alexandre de Coupigny, directeur des opérations, et Olivier Bontemps, directeur de la création. 
Le premier, publicitaire, a notamment travaillé chez Saatchi & Saatchi France avant de rejoindre Interbrand, la filiale d'Omnicom spécialisée dans la création et l'évaluation des marques. 
Le deuxième est, lui aussi, un ancien d'Interbrand où il a développé l'expertise sur la valorisation financière des marques. Il est aussi membre de la commission française Afnor en charge de l'élaboration d'une norme Iso sur la valorisation des marques. 
Enfin, le troisième, fondateur de l'agence de communication audiovisuelle View, a été l'un des directeurs de création de la société de production et de création Gédéon. 
«Royalties aime tout ce qui touche aux marques et à leur développement, de la stratégie à la création, en passant par l'organisation et la communication, assurent ses trois fondateurs. Les grandes marques se développent sur des leviers de valeur qui peuvent être stimulés presque sans limite et devenir autant de relais de croissance et augmenter leurs revenus.»
Installée au 133, avenue des Champs-Élysées, à Paris, siège du groupe Publicis, la nouvelle filiale compte huit collaborateurs et s'appuiera sur les ressources de ses deux principaux actionnaires. Elle est déjà en charge de missions de brand management pour Orange, client de Publicis Conseil, et Radio France. Publicis Royalties vient étoffer le réseau Publicis en France (deuxième pays du réseau en termes de taille), qui comprend plus de 1 000 salariés, au travers des enseignes Publicis Conseil, Publicis Dialog, Publicis Constellation, Publicis Et Nous, Publicis Net et Loeb et Associés.

Brand Health International is grounded in the conviction that brand development and branding are fundamental to enhancing the potential and success of pharmaceutical products. Brands and branding are important because they are about shaping and re-shaping the way that the medical world thinks and feels. This conviction is reflected in our profound contribution to the theory and practice of brand research in this area. Brand Health International claims an intellectual leadership position in the territory of pharmaceutical brand research. 

The key principals in Brand Health have made a profound contribution to the understanding of brands and brand development within the healthcare arena. 

Over the course of 20 years Mike Owen and Jon Chandler have produced an extensive array of publications, conference presentations and seminars, including the book ‘Developing Brands with Qualitative Market Research’ published by Sage in 2002. Jon and Mike have pioneered the development of task based research in the healthcare arena.

Claire McPhillips has been a pioneer in the development of research approaches designed to parallel the reality of the selling situation. 

Cory Inglis has been instrumental in the introduction of marketing output-driven research. 

Peter Winters has been a pioneer in the development of quantitative brand research conducted via the internet. 

Brand Health International has been formed out of the coming together of three separate specialist brand research companies: Context Research International [Mike Owen and Jon Chandler], Root [Claire McPhillips and Cory Inglis] and the original Brand Health International [Peter Winters]. Each of these companies brings a distinctive component to the Brand Health International offering so that these come together into something unique in the world of healthcare brand development.

Brand Health International is an Associate Member of EphMRA and PBIRG and active within the BHBIA.

Description: Welcome to dais... We're new. And as everybody knows (brand managers especially) newer always means better. But hey, we're not resting on our laurels. We know that our shimmering newness won't last forever and eventually we'll have to slug it out with the old guard for our place on the shortlist/roster/podium.

We are the digital platform for archibald ingall stretton... Great, just what London needs, another digital agency. But in fact it's exactly what was needed. Our founding fathers identified a gaping chasm in the market. Many digital agencies could only really offer design skills. What was missing was an ability to blend planning, creativity and data. What was missing was an interactive agency that actually interacts.

So in April 2005 they took the virtual bull by the e-horns and assembled a veritable dream team of interactive luminaries to bring dais... into the world.

We are ready. We have the people. We have the technology. We have the web site (always a good sign for a digital agency...).

Description: Vision Statement
Contributing to health care by making available to Pharmaceutical and Biotech industries its long term experience and broad expertise in early clinical development and bioanalytical services, aster.cephac aims to be the leading niche provider by recognising as its main values: 

Client Service 
Quality 
Information Sharing 

General Information
aster.cephac is a full service provider of Clinical Pharmacology trials and Bioanalytical Services. Since 1975, we have served the pharmaceutical and biotechnology industries with expertise and innovation as an Early Phase clinical trial specialist, and have become the largest independent Bioanalytical unit in Europe. 
Whether you require a single study or an entire drug development program, we offer processes, trials and analyses of the highest standard – enabling you to bring your drug to market earlier, accelerate your decision-making process and increase shareholder value. 

Facilities & Staff

Centrally located in Paris and Poitiers, France, an expanding international client base entrusts its studies to our units. Phase I-IIa trials are conducted at our 9, 200 m² facilities in Paris, which include 80 hospitalization beds, equipped according to the latest technology and international safety requirements.  
The modern 3, 200 m² bioanalytical unit in Poitiers (1h30 south of Paris) includes 16 LCMS-MS and a rapidly growing Immunoassay department.
aster is certified ISO 9001, twice successfully FDA inspected and cephac is GLP grade A.

Our greatest asset is our staff – all 400 of them. Our specialists work on a one-to-one basis with you throughout the project to ensure that your needs and expectations are fully met. 
aster.cephac has created a stimulating environment for staff to develop their careers and grow with us. As a result, key staff turnover is extremely low. For instance, the full time investigators, Study Directors and project managers you will be working with have been with aster.cephac for an average of 10 years. 

We take pride in our staff's loyalty, which, in turn, facilitates long-term and stable relationships with sponsors.


Strengths
Our strength originate from our corporate values

Scientific expertise gained from 30 years’ experience 
Full service offering – Clinical Pharmacology – Bioanalysis – Pharmacometrics 
Innovative services 
Proven quality assurance 
First-rate Clinical & Bioanalytical facilities 
Customer focus

The Institute of Chartered Accountants in England & Wales is the largest professional accountancy body in Europe with over 128,000 members.
The Institute was established by Royal Charter in 1880. It is now a key influencer on the international stage and the leading UK body of finance professionals offering world class qualifications.

Key policies
Latest ICAEW Enterprise Policy papers
·	Small business: at the heart of government <http://www.icaew.com/index.cfm?route=145637>

The budget cycle
The Institute makes representations to the chancellor, HM Treasury and the HMRC throughout the year but particularly in the run-up to the pre-budget report and the budget. We also respond to the budget and work towards improvements in the subsequent Finance Bill as it passes through parliament.

Description: offices in Dubai, New york and London

Complinet is the market-leading publisher of information and provider of software solutions to the international financial services industry. Complinet's range of services includes publishing, compliance training and software development. In the world of financial services regulation we are unique in the range of services that we provide and in our approach to their delivery.

The key to our success is our clear understanding of the dynamic and complex elements of this heavily regulated industry and the significant pressure that this environment places on professionals working in it.

At Complinet we combine expert content with leading edge software to help our clients actively reduce the risk of regulatory failure. Our products and services not only reduce the cost of compliance but they also help firms to develop a compliance culture that promotes best practice throughout their business.

Complinet was founded in 1997 and employs over 200 people in its offices in New York, London and Dubai. Each day, more than 50,000 regulatory professionals working in more than 1200 companies worldwide rely on Complinet for quality analysis and robust compliance systems.

Our customers include some of the world's leading regulatory and government bodies as well as the major financial services firms, lawyers and consultants.
