Description: All business is now multi channel and Leo Burnett is structured accordingly. The Leo Burnett Group specialise in Advertising, Digital, Social Media, Content and Innovation, Sales Promotion, Direct Marketing, Event Management, Licensing and Luxury Branding.
We have one planning department across all these disciplines; one creative department creating ideas that work across all relevant media; one account management team and one production department.

The GROUP:


Arc Worldwide is the global marketing services company of The Leo Burnett Group, grounded in the understanding of people and behavior.

Atelier, part of the Leo Burnett Group, is dedicated to creating communications with style and substance for fashion, beauty and luxury brands.

Flip Media founded in 2003 and headquartered in Dubai (UAE), Flip Media has more than 100 employees across the Middle East and India, and has worked with some of the region's most well-known brands. The agency provides end-to-end digital solutions, including strategy, design and production, content and delivery, and technology across all platforms.

Leo Comm a combination of world class public relations proficiencies and insurmountable professionalism, with expertise in consumer, technology, corporate and telecommunications industries. 

Holler founded in 2001 and headquartered in London, Holler first joined the Leo Burnett Group in 2011. Since its inception, the agency’s overriding vision has been to deliver all-encompassing communications solutions designed to build brand growth through cultural relevance. Essentially, Holler’s mission is to rely on best-in-class strategic thinking to craft campaigns that focus on people and their behaviors, turning ideas into actions.

Description: Medley Business Solutions is a management and IT consultancy, formed in 1997. We have since grown consistently and successfully, earning long-term relationships with our clients by delivering a valued quality service. 
We provide client-side consultancy delivering business change and improvement. We work with our clients as trusted advisers reviewing their business operation, scoping new initiatives, capturing requirements, and defining and delivering effective business solutions and successful change.

We are financially and vendor independent. This means our advice and recommendations are completely impartial and purely designed to meet the needs of our clients.

Our people are our biggest asset and we only recruit experienced, quality individuals who have a track record of delivery with major organisations. We have built a capable team with skills and expertise from blue-chip companies, major systems houses and leading management consultancies.

02/07/06 InVentiv Health acquiert Chandle Chico Agency pour 65M$

Chandler Chicco Agency se lance en France
L’agence indépendante spécialisée sur le secteur de la santé Chandler Chicco Agency (CCA) implante ses premiers bureaux à Paris. La nouvelle filiale du groupe Chandler Chicco Companies est dirigée par Jean-Yves Goar, ex-conseil en communication pour la santé. L’agence parisienne compte parmi ses clients les laboratoires Allergan et Bristol-Myers Squibb.
 
CCA délivre du conseil stratégique en communication et en relations publiques aux hôpitaux, ONG, associations de patients, organisations professionnelles et aux laboratoires pharmaceutiques. 
 
 19/09/2006 - CB News - Anne-Valérie Hoh 
SANTE. Déjà présente à New York, Londres, Washington et Los Angeles l'agence américaine Chandler Chicco Agency (CCA), spécialisée en communication santé, ouvre un bureau à Paris. Cette filiale est dirigée par Jean-Yves Goar, consultant en communication sensible, et compte pour premiers clients : les laboratoires Allergan et Bristol-Myers Squibb. L'agence s'appuiera en relations presse sur Presse & Papiers, dirigée par Anne Brossard-Saillant

Jean Yves Goar explained to me he needs people who are looking for an exiting new challenge. CCA Paris is an atypical agency. He needs someone who is with an open mindset and looking for a  new adventure... Need to be prepared travel alot etc.

Description: Nous prenons en charge toute votre communication, de la mise en œuvre à l’exécution, avec un objectif : accroître votre image de marque. Nous devenons votre interface communication pour tout ce qui concerne l’information et les messages que vous souhaitez faire passer auprès des revues professionnelles, tant sur le plan rédactionnel que publicitaire.
Les tâches récurrentes
Il s’agit de toutes les actions de relations presse courantes liées à la vie de nos clients 
  Identifier les produits, les faits marquants dans la vie de votre entreprise. 
  Préparation et réalisation des communiqués de presse (collecte de l’information, re-mise en forme). 
  Transmission de l’information aux différents organes de presse. 
  Suivi et relance éventuelle (si l’envoi n’est pas suivi d’une parution) du traitement journalistique fait par chaque support. 
  Sur une manifestation professionnelle : Nous serons à vos côtés pour préparer les dossiers de presse à l’attention des « journalistes visiteurs » de la manifestation. Organiser un « point presse » sur le stand, ou en parallèle dans une salle adjacente au hall d’exposition. 
  Réalisation d’un Press Book périodique relatant vos différentes présences rédactionnelles dans la presse.

Description: Pour répondre aux besoins de nos clients en matière de performance commerciale, nous avons bâti des solutions autour de deux piliers fondamentaux :

* LA DATA DIGITALE
Nous sommes spécialisés sur la collecte de datas online afin d'apporter de la valeur ajoutée à nos bases de données offline en y intégrant des données comportementales, sociales… 

* ACTIVATION DE LEVIERS DIGITAUX : 
Une fois récoltées et traitées, ces datas sont valorisées à travers l’activation de différents dispositifs digitaux (SEO, SEM, emailing, affiliation, content marketing,…). 
Notre savoir-faire en lead nurtering nous permet ainsi d’alimenter les forces de vente de nos clients en contacts chauds ayant démontré une appétence forte.

Nous couvrons tous les besoins des entreprises en matière de développement commercial, de la petite entreprise au compte clé, en passant par les entreprises à réseau de distribution.

- Des solutions packagées pour les petites entreprises, leur permettant de piloter en toute autonomie leurs campagnes de prospection 

- Une application en mode cloud pour les entreprises à réseau leur permettant de dynamiser leurs distributeurs.

- Des solutions sur-mesure, pour les comptes clés pour répondre à leurs enjeux de développement commercial


Spécialiste de la data B2B, nous avons su enrichir notre base offline de 10 millions d'entreprises par des données comportementales, sociales ... récoltées par le biais de cookies ou de crowdsourcing sur nos différents portails. Nos bases ainsi enrichies, nous permettent de proposer à nos clients une source inédite de données ouvrant à des opportunités de ciblage intelligent

Description: En 2000, CEMKA et EVAL ont fusionné leurs activités pour constituer l'un des premiers bureaux d'études français dans le domaine de la Santé Publique, de l'Economie de la santé et de l'Epidémiologie.

L'expertise développée par CEMKA-EVAL dans ses disciplines est reconnue au plan national et international, ainsi qu'en témoigne la richesse de ses publications.
Cette expertise est mise au service des besoins et des attentes de ses clients (Autorités de Santé, industrie biomédicale, acteurs associatifs, structures de soins).

CEMKA-EVAL, associe une grande diversité de talents : médecins, économistes de la santé, spécialistes de la Santé Publique, sociologues, biostatisticiens…
Le haut niveau de performance de ses consultants repose sur leur polyvalence, leur technicité et leur complémentarité.
L'esprit de l'équipe et sa pérennité assurent une maîtrise de la gestion des projets.

La qualité des prestations délivrées repose de plus sur le développement de procédures internes et sur l'intégration d'outils nécessaires à la réalisation de toutes formes d'études de terrain.
CEMKA-EVAL dispose également de son propre centre logistique d'enquêtes .

Dans tous les cas CEMKA-EVAL s'engage à mettre, à la disposition de ses partenaires, les moyens et les compétences pour apporter la meilleure réponse possible face aux questions qui se posent aujourd'hui dans le domaine de la Santé.

Description: Established in 2001, The Future Laboratory is a trend forecasting, research and brand innovation consultancy. We deliver market and consumer insight to clients including Louis Vuitton, Sony, American Express, Marks & Spencer, General Motors, British Gas, O2, Pernod Ricard, HSBC and The Body Shop, alongside leading agencies including Edelman, Golin Harris and Consolidated PR.

We look at the niche, the different and the diverse to help clients know what is new and next in consumer thinking. 

Co-founders Chris Sanderson and Martin Raymond like to quote author William Gibson: ‘The future is already here, it’s just not very evenly distributed.’ Together with partner Tom Savigar, they explain that their ‘job and passion is to help navigate a path into the future’. 

Over the past 10 years the business offer has evolved to reflect clients changing needs. While trend forecasting, consumer and market insight are still at the heart of the business, The Future Laboratory now also helps clients develop strategies to help make the future happen via our A.H.E.A.D. programme, our strategic framework for master planning clients’ futures.

The broader business offer is delivered by a core team of 50, with diverse experience and skill sets, alongside a network of global correspondents, allowing for a powerful exchange of information, inspiration and innovation.

The Future Laboratory works with clients across the world from headquarters in the heart of Spitalfields, east London.

ABA delivers inspiring, commercially-savvy findings, which clients tell us make a real difference to their businesses – as evidenced by the fact we have worked alongside many of Britain’s biggest brands for over a decade. It is our ability to ‘make a tangible difference’ that MRS cited as a key reason for naming us Best Agency 2012.

The way we make this difference is through strengths such as:
- Having great people and investing heavily in their development – so clients only have first-class brains on their work
- Developing partnerships with brands such as John Lewis, M&S, ASDA and Virgin Atlantic by working on everything from urgent, fast-turnaround projects to long-running strategic studies.
- Having the ability to join-the-dots between different studies, pinpoint the key commercial insights and then communicate these in a short, punchy manner
- Putting particular emphasis on ‘thinking time’, which we have learnt makes all the difference in providing clients with clear direction forward rather than undigested data
- Evolving, over 20 years, the slick research processes that free us to concentrate on ‘thinking time’ - examples being: bespoke methodologies, often blending quant and qual, to get to the heart of clients’ objectives and proprietary survey software, Qgen, which produces surveys that look genuinely on brand but are also excellent value for money

Description: This is how McCluskey International first began in 1987, and today we are justifiably proud of the creativity and success of our campaigns. Put simply, we deliver outstanding results designed to give maximum return on investment. 
Our experience across the globe has given us an exceptional network of media contacts within the travel and lifestyle arenas, all of whom trust us to deliver hard hitting, timely and factually correct stories that capture the imagination. 
We are constantly researching new trends, and understand how to harness the increasingly powerful advancement of online PR and other media, in conjunction with traditional practices. We have recently worked with a number of clients to produce podcasts, blogs and other online content.
PR teams are carefully selected to match each client's requirements, and in addition every client can be assured of strategic consultancy from agency principal Judy McCluskey.

Destination representation is a core service requirement for many of our clients, and our trade marketing team was established in 2000. We are proud of our quickly-gained reputation for excellence among the UK travel trade.
Our team creates and executes an agreed marketing plan to our clients’ individual specifications. No matter how large or small, our clients can be assured of a professional and comprehensive programme. 
We can incorporate every aspect of sales, marketing and support activity, ranging from brochure analysis to online and face-to-face sales training; exhibition and event organisation; consumer enquiry lines and fulfilment, design and print production, web marketing and much more.


All above the line disciplines can be provided in a cost-effective and creative way at McCluskey International. 
We are now the preferred agency for all aspects of the marketing mix for a number of our clients, and especially those organisations without a UK based office through which to channel their international requirements. 
Clients including Ontario, the Maldives and the Italian region of Piedmont have all chosen to place their advertising requirements in our capable hands.
Affinity marketing offers our clients major promotional opportunities with strategically selected high profile partners. 
Some of the consumer brands we are proud to have partnered with include O’Neill Surfwear, Mulberry, Carluccios, Snow and Rock, and Monsoon. 
With her strong consumer marketing background and understanding of the tourism sector, our marketing director Jackie Stainer oversees all aspects of the promotion, giving our clients increased exposure to new, targeted audiences, data-collection, and brand enhancement. 
Jackie’s close relationship with the PR and trade marketing teams ensures a cohesive and consistent approach to all partnerships.
E-marketing is possibly the most important change in the way we market ourselves today, with one in 20 visits to the internet being to travel websites. 
McCluskey International has been quick to embrace the online world. We offer our clients the very latest online marketing service, from rewriting your website to search engine optimisation, podcasting, viral marketing, blogging and online advertising. 
We work with experts at the top of their field to ensure that we - and you - are always working at the forefront of technology.
Take a look at our very own McCluskey blog in the 'extras' section, where you can also find numerous examples of podcasts and other online marketing projects.

Description: 
C'est celui qui dit qui y est.....eh oui, beaucoup d'agences revendiquent le "360°" ; encore faut-il le prouver. Chez Armania, 360° veut dire - au-delà de la publicité -, représenter une vraie "force de réflexion" et de proposition sur l'ensemble des supports : le digital, le contenu, la fidélisation et le marketing services. 360°, c'est aussi notre façon de travailler : dès le brief, nous aimons gratter nos cerveaux pour trouver d'autres approches. Nous aimons nous appuyer sur un planning stratégique qui ne laisse aucune piste inexplorée, un planning qui lit entre les lignes pour les faire bouger. Nous aimons bâtir des plateformes et des thèmes de marque qui ne sont pas des me too. Plus de contenu, plus de sens pour aller dans le bon sens. Encore une de nos spécialités maison. A chaque étape, creuser pour enrichir le discours, sans l'engraisser. Armania est une agence vivante, qui vit sans peur et pour faire naître des idées, qui prône l'audace plutôt que la complaisance, une agence qui ne craint pas le chaos pour accoucher d'une étoile qui danse comme disait Monsieur Nietzsche...La création, nous la voulons la plus neuve possible, déroutante ? Pourquoi pas. L'important est qu'elle interpelle notre réflexion dès l'amont. Un challenge qui booste notre travail, au quotidien.

Après un démarrage en trombe dans l’édition, l’agence n’a cessé d’évoluer pour offrir aujourd’hui l’ensemble des compétences d’une agence en communication globale.
Forte d’une structure de conseil en stratégie, Armania pense la marque comme une histoire à raconter avec en son centre un thème, source d’inspiration pour l’ensemble des prises de parole du client, quel que soit le medium.
Cette histoire, pour être entendue dans un premier temps, puis aimée dans un second temps, doit être intelligente ; elle doit aussi ne pas se confondre avec les autres, être différente et s’enrichir avec le temps.
Et elle ne peut vivre que si les personnes qui la racontent sont convaincues par le discours ; c’est pourquoi le thème de marque doit être aussi attrayant pour le personnel de l’entreprise que pour les consommateurs.
Armania : cinq continents sur la même planète !
Conseil (transversal aux pôles) : coaching de marque®, planning stratégique, études, veilles concurrentielles et stratégiques… 

Publicité : presse, affichage, radio, TV …

Edition : rapport annuel, guides, dépliants, catalogues ...

Fidélisation, MD : carte de fidélisation, mailings, emailings, analyse on et off line, formation …
Digital : création de site internet, bannières pub, emailing, campagnes SMS, marketing mobile

CRÉ-A-TI-VI-TÉ ! Voilà l’enjeu vital, le carburant céleste, le moteur de la croissance pour vous, pour nous, pour Petite Boîte & Fils comme pour XXL Company. 
« The creative imperative », l’impératif créatif. C’était le mot d’ordre du 36e Forum économique mondial de Davos. Pourquoi ? 
Parce que « les théories, les outils et les structures sur lesquels s’appuyaient les décideurs durant la dernière décennie sont devenus obsolètes ». Klaus Schwab, fondateur et président du Forum, le dit très bien. Nous ne pensons pas autrement. En plein changement d’ère, au cœur de la révolution planétaire, sois créatif ou disparais ! 
C’est l’impératif, sans alternative.
La créativité partout, tout le temps, « parce que 2 / 3 des français trouvent la publicité banale, qu’elle est envahissante pour 75% d’entre eux, dangereuse pour 50 % et qu’ 1 / 4 se déclare publiphobe » 
Sources : IFOP
Le thème de marque pour se

At Clarke Mulder Purdie we believe that good public relations relies on being well connected to the big issues affecting our clients. This belief lies at the heart of all we do. Through our leadership panel - hothouse - we work with some of Europe's leading experts from across business, media, government and technology.

We specialise in delivering high-impact and creative media relations and thought leadership campaigns that deliver results. Results that support commercial goals. 

In the corporate communications and B2B sector, creativity is sometimes in short supply. We set out to change this. Description: Weber Shandwick | FCC in Dublin is one of Ireland’s leading public relations agenices. Founded in 1989, the firm has won fourteen Public Relations Consultants Association (PRCA) awards for the quality of its work since the awards inception in 1995. 

The agency has a proven track record in corporate, financial, technology, public affairs, consumer and healthcare public relations. Weber Shandwick | FCC offers a comprehensive service in the development and implementation of communications programmes, and public awareness campaigns.

Description: CRO
Approximately 78 people as of today.
Groupe NOVASCO

ASCOPHARM is the original CRO structure of the group. ASCOPHARM was founded in early 1995, by personnel with significant experience in drug development management. This experience had been gained through years of work with both pharmaceutical companies and CROs, particularly its founders, Dr. Hervé Karsenty, General Manager and Medical Director, and Mrs Nelly Rémond, Director of Operations.

ASCOPHARM was founded and developed on the basis of four main concepts: 

Achieving and ensuring high quality in all scientific work, 
Working entirely within a non-profit system, to guarantee unbiased and devoted clinical research (Status of a non-profit "Association Loi 1901"), 
Forming a real partnership with pharmaceutical companies, 
Creating an atmosphere in all aspects of research, which is both friendly and efficient. 
To date ASCOPHARM has developed a variety of services, from study conception to publication, all performed by highly experienced personnel: 

Medical and clinical research writing, 
Central randomisation, 
Clinical study affairs: 
Clinical research monitoring services, 
Medical/safety monitoring and review, 
Epidemiology and Post Marketing Surveillance 
Regulatory affairs, 
Data management, 
Biostatistics, 
Training Services, 
Logistic Services, 
Clinical study budget management, including investigator payments, patient management, etc. 


The functional structure of the group is in essence very similar to the structure encountered in the pharmaceutical industry. Only few variations have been implemented in order to fulfil the specificities of the group.

* Management: The Group is headed by its General Director, Dr Herve Karsenty, and its Director of Operations, Mrs Nelly Rémond. Strategic decisions involve also the Board of Directors which includes also the Director of Business Development, Mr Thierry Lapuente, The Director of Key Projects and IT, Mr Bruno Voulaz, The Director of Coordination, Mrs Lucie ROUCH, and the Director of QA, Mrs Christel Souillard-Maudet. The Board of Directors meets formally every semester to define major orientations of the group which comprises approximately 78 people as of today.

* Monitoring: Monitoring includes both clinical monitoring and site assistance. 7 Group Managers are under direct responsibility of the Director of Operations. Each Group manager has 3 to 6 CRAs under his/her responsibility. The monitoring group represents a 40 people department.

* Data Management: Headed by Mr Laurent Bertel, Data Management comprises 2 Data Managers/Programmers. One Coding specialist is responsible for the management and use of major data dictionaries. In addition, data entry personnel are under direct supervision of this group. This department liaises with IT development which has responsibilities on programming and maintenance of randomization servers.

* Biostatistics: Biostatistics is headed by Mrs Murielle Gagneau, who drives a total of 5 statisticians. This group is also directly involved in clinical writing activities together with the medical group.

* Medical and Regulatory Affairs: This department includes 5 Doctors in Medecine and 3 a number of Clinical Coordinators. This department is responsible for pre-study regulatory affairs, medical support and pharmacovigilance, and is involved in clinical writing activities together with the Biostatistics department.

* Quality Assurance: QA is headed
Status: Active

Description: meeting with Olga - HR director on 30/04/13 - Laura Kirby and Daisy Smith

Structure:
30 in total. 20 on PR team. 
Split with Outside Line
other office with Channel 5

They do all sorts of publicist work:
Arts and literature, events/concerts, personal PR, CEO PR, 
their corporate division is really growing.
Social media team is also growing - will be looking for this team

How they recruit
Agencies are their last resort. Before talking to agecies they will reach out to their own contacts, referals, post an advert. A lot of people contact them directly on the basis of their reputation
Don't tend to take on temporary people - unusual to hire a freelancer
she normally pays 10% and works with agencies such as Handle and Sorted

Type of people they recruit:
would rather hire established publicists who can do the job rather than hiring junior members to train up

Important qualities:
Eager, work orientated, creative. able to work alone and as part of a team. They work a lot of hours, no overtime. staff expected to work at the weekend but this is also a perk as they get to go to festivals etc

Retention:
staff do come and go but a lot of the team have been there 10 years + including Olga herself. It is v. unusual for people to leave under a year.

Description: 09 Sep 2008 09:13 MB:
Home
The Carbon Markets and Investors Association (CMIA), formed in August 2008 by the merger between the Carbon Markets Association (CMA) and INCIS, is an international trade association representing service providers to the global carbon market. 
The CMIA was formed to represent businesses at the cutting edge of the services sector working to reduce carbon emissions through the market mechanisms of the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) and the Kyoto Protocol. It was created to ensure the progressive business voice is heard - market-friendly climate change policy creates new business opportunities. 
The CMIA has more than 60 member companies including: financial institutions, carbon funds, project developers, lawyers, accountants, verifiers, emissions brokers and IT firms. We aim to promote growth and stability in the carbon market and to enhance competitiveness in the climate change sector. 
Our members in the CMIA provide highly-skilled jobs and added value to the economy through the offer of services to the growing global market for the reduction of carbon emissions. CMIA's current international membership accounts for an estimated three quarters of the transaction value in the global carbon market worth an estimated 64 billion USD in 2007.

Description: - Founded in 1987, OC&C Strategy Consultants operate around the world to bring clear thinking to the most complex issues facing ambitious management.

- We work side by side with our clients to achieve lasting improvements in strategic performance and to maximise long-term growth. While our style is collaborative, we remain challenging, engaging with people as well as with problems, tailoring each solution closely to the situation at hand.
- The strategies we develop are creative, possibly provocative yet always practical and, above all, actionable.

Description: Here at Why Media we provide Marketing, Design and Communications services. Our creative agency has offices in Central London and Cambridgeshire and spans experience within the marketing world for almost two decades. We offer a niche service, providing our clients an external marketing solution with an internal approach. Why Media specialise in creating digital marketing strategies and online solutions for Shopping Centres, House Builders, Commercial Property, Fund Managers and Civil Engineers, as well as supporting a number of digital start up’s and entrepreneurs. 

Why Media have also been involved in some of the UK’s largest private sector developments, providing services including consultancy, Graphic Design, Website Development and Marketing Strategy. 

Creating a business within the fast paced industry of marketing involves a clear business strategy and hard work. Why Media’s dedicated team are constantly researching and developing new and exciting concepts which have allowed our clients to stay ahead of the curb and challenge the boundaries of marketing 


At Why Media we believe in offering our clients complete transparency and clarity when it comes to billing and understanding objectives. In order to aid this, each Why Media client has a dedicated Client Manager who is available to assist with all questions, queries and comments. 

As with many Professional Service providers, Why Media charge all clients on an hourly basis.

Description: Qatar Solar Technologies (QSTec) is about enabling solar power by producing quality polysilicon for the ever expanding international solar energy markets. QSTec provides the building blocks of photovoltaic power that help reduce green house emissions and protect the environment for future generations.

Headquartered in Qatar, QSTec will produce 8,000 tonnes per annum of high grade polysilicon for export to the world’s solar energy markets. QSTec is a joint venture between Qatar Foundation (70%), SolarWorld AG (29%) and the Qatar Development Bank (1%). Quality, reliability and efficiency is important to us which is why QSTec has teamed up with one of the world’s leading integrated solar companies, SolarWorld AG, and the leading technology and equipment provider, Centrotherm Photovoltaics. QSTec is also constructing a 150 MW Solar Module manufacturing facility and a 1.4MW solar farm on it's Ras Laffan site. 

The project is valued at US$1bn and first silicon out will be in December 2014.

Description: New player enters UAE’s business and corporate solutions market
Media Specs Corporate Solutions aims to provide a unique level of comprehensive
and cost-effective services
Dubai, UAE – Monday 3
rd Oct 2011: Media Specs Corporate Solutions (MSCS), a new company providing
Strategic and Tactical Solutions for media and business companies, has launched recently in Dubai, UAE.
Mainly located in Dubai Media City (DMC), with a future plans to establish operating offices in GCC and Levant
countries, the new company aims to provide a different level of service by helping its clients identify and create
their strategic goals, as well as supporting their growth plans.
Armed with a wealth of experience in corporate business, communications and marketing, as well as a wide
network of resources, MSCS plans to offer comprehensive, innovative yet affordable business solutions relevant
to the needs and requirements of the industry from both an agency’s and a client’s perspective.
Announcing the launch of Media Specs Corporate Solutions FZ LLC, Raghid Eid, CEO, said: “With a perfect
balance of experience, resources and leadership skills, we at Media Specs Corporate Solutions take ownership
and responsibility of our client's project, ensuring periodic performance measurement and outcome of planned
media solutions.
“We value our client's visions, and work with them hand in hand towards achieving their visions by integrating
these values into our high-standard, solution-oriented services.”
Media and non media companies in UAE industry make up the target market for MSCS, which aspires to expand
its presence and scope of services in the future based on market demand.

Description: Silatech is a dynamic social initiative that works to create jobs and expand economic opportunities for young people throughout the Arab world.

We promote large-scale job creation, entrepreneurship, access to capital and markets, and the participation and engagement of young people in economic and social development. Founded in 2008 by Her Highness Sheikha Moza bint Nasser, we find innovative solutions to challenging problems, working with a wide spectrum of NGOs, governments and the private sector to foster sustainable, positive change for Arab youth.

What’s in a Name?

“Silatech” comes from the Arabic word “Sila,” which means “connection.” In Arabic, “Silatech” means “your connection.” 
We aren’t a job finding service, but we take seriously our role as a vital connection linking young Arabs to employment opportunities. As a small but agile and results-driven organization, we bring NGOs and civil society, governments and the private sector together to address youth unemployment issues from every angle.

Vision

An Arab world in which young people are able to work, and are engaged in the economic and social development of their societies.

Mission

To connect young people with improved opportunities for employment, enterprise and civic engagement. We do this by mobilizing knowledge, investment, technology and networks, and by influencing mindsets and policies that are key to unlocking wider impact.

Description: Recordati, established in 1926, is a European pharmaceutical group, listed on the Italian Stock Exchange (Reuters RECI.MI, Bloomberg REC IM, ISIN IT 0003828271), dedicated to the research, development, manufacturing and marketing of pharmaceuticals, with headquarters in Milan, Italy, operations in the main European countries, and a total staff of over 2,000. A European field force of over 1,000 medical representatives promotes a wide range of innovative pharmaceuticals, both proprietary and under license, in a number of therapeutic areas. Recordati’s current and growing coverage of the European pharmaceutical market makes it a partner of choice for new product licenses from companies which do not have European marketing organizations. Recordati is committed to the research of new drug entities within the cardiovascular and urogenital therapeutic areas in which its research team has proven scientific competence and a track record of discovery and development of original drugs, the most recent of which, lercanidipine, a latest generation calcium channel blocker for the treatment of hypertension, is the company’s leading product. Consolidated revenue for 2005 was € 576.1 million, operating income was € 111.1 million and net income was € 64.5 million.

Description: Visit London			– the promotion of the City as a place to do business.  Campaign extends throughout Europe
PEC UK 			– the world’s conference, which will be in London in 2008, for the meeting and incentive industry 
EIBTM 				– the world’s leading exhibition annually in Barcelona for the meeting and incentive industry (all travel)
CIBTM 			– the same event but smaller in Beijing
GIBTM 			– an event in Abu Dhabi which launched last month

(All of the above three are organised by Reed Travel Exhibitions)

Newmarket Racecourse 	– the brands values have been enhanced by being part of a new dynamic team repositioning The Guineas and The Ritz Club July Festival.  Both key racing events in the UK social calendar
The National Boat Caravan & Outdoor Show 
– one of the largest consumer events in the UK takes place over 10 days at the NEC every February
The London Caravan & Outdoor Show 
– a London launch for the organiser of the above event which Cut Communications did from the outset three years ago
Maui Jim 	– the world’s leading polarised lensed sunglasses.  Cut Communications if currently promoting them throughout Europe specifically as corporate gifts within the meeting and incentive industry.  

Newmarket Racecourses – Cut does PR for both the Guineas and the July Ritz Festival. The client’s wish is to establish those events and by no means does Cut Communications do racing PR! Cut is promoting these events to lifestyle magazines and has great links with Harper’s, Vanity Fair, Esquire etc. One of the latest achievements was to suggest to the client to have Frankie Dettori bring his successful Knightsbridge restaurant to the Guineas. This PR idea was then followed through with an exclusive media lunch organised by Cut.
Meetings and Incentives Shows Organised by Reed Travel Exhibitions including: EIBTM (Barcelona), GIBTM (Abu Dhabi) and CIBTM (China). For these accounts Cut does PR on a global basis (with a list of over 600 names in over 30 countries) and therefore has to be very flexible with regards to a variety of queries from journalists. It is also very challenging (but rewarding) to work with different time zones and numerous deadlines!
Visit London – Meetings and Incentives. Cut promotes London as the place to have a meeting or conference to the European media (excluding UK). This is a great account as London has been very successful in attraction global key events. Cut is in charge of organising and escorting family trips as well as enabling Visit London to maximise their visibility at trade shows. Cut also carries out other PR activities for Visit London, such as press release distribution and interviews.
Maui Jim (America’s top polarised sunglass company) – this client is moving into the European incentive and meetings industry. Cut’s role is to ensure Maui Jim has the right visibility in key meetings and incentives publications in Europe and the Middle East.
National Boat Caravan and Outdoor Show (one of the UK’s biggest consumer shows) – currently the show runs over nine days and attracts large numbers of visitors but more importantly they all spend quite a lot of money! New caravans, motor homes and accessories are unveiled at the show and creativity is paramount on this account to make it into the national press. 
Cut is also about to sign two new clients that are travel related.

From Fortune 500, Eurotop 300 and the largest Asia-Pacific firms to new economy leaders, senior executives turn to L.E.K. for guidance in successfully navigating some of the toughest, highest-value issues facing their businesses. Description: The Health Foundation wants to make the quality of healthcare in the UK the best it can be. Working with others, we are helping to shape a future healthcare system that offers safe, effective and responsive care for all. 

We are a charitable foundation and operate independently from government, political parties or other interest groups.

Our endowment enables us to spend at least £20 million annually. We seek out the best people in healthcare and support them to learn and share with others. Through projects, research and evaluation studies we test and measure new ways of improving health services for the future. 

We seek to influence healthcare decision-makers so that we achieve sustainable and widespread improvements in the quality of patient care.

Our work is currently focused around five main aims:

building and making public the knowledge base for quality and performance improvement 
developing leaders to improve health and healthcare services 
supporting organisational efforts to improve quality and performance in health and healthcare services 
engaging clinicians in quality improvement 
engaging patients for better health and healthcare outcomes.

Description: BPG Group, headquartered in Dubai, is one of the largest marketing solutions groups in the MENA region. We cater to a wide range of International, regional and local clients through our extensive network across the region; offices in Dubai, Abu Dhabi, Kuwait, Jeddah, Doha, Baghdad and Erbil; Associates in Amman, Bahrain, Cairo and Muscat; and Alliance Partners in Karachi, Tampa and London.
OUR DIFFERENTIATORS CONTRIBUTE TO OUR SUCCESS:

Experience: We have over 30 years history of creating and executing solutions for our clients. We have helped build global brands out of local initiatives over the last two decades
Track Record: We have a documented track record of recognised successes, which include local/regional market leaders in retail, government initiatives, financial services and real estate
Integration: We seamlessly deliver specialist and integrated solutions. Nearly half of our revenue comes through a single-window delivery of integrated programs
BPG Group has over 220 team members representing 29 countries and is made up of specialist Strategic Business Unit covering the disciplines of advertising, activation, public relations, branding and design, public advocacy, media asset management, healthcare marketing and digital marketing. The SBUs work together seamlessly to deliver game changing integrated marketing solutions for our clients and have been involved in some of the biggest marketing communications initiatives ever undertaken in the GCC & MENA region, including the Dubai Shopping Festival, Dubai Summer Surprises, the 15th Asian Games Doha 2006, launch of H&M, among others.

1980: The late Majed Ahmed Al Ghurair starts PanGulf Publicity
1982: PanGulf Publicity hires the first copywriter in the UAE
1988: PanGulf Publicity is the first agency to purchase a MAC in the UAE
1992: PanGulf Publicity wins 11 out of 23 at the International Advertising (IAA) GCC Advertising Awards
1995: Dubai Shopping Festival is launched; a game-changing idea that is assisted by PanGulf Puclicity
1995: PanGulf Publicity creates 4 SBUs; PanGulf Advertising, PanGulf Public Relations, PanGulf Direct and PanGulf Strategy
1998: PanGulf Publicity divests a substantial minority stake to Cordiant Communications Group (holding company of Bates Worldwide) and rebrands itself as Bates PanGulf
1999: Dubai Internet City is launched, with assistance from Bates PanGulf
2000: Bates PanGulf opens an office in Kuwait
2003: Bates PanGulf launches Healthworld – the first specialist Healthcare marketing practice in the region
2003: Cordiant Communications Group is acquired by WPP
2004: Alliance with Bell Potinger Group – an international full service communications business
2006: Bates PanGulf celebrates 25 years
2006: Massive PR Campaign surrounding the Doha Asian Games is launched
2007: Bates PanGulf rebrands itself as BPG – an ambition to expand beyond PanGulf
2009: BPG Media forms strategic alliance with Maxus, GroupM’s global media agency of the year, to become BPG Maxus
2011: BPG Possible is a joint venture between the BPG Group and Possible Worldwide an interactive marketing agency, part of the WPP Group
2012: BPG Iraq is officially registered with branches in Baghdad and Erbil, BPG Qatar receives commercial license for office in Doha
2013: BPG Group partners with one of the world’s leading communications agencies, Cohn & Wolfe, to create BPG Cohn & Wolfe

BPG Maxus – Lean into change
BPG Maxus is one of the leading media planning & buying specialists and a market-pioneer in digital media solutions. 

In 2010, BPG Media formed a strategic alliance with Maxus – GroupM’s Global Media Agency of the Year – to become BPG Maxus and to offer best-in-class media solutions to our rich client portfolio. Maxus operates in 57 markets globally, and through the resources of GroupM, serves clients in over 130 markets worldwide.

BPG Maxus recognizes the power of ideas and innovation. Our people are firm believers that great media ideas can stimulate consumers to create and then distribute content in a big way. In the new age of communication, BPG Maxus is helping our clients choose the best channels and marketing models from a wide range of services:

Consumer Insights
Media and Market Research
Media Strategy and Data Analysis
Planning and Buying
Digital and Social Media
Mobile Media
Branded Content and Product Placements
Out of Home Media
Media Marketing Consultancy
Relationship Media
At BPG Maxus, we build deeper relationships between consumers and brands; creating more valued communication for businesses and consumers. We call this Relationship Media. The Relationship Media approach is combining very creative communications planning with sophisticated data analytics to deliver bespoke media solutions that will find new ways to excite customers about your brand.

Description: Facebook étend ses hashtags sur mobile 
MARKETING MOBILE. Quelques semaines après le lancement officiel des hashtags <http://www.strategies.fr/actualites/medias/214747W/facebook-introduit-les-mots-dieses.html>, ces «mots-dièses» permettant de centraliser les conversations, Facebook vient d'en décliner la fonctionnalité sur mobile. Lors de la recherche sur un hashtag donné, l'application présentera ceux qui peuvent lui être associés. Facebook devrait par ailleurs déployer d'autres fonctions, dont les hashtags les plus populaires sur le modèle de Twitter, d'après le site spécialisé Tech Crunch <http://techcrunch.com/2013/06/27/facebook-related-hashtags/>

Description: Broadcasters' Audience Research Board 

The Broadcasters’ Audience Research Board (BARB) provides official viewing figures for UK television audiences. It commissions specialist research companies Ipsos MORI, Kantar Media and RSMB to collect data that represent the television viewing behaviour of the UK’s 26 million TV households. 

BARB viewing data give broadcasters, advertisers and other interested parties a minute by minute breakdown of viewing at regional and national levels. This information is vital in assessing how programmes, channels or advertising campaigns have performed and provides the basis for airtime advertising trading.

Description: Headquarter in NY

Suite à la participation en 2005 de Marie-Catherine Dupuy (vice-présidente créative de TBWA France) et de Marie-France Lavarini (vice-présidente de TBWA Consulting) au premier Worldwide Women's Forum à Deauville, TBWA a décidé d'être un partenaire actif de l'édition 2006, qui se déroule du 5 au 7 octobre à Deauville. Thème choisi : la responsabilité des femmes dans l'amélioration de la société. TBWA va présenter quatre ateliers sur le thème «How disrupt the world of work», animés par Fiona Clancy (directrice mondiale du planning stratégique de TBWA), Marie Jalmieson (directrice des stratégies de TBWA Afrique du Sud), Wendie Stone (directrice des stratégies à Londres) et Anne Charbonneau (directrice du planning stratégique de TBWA Paris). 

Le groupe TBWA France a annoncé, vendredi 10 novembre, la nomination à la présidence de l'agence TBWA Paris de Guillaume Pannaud, quarante ans, actuellement président de Draft FCB. Prenant également la suite d'Arthur Sadoun, nommé président de Publicis Conseil, il aura également en charge TBWA Interactive et Tequila. TBWA France doit encore trouver un remplaçant à Valérie Hénaff, directrice des plannings stratégiques de TBWA Paris, TBWA Interactive et Tequila, qui va, elle aussi, rejoindre Publicis Conseil comme directrice générale de la stratégie et du développement.

Epsilon rejoint le groupe TBWA France

AGENCES. Epsilon, spécialiste de l'édition publicitaire de la grande distribution, va rejoindre le groupe TBWA France. Créée en 1982 par Didier Perrin et Eric Depoivre, cette agence rémoise emploie actuellement 35 collaborateurs. E-Graphics, E-Graphics TypoWeb et Epsilon vont fusionner pour créer E-Graphics France, spécialisée dans la production numérique globale, et implantée sur cinq sites en France. Description: As Black & White Communications we have provided specialist PR consultancy
to the technology, engineering and IT sectors since 1998, joining Freshwater UK in March 2006. In February 2007 we rebranded under the name Freshwater Technology. The company is still directed by Black & White’s founder, Rachel Owen.
Freshwater UK is the country’s fastest-growing national PR network, and has more than 50 staff based at seven offices, including dedicated operations for Wales, Scotland, the English regions, consumer PR and creative services. As the group’s technology PR specialists we deliver bespoke programmes to match our clients’ budgets and business aims, regionally, nationally or worldwide, supported by our network of offices throughout the UK.
While we offer the full range of marketing communications services you’d expect, we stand out because we take time to understand your business. We excel at packaging complex business and technical arguments for maximum impact and distilling key business benefits from technical data. We take pride in the accountability and transparency we offer in all aspects of our work.
Using a structured approach based on research, planning, implementation and evaluation, Freshwater Technology can help you educate, inform and influence your audiences in the UK and all over the world.

Insight was set up in January 2006 by former Edelman director John Lehal.Very strong in HEALTHCARE PA.


SEE ATTACHMENTS FOR COMPANY PROFILE


NEWS

01.05.07 PAN - new ‘strategic partnership’ with London based healthcare media relations specialists Reynolds-Mackenzie (Launched 2004 - 2ex-BM: Eva Reynolds, Alison MacKenzie).
12.07.07 PRW - Former Labour Party aide Hilary Evans is to join as account manager. She previously worked as government affairs manager at Morgan Allen Moore, joined 2005.  (January - similar hire of Olly Kendall, former deputy press secretary to ex-Lib Dem leader Charles Kennedy.)
08.08.07 PRW - Insight Public Affairs has landed a brief from a division of Rentokil, Enviro-Fresh, that is trying to bolster its environmental credentials
17.01.08 PRW - Insight Public Affairs is to raise political awareness of reading initiatives, as the Government kicks off a major drive to promote literacy throughout 2008.  The agency has been hired by the National Literacy Trust.
21.02..08 PRW - Insight Public Affairs is helping to push through a private members bill that would improve the data collected about children with special needs.  
01.03.08 PRW - Insight is now a 10-strong outfit after appointing Edelman senior account manager Chris West as account director.  In other changes at the agency, former British Retail Consortium public affairs manager James Tyrrell has been promoted to associate director, while Amanda Stuart and Andrew Hobson have moved to account director roles.
15.04.08 PRW - APCO has lost its account with Lloyds pharmacy after close to ten years, with the business picked up by Insight Public Affairs.  APCO and Lexington Communications also pitched for the account, which is understood to be worth six figures.
02.06.08 PRW - Insight Public Affairs and InHouse PR have been jointly drafted in to help launch the new political magazine Total Politics.  The monthly publication, published by leading political blogger Iain Dale, will be launched on 23 June.  Insight Public Affairs and InHouse PR, which recently worked on Boris Johnson's successful mayoral campaign, have been charged with raising the profile of the magazine pre-launch and delivering a London launch event, details of which are being kept under wraps.
26.06.08 PRW - US gambling giant Harrah's is embarking on a covert lobbying drive as it attempts to get the green light to run a number of casinos across the UK.  Insight MD John Lehal declined to comment, but the latest edition of the APPC register reveals that Harrah's is a new addition to Insight's client list.
05.09.08 PRW - Insight Public Affairs is to provide assistance to the Florida Democrats in the forthcoming US presidential elections. The agency is sending a 20-strong delegation to Miami, including Labour MPs and party strategists. Insight is headed by former Edelman director John Lehal.
10.10.08 PRW - further bolstered its Conservative credentials with the hire of Louise Abbott, a senior consultant at Morgan Allen Moore and former aide to the Conservative MP David Amess.

Description: 
Bryan Kennedy
Chief Executive Officer

As CEO, Bryan oversees the strategy and delivery of Epsilon's innovative online and offline marketing solutions for its global client roster. Serving Epsilon clients since 1996, Bryan has been a key architect behind Epsilon's rapid growth and expansion into the data and digital marketing services arena as well as the company’s current position as the largest agency company in end-to-end, direct-to-consumer connections. Under his supervision, Epsilon has received numerous accolades as a marketing innovator, including noted recognition from Forrester Research and Ad Age.

Prior to his current role, Bryan served as Chief Operating Officer and President of Epsilon's Marketing Technology division where he oversaw the development and execution of marketplace strategy and international operations. His responsibilities included management of the marketing services product portfolio ranging from strategy and analytics to loyalty, customer data integration, campaign management and digital marketing solutions. He also served as Epsilon's Chief Technology Officer, overseeing database design and management and as well as data-driven marketing programs.

Bryan earned his undergraduate degree from Wheaton College in Wheaton, Illinois, and his MBA from Harvard Business School.

Description: Part of The PR Agency
Starwood (Middle East)
Starwood is one of the world's largest hotel and leisure companies. It has an extensive range of properties in the Middle East, including Sheraton, Four Points and Westin hotels in Dubai, Qatar, Bahrain, Syria, Jordan, Lebanon, Kuwait and Saudi Arabia. There is a range of both business and leisure properties, offering facilities for meetings and incentives, conferences, business travellers, cultural excursions, family holidays, couples and special occasion travel.
Visit their website:  <http://www.ghotw.com>www.starwoodhotels.com <http://www.starwoodhotels.com>
El Gouna, Egypt
El Gouna, The Red Sea’s Premier Leisure Destination, is built of 10kms of beachfront and boasts award-winning architecture. Spread across a myriad of islands interlinked by beautiful lagoons, El Gouna offers a wide range of accommodation facilities, from comfortable guest houses to luxurious beachfront resorts. El Gouna is easily accessible, only 22 km away from Hurghada International Airport, a short flight away from Europe’s capitals. El Gouna offers a variety of activities including an 18-hole USPGA golf course, some of the world’s best diving, snorkelling, fishing, horse riding, go-carting, professional kite surfing, tennis and squash, to name a few. In addition, El Gouna is home to a variety of restaurants, bars, pubs, discotheques, shopping arcades, bazaars and an art village. El Gouna welcomes, families, couples and groups alike and is home to many secluded white sandy beaches, some deserted and others with bars and live music.
Visit their website: www.elgouna.com <http://www.elgouna.com>
Taba Heights, Egypt
Taba Heights is a new, unspoilt destination, located on the Red Sea in Egypt’s Sinai Peninsula, nestling on the shores of the Gulf of Aqaba. It is owned by Orascom Hotels & Development, and is a sister resort to El Gouna, well known as the Red Sea’s premier leisure destination.
Taba Heights is just 19 kms from the Taba-Eilat border and within an hour of Taba airport. It currently has a choice of four hotels including the Hyatt Regency Sinai, Taba Heights Marriott Beach Resort, Sofitel and the Three Corners El Wekala. The Intercontinental Taba Heights is due to open in 2006, and there are long terms plans for a total of 20 hotels.
For its size, this beautiful resort offers an amazing array of activities, from excellent diving and snorkelling on pristine coral reefs close to the shore, to camel riding and desert safaris in the Sinai. Most of the hotels feature health and spa facilities and kids clubs, and an 18-hole golf course is set to open later this year.
Visit their website:  <http://www.ghotw.com>www.tabaheights.com <http://www.tabaheights.com>
Great Hotels of the World
Launched in 1997 and headquartered in London, Great Hotels of the World is a global luxury hotel marketing alliance. Great Hotels of the World has identified five niche sectors of luxury travel – golf, romantic, spa, family and incentive & business – and now represents over 240 of the world’s greatest hotels and resorts across these lifestyle-specific programmes. Membership of each programme is by invitation only and is limited to exceptional hotels within the recognised niche market. Comprehensive glossy directories are published annually for each of the programmes.
Visit their website: www.ghotw.com <http://www.ghotw.com>

Description:  

FRONT ROW PR is a specialist communications agency operating within the fashion, beauty, luxury goods, media and lifestyle sectors.

The agency work strategically and creatively with their client base to maximise publicity opportunities and manage full-service, highly accountable and award-winning campaigns. Front Row PR are equipped to offer a full communications package, from strategy and consultancy to launches and events,
from the generation of publicity materials and copy-writing to  product placement and  full-service media liaison. 

Front Row PR possess an excellent network of  contacts across all media sectors and guarantee that senior staff work hands-on on your account, ensuring that your publicity campaign is highly visible, directional and different. The campaigns devised by the agency deliver maximum impact, achieve stand-out and position your brand prominently within your target marketplace….

Managing Director Maria Blake began her career as a marketeer for Conde Nast Publications and the Guardian Newspapers. She worked for agencies including Rapier and as an independent publicity consultant   for brands including French Connection and Britart before founding Front Row PR in 2000. She has built the agency into a respected one-stop communications shop offering highly effective publicity campaigns.

Description: G2, OgilvyAction and JWTAction combine to form world’s largest activation agency

NEW YORK and LONDON — WPP (NASDAQ:WPPGY) announces the launch of Geometry Global which even at inception will form the largest and geographically strongest activation agency in the world.

Geometry Global will be an autonomous network within WPP. With headquarters in London and New York, it comprises G2, Grey Group's activation agency, OgilvyAction, Ogilvy & Mather’s activation business and JWTAction, JWT’s shopper marketing and experiential agency. JWTAction is itself a joint venture between JWT and OgilvyAction in the United States and will retain its autonomy within Geometry Global.

Geometry Global addresses increasing client demand for activation, which with the emergence of digital and mobile media, now results in reaching people both inside the store and outside the retail environment more effectively. Fast growth sectors in the industry, such as digital, social media, mobile and search drive growth in activation, as does the increasing importance of shopper marketing. According to Grocery Manufacturers Association’s “Shopper Marketing 5.0” study, shopper marketing alone is a US$50-60 billion category. That is up from an estimated US$35 billion in 2009. It is one of the fastest growing sectors in marketing.

Geometry Global will service its clients with more resource, talent and a bigger geographical footprint than the component agencies could have achieved separately. Geometry Global will operate in 56 markets and employ almost 4,000 activation specialists. The companies bring complementary expertise in consumer activation, trade marketing, shopper marketing, one-to-one marketing and digital activation.

Toby Hoare will be Chairman of Geometry Global and will be based in London. He retains his responsibilities as CEO of JWT Europe and Chairman of JWT London. He will share his time between the two companies. Steve Harding, formerly CEO of OgilvyAction, will be Geometry Global’s first CEO. Harding will be based in New York. Matthew Schetlick, formerly the COO/ CFO of G2, becomes the COO/CFO of Geometry Global and will also be based in New York.

"With peoples’ attitudes and behaviors transformed by the digital and mobile revolution, traditional activation requires both a broader set of capabilities and a laser focused approach to be truly worth the increased investment from marketers," said Hoare.

Harding added: "The global context adds another dimension as marketers and retailers alike look to capitalize on consumer spending in fast growing markets. Geometry Global combines all these together under one roof in more places around the world than any other network of its kind.”

Geometry Global demonstrates WPP’s commitment to fast growing markets and sectors, such as activation and shopper marketing. Geometry Global will work closely with The Store, WPP’s global retail practice. Last year The Store brought together the specialist resources of over a dozen WPP companies to create The Shopper Marketing Store. That offer harnesses and provides easy access to world-class agencies and experts in the field via a single web portal. Geometry Global will also work closely with Kantar, WPP’s data investment management company, Barrows, a South Africa-based shopper marketing specialist operating in fast growing markets and Smollan Group. Smollan Group is a field marketing, brand activation, marketing intelligence and technology company operating on five continents.

Description: Based in Paris, Firefly France combines the dynamism of a small, ambitious start-up with the benefits and resources of one of the UK’s largest communications consultancies. This combination produces a potent mix of strategic input, experience, flexibility and fresh creative ideas.
Since its opening in late 1999, Firefly France has helped over 20 clients penetrate the unique French communications market, running high profile business and consumer campaigns. Firefly France clients have included TDK, Atos Origin, Softbank, MagicMaman, Neulevel, Brience, Red Hat and Nuance.
Firefly France’s team is experienced in working on pan-European and French specific communications programmes. With an expert view of the local market and media, Firefly can advise on the most appropriate way to promote products and services in France.
For more information please contact Philippe Caillet at philippe.caillet@fireflycomms.com <mailto:philippe.caillet@fireflycomms.com>.

Description: We’re a small but beautifully formed media and lifestyle PR agency based in leafy Chiswick. I’m the MD and I have the enviable task of searching for an AM to replace a team member who is off to work somewhere closer to home and on fmcg brands. 
Our clients include Match.com, iVillage UK, Sky, News Magazines, love it! Magazine, maxcleavage.com amongst others and we’re expecting a big dollop of exciting new biz to land in the agency this Autumn. 
This person needs to have all the potential gravitas of an Account Director and be able to manage a large corporation on one hand and a fast moving start-up web business on the other, so their client management skills need to be absolutely incredible. They need to have a good understanding of the media and some good contacts as they will have media relations responsibilities too but they will need to work alongside other members of the team on media relations. We want someone who is as quick at picking up the phone to the media themselves as telling someone else to do it.
We’re a teeny tiny agency – just six of us – so we don’t want big agency people who want glass offices with their title. We’re looking for an incredibly bright and enthusiastic individual with bags of energy who can motivate and inspire all of us.

Description: 
Paris, le 20 avril 2007
Publicis Groupe et Richard Attias lancent PublicisLive,
agence dédiée aux événements les plus prestigieux du monde
Publicis Groupe et Richard Attias annoncent aujourd’hui le lancement d’une joint venture dans le
secteur événementiel : PublicisLive. Richard Attias, actuellement Président de Publicis Events
Worldwide, détiendra une participation minoritaire dans la nouvelle agence, qui aura son siège à
Genève. PublicisLive se consacrera exclusivement aux conférences internationales et
institutionnelles aux manifestations prestigieuses du monde de l’entreprise, particulièrement sur
l’Europe et le Moyen-Orient.
PublicisLive va répondre à une demande, de plus en plus soutenue de la part des gouvernements,
des institutions et des entreprises, pour l’organisation d’événements sophistiqués d’un point de vue
technique, et riches en contenu. Richard Attias a développé Publicis Events Worldwide ces dix
dernières années pour en faire un des tous premiers réseaux à l’échelle mondiale ; il se
concentrera désormais sur ce type d’activités très spécifiques. Il conservera des relations avec
d’importants clients internationaux, dont le World Economic Forum qui, chaque année, réunit à
Davos, en Suisse, les principaux décideurs du monde. Il a par ailleurs récemment contribué au
lancement et à l’organisation de manifestations annuelles aussi prestigieuses que la Conférence
des Prix Nobel à Petra ou le Monaco Media Forum. Ces deux manifestations seront dorénavant
gérées par PublicisLive.
Après une période de transition où Richard Attias conservera son rôle au sein de Publicis Events
Worldwide, il se consacrera au développement de PublicisLive. PublicisLive sera distinct du
réseau de Publicis Events Worldwide et de ses bureaux en France, aux Etats-Unis, en Autriche,
en Allemagne et dans la région de l’Asie Pacifique. Les deux entités feront partie des Agences
Spécialisées et Marketing Services (SAMS) de Publicis Groupe, supervisées par John Farrell.
« Richard est à la fois un entrepreneur et un grand créateur au sein de la famille de Publicis
Groupe. Il a fait de Publicis Events Worldwide un acteur qui compte au plan international dans le
domaine de l’événementiel », déclare Maurice Lévy, Président du Directoire de Publicis Groupe.
« Je suis ravi qu’il puisse désormais se consacrer à ce segment de marché, plein de défis mais
aussi hautement gratifiant, en véritable partenaire de notre Groupe. J’ai pleine confiance dans le
succès auquel est promis PublicisLive, pour le Groupe comme pour Richard. »
« Je suis à la fois fier et honoré, qu’une fois encore, Publicis Groupe me donne les moyens
nécessaires pour lancer un nouveau projet international, qui répond à une demande accrue de la
part de nos clients », déclare Richard Attias. « PublicisLive n’a absolument aucun équivalent sur le
marché, grâce à la qualité de ses équipes, à sa taille et aux solides relations que nous avons
nouées au fil des années. »
Contacts
Publicis Groupe
Eve Magnant, Corporate Communication + 33 (0)1 44 43 70 25
Publicis Live
Frédéric Jacquemoud + 41 22 718 64 64
Doreen Bonnami + 1 212 474 6151

25/04/08
Richard Attias, président de Publicis Live, filiale suisse conseil en événements internationaux de prestige de Publicis Groupe, quitte ses fonctions afin de se lancer dans un nouveau projet entrepreneurial en dehors du groupe. Il restera consultant externe de l'agence, qu'il a fondé en avril 2007, pendant la période de transition. John Rossant, actuel vice présiden

Description: Welcome to ICODA European Affairs, a company of inquiring minds and passionate people giving a voice and shape to the interests of our clients.
Founded in Brussels in 1991, ICODA European Affairs has been been offering a broad range of companies, trade associations, interest groups and others, first-hand knowledge and expertise in EU decision-making, EU legislation and EU policy. Our office just behind the European Parliament places us at the very heart of European decision making.
We are rightly proud of the clients for whom we work, ranging from law firms to multinationals in a variety of sectors. We also work for European associations and public authorities such as the European Commission. All clients have a direct line of communication to one of our senior partners, at all times.
The ICODA European Affairs team supports clients with their European Affairs challenges by delivering a series of services such as developing communication and public affairs strategies. Our experts combine their extensive knowledge of the EU decision-making process with practical experience and a dose of common sense.
ICODA European Affairs is supported by a network of associated experts and partner companies. ICODA European Affairs started this network in 1993 and expanded it ever since. The associates of the ICODA European Affairs operate independently, but share experiences, knowledge and some of their resources.

Description: CBS Outdoor is a division of the CBS Corporation, and is one of the leading outdoor media companies in the world. CBS Corporation has preeminent positions in Television, Radio, Outdoor and Online advertising and is an industry leader in the creation, promotion and distribution of entertainment, news and sports with such well-known brands including CW, CBS Interactive, CBS Paramount Television, CBS Radio, CBS Television Distribution, CBS Television Stations, CSTV, Showtime and Simon & Schuster. 

CBS Outdoor sells and services more outdoor advertising than any other billboard company in the Americas. With more than 1,600 U.S. employees located in more than 50 offices nationwide, we are the premier out-of-home media provider to outdoor advertising agencies in the United States. In addition to our overall advertising agency client base, we also sell and service more out-of-home media to local direct clients than any other outdoor company. During the company's nearly seven decades its sole focus has been providing the very best out-of-home media opportunities to marketers across the country. 

We are much more than just a billboard company. CBS Outdoor currently operates nearly 550,000 outdoor media displays nationwide. In addition to over 100,000 traditional Billboards spread throughout every major U.S. city, CBS Outdoor offerings also include Street Furniture advertising, Transit advertising, Mall advertising and more, with coverage across vast geographies utilizing multiple media forms within key markets. 

In addition to advertising sales, CBS Outdoor also offers a full range of advertising services from our creative, business development and marketing departments. Working with numerous outdoor advertising agencies, buyers and especially direct clients, extended advertising services have given us a considerable edge over most traditional billboard companies.

They run an online research panel in the UK called work.shop.play. www.workshopplay.co.uk that is interesting in the behaviours, ideas and opinions of people living in urban areas on a variety of topics. 

The company behind work.shop.play. is called CBS Outdoor. We’re all about ‘engaging audiences', and reaching, understanding, marketing and selling consumer audiences when they’re ‘out of home’ is our absolute mission. 

Our commercial offering is built on an understanding of where people are going, why they’re going there, what they’re thinking and doing on the way and at their destination. It allows us to offer brands more intelligent and efficient ways of targeting audiences. 

In a nutshell, CBS Outdoor wanted to be even better informed and knowledgeable about their audience – and so work.shop.play. was born. 


Company Size
10,001+ employees

Description: MCC International is an award-winning PR and marketing communications agency, currently celebrating its 22nd anniversary. The agency promotes high and emerging technology and science companies, as well as professional service organisations, from entrepreneur start-ups and spin-offs to global consumer brands.

Acting as our client's press office, we take full responsibility for devising and delivering the essential strategic messages directly to our client's stakeholders, creating significant product and service awareness within our client's target audiences. 

With over 20 years experience, MCC International is at the forefront of setting the IT and science agenda, breaking stories to broadcasters, national, trade, digital and social media to provide compelling and incisive comment and position our clients as leading players in their target markets.

Description: Qui sommes-nous ?


Depuis sa création, ClinSearch marque sa différence en s'engageant contractuellement auprès de ses clients sur les résultats de ses travaux et son haut niveau de disponibilité. Cette politique d'engagement a su convaincre nos interlocuteurs et a tout 
naturellement conduit à créer de véritables partenariats avec nos clients.

Nous sommes un fournisseur de solutions stratégiques, humaines et techniques, centrées sur l'évaluation.

La dispersion de notre savoir-faire au risque de ne plus en avoir aucun, est contraire à l'essence même de notre entreprise. C'est pourquoi nous restons une société de taille humaine évoluant uniquement dans le cadre de son champ d'expertise, se permettant ainsi d'offrir des solutions non seulement adaptées mais complètes.

Parce que notre équipe est constituée de professionnels de la 
santé et de l'évaluation, nous sommes en mesure d'apporter, dans de nombreux pays d'Europe, nos services :

à l'industrie pharmaceutique et des nutricaments, 
aux sociétés de biotechnologies, 
aux réseaux de soins, de prévention et autres établissements sanitaires, 
aux professionnels de la santé impliqués dans la recherche et l'évaluation, 
aux sociétés d'assurance et aux mutuelles, 
au secteur de l'environnement et de l'agro-alimentaire. 
Nous consulterons et mobiliserons systématiquement nos réseaux de cliniciens, de biologistes et d'experts afin d'être toujours au plus près de vos attentes en termes de conseil, de délai et de qualité.

Notre charte ...
Le refus de l'opacité, le souci de la transparence, 
Le choix du partenariat, l'envie de vous faire partager nos idées de plans de développement, 
Une équipe qualifiée, des solutions coût-efficaces, 
Un réseau étendu de partenaires pour assurer la mobilisation rapide d'expertises multiples
Une organisation centrée sur la qualité des systèmes d'information et l'innovation, 
Un conseil scientifique assurant la qualité et la rigueur des services 

... Notre offre
Nous travaillons à l'émergence de projets innovants, 
Nous effectuons l'analyse critique de vos projets, 
Nous garantissons la sécurité des informations, le respect des délais, et notre indépendance, 
Nous donnons un accès sans restriction à nos procédures, 
Nous appliquons un Contrôle Qualité à toutes les étapes de votre projet. 


\
Une offre complète
en matière de rédaction médicale 

Recherches Biomédicales
Etudes cliniques, épidémiologiques et pharmaco-économiques, pharmacovigilance, Santé Publique …

Documents techniques d'un essai thérapeutique,
Comprenant des propositions d'intégration de solutions techniques innovantes.

Documents réglementaires (en collaboration avec le département des opérations cliniques),
De la constitution du dossier pour le comité de sécurité virale, à la demande d'autorisation pour l'utilisation d'un moyen de cryptologie.

Publications - Communications

Publications (revues internationales à comité de lecture)

Rédaction du manuscrit (français, anglais), tableaux et figures inclus - Expertise

 ASSISTANT / STAGIAIRE COMMERCIAL (H/F)  

Dans ce cadre du développement de l’agence et faisant suite à la création d’une nouvelle entité, nous recherchons un stagiaire qui sera amené à : Assimiler les mécaniques des cycles commerciaux existants ; Auditer la concurrence ; Définir un plan commercial en intégrant le compte d'exploitation des offres ; Formaliser la recommandation du nouveau cycle commercial ; Réaliser les briefs prestataires et suivre la mise en place. Description: Imagination is a world-leading communication agency, a global concern with full service offices on four continents. 

What we do is expressed in a single word: communication. No matter the channel or the audience, we conceive, develop and deliver communication that has relevance, immediacy and clarity, to connect client with consumer. 

Our philosophy is to develop supportive partnerships, working with clients to consolidate growth and explore new communication initiatives, in their sectors and beyond. 

As a result, we have decades of experience in brand communications, in investor relations and in the retail and leisure sectors, worldwide. 

We provide a seamless service that embraces strategic thinking, concept development and the generation of all the creative collateral to convey messaging and invest it with lasting impact. 

Our ability to do so owes much to the breadth of our expertise; our integrated project teams are drawn from an in-house community that is unique in the industry. 

Delivery anywhere in the world is an essential part of that service, effected through a network of ten offices in Europe, The Americas and Asia - individually representing a local point of contact, while, collectively, working as one...

We provide a range of services including Press Relations, events, localisation of English documents into French (advertising, web sites, leaflets, datasheets…). We strive to meet all of our clients’ needs, provided we can do it, and do it well!
Our background
Actual PR was founded in 1995 by experts who had previously handled all forms of communications at Intel since 1982, covering 5 European countries: Press Relations, Trade Shows, Seminars, Advertising, Literature, Direct Marketing, ‘Intel Inside’ program.
International 
Actual cooperates with international PR agencies that work for the same clients. Actual is also affiliated with structured networks that cover both Europe (www.dactylnet.com <http://www.dactylnet.com>) and the world (www.rainierpr.co.uk <http://www.rainierpr.co.uk>). Unlike agencies which are subsidiaries of larger organizations, where clients ‘choose’ the network, (and not necessarily the most suitable agency in each country), our approach makes it easier to recommend the local PR agents that seem to be better suited for every prospective client we are dealing with.
References 
Aethra, All Telecom, Alcatel Space, Alienware, Altera, Averatec, Cadence, Carrier1, ChamberSign, Continental Edison, Cyrix, D-Link, Digital, Documentum, InterVideo, iRhythms, Keyvelop, Luratech, Mailinblack, National Semiconductor, Novogo,

Description: Senior Account Manager 
Contract type: Permanent  
Reference number: AMS UK00043 
Location: Bracknell 
Functional area: Human Resources Recruitment Process Outsourcing Managed Services  
Closing date: 30-Apr-2005 
 
  
  
Department Overview 
Our client, a niche UK Telco, has exceptionally ambitious growth targets for the next two years. Operating in a fast moving, high growth sector of the telecom industry, they have engaged AMS to deliver all permanent and temporary recruitment across their business.

To achieve this we are building an on-site team to take ownership of the whole recruitment process from resource planning to on-boarding, to implement a Recruitment Management System and add value through delivering bespoke selection and assessment processes. This will be a growing and dynamic team over the course of the next year and is right at the heart of this clients on-going business plans.
 
  
Main Purpose of the Role 
Working on a client site, the Senior Account Manager will manage and control all aspects of recruitment within the company. 

You will liase and interface with the hiring managers to add value to the streamlined recruitment process. Reporting in to a Project Manager you will support them in the day to day running of the client account, taking ownership for part of the solution.  
  
Responsibilities 
Client Focus: 
• Liase with all levels of management within the client to develop and maintain business plans and organisational structures.
• Place staff in accordance with the agreed service levels with client.
• Reduce dependency of third party suppliers through direct delivery methods.

Business Communication: 
• Facilitate communication channels between line management, the HR community and AMS.
• Develop/ maintain all MI for both parties and add value through strong market awareness.

Team Management: 
• Responsible for development and motivation of the account team.
• Develop and implement database and workflow products 
• Devise effective recruitment strategies.

Business Development: 
• Identification of additional business revenue opportunities both inside and outside the client.
 
  
Skills - Technical 
• Graduate calibre
• CIPD (desirable) 
• Second European language (desirable)
• Minimum four years working in the recruitment industry or HR management with focus on recruitment
• Previous experience of managing an on-site recruitment function 
• Minimum of two years of managing teams is essential 
• Ability to develop and deliver business plans and recruitment strategies 
• Highly motivated, organised and methodical with strong problem solving and presentation skills. 
 
  
Skills Behavioural 
• High degree of commercial acumen, quickly able to identify and capitalise on business opportunities 
• Highly customer focused with a professional approach to service delivery
• Excellent team player, as well as having the ability to work autonomously.
