 Mission Statement: Lucid is a new agency with a different approach to medical education. We deliver KOL developed and endorsed education. Our services are based upon three core areas:

Identification of KOLs
We believe the first step is to spend time to identify the right KOLs to work with. Using our Lucid KOL research techniques and our IBELIEVE matrix, we identify potential partners for programmes.

Engagement
We’re committed to working alongside you and the KOLs to define the right medical education programmes, sharing the brand strategy and challenges, tasking the KOLs to find solutions. This process creates excellent insight, making it easy to develop win:win programmes.

2012 news
The deal will see Lucid’s two principals, Caroline Wagstaff and Ruth Starling, become directors and shareholders in the newly enlarged business.
Lucid’s clients include leading players in the Lloyd’s of London insurance market, multinational corporate and marine insurance businesses and top-tier professional services firms.
Luther Pendragon covers a number of communication areas including healthcare, and has clients including Bristol-Myers Squibb, the Royal Pharmaceutical Society and GE Healthcare.
Lucid also has a growing presence in the US, offering a platform for Luther Pendragon to expand its American client base - Lucid’s team in London will move to Luther Pendragon’s offices in Ludgate Hill.
Simon Whale, managing director at Luther Pendragon, said: “The last few years have shown that firms in the financial and professional services sectors have an increasing need to promote their services and defend their reputations. Lucid have that expertise in depth and will add great weight to our credentials in this area.
“We’re delighted that Lucid will be joining us. It represents another vital step in fulfilling our objective of offering clients across a wide range of sectors a complete corporate communications service, underpinned by the passionate attention to detail and highest quality client care that both Luther and Lucid are built upon.”
Ruth Starling said: “Luther’s broad corporate communications expertise, including services such as financial public relations, public affairs and their social media savvy put us in the sweet spot of being able to offer the full range of joined up communications - which is exciting for clients and exciting for us.”

Description: Les co-fondateurs et associés
Stéphanie Chevrel
Après un parcours de journaliste dans la presse médicale et santé grand-public - Impact Médecine, Editions Masson, Bien-être et Santé, Prévention Santé… - elle rejoint en 1980 la filiale RP du groupe BOSSARD alors dirigé par Jean-René Fourtou.
En 1988, elle crée sa propre agence de Relations presse institutionnelle et santé. En 2002, elle crée la marque Capital Image avec Gaël de Vaumas pour intégrer les techniques multimedia et l’approche corporate à son savoir-faire reconnu en Relations medias et Relations publics santé.

Stéphanie Chevrel est diplômée de l’IFP (Institut Français de Presse, Assas, Paris 6e) . Elle est membre du Syntec (Syndicat professionnel des acteurs du Conseil) et est membre fondateur du YEO France (Young Entrepreneurs' Organization).

Gaël de Vaumas
En 1985, il fonde le Press Club TV à Paris. Producteur délégué de la chaîne TV5, il réalise de nombreuses émissions TV notamment « l’Enjeu » avec Emmanuel de La Taille (210 émissions) et de nombreux directs pour France TV. Il présente « Horizons », le magazine des entreprises et des institutions (312 émissions) et conçoit des émissions thématiques : « La Nuit de la Science » (6x52’), « Paris en toutes Lettres » (4x52’)... En 1998, il crée l’agence d’information presse sur Internet : www.presstvnews.fr, la nouvelle information des médias qui recense plus de 50 000 journalistes. Il s’associe en 2002 avec Stéphanie Chevrel. Son domaine : le corporate, les entreprises et les institutions. Ses spécialités : les enquêtes reportages, la création et la diffusion d’informations, la création de salles de presse sur le web.

Gaël de Vaumas est ingénieur et journaliste, diplômé du CFPJ (Centre de Formation et de Perfectionnement des Journalistes) à Paris et de SDSU (San Diego State University), Journalism and Communication. Il est Vice Président élu de la FNIM (Fédération Française de l’Information Médicale) et Directeur de la rédaction du site www.presstvnews.com.

L'équipe

Capital Image est composé de professionnels des Relations publics. En 2011, la majorité des équipes est composée de seniors :
      - Responsable des stratégies (Celsa, Paris Dauphine)
      - Directeur des opérations et conseil scientifique (doctorat en biochimie et biologie moléculaire)
      - Responsable relations médias (iep, ifp) et attachées de presse
      - Chefs de projet relations publics (iep, iicp, Sorbonne Nouvelle, licence de droit Assas)
      - Rédacteur (Ecole supérieur de journalisme)
      - Chef de projet digital/infographie (edhec).
Capital Image s'appuie sur des consultants partenaires depuis 2002 dont un consultant en gestion de crise et stratégie médicale (doctorat en médecine).
Les seniors comme les juniors ont pour la majorité travaillé dans les médias, l'industrie pharmaceutique, l'industrie agroalimentaire, la communication ou les Relations publics avant de rejoindre Capital Image.

Description: 
About Us


Background 
Spectra Intelligence was founded in 2005 to provide syndicated market research information to the global life sciences industry and capital investment sector. The company derives its name from the Latin 'Spectare' and 'Specere' which means ‘to observe or look at’, but also means extensive range or series. The name reflects our hopes and commitments to provide companies and institutions with a repertoire of focused, cutting-edge, authoritative, and forward-thinking market research studies to stimulate commercial enterprise, innovation, and industrial growth. 

Spectra’s management and advisory team comprises leading industry analysts, academics, and established senior-level executives who together work to produce outstanding and highly regarded competitive intelligence publications that are essential for companies to advance corporate strategy and facilitate decision-making at the senior executive level. 

Global Services 

Spectra Intelligence aims to be a leading knowledge provider for the global pharmaceutical and biotechnology industry. Our services range from the publication of a series of syndicated high calibre market research reports to consultancy services to identify product market and equity investment opportunities. 

Companies and institutions are encouraged to contact us in confidence for specific data needs or research requests regarding therapeutic areas, products, technologies, and market research and analysis. Spectra’s experienced industry analysts also offer competence in undertaking third-party assessments for licensing and acquisition activities within the industry to match core activities and portfolios with suitable partners based on our extensive coverage of all therapeutic drug markets, devices, and biotechnology products.

Description: 




 
INNOTHERA est un groupe indépendant, en pleine mutation, implanté en France, avec de fortes perspectives de développement international.
En 1989, le groupe INNOTHERA prend son premier virage stratégique en se recentrant sur la santé des femmes.
En 1999, le groupe INNOTHERA décide de se spécialiser sur la maladie veineuse et de devenir le leader dans le traitement des maladies veineuses.
La maladie veineuse est un véritable problème de santé publique. Grâce aux données issues de l'étude SU.VI.MAX et publiées en 1999, on sait maintenant que 14,6% des hommes et 33,6% des femmes sont touchés par la maladie veineuse chronique, en France. La prévalence des varices augmente avec l'âge et à partir de 55 ans, près de 30% des sujets féminins en sont porteurs. Les phlébotoniques et la contention sont deux des voies de traitement actuelles de cette maladie. 

Dans ce domaine, INNOTHERA présente l'originalité de commercialiser à la fois un médicament (plus couramment appelé 'veinotonique') et des bas de contention et de maintien, présentés par la même équipe de vente auprès des médecins et des pharmaciens.
En 2001, le groupe confirme son engagement dans le domaine de la maladie veineuse, en particulier en accentuant sa recherche pour l'amélioration et la médicalisation de la contention élastique. Dans le même temps, le groupe a renoncé à développer un nouveau médicament veinotonique.
En parallèle, le groupe INNOTHERA s'investit dans le domaine des pathologies quotidiennes et de la qualité de vie des patients atteints de pathologies chroniques, critère trop rarement pris en compte.


Aujourd'hui, nos objectifs sont d'améliorer les traitements de la pathologie veineuse et d'en réduire les coûts. Pour y arriver nous avons investi de façon importante dans la recherche et l'innovation. Aujourd'hui, une vingtaine de chercheurs travaillent à l'amélioration des textiles médicaux.


A l'international, nous avons un programme ambitieux de développement tant en Allemagne (où la concurrence est forte en matière de contention) que dans d'autres pays. Nous nous attachons également à prendre en compte les particularités de chaque marché concernant les niveaux de compression exigés pour répondre aux critères locaux des autorités médicales.

INNOTHERA est devenu le seul laboratoire en France et dans le monde, à maîtriser simultanément une compétence dans le traitement médicamenteux de la pathologie veineuse et une compétence dans la contention veineuse. Et notre premier intérêt demeure de soigner les maux, les souffrances qu'endurent chaque jour des millions de personnes dans le monde entier à cause de jambes lourdes, d'insuffisance veineuse, d'oedèmes ou d'ulcères prononcés.

Description: Opportunity Now and Race for Opportunity are the gender and race campaigns from Business in the Community, a registered charitythat stands for responsible business. 
We know that creating diverse and inclusive workplaces is a business imperative, not just a nice to do. Organisations benefit when they create workplaces which tap into a diverse range of skills and talents.

We work with more than 200 of the UK’s most significant employers to help them leverage their diverse talent and create workplaces which really work for all.

We do this by providing practical and pragmatic advice, cutting edge tools and research. We share the latest best practice to help organisations benefit from gender and race diversity.

As well as all of this expertise, knowledge and support, we also campaign on the issues which will make the most beneficial difference to individuals, society and our economy.

Description: About Us
We believe that humanity faces an immense challenge. We can no longer treat the planet without any thought for the future.
So we’re working with over 120 leading businesses and organisations to bring about change.
We are a charity committed to sustainable development </what-is-sd>. 
This means developing an enriching and enjoyable way of life that does not threaten the global environment or rob future generations of resources.
We want to see businesses and communities thriving in a future that’s environmentally sustainable and socially just.
It can be done. In fact it’s the only way businesses and communities will prosper in the long run. But we need bold action, now. 
We play our part by: 
Showing organisations what a sustainable future could look like and challenging them to make a difference 
Delivering practical solutions to help organisations change 
Training leaders to bring about change, and educating the leaders of tomorrow 
Communicating success stories

Description: We are
Wolff Olins is the world’s most influential brand business. We have 180 people in London and New York. We started in 1965, and we’re now part of Omnicom. In a world of caution and conservatism, we’re ambitious for clients. In a time of anxiety and cynicism, we’re optimistic for the world.
You get
We help clients break away from their competitors and become something unique – not one of many but one of one. We help you change the rules, change people’s minds, and maybe even change the world. Because we’re inventive, we’ll help you be desirably different. Because we’re commercially rigorous, you’ll own market territory no one else can occupy. And because we’re collaborative with your people, they’ll wholeheartedly come with you.
We do 
Ambition. We start with your business ambition, and create a brand strategy to achieve it: how many brands you need, what they should stand for and how to get the maximum impact from them. We do business ambition definition, brand audit, brand architecture, brand idea, action blueprints, brand management and brand measurement.
Innovation. Consumers believe what you do, not what you say. So we help create new services, products and experiences that don’t just make money: they make your brand real. We do customer experience, service and product design, retail design, digital design, innovation labs, pipelines, pilots and prototypes and product portfolios.
Transformation. A big ambition demands big change in how your people think, feel and work. We use brand to stimulate this change, making it creative, interactive, tangible and lasting. We do programme management, people policies, organisational design, brand coaching, culture change programmes, employee communication, employee training and workplace design.
Expression. Branding is no longer about imposing a logo everywhere. We help you build a presence in the world – a brand platform from which you can engage different audiences in the best ways. We do naming, visual identity, verbal identity, brand rollout, film and animation, marketing communication and investor communication.

Description: BrandInstinct
Client Meeting

Set up
5 Years old
Senior people only 10 years + experience - no training systems for juniors
75% overseas clients - Russia and Middle East
UK is very competitive and they choose carefully what they pitch for
Much of work is through own leads
People travel a lot
20 in total - 3 engagement people, few designers rest “Consultants”
Work in small teams - every project is a mix and match dependent on requirements
Work on each client depends on r’ship - they may just be doing strategy, or identity, may do it all (in middle east often then will have their own people to do some bits)
Growth - never more than 50 - they want to retail position of excellent people&service 

Competitors - Interbrand, Futurebrand
Take on contract and perm dep on candidate

Not looking at mo - as just coming to end of 3 projects but will see good people
Engagement people will see - would need 4/5 years (but flexible as it’s not been around for ages!)

Culture
Very flat, everyone is a consultant, no training/hierarchy, but mutual agreement they want to be the best!

Ideal candidates
People must understand culture differences etc
Flexible in the way they operate and understand they way BI work
International experience
Self motivator
A rigid person wouldn’t fit

Not keen on interbrand/futurebrand people - they have been trained in a specific way

Bens
Pay well

Interview process: Meet Ian and Aaron - will be relaxed chemistry chat - may come back 2 - 3 times & meet different people

Description: Fondée en 2008 par Robert Zarader, Equancy&Co est la plateforme de conseil en communication corporate du groupe Equancy. Entièrement dédiée aux enjeux d’image et d’opinion de ses clients, elle développe des solutions « sur-mesure ».
Notre ambition est de proposer aux entreprises et aux institutions un regard et une capacité d’analyse reposant sur une valeur forte : l’indiscipline.
In-discipline - dans chaque discipline, nous sommes en mesure, grâce à nos équipes et à notre capacité à mobiliser un réseau d’experts reconnus, de vous apporter les meilleures expertises.
In+discipline - parce que dans tous les domaines, le tout est toujours supérieur à la somme des parties, nous faisons en sorte de ne jamais rester prisonniers d’une discipline, mais d’avoir toujours en tête une solution globale.
Indiscipline - « une impertinence justifiée » : pour nous, c’est une qualité qui traduit une liberté d’analyse et de ton, ainsi qu’une ouverture à toutes les idées, quelle que soit leur origine, dès lors qu’elles concourent à la bonne décision.

Description:  
Advanced Drug Development Services

Après avoir occupé pendant plus de 15 ans des postes de Direction Médicale ainsi que de Développement Clinique dans l'industrie pharmaceutique, le Docteur Michel LEVY fonde ADDS en 1995 afin de proposer du Conseil dans ses domaines d'expertise. 

Devant le développement croissant des missions qui lui sont confiées et à la demande des clients, ADDS décide en 1997 de compléter son offre par la création d'une CRO intégrée, permettant la réalisation des projets qu'elle conçoit, et se dote d’une structure scientifique et logistique de qualité. 

En 2002, ADDS est certifié ISO 9001 version 2000 pour l'ensemble de ses services liés au développement du médicament. 

En 2004, le centre de formation, nouvellement créé, est intégré dans le périmètre de cette certification.

Description: Création en avril 2001 
Né du postulat que tout médecin est potentiellement un investigateur/enquêteur en devenir, ClinicalLand a développé un réseau avec un nombre important de professionnels de santé. 
La synergie avec ces partenaires permet d'optimiser les programmes d'investigation. 
Acquisition de ClinicalLand, par le Groupe Dermscan en 2006 
Le Groupe Dermscan a été séduit par le concept innovant de ClinicalLand. 
Grâce à sa récente prise de participation majoritaire, en Novembre 2006, il souhaite valoriser et développer le potentiel de ClinicalLand.
Fort de ses 17 ans d'expérience des études cliniques, avec un chiffre d'affaires de 7M€ en 2005, le Groupe Dermscan connaît une croissance régulière et apporte ainsi toute son expertise et sa stabilité financière.
Avec PharmaScan, CRO et Centre d'Investigation Clinique (69, Lyon), il réalise des études cliniques (Phases I, II, III et IV) de médicaments et des dispositifs médicaux dans les domaines de la dermatologie, l'ophtalmologie, la gynécologie et l'odontostomatologie. 
De nouvelles perspectives pour ClinicalLand 
Cette nouvelle organisation permet à ClinicalLand de se consacrer pleinement à l'optimisation et à la réussite des études.
Elle permet également de proposer à sa base d'investigateurs, un choix plus varié et plus important de programmes d'investigation santé, tout en répondant plus efficacement à leurs attentes. 


Partenaire des investigations cliniques  
 
 Parfaite connaissance du métier pour des solutions adaptées 
Expertise reconnue des relations avec les investigateurs
ClinicalLand, société française de recherche sous contrat (CRO), propose une offre complète et innovante.

Domaines d’activités : Médicaments éthiques, OTC et dispositifs médicaux. 
De la conception des protocoles à la rédaction du rapport final : réalisation de  l’ensemble des projets d’investigation clinique de phases I à IV, aux enquêtes observationnelles et épidémiologiques. 
ClinicalLand participe à l’attractivité de la recherche clinique en France
En optimisant les programmes d’investigation en collaboration et en adéquation avec la pratique des professionnels de santé.


Réponse aux problématiques médicales et marketing. 
Développement d'un réseau de Centres d'Investigations Cliniques Privés (CICP®).

 
Plus de 6 000 investigateurs actifs au service des études

Description: Located in Brussels, Pleon can be found in the middle of a cosmopolitan city, with a liveliness and an appeal that are intimately related to its role as a crossroads for all of Europe. Description: TTA is a full service agency offering PR, marketing communications and market development services to both large and small B2B companies. TTA specialise in IT PR. In addition to its PR services TTA has been very successful at offering tailored made marketing services and international business and sales development programmes including business coaching and training.

Press Relations
TTA Communications is a specialist technology press relations agency
working with leading edge technologies and related products and
support services.
We have a proven track record of translating high technology products
into well-differentiated business solutions. 
Editors respect our insight and understanding of various business
audiences and this results in considerable client coverage that is of
informative and/or consultative in nature. 
All of TTA's account managers have previously worked for IT vendors
and have an in-depth understanding of the technologies involved,
including:
Data and Voice networking products 
Software applications 
Contact Centre solutions 
Biometrics 
Video applications: CCTV, Video conferencing, 
Voice over IP (VoIP) 
LAN, WANs, Internet 
Wi-Fi, 
EPoS. 
TTA understand how to communicate the business and technical benefits
of these technologies to the end-user, channel and national press.
The principle objectives of a TTA PR campaign are as follows:
Increase brand awareness throughout the client’s target markets,
positioning them as a brand custodian.
To generate thought leadership articles/comments on behalf of the
client and position them favourably within the media focusing on their 
key USPs and brand attributes. 
To ensure that all relevant features (see list above) are tracked
and to secure telephone and/or face-to-face interviews for the client
to comment
To sustain existing and develop new journalist relationships with
key trade press (Contact Centre/Marketing/Technology/Vertical/Business),
broadsheet and where appropriate regional titles.

Description: Beam is a London-based, independent PR agency which began in January 2004.
The team’s collective experience covers technology and lifestyle sectors and we’re proud to have worked with some great brands from day one.
We believe in the power of Public Relations, just not the fluff that often surrounds it. At Beam, you’ll find a team of straight-talking, smart, creative and hard-working individuals – all with a great eye for a story and the business sense to know how their work affects the bottom line.
Beam Thinking
Call it brand evaluation, call it strategic council, call it an executive thought shower (apparently some do) — the bottom line is that an inspired PR campaign begins with some clear thinking and a true understanding of the client’s needs. From there on in, it’s our job to plan a smart and creative campaign that delivers fantastic results.
Creating PR Tools
Press releases and media alerts are par for the course at Beam but we’re happy to work with all manner of wordsmith-like tasks — from speeches and brochures to website copy. Check out the Beamblog <http://www.beamagency.com/beamblog/> for a taster.
We also work with fantastic photographers and graphic designers to create memorable pictures and promotional materials.
Media Liaison
With more than 25 years’ collective experience in the industry, Beam has a somewhat bulging contact book. We know that good PR is not just about contacting anyone and everyone — it’s about being focused and selective, and targeting the press that will really make a difference to your business. Most importantly, it’s about understanding the needs of the media and how they work. 
We know what makes a good story and whom to pitch it to.
Event Management
Beam events can be various things: chic and sophisticated, low-key and informal or a complete riot. But they are always well-planned, fiercely co-ordinated and successful.
Media Monitoring
Every morning, our first job is to monitor national and regional newspapers, websites and blogs for coverage and content that might be relevant to our clients. If there’s a story that might be appropriate, we’'ll make sure you know about it straight away. If there's an issue of the day that’s right up your street, we’ll help you share your news with the media.

Description: Thales, as the UK's second largest defence company, enjoys a rich legacy of innovative excellence which has been incorporated through the absorbed heritage of many of the UK's leading defence companies. 

Thales in the UK now draws together in one company such famous businesses as Racal, Thomson CSF, Shorts Missile Systems, Thorn EMI and Pilkington Optronics. Thales employs 12,000 people at 70 locations around the UK. Together we reliably provide the systems at the heart of the UK's military capability as well as delivering solutions from flight simulation and secure transactions to integrated communications.

The group now provides a unique blend of capabilities that provide world-leading defence electronics solutions across a broad front, with air, sea and land applications, as well as in the all-important area of network enabled capability. Long-term customer partnering is now a major component in the growing success story of Thales in the world's most competitive defence market.
Thales responds to the changing needs of defence electronics markets, positioning itself as a prime contractor and systems-and-services provider to design and develop systems and services for land, air and naval forces.
Thales has the necessary programme management, systems engineering and integration skills to win major contracts as a Prime Contractor and to be a partner of choice.
Representing around 55% of Thales' UK business, Thales Defence plays a major role in the defence and aerospace landscape worldwide. As a well established Prime Contractor and the UK's second largest supplier of defence electronics systems, the Company will deliver excellent value for money to its customers around the world and particularly in the UK home market.
Thales Defence has seven business areas in the UK, all closely linked to the corresponding Thales world-wide business groups: 
Air Defence: missile system design, manufacture, integration and checkout. air command & control and aircraft mission support systems. 
Airborne Systems: operating in the fields of Major Systems, Electronic Warfare and Radar systems, Missile Electronics and Customer Support and Services. 
Avionics: helicopter avionics systems integration. communications and surveillance systems. 
Communications: integrated naval and Airborne communication systems, EW systems, satcom ground terminals, IFF, remote ground sensors, tactical communications. 
Naval Systems: naval sonar systems, helicopter sonar systems, in harbour and ship defence. 
Training and Simulation: simulation systems, training services, synthetic environments.

Description: Angel is a biopharmaceutical company offering process development services and pre-GMP and cGMP manufacturing to support biotechnology and pharmaceutical companies worldwide.

Angel is able to provide development and manufacturing support for production of biologics working from laboratory scale to development of a robust manufacturing process.  These services range from strain development, through near GMP manufacture of the small quantities needed for pre-clinical studies to the high quality GMP drug produce needed for clinical trials and beyond.  This is supported by an understanding of the international regulatory requirements for drug development which can be used to guide a client in the formulation of its manufacturing strategy.

Description: OgilvyAction is the brand activation arm of the Ogilvy Group; a through-the-line marketing services agency with 49 offices in 40 countries. We help clients win in The Last Mile™, the distance a consumer travels between attitude and action.
At OgilvyAction we create tailored brand experiences wherever and whenever a consumer can be most impacted by a message. We understand the consumer journey and the different touch points along the path to purchase.

We start by analyzing the brand, the shopper and the retailer. Using our extensive understanding of consumer behavior and our activation expertise, we then bring brands to life for both the consumer and trade customer.

We craft a truly media-neutral strategy so that our clients benefit from the best possible activation of their brand and their money is put to use in the best possible place.

From this we develop our "big idea." It’s all about provoking action. The big idea must engage consumers and trade customers, involving them with brands in new and unexpected ways.

Our clients see the return on their investment because we assess the impact of our work on sales performance, brand value and consumer behavior. They also see the benefit in the relationship with their retail customers.
Clients include: Coca Cola, Heineken, Motorola, Sunsilk

Description: Broadcast PR & content specialists


In 1990 Rob Jones, our Chairman and major shareholder started USP as a broadcast consultancy, drawing on his programme production experience in radio and television, to advise broadcasters.
Quite quickly brands and agencies started to tap into this resource too with USP helping them to get their messages on the air with promotions and sponsorships. Alongside this we continued to win commissions from the BBC and commercial radio. Kirsty Young's Talk Breakfast, the Jazz FM Breakfast Show and Smokey Robinson's Soul Selection were among our biggest shows in the early days.
Today, we have distilled our client side and broadcaster side experience into an offering which places us at the leading edge of the exciting new digital age. We have traditional quality production values through our experience producing to the highest of British broadcasting standards, but we also have a non-traditional attitude and experience of producing branded content for clients. We are extremely proud of our studios complex in the heart of London's West End. A visit to USP Content is rarely a disappointment for celebrity spotters! Michael Douglas, Mariah Carey, Gwen Stefani, The Corrs, Russell Brand, Ian Wright, Sugababes and many more are all regulars. OK - Michael Douglas is not exactly a regular but the others are!

Description:  
 
Metroline is a wholly owned subsidiary of singapore based ComfortDelgro Corporation, which is the world's second largest listed land transport company. The purchase of Metroline was formally approved by shareholders on 21 March 2000.

Metroline’s principal business is the provision of bus services under contract to London Buses, operating through an area that extends from North to West London and includes Central London and the City. This service has been extended recently with Metroline's purchase of F E Thorpe & Sons Ltd in August 2004.

Description: The Central Office of Information (COI) closed on 31 March 2012. 

COI was the Government’s marketing and communications department. 

COI worked in partnership with other government departments and the public sector to deliver communications projects and information campaigns that provide maximum effectiveness and excellent value for money. 

It provided consultancy, procurement and project management cross the full communications and marketing mix, from advertising and research through to digital engagement and PR. 

COI also worked with the Government Communications Network (GCN) and Cabinet Office to achieve greater efficiency across government communication and set standards and guidance across a range of channels. 

COI ranked third in the 2010 Sunday Times 75 Best Places to Work in the Public Sector. It employed over 700 specialists in offices across the UK.

Company Size
201-500 employees

Founded
1946

Co Investments 

Special Opportunity Co-Investments which give our clients direct access to underlying companies

Description: PR is an increasingly vital marketing tool, especially as traditional forms of advertising struggle to catch consumers’ attention. PR has a huge role to play in a successful integrated marketing campaign that will ultimately positively influence the target audience. 
Clementine Communications is working to dispel the myth that PR is all about extravagant parties and Champagne lunches. Building creative proposals that meet our clients’ core business objectives, creating strategic alliances with like-minded brands, professional relationship building exercises between the media and client all contribute to generating valuable editorial .
Our dynamic team of ambitious and creative consultants are highly skilled at maximising the potential of brands across many different industry sectors. Analysing the behaviours, needs and wants of the end consumer allows us to identify how and where to target these consumers via the media that most interests them. Therefore we wouldn’t necessarily product place the latest sports car in the motoring section – when was the last time you read the motoring section? We might include it in a fashion shoot in Tatler, have Gordon Ramsay driving to a truffle hunting expedition for Observer Food Monthly or see Ben Fogle exploring the Hebrides for BBC’s Holiday Ten Best.
Clementine Communications is not just another service provider, but our experience has found we become an integral part of our clients’ team and are able to provide strategic advice to senior management. We have a proven track record of building long-term relationships with our clients due to loyalty, commitment and consistently exceeding their expectations.
If you would like to discuss ways in which our team can benefit your brand please contact us. </cc/node/24>

Description: Présentation 
Créée en 1994 par Frédéric Montin et Evelyne Martin, Yucatan est une agence conseil en Relations presse et Relations publiques, dotée de 2 pôles : BtoB et BtoC.

L’agence est reconnue par ses clients et par les journalistes pour sa parfaite expertise des stratégies et opérations media et sa capacité à positionner rapidement ses clients comme des acteurs majeurs de leurs marchés. 

De la réflexion stratégique à l’accompagnement quotidien
Nos clients doivent être performants sur des marchés en perpétuelle évolution où les acheteurs sont de plus exigeants et les concurrents particulièrement agressifs. 
Ils doivent agir vite et bien pour être efficace commercialement et atteindre leurs objectifs. Pour cela leur communication est un élément déterminant qui exige de la part de leur agence la compréhension de leur mission, de leur univers concurrentiel et des messages à délivrer aux media. 

Notre rôle : vous positionner auprès des media comme la référence dans votre secteur pour accélérer votre succès 

Notre objectif : être partenaire de votre réussite.
□ Une équipe – Des personnalités
L’équipe dirigeante est toujours très impliquée dans les actions menées par un team de 12 consultants rompus à la communication stratégique et opérationnelle.
Ils vous accompagnent au quotidien de manière pro-active, comme force de proposition, assurant toutes les étapes nécessaires à votre succès : analyse, mise en place des outils, suivi, mesure de la qualité des résultats,...


L’international : Worldcom PR Group et Dubaï
WORLDCOM PR GROUP 
Yucatan est membre actif du plus important réseau international d’agences de Relations Publiques indépendantes, le WORLDCOM PUBLIC RELATIONS GROUP.

The Worldcom Public Relations Group regroupe 101 partenaires dans 134 villes réparties sur tous les continents.
Créée en 1988, l’organisation est au service de clients nationaux et internationaux qui souhaitent bénéficier d’un accompagnement en matière de stratégie et d’actions de marketing et de communication. Les partenaires du Worldcom PR Group apportent l’expertise de professionnels qui maîtrisent parfaitement les marchés, la langue, la culture et les coutumes locales.

La gamme de services proposés par les agences du Worldcom PR Group font l’objet d’une certification, « The Worldcom Certificate Quality Standards », gage de professionnalisme qui repose sur des standards de qualité. Les agences partenaires doivent strictement répondre à ces critères et les respecter.

Worldcom EMEA regroupe 27 agences européennes ayant une forte expertise dans les secteurs de la grande consommation, l’alimentation, la santé, les technologies, la finance et les pouvoirs publics. Les agences du Worldcom EMEA assurent les relations publiques de sociétés telles que Cotton Council International, Rockwell Automation, Palm, Allied Telesyn, la campagne Anti-Tabac de la commission européenne,… 
DUBAÏ

Associée à l’agence Majlis PR, Yucatan met en oeuvre tout type de stratégies de communication sur l’ensemble des pays du Moyen-Orient : Emirats Arabes Unis, Oman, Koweit, Arabie Saoudite, Qatar, Barhein et Liban.
Ses domaines d’expertise s’étendent des relations presse et publiques à l’organisation évènementielle et à la rédaction de contenus pour tous vos documents, print et web. L’agence possède également une importante base de données VIP d’acteurs locaux et expatriés.
L’expertise de nos équipes nous permet d’optimiser une communication (qu’elle soit corporate ou produit) couvrant l’

Description: Leader de la digitalisation des documents et demandes RH en Europe, Novapost double son chiffre d'affaires chaque année depuis 2010. L’éditeur vient de lever plusieurs millions de dollars pour accélérer son développement aux Etats-Unis et en Europe, et est nommé « Cool Vendor 2014 » par Gartner pour son approche pionnière de la gestion du capital humain. Présent à Paris et New York, Novapost prévoit de recruter une centaine de collaborateurs d’ici fin 2015, dans 4 pays différents. La satisfaction de ses clients est le reflet de sa politique d’innovation constante, de la qualité de ses solutions et de l’engagement de ses équipes.
Novapost édite PeopleDoc, une plateforme SaaS globale à destination des Responsables RH. PeopleDoc facilite l'accès, le partage et la distribution sécurisée de l'information RH. Elle aide plus de 150 grandes entreprises françaises et internationales à digitaliser leur fonction RH, de la gestion en ligne des processus de recrutement (signatures de contrats, collecte des justificatifs...) à celle des dossiers et des échanges avec leurs salariés (bulletins de salaire, entretiens annuels...). Elle assure leur conformité règlementaire, en simplifiant les processus et en réduisant les coûts.

PeopleDoc est le    n°1   de la digitalisation des documents et demandes RH en Europe.
 Sa plateforme de digitalisation RH facilite et dynamise la gestion des processus
 administratifs RH.

Description: Nous voulons fournir aux consommateurs du monde entier des produits de haute qualité et d'un excellent rapport qualité/prix, qui améliorent leur vie quotidienne

En contrepartie, nous espérons obtenir la première place pour nos produits auprès des consommateurs : ceci entraînera le développement de nos ventes et la croissance de nos profits, favorisant ainsi la prospérité de notre personnel, de nos actionnaires et des communautés économiques et sociales au sein desquelles nous vivons et travaillons.




NOS VALEURS FONDAMENTALES

P&G, c'est d'abord et avant tout son Personnel et les valeurs fondamentales qui l'animent.

Le personnel de Procter & Gamble

Nous voulons attirer et recruter les personnes les plus qualifiées partout dans le monde. Nous construisons notre organisation sur la promotion interne, les individus étant traités en fonction de leur seule performance. Nos actions sont fondées sur la conviction que le personnel de P&G est et sera toujours son capital le plus important.

Leadership

Chacun d'entre nous est pleinement responsable dans son domaine et se sent profondément investi de la mission d'obtenir des résultats de premier ordre. Nous avons une vision claire du but à atteindre. Nous nous concentrons sur la réalisation d'objectifs ambitieux et de stratégies gagnantes. Nous améliorons sans relâche notre capacité à mettre en oeuvre nos stratégies et à éliminer les blocages organisationnels.

Engagement personnel

Chacun d'entre nous assume la responsabilité personnelle d'agir en fonction des besoins des affaires, d'améliorer les façons de travailler et d'aider les autres à développer leur efficacité. Chacun agit comme s'il était propriétaire de la Société, gérant le patrimoine de l'entreprise comme si c'était le sien et avec pour finalité son succès à long terme.

Intégrité

Nous nous efforçons toujours de faire ce qui est bien. Nous sommes honnêtes et directs avec les autres. Nous agissons conformément à la lettre et à l'esprit de la loi. Les valeurs et les principes de P&G animent toutes nos actions et nos décisions. Nos propositions sont justifiées par des données de faits et défendues avec honnêteté intellectuelle, en évaluant les risques de manière réaliste.

Passion de la réussite

Nous sommes résolus à être les meilleurs dans les domaines qui comptent le plus. Nous ne nous satisfaisons pas du statu quo. Nous avons un ardent désir d'amélioration et de réussite sur nos marchés.

Confiance

Chacun d'entre nous respecte ses collègues, les clients, les consommateurs : il les traite comme il souhaiterait lui-même être traité. Nous avons confiance dans les compétences et les bonnes intentions d'autrui. Nous sommes convaincus que l'on travaille toujours mieux dans un contexte d'estime réciproque.


NOS PRINCIPES

Les principes et les comportements qui découlent naturellement de notre raison d'être et de nos valeurs fondamentales 

Nous respectons chaque employé en tant qu'individu

Nous croyons que toute personne a la capacité et la volonté de donner le meilleur d'elle-même.
Nous valorisons les différences.
Nous encourageons et permettons à chacun de réaliser des objectifs ambitieux avec des standards élevés de qualité.
Nous sommes honnêtes dans l'évaluation de la performance individuelle.


Les intérêts de la société et les intérêts de l'individu sont indissociables

Nous croyons qu'agir dans l'intérêt de l'entreprise de manière intègre est la clef de la réussite commune de la Société et des individus. Cette recherche de

Description: University College London is one of the premier Universities in the UK for research and innovation, and is dedicated to harnessing its exceptional research for positive social and economic benefit. To this end it has created UCL Business PLC. 

A wholly-owned subsidiary of University College London, UCL Business has been formed to help industry and business make the most of UCL innovations. Through licensing technologies & innovations, engaging consultancy services, creating shared-risk joint-venture businesses, and utilising UCL’s specialist Service Companies and Subsidiaries, UCL Business promotes and supports the transfer into industry of expertise and knowledge over a wide range of disciplines. To do this, UCL Business:
Identifies promising new technologies and innovations. 
Promotes UCL expertise and innovations worldwide. 
Offers a single point of contact for business relations with UCL. 
Provides responsive, professional and coherent support for academic/business collaborations, from consultancy through to patent registration, technology licensing and structuring spin-out companies.

Well I am currently working with a independent fully integrated communications agency based in the heart of London who are currently recruiting for a junior consultant for their Corporate/Consumer team.  It is for an agency called Mantra PR, www.mantra-pr.com 

 

The agency works on a mix of Corporate, Consumer, Financial and B2B public relations, and work for over 40 of the UK's most exciting businesses across a range of sectors from retail to media.  They have a flat structure and are not title fussed, they have a really good company culture and have a laid back and funky environment.  They are a medium sized agency with 20 people in the London office and are growing rapidly and winning business all the time

 

The ideal candidate will have up to 2 year’s corporate/consumer pr experience, the work is a mix of Management consultancy/financial services/ and consumer markets specialising in the media field, their clients are quoted media and technology companies, household names, global media businesses and hot start-ups, current clients include (Discovery Channel, Virgin, AOL). They are looking at a package up to £28k however that is depending on experience and current rates.


26 July 2007 
Latest deal secures PR industry Top 15 ranking.
Loewy, the fast-growing marketing group, has bolstered its public relations offer with a deal which sees leading corporate consumer agency Mantra Public Relations joining the Loewy family. It secures Loewy a Top Fifteen agency position in the PR sector based on turnover – with nearly a third of Loewy’s 350 staff now engaged in PR activity.
The deal is a strategically important one as Loewy builds a group ready to take on the wider marketing challenges of the Web 2.0 world by offering clients best in class specialists to provide key point solutions, but also a collaborative melting pot to provide integrated campaign support. 
With Mantra, Loewy’s PR capabilities now cover consumer, corporate, technology, and public sector expertise. Loewy acquired specialist technology PR consultancy Rainier in October 2006 and consumer PR agency BMA Communications in September 2005.
Mantra has an impressive reputation. It was co-founded in 2000 by Debbie Wosskow and Lawrence Dore, formerly of both Brunswick and Citigate Dewe Rogerson. It positions its work as a blend of ‘creative corporate and intelligent consumer communications’ with a client list to match. It includes The Financial Times, The Economist, Emap plc and ITV – recognition of the quality of the client base has been a key factor in Loewy’s decision to join forces. 
Wosskow’s achievements have been recognized beyond the PR sector. She was profiled as one of Management Today's top 35 Business Women in 2004. Dore is a member of the CIPR Executive Board.
Loewy CEO, Charlie Hoult, says: “Mantra PR has all the hallmarks of a Loewy company – innovative, creative, knowledgeable and with a proven reputation for outstanding work - and will fit well into our family of crea

Description: Canalys offers the reactivity and dynamism of a much smaller company, with the global coverage and local insight gained from offices in America, Europe and Asia. Experts in their fields, our analysts combine market knowledge and approachability to create tailored customer deliverables. Our dedicated mobility services span smart phones, pads, notebooks, tablets, security and app stores. We also offer the most thorough smart phone data – tracking shipments into the channel, not sales or activations. 

Within the IT infrastructure sector, our services encompass data centers, networking, security, unified communications, client PC markets and go-to-market strategies. Regardless of the customer segment, we maintain an unrivalled focus on technology distribution channels. 

Each of our services benefits from the same strict methodology, with clear, global definitions and detailed, country-level data published on the same day – no preliminary data or forecasts. We are transparent about our facts and always happy to give more details about our findings. All Canalys customers – wherever they sit in an organization – have access to our research in their respective service areas. 

Our channel partner community, Candefero, further enhances our core service areas by enabling us to provide real-time insights on market movement from the ‘people on the ground.’ This unique dialog with several thousand partners forms the basis of our annual Canalys Channels Forum.

Specialties
App Interrogator, IT Security Analysis, App Store Analysis, Channels Forum, Bring Your Own Technology, Data Center Analysis, Tablet PC Analysis, Network Infrastructure Analysis, Smart Phone Analysis, Unified Communications Analysis, Channels Analysis, Consulting

BDDP Unlimited est l'alliance de publicitaires et de producteurs de contenu on et off-line. Son rôle est de produire des idées, d'inventer leurs modes de diffusion et de déployer toute leur richesse de contenu. Avec ses 220 personnes, elle offre aujourd'hui aux marques et aux entreprises la plus grande capacité de production de contenu du marché, quelle qu'en soit la forme : publicité tv, internet, affichage, presse, radio mais aussi conception de magazines de marques, web TV, édition, communication mobile... 
Des idées qui inspirent toutes les disciplines de communication
Certaines idées ne sont que des idées de film, d'autres ne sont que des idées d'affiche, d'autres encore ne sont que des idées de magazine ou ne vivent que sur Internet. Nous recherchons avant tout des idées dont le potentiel ne se limite pas à un seul média, des idées de communication suffisamment fortes et transversales pour inspirer toutes les disciplines de communication.
Tout contenu est création
La création ne s'arrête pas aux frontières de la publicité. Nous avons pour ambition de produire des idées susceptibles de s'incarner dans toutes les formes de contenu. Un spot TV, une affiche, une annonce presse ou un message radio, c'est de la création. Mais un livre, un magazine, un site Internet, une web TV, un jeu vidéo ou même un simple e-mail, c'est aussi de la création. Pour peu qu'il soit créatif, tout contenu est création. 
Nos expertises spécifiques
Au-delà de la publicité (BDDP & Fils) et de la production de contenu on et off-line (Textuel et Textuel La Mine), BDDP Unlimited répond également aux problématiques de marketing services et dispose d'une régie intégrée (Médias et Supports) permettant aux marques de cofinancer avec d'autres annonceurs les nouveaux supports que nous développons.
Nous sommes tous installés à Barbès
Les 220 personnes qui composent BDDP Unlimited sont toutes rassemblées dans un même lieu à Paris à proximité de Barbès : 146 rue du Faubourg Poissonnière dans le 10ème arrondissement
Une organisation d'agence réinventée
Créer un message unique destiné à être répété à un public large est dans les cordes de toute agence organisée de façon traditionnelle. Mais qui est aujourd'hui capable de multiplier les contenus nécessaires pour s'adresser à une multitude de micro-communautés ? On peut facilement produire le contenu créatif d'une vague de campagne, mais les internautes sont en « mode continu » et ne s'arrêtent pas de communiquer entre les vagues. Comment produire le contenu suffisant pour maintenir la relation entre les vagues ? Et si tout le monde s'accorde à dire qu'il faut « passer du monologue au dialogue » qui parvient réellement à produire le contenu nécessaire à un vrai dialogue ?
Une organisation traditionnelle d'agence ne permet pas de produire du contenu en qualité et en quantité suffisante. Créer des sites Internet et développer les canaux de diffusion ne suffit pas s'il manque l'essentiel : un contenu suffisamment riche et attractif.
En associant deux métiers, publicitaires et professionnels du contenu, ceux qui initient les idées et ceux capables de les développer le plus, BDDP Unlimited est une structure d'un nouveau genre, qui offre aujourd'hui la plus grosse capacité de production de contenu on et off-line du marché.

Description: The Marketingroup acquiert L'Enchanteur des nouveaux médias 
28/10/2007
Rachetée par The Marketingroup, l'agence d'e-CRM L'Enchanteur des nouveaux médias compte être dans les 6 premières agences interactives du marché d'ici 2 ans et avoir une marge qui croît de 30 %. 
Voilà L'Enchanteur enchanté. L'agence conseil en marketing et communication online, L'Enchanteur des nouveaux médias, vient d'être achetée par The Marketingroup, agence de marketing services coté sur Alternext. Valorisée à 1.280.000 euros, l'acquisition s'est faite à 60 % en cash et 40 % en actions et se soldera par une fusion fin 2009. L'opération permet à chacune des entités de se repositionner sur son marché, l'une par rapport à sa taille, l'autre à son expertise.
Pour The Marketingroup il s'agit en effet de placer Internet au cœur de son activité. Le groupe, né en 2000 de la fusion de trois agences de communication, opère sur deux métiers différents, mais complémentaires : le conseil dans la relation client (CRM) et la gestion de centres d'appels, sous la marque Phone Marketing. Pour Marc Gladysz, président du groupe, "il devenait incontournable de se doter d'une expertise Internet très forte, qui aille au-delà de simples compétences." Après une année de recherche et 8 mois de négociation, L'Enchanteur des nouveaux médias, auquel il avait déjà sous-traité quelques opérations, est apparu comme le partenaire idéal.
Ce dernier, connu pour avoir réalisé la "netcampagne" de l'UMP durant la campagne de Nicolas Sarkozy, perçoit quant à lui ce rapprochement comme "une évolution naturelle", étant donnée la maturité qu'acquiert le marché des agences interactives. Pour son fondateur, Arnaud Dassier, "la phase expérimentale où Internet recueillait les queues de budget est terminée, les annonceurs recherchent désormais des agences qui aient les reins assez solides pour assumer des budgets consistants." Etre intégrée à The Marketingroup permet donc à l'agence d'acquérir une taille critique pour répondre à tous types d'appels d'offre.
Les deux agences se sont également retrouvées dans l'importance qu'elles donnent au e-CRM, "beaucoup plus puissant que l'image pure", selon Arnaud Dassier. "Il était donc logique que nous nous tournions vers une société de marketing services, plutôt que vers une agence de publicité." Et d'ajouter, "notre poids est suffisamment significatif par rapport à celui de The Marketingroup (respectivement 2 et 23,8 millions d'euros de chiffre d'affaires au dernier exercice clos) pour être plus qu'une goutte dans un océan, et pour pouvoir entraîner le reste du groupe."
Marc Gladysz ne le contredira pas, puisqu'il s'attend aussi à un "effet acquisition" sur sa structure : "annoncer une culture digitale forte devrait nous rapporter de l'activité offline." La croissance de The Marketingroup, qui stagne aujourd'hui à 2 %, repassera à deux chiffres, selon ses pronostics. En ce qui concerne L'Enchanteur, l'objectif est d'atteindre une croissance de la marge brute de 30 à 50 %. Son dernier exercice, clôturé en septembre, a dégagé une marge brute de près d'1 million d'euros et Arnaud Dassier vise 1,5 million en 2008 et 2,5 millions en 2009.
Désormais directeur associé et deuxième actionnaire de The Marketingroup, le fondateur de L'Enchanteur compte bien donner les moyens à son agence de "continuer sa politique d'investissements et de se renforcer sur le Web 2.0, le Web d'influence et le secteur public, via les collectivités locales et les administrations qui cherchent à f

Description: Comment ça marche ? Les entreprises présentent un projet à financer. Unilend évalue leur capacité de remboursement. Les projets les plus solides sont présentés aux prêteurs. Chacun choisit librement le projet, le montant et le taux d’intérêt auxquels il souhaite prêter son argent. Dès que la somme est réunie, l’entreprise retient les meilleures propositions. Unilend lui remet son financement et organise tous les mois les remboursements des prêteurs.
Chacun peut prêter à des centaines de projets et recevoir des intérêts. Les entreprises peuvent emprunter facilement et rapidement auprès de centaines de prêteurs.
En savoir plus : article dans L’Express, video interview co-fondateur sur BFMBusiness.
Menés par des entrepreneurs expérimentés, le projet est soutenu par des investisseurs issus du monde la finance. Notre ambition en terme de visibilité et d’usages nous amène à renforcer notre équipe.

Description: Un savoir faire reconnu
 
Née de l'envie de répondre aux besoins de l'industrie du médicament, altizem est une CRO créée fin 1998 qui dès sa création a obtenu la confiance des acteurs de la profession. Ses fondateurs ont une expérience reconnue de plus de 20 ans dans les métiers de la recherche clinique. 

Une capacité à gérer des projets d'envergure 

Spécialisée dans le traitement des données des études cliniques et épidémiologiques,
altizem travaille en collaboration avec les acteurs mondiaux de l'industrie pharmaceutique, agro-alimentaire et cosmétique.
Nous intervenons sur des essais nationaux et internationaux en ayant toujours pour objectifs : la réactivité, la qualité et le respect des normes afin d'obtenir l'entière satisfaction de nos clients.

Description: The Logic Group is a long established market leader in the provision of trusted payment and loyalty solutions initially for the UK and Ireland and now increasingly across the rest of Europe. The company was originally formed in 1986 to provide consultative advice to tier one commercial organisations. Through the 1990’s we led the introduction of integrated multichannel payment software solutions with many innovations including the support of multicurrency transactions and dynamic currency conversion. 

In 1998 we introduced our first loyalty service followed some years later by our first managed payment services. We were the first to introduce an integrated Chip & PIN solution in the UK and as a result of our leadership were awarded a Queen's Award for Innovation in 2005. Continuing to lead the industry in the provision of secure payment solutions, the following year saw us introduce Europe’s first multichannel, PCI DSS compliant, managed payment service. 

Building on our consulting heritage, we have continued our relentless pursuit of added value for our clients with innovation in the areas of gift cards, contactless technologies, integrated tax free shopping and both managed fraud and information services. In 2009, we continued the next phase of our European growth strategy by opening our Madrid office to support our expansion within Southern Europe.

Specialties
Multichannel Payments, Security, Fraud and Risk Management, Customer Loyalty Management, Information Management & Insight, PCI DSS - We are a certified QSA, Mobile Payments, Mobile Loyalty, Customer Data, Insight and Analytics, NFC and Mobile Wallets

Description: Havas Worldwide London (formerly known as Euro RSCG London) is a uniquely integrated agency: we blend advertising, digital, social media, search, channel strategy, retail marketing and PR all under one roof and on one P&L – both locally and internationally.

We believe that effective ideas are much more likely to come from joined-up thinking and execution, without any haggling over individual company P&Ls.

Driving and managing social momentum

Our approach to brand marketing, as a result of our uniquely integrated position, is focused on driving and managing social momentum.

Because of the unique structure and competencies all being in one place and on one P&L, we are able to work with clients to help create brand content that drives positive momentum. But we can also react swiftly and adeptly to help manage negative momentum if and when it occurs.

It is this kind of approach that led to us winning a TED “Ideas worth spreading” award and made us one of the most awarded agencies in the UK over the last couple of years, including awards from D&AD and Cannes Lions.

Description: Edito
En 1991, je fonde l’agence Force 4, qui va très rapidement se spécialiser dans les Relations Presse/Relations Publiques du Vin et de l’Art de Vivre.
Leader sur son secteur, l’agence a forgé sa réputation sur son savoir-faire, son dynamisme, sa déontologie, son efficacité, son carnet d’adresses, ses capacités d’organisation et sa volonté d’aller toujours plus loin.
Force 4 est aussi la seule agence de Relations Presse/Relations Publiques qui compte à son actif un salon : « Les Rencontres Vinicoles ».
Ce salon que j’ai créé en 1997 s’est imposé en quelques années comme le rendez-vous incontournable des professionnels du vin à Paris. Prochainement, les Rencontres Vinicoles vont désormais rayonner dans de nombreuses grandes villes.
Force 4, c’est tout simplement un subtil assemblage de 4 critères : une équipe compétente, un carnet d’adresse, une profonde exigence du client et une méthodologie qui a fait ses preuves.
Un assemblage de compétences
Dans des métiers comme les nôtres c’est bien souvent la personnalité du dirigeant qui motive le choix du client.
Mais seul on ne peut rien faire, c’est pourquoi je me suis toujours attachée à m’entourer d’une équipe d’hommes et de femmes compétents, passionnés, engagés, énergiques et qui surtout ont l’esprit maison.

Description: Coors Brewers Limited was formed in 2002 when the brewery operations of the former Adolph Coors Company (now known as the Molson Coors Brewing Company) purchased what was once known as Bass Brewers. It owns the widely recognized Carling beer brand and in 2003 launched the Silver Bullet (Coors Fine Light Beer or as it's known in the US, Coors Light). Other products distributed by Coors Brewers include Caffrey's, Grolsch, Screamers, Toby, and Worthington Ale. The company also operates the Coors Museum of Brewing (formerly the Bass Museum) in Staffordshire, which documents the history of British brewing with its extensive exhibits

Description: Mudskipper Business Limited
20 Mortlake High/8 Street  London   SW14 8JN  


Met with Ruth and Richard today (27/03/06), looking for medical writers to do; abstracts, manuscripts, medical education projects, KOL, will work very closely with clients as they do not have account handlers as such. They are looking for both Mortlake and Maccelsfield office. 
They have a very flat structure and each writer takes ownership of their own projects-do quite a lot of early stage work i.e. pahse 1-2. Preferably looking for candidates with PhD or solid experience. candidates must be honest , confident and capable of working independently and down to earth. 

Therapy areas: oncology, hematology, endocrinology-they would like to expand into CNS and gastro. Main clients are astrazeneca, gsk, jansen, johnson, novartis and procter gamble.

They will not use freelancers.

Renumeration:
basic salary
pension: 5/10
bonus:up to 10% of basic salary, normally 8-10%
Profit share: couple of grand
life insurance
annual salary review in May
6 month probabtionary period



NEW INFO 03.12.07 
We are currently seeking to appoint experienced medical writers for Mudskipper (www.mudskipper.biz <http://www.mudskipper.biz/>) and 7.4 (www.7point4.biz <http://www.7point4.biz/>) at our offices in Mortlake and Bollington, Cheshire (Mudskipper) and Oxford (7.4).
Our medical writers need to have excellent scientific understanding – the vast majority have science PhDs. We are keen to recruit additional writers who have at least around 2 years’ experience gained working in good international medical communications agencies. 
Mudskipper and 7.4 are not ‘typical’ agencies and I think it’s fair to say that medical writers are more highly valued here than at many firms. All of our writers play an active role in their account teams – many lead their teams. We do not have account handlers to act as the go-between between clients and writers. Our writers have direct contact with their clients and the KOLs that we work with. The ability to establish effective working relationships with international KOLs is a key feature of our existing writing team.
Mudskipper has an enviable record when it comes to retention of medical writers. Of those who have been recruited and have successfully completed their probationary period (6 months), NONE have left the company since we started.
Here is a very quick overview.
Mudskipper Business Limited (www.mudksipper.biz <http://www.mudksipper.biz/>) has been trading for over 6 years. The firm is managed by the team who set it up, and has grown to a team of 32 talented individuals based in offices in Mortlake and Bollington, Cheshire. 
7.4 Limited (www.7point4.biz <http://www.7point4.biz/>) was established last year as part of our growth strategy. We do not want Mudskipper to grow into a large agency that requires a ‘corporate’ structure. So, whilst Mudskipper will continue to grow for the next few years, we are looking to 7.4 to develop more rapidly.
Both agencies are run to a very high standard and have a common style – flat structure, team approach, individual rewards, focus on excellent delivery and innovation rather than chasing sales targets. Both are performing very well and have an excellent client base – all leading international pharmaceutical companies.
7.4 is led by Matt Stanton who joined from the client side (he’s a pharmaceutical marketer). Matt reports to the board of the holding company which owns Mudskipper at 7.4 – that company is owned by

Description: Betite & Menant en artisans du luxe 
Maurice Betite et Jean-Marc Menant ont quitté le groupe Havas. Cultivant un positionnement d'artisans, ils ont monté leur propre structure. Premier client : Céline. 
La loi d'airain des multinationales ne réussit pas aux publicitaires. Deux ans après la création de By, le département luxe de l'agence Devarrieuxvillaret, Maurice Betite et Jean-Marc Menant ont discrètement jeté l'éponge, l'été dernier, pour se mettre à leur compte et créer Betite & Menant, enseigne sise rue de Turbigo, dans le iiiearrondissement de Paris. Avec des clients comme Céline et Lacoste (ce dernier est passé depuis chez BETC Luxe), By tournait pourtant bien : 2 millions d'euros de marge brute pour neuf salariés. Un ratio dont nombre de managers d'agences se satisferaient.


Le grand saut


« Mais même si cela se passait très bien avec Benoit Devarrieux et Jean-Pierre Villaret, nous n'étions pas vraiment maîtres chez nous, raconte Jean-Marc Menant. Se voir refuser l'achat d'un ordinateur par Boston [siège de l'agence Arnold, dans l'orbite de laquelle est située Devarrieuxvillaret au sein de la galaxie Havas] au motif qu'il n'y a pas de plan d'investissement dans le parc informatique, cela finissait par être pesant. »

Au bout de deux ans, les deux publicitaires se sont donc dit qu'il ne servait à rien de gémir dans son coin et se sont pris par la main. Le grand saut, mais pas sans filet. La marque de luxe Céline les a suivis dans leur nouvelle aventure, un client pour lequel Betite & Menant sortira, en avril, une campagne print sur un parfum. Autre création à venir, une campagne pour un parfum Zegna.

Toujours positionnée sur le luxe, la mode et la beauté, spécialités de ses deux créateurs, la nouvelle enseigne compte cinq personnes, dont deux directeurs artistiques et une productrice acheteuse d'art. Jean-Marc Menant n'est pas guetté par la folie des grandeurs. « Si nous retrouvions la taille de By, soit une dizaine de personnes, ce serait très bien. Nous ne sommes pas taillés pour travailler pour le compte d'une multinationale américaine. »

Description: Beyond Analysis is changing the world of data analytics and human insight. Here’s how. 

Some companies try to grow sales without knowing the facts that data reveals, but that’s just plain guesswork. Some try to do it in ways that conflict with how we know human beings really behave. Well that’s just wishful thinking. 

If you use data without human insight you lack understanding. If you apply human insight without data you don’t have the rigour. 

Beyond Analysis uniquely combines data analytics with knowledge of what makes people tick. We unlock the value of human behaviour; it’s what makes us special. 

For businesses, this means we create phenomenal leverage in getting people to both take control and change their behaviour. Whether, that's your customers, your staff, or your suppliers. The result is a solution that is a natural fit for an organisation but also game changing in terms of delivering extraordinary business outcomes. 

Beyond Analysis enables you to replace guesswork and wishful thinking with understanding and rigour. 
This means that you can confidently take the precise actions that will generate extraordinary growth for your business.

Specialties
customer strategy, insight and analysis, insight products and tools, Loyalty programme design and management, data commercialisation, reporting, infographics, customer experience design, data strategy, CRM.

Description: They say time flies when you're having fun, but It hardly seems possible that Lyn Joseph PR has just passed its 25th birthday! Many things have changed in that time - newspapers and magazines have launched, digital photography has arrived and so have millions of emails! But during this time we have built a highly-respected track record of launching some of today's most successful companies, including the UK launches of French mail order catalogue La Redoute, American footwear Nine West, French fashion for expectant women Formes, Lepel Swimwear and Discover Mademoiselle Lingerie. We have also raised the profile and helped a number of companies grow including Blooming Marvellous, Faith and The Cashmere Company, and have just completed six years representing Peacocks, one of the UK's leading value fashion retailers.
We have deliberately kept the company small, to continue to offer a distinct personal service specialising in fashion, lifestyle and women's consumer related accounts. By working with a select number of clients at a time we are able to offer a tailor made service and represent small and large companies.
We not only deliver brilliant product placement within national and regional press, but according to your budget can hold press events, plan reader offers, research and negotiate celebrity endorsements, organise sponsored trips, support store openings and suggest a million and one other ways to help your company grow.
Based in London's West End, our offices and showroom are conveniently situated for press to view collections.

Description: About Tribal Worldwide 

Tribal Worldwide (www.tribalworldwide.com), a global creative agency, is headquartered in New York City with 60 offices spanning 42 countries around the globe. Since its founding in 2000, Tribal has expanded and been recognized well beyond its digital roots. By 2005, Tribal was named Interactive Agency of the Year by Adweek and was heavily recognized at the Cannes International Advertising Festival, where it took home the most Lions and the Cyber Grand Prix. In 2007, Tribal was the first “digital” agency to be named Global Agency Network of the Year by Advertising Age and in 2009 was the first to win the Grand Prix in Film at the International Advertising Festival at Cannes. The agency was recently inducted into The FWA Hall of Fame in 2012, an industry-recognized Internet awards program and inspirational portal that honors cutting-edge digital creativity. Tribal continues to draw on its expertise in digital innovation and its heritage of creativity and insights to bring clients the most effective and discerning marketing solutions for today’s world. Tribal Worldwide is part of Omnicom Group's (NYSE: OMC) DDB Worldwide.

Caroline Cawston, who has thirty years experience in the political arena, heads this small London-based consultancy, operating since 1989.

Harcourt provides strategic advice on how to initiate and maintain good relationships with politicians and civil servants in local and national Government, public bodies, trades unions, the media, special interest groups and the general public.

How could you benefit from public affairs advice?
You know what you think of politicians and the media, but how do they see you?
Do you provide a sensitive service or produce a controversial product?
Are any of your processes or systems environmentally unfriendly?
Do you have or are you seeking contracts with local or national government, or abroad?
Do you know what perceptions politicians and the media have about you and your organisation?
Is there anything government can or should do which would make you more competitive?
Is there anything these audiences could or should do to help you achieve your goals?
If these are the kinds of questions your company or organisation has to address, then public affairs advice can play a vital part.

Description: Optimal solutions to the competing demands of cost and people management. 

Soaring health care costs driven by aging populations, advances in medical technology and continuing investments in new treatments are straining private and public health care systems in most major economies worldwide. For employers, this translates into an increasingly delicate balancing act: reducing cost burdens through creative plan design and program management while continuing to meet employees' needs and maintain high levels of performance and engagement. 

To help employers strike an optimal balance, Towers Perrin offers expertise in designing, funding, pricing, implementing and managing the full array of health and welfare programs. This capability encompasses health care strategies for active employees and retirees, as well as disability, dental, life insurance, behavioral health, pharmacy and flexible benefits. 

While the specific nature and scope of our services differs depending on local systems, laws, conditions and needs, our broad offerings include: 
Program strategy, design and pricing 
Vendor evaluation, selection and monitoring 
Care and disease management consulting 
Employee education and research 
Communication and change management 
Performance measurement and monitoring 
Funding strategies 

Legal compliance 
We bring a multidisciplinary approach to our work, seamlessly integrating the skills of our actuaries and underwriters, physicians and other clinicians, operational and administration auditors, employee research professionals, communicators and change management specialists. And we employ a range of sophisticated software, proprietary databases and Internet technology to ensure we provide practical, fact-based solutions.

Description: PRWeek 14/08/07
The big-screen TV in Chris Webb's corner office is tuned to Sky News, with the bright red ticker at the bottom of the screen announcing that pop star and Max Clifford protege Kerry Katona has been robbed at knifepoint...

A less polite man might be tempted to respond to PRWeek’s remarks that this latest news may not rank up there with the nat­ional crises he handles on a regular basis. But ever cautious and media-savvy, Webb does not take the bait, simply raising one eyebrow and changing the subject. The truth is that as deputy director of public aff­airs for the Metropolitan Police, the soft-spoken South Londoner has been inv­olved with responding to almost every major nat­­ional incident since the Clapham rail crash in 1988, when he was a press officer for the London Ambulance Service. 
Now, from his office high up on the 13th floor of New Scotland Yard, Webb is ­responsible for day-to-day comm­unications across the Met, from routine int­ernal comms to counter-terrorism strategy. With a staff of 72 and a budget of £6.3m, he is far removed from his days in the ambulance control room at Waterloo. 
‘It was an exciting time, the late 80s,’ says Webb of his first few years in crisis comms, when he dealt with press enquiries on behalf of the London Ambulance Service. He landed the job as a fluke when out-of-hours media requests were diverted to the ambulance control room, where he answered 999 calls. He soon developed a taste for working with the media, and, crucially, seemed able to remain calm during emergencies. 
‘There were major incidents year on year on year,’ says Webb in a characteristically deadpan voice, reeling off a laundry list of accidents in a tone others reserve for discussing the weather. ‘In 1988 there was the Clapham rail crash, and in ’89 there was the sinking of the Marchioness. Who’d have thought a pleasure boat would have sunk on the river Thames?’
Webb, now 43, was a senior press officer with the North London Police when he was app­ointed to head up the comms team ahead of one of the most headline-stealing events in recent memory, the funeral of Princess Diana. True to form, Webb seems unfazed when asked to recount the experience. ‘We had the world media focused on us around the clock. I dealt with comms from the Sunday morning, through to the actual Westminster Abbey service the following Saturday. Great working relationships were developed in that time, both with Buckingham Palace and a number of the Government departments.’
These relationships have been tested ever since, with Webb relying on his comms counterparts at all London’s emergency service divisions, the Mayor’s office, Transport for London and government departments to come together under his chairmanship in emergency situations like this month’s foiled West End car bombing. Leading this so-called Gold Group of comms heads is part of Webb’s job description, and one that has become increasingly crucial in the post-9/11 era of constant terror threats. 
Glenn Sebright, head of media and internal comms at the London Fire Brigade, was one of the Gold Group representatives following the Haymarket scare. ‘It’s vital to have confidence in your colleagues in these situations,’ said Sebright. ‘Chris chaired the Gold meetings through the period of time the sec­urity threat was raised to critical, and played a key role in coordinating communications between the emergency services.’
For Webb, the first hour after a terror ­att­ack is the most importan

Description: 
We opened our doors for the first time at the birth of the millennium and since then we have become the world’s largest Word of Mouth company and have undertaken Word of Mouth campaigns for some of the world’s largest companies across more than 60 countries.
With our headcount now hovering around 100 we believe we have the most passionate, most focused Word of Mouth specialists to be found anywhere on planet Earth.
Our multi-lingual team of strategists, analysts, linguists, creatives and researchers help us deliver award winning work both online and offline for clients spanning fashion, finance, food, leisure, media, motoring, retail, telecoms and travel.

What we do 
Know…
We provide brands with deep level intelligence about the conversations consumers are having in both virtual and physical landscapes.
Through this insight and understanding we help companies build narratives that people want to engage with and share.
Through greater empathy and advocacy, consumers are inspired to involve brands actively and passively in their social interactions.
Put simply, we help brands to make a difference by behaving differently. We help brands be more sociable; building sustainable relationships over time with people who want to talk to them and about them.
Passion…
Word of Mouth embraces mankind’s innate need to communicate and is driven by shared passion.
We help brands understand the passions that ignite social interactions so they can inspire communication on a one to one, one to several or one to many basis.
WOM is not limited to verbal communication but is a consequence of sensory experiences so we help brands understand how they look, how they sound and how they feel, as well as how they talk.
Social media has exponentially increased the power of WOM by making it possible for individuals to connect instantly with thousands of others who share their passion around the world.
We help build conversational ecosystems which support sustained interactions among passion groups.
