Description: La création de nouveaux médicaments répond à des exigences strictes, codifiées, qui évoluent avec l’augmentation des connaissances et l’harmonisation des règlements. 
Notre industrie est sans cesse à la recherche des équilibres entre matières et disciplines scientifiques dont la maîtrise est nécessairement inégale dans l’entreprise.
Qualité des résultats, valeur du budget de R&D et succès dépendent de la subtilité de cet équilibre. L’efficacité de la recherche est un art, le nôtre est contemporain des études

Pharmacodynamie 
APCIS conçoit et réalise les études animales, conformes à l’état de l’art nécessaires au développement pharmacologique et à la sécurité des médicaments. 

APCIS conçoit et réalise les études animales, conformes à l’état de l’art nécessaires au développement pharmacologique et à la sécurité des médicaments. 
 
Nos spécialistes trouvent des applications nouvelles à des molécules connues, des formes à libération programmée adaptées au fonctions du principe actif développé.

Description: The British Academy is an independent national academy of Fellows elected for their eminence in research and publication. It is the UK's expert body that supports and speaks for the humanities and social sciences. Most of their funding comes from Govt rather than industry.

08 Jan 2016 10:01 AG:

Met with Natasha McCarthy (Head of Policy) and Stevie Bennett (HR Officer) re: a Policy and Public Affairs manager post paying £38-£40k. 
Policy team is being restructured and split into a 'public policy' team which she leads and a higher education & research team headed by someone else that has more of an advocacy function. Altogether there are about 7 ppl across those teams. 

want Someone that is externally focussed, proactive and engaging. Massive plus if they are a good fundraiser, commercial person. Need to be able to do policy formulaton, good in a PR and public facing role, bringing out the academic work the academy does and engagement with Westminster, build relations there, organise events. 

This person could come from Govt. Depts, think tanks, membership body. Need to be able to give them ideas on how to implement the ideas of the policy team. 

the centre of science policy do this function really well in terms of building relationships with the wider community and westminster to push their ideas. 

Timelines:
CVs by 22nd Jan
1st interview - w/c 25th Jan - interview or written exercise
2nd interview - w/c 1st feb - meet with CEO - he is heavily invested in policy and comes from that background

Description: 

Hill & Knowlton, Ireland 

Hill & Knowlton’s Dublin Office was established in March 2003 and employs a team of seven consultants specialising in corporate communications and financial public relations. The agency has particular sector expertise in the information technology and consumer product sectors. 
Hill & Knowlton Ireland has experience in the running of corporate reputation campaigns and public awareness programs on behalf of leading companies and governmental organizations at both national and international level.        IDcommunes, agence de communication publique, recherche un collaborateur pour prendre en charge les budgets de l’agence qui lui sont confiés par les collectivités locales et les EPCI.
Missions :
Placé sous l’autorité du directeur de l’agence, vous partagerez votre temps entre le conseil et la mise en œuvre de projets de communication.
- Audit et stratégies de communication
- Conception et animation de processus de concertation
- Conception et réalisation d’outils et/ou d’actions de communication : supports écrits, site internet, débats…

Profil :
De formation supérieure (Sciences Pô, DESS de communication publique…), vous justifiez d’une expérience minimale de 5 ans dans des postes à responsabilité en matière de communication publique locale (en agence ou en collectivité)
Poste à pourvoir le plus rapidement possible


Afin de renforcer notre pôle « print et relations publiques », nous recherchons un(e) CHEF DE PROJET SENIOR capable de coordonner l’édition de divers supports de communication imprimés ou électroniques (plaquettes, affiches, dépliants, cartons d’invitation, cartes de vœux, CDrom, sites internet, etc.) et d’organiser toutes sortes d’événements à caractère institutionnel (colloques, rencontres-débats, conférences de presse, inaugurations, etc.).

Missions :

Placé sous la responsabilité des consultants de l’agence, vous partagerez votre temps entre la coordination des équipes internes, des collaborateurs et prestataires externes et des clients. Vous participerez également à la réalisation des supports et événements de l’agence ainsi qu’à l’effort de développement de l’entreprise.

Intervenant sur les plans éditorial, rédactionnel et graphique, vous animez les comités de pilotage, vous coordonnez la production et le montage des projets et faites l’interface avec les clients.



--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

La Collective du sucre (Cedal) annonce le lancement d’une campagne presse et radio le 22 octobre prochain, orchestrée par Publicis Conseil, afin d’informer les consommateurs sur les conséquences de la réduction en sucres dans les aliments. Baptisée "Quand on enlève du sucre, savez-vous ce qu’on met à la place ?", la campagne met en avant les importantes modifications subies par les aliments industriels "privés" de sucre par le biais de 3 visuels humoristiques qui visent à expliquer ce que des fabricants ajoutent aux produits réduits en sucre pour compenser.


Publicis Consultants lance la marque Publicis Consultants Net Intelligenz
Publicis Consultants a officialisé hier le lancement de sa nouvelle marque, Publicis Consultants Net Intelligenz. La structure, qui compte une vingtaine de personnes, est placée sous la responsabilité de Xavier Théry, qui a rejoint le groupe en début d’année et est nommé directeur. Il est placé sous l'autorité directe d'Eric Giuily et Sege Perez, coprésidents de Publicis consultants France. L'entité se positionne comme "l'alliance de l'expertise corporate et de l'expérience web".

Publicis Consultants lance Publicis Consultants Budapest

Publicis Consultants se développe en Bulgarie
L’agence de relations publiques bulgare MARC Communications a rejoint le réseau de communication corporate et relations publiques Publicis Consultants en tant que partenaire stratégique. Depuis le 6 février 2007, l’agence, basée à Sofia, est nommée Publicis Consultants MARC. L’entité faisait déjà partie du groupe Publicis, puisqu’elle avait rejoint, en 2002, Publicis MARC Group.

Laurent Wormser, nouvel associé chez Publicis Consultants
 
Laurent Wormser, 42 ans, jusqu’alors partner chez Financial Dynamics où il était en charge du développement, rejoint Publicis Consultants en tant qu’associé. L. Wormser a également passé huit ans en tant que Partner chez Euro RSCG C&O, en charge de la communication d’opérations financières.

Description: River specialises in generating consumer insights that inspires great marketing. We get closer to brands, consumers and organisations and use this closeness to inspire innovation, consumer engagement and brand growth. 

The guiding principle of River’s work is immersion. To understand consumers’, brands, products and even our clients we dive in and experience their environments. We study consumer needs, attitudes, behaviours, influences and aspirations and turn this insight into opportunity. Our immersions bring understanding, understanding brings insight, and great insight inspires great marketing. 

We operate across the spectrum of research methodologies – from small qualitative innovation projects, to large scale international consumer trends, tribes and market movement programmes. Consumer insight is just one part of marketing decision making – River ensures that you have the right insights and the right framework to make those decisions

Specialties
Marketing insights generation, Online communities, Customer Closeness, Segmentation, Branding & communications research, Qualitative and quantitative research programmes, Innovation and co-creation, Workshop facilitation, Concept development &NPD, Ethnography

Description: Bienvenue sur le site d'Axonal,
société de recherche clinique sous contrat depuis 1989.

Axonal propose des services complets pour la réalisation d'études et enquêtes pharmaco-épidémiologiques, essais thérapeutiques et opérations médico-marketing.

Axonal est en particulier spécialisée en épidémiologie, traitement des données d'étude et solutions technologiques adaptées aux études.

1989  
  
Cinq médecins passionnés d'informatique et de statistiques créent Axonal.
Leur objectif est de proposer à l'Industrie Pharmaceutique de nouveaux services avec la maîtrise des bases de données, pour la conception de CRF, le data-management et le traitement statistique de données d'Essais Cliniques.  
  
 
 
1991  
  
Développement de la gestion centralisée d'étude de phase IV et d'enquêtes à effectifs importants.  
  
 
 
1994  
  
Développement de l'activité monitoring sur site pour les Essais Clinique de phase III et IV.  
  
 
 
1996  
  
Axonal change de statut et devient une SA.
L'activité principale se concentre sur la gestion complète d'études et d'enquêtes, de la conception du protocole à l'analyse des résultats. "De la Suite dans les Données..." devient la signature officielle d'Axonal.  
  
 
 
1999  
  
Engagement vers la qualité pour Axonal, nomination d'un Responsable Assurance Qualité.
Elle signe notre volonté d'apporter des garanties complémentaires et plus de satisfaction à nos clients.  
  
 
 
2000  
Première étude observationnelle avec utilisation d'un PDA palm®.
Premières applications internet.  
 
2001  
Création d'une unité Monitoring et d'une unité Biométrie.   
 
2002  
Certification AFAQ ISO 9002 (1994) en février 2002. Premier essai thérapeutique avec e-CRF.  
  
2003  
Axonal participe activement à la création de l'Association Française des CROS (AFCROs). Organisation des premiers séminaires gratuits destinés aux professionnels de la santé.  
  
2004  
Certification ISO 9001 version 2000. Première étude pharmaco-épidémiologique utilisant un PDA communiquant couplé à la solution EOL® distribuée par Acuitude.

Description: NEWS

01.03.07 PAN - Jonathan Oates quit. Go to Lib Dems as director of policy & communications.
06.08.07 PAN - Tim Walker to go to the GMC as Assistant Director of Comms.
08.08.07 PRW - BM’s UK chairman Gavin Grant has defended the agency’s global head, after calls for his resignation made national headlines in the US this week.  US labour activists have given B-M’s global CEO Mark Penn an ultimatum: ­resign as head of the PR conglomerate or step down as Hillary Clinton’s top campaign aide.
24.08.07 PRW - London Mayor Ken Livingstone has pledged to stop using public affairs agencies that refuse to adhere to industry-wide ethical codes. ‘Bell Pottinger’s contract with the Greater London Authority [GLA] has come to an end… In future, when such contracts are let by the GLA I will ensure that adherence to the ethical rules of the industry is a criteria for appointment.’
13.09.07 PRW - Tony Blair’s former director of comms David Hill is to rejoin the Bell Pottinger Group as a dir­ector based in The Collective - an arm of the consultancy that deals with clients that have ‘complex, multi-disciplinary needs’. He was formerly MD of Good Relations.
12.12.07 PRW - Bell Pottinger is making an aud­acious bid to land more clients in the sensitive areas of defence and security by setting up a dedicated arm of the business (agency already ret­ains defence clients including BAE Systems, Rolls Royce and MBDA).
15.02.08 PRW - won an account with Asda's property PR division.
19.02.08 PRW - BPPA is to set up a new planning unit in an attempt to fend off competition from rival lobbying firms.  Appointed former Four Communications AD Emma Waterfall as director of the new unit.  She will join next month and will be responsible for developing and growing the business ahead of a planned launch later this year. The team will consist of: Chris Parr, Laura Wentworth-Stanley & (consultant) George Parkinson.
10.03.08 PRW - Bell Pottinger's public affairs arm held talks about lobbying on behalf of Zimbabwe; Agency boss Peter Bingle said he turned down the chance to work for Robert Mugabe's regime.
29.05.08 PRW - developing EU practice, headed up by Kevin Doran - Director of European Affairs.
02.06.08 PRW - lost corporate eBay account to Blue Rubicon
11.06.08 PRW - The Liberal Democrats' comms chief Jonny Oates is quitting the party and returning to Bell Pottinger Public Affairs, his previous employer after just 15 months.
13.06.08 PRW - HSBC is putting its public affairs account out to pitch after seven years with Bell Pottinger Public Affairs.
03.07.08 PRW - BPPA been hired by TAG Farnborough Airport to help push through controversial expansion plans.  The account will be led by associate director Chris Parr.
11.07.08 PRW - BPPA has lured rising star Joe Phelan from fellow Chime agency Good Relations. Phelan, currently an account director, will join Bell Pottinger as associate director. Last year, Phelan featured in PRWeek's '29 under 29'.
01.08.08 PRW - Jacobs, the consultants behind the London congestion charging zone have hired BPPA for a lobbying offensive.
29.08.08 PRW - Chime's PR interest, The Bell Pottinger Group, the UK's largest PR firm, recorded operating income of £27.7m in the first half of 2008 - up 15 per cent on last year.
28.08.08 PRW - Green campaigners have expressed concern that the Government's Nuclear Decommissioning Authority (NDA) is using the same lobbying consultancy as a firm that often bids for major nuclear decommissioning contracts.

Description: We're a creative strategic consultancy. 

We work with some of the world’s most innovative companies, across all sectors, including Nike and SC Johnson, to help them to disrupt their markets with transformative strategies. 

We drive our clients’ transformation process with some proven principles. 

• We co-create. We bring together your smartest people, your client agencies and creative consumers. 

• To get you new, radical answers, we don’t ask the same questions to your core customers. Instead we recruit extremists: rejecters, experts, hackers… 

• We run online co-creation communities. This gives your key stakeholders ongoing access to insights, inspiration and ideas. It keeps your consumers’ voice at the heart of your process. 

We're a diverse bunch. We hire smart, restless people, from academic psychologists to MBAs to product and graphic designers to programmers and advertising creatives. Then we team them up and let them loose on the world. It’s a bit like creating 70s cop shows, but with less predictable plots.

Description: Since 1972, Perception Research Services (PRS) International has specialized in consumer research to help marketers connect with shoppers and close sales. 

Today, we conduct over 800 custom studies annually to guide, assess and improve packaging and shopper marketing efforts, including qualitative research, on-shelf assessments, in-store, online and in-home studies. 

With our unmatched experience and proprietary tools (including PRS Eye-Tracking), PRS delivers the vital insights and expertise you need to “win at retail”.

Our Deliverable is Guidance & Insight (Not Data)
We are fully committed to serving as a partner and advisor to our clients, rather than being a data provider. Across all studies, we draw upon our unmatched experience and expertise - and our unique research methodologies - to provide analysis and diagnostic insight to marketers, researchers, and packaging designers.

Packaging research, Shopper Marketing research, custom consumer research, Eye-Tracking, virtual shopping, emotional measurement via facial coding, quantitative research, qualitative research

Responsable d’une équipe d’attaché(e)s de presse, vous gérez et optimisez un portefeuille de clients. De formation supérieure, vous justifiez d’une expérience de 3 à 5 ans en agence ou en entreprise, dans le domaine informatique, télécoms ou multimédia. Vous êtes doté(e) de qualités rédactionnelles et relationnelles, ainsi que d’une connaissance intuitive des besoins et des attentes de la presse.

Réactivité, sens de l’organisation et un goût pour le travail en équipe sont les qualités indispensables pour réussir dans ces fonctions. Le caractère international de notre groupe ainsi que la gestion de budgets pan européens requièrent une parfaite maîtrise de l’anglais.

Attaché(e) de Presse 
Nous recherchons un ou une Attaché(e) de Presse Junior, poste CDD 6 mois (évolution rapide en CDI) à pourvoir immédiatement.

Vos principales missions : qualification des fichiers journalistes, rédaction des documents presse, suivi téléphonique des annonces, gestion des rapports d’activités, organisation de rencontres journalistes & réalisation de revues de presse. La maîtrise de l’anglais & des outils informatiques sont indispensables.

Curiosité, belle plume, aisance au téléphone, organisé & enthousiaste, toutes ces qualités permettront à notre futur collaborateur d’évoluer au sein d’une équipe dynamique rompue aux techniques de la communication presse.

En collaboration avec un Consultant senior, vous avez en charge les relations avec la presse. Vous organisez des rencontres, des conférences, des événements ainsi qu’une revue de presse mensuelle pour nos clients. Ce poste pourra évoluer à terme vers des fonctions plus stratégiques.

Réactivité, sens de l’organisation, aptitudes rédactionnelles et goût pour le travail en équipe sont les qualités indispensables pour réussir à ce poste. Le caractère international de notre groupe ainsi que la gestion de budgets pan européens requièrent un anglais parfaitement courant.

Immediate Opportunity for Graduates to join our fast growing company
March or April start, and including native/fluent French and German speakers 
If you would like to:



be involved in a young company where a successful business offers career opportunities 
work within a small like-minded team of English, French and German graduates, 
gain a range of transferable skills to help you succeed in the commercial world 
be challenged in your role and be recognised for your contribution 
We have an opportunity for you….

Clarify was set up in 2003 to work with the sales and marketing teams of high value, consultatively sold, business-led technology organisations. 

The company is small with just 20 people, but has considered yet ambitious plans for growth. We offer new recruits the opportunity to become involved in the development of the company from the beginning of their career at Clarify. We are keen to involve like-minded individuals who will be the future Managers and Senior Managers as the business grows. 

We are looking for motivated individuals, who will enjoy learning how to prospect and talk to senior decision-makers of the Top 300 UK businesses to diagnose their current business pains, problems, objectives and where relevant aligning these to the solutions our customers offer. We also have opportunities for fluent German or French speakers, with the chance for natives of these countries to develop your English language capabilities. 

We will teach you a variety of skills including consultative sales skills, pipeline development and management, account mapping, customer management, as well as a whole range of personal development skills to increase your ability to succeed in a commercial environment. 

You bring to us a drive to be successful, a desire to learn and the commitment to achieve and progress.

Description: About us

Sponsorvision is a specialist programme-led marketing agency and has pioneered the TV sponsorship medium in the UK over the last 10 years.

We're most famous for creating the Chocolate (Coronation) Street for Cadbury, and the first ITV peak time ad-funded programme for BT. We have marketed over 100 brands through TV programming. 

We have a great track record in identifying hit programmes. We have identified and placed our clients on the first series of Who Wants to be a Millionaire, Cold Feet and Pop Idol.

We also developed ad-funded programming. In 2002 we were hired by Coors to turn their Carling Homecomings music event into a TV programme. We successfully created a Carling branded television series, which was broadcast on Friday nights on Channel 4 - a key night for the broadcaster in terms of youth programming.

This year we have also completed a major research initiative in partnership with Hall & Partners Europe looking at how broadcast sponsorship works and how to measure it better.

We provide a full service approach to programme led which incorporates brand planning, media planning and buying, creative solutions and production, off-air exploitation and evaluation.

Description: Revolution Sports Marketing Group: 01903 883747; www.revolutionsports.co.uk 
revolution sports marketing is an agency with a new attitude towards sports marketing and communication that specialises in driving brand and corporate development through the medium of sport.  We are dedicated to helping clients gain a fresh marketing perspective, promoting brands more effectively and seeking out profitable business opportunities and partnerships.

We offer brands and businesses a range of specialist services, from sponsorship negotiation and activation, to public relations, event management and measurement and evaluation, as well as representing selected rights owners.   Whether working with internal marketing teams or as a totally independent resource, Revolution Sports Marketing is dedicated to providing creativity, experience and innovation.

Chairman - Mike Smithwick

Mike has worked on major international sports events including the Rugby World Cup, the World Ice Skating Championships and was the creator and driving force behind the London Triathlon. Mike provides a wealth of experience to the business and his diverse experience across the sports industry is invaluable to the ongoing development of the organisation and expertise on behalf of clients.

managing director - merrick Haydon

Working in the sports marketing and sponsorship industry for the last ten years has provided Merrick with a wealth of experience across many sports events and properties, working with clients such as American Airlines, Amerada Hess, BG, BMW, Halifax, Coca-Cola Great Britain and Ireland, Computacenter (UK), Gerrard, Marsh, Morgan Stanley, NEC (UK), Pepsi, Reuters, Rolls-Royce and Skandia.

 

                                                                

Examples of events involved with on behalf of clients and rights holders include the Oxford & Cambridge Boat Race, the Cheltenham Festival, Glorious Goodwood, the Chatsworth SsangYong International Horse Trials, Skandia Cowes Week, Halifax BUSA Championships, ICC Champions Trophy Cricket, NEC Harlequins, Marsh Team GB, LTA City Tennis Clubs and the Goodwood Festival of Speed.

Founded: Maiden Management is an independent event management and production house specialising in sport and entertainment. 

We offer a wide range of bespoke event management services, which can be applied to a variety of sports and types of event. Our services are comprehensive and we creatively project manage events from conception to completion. We provide these services for a range of events from private functions for 12 people to public spectacles for up to 12,000.

Maiden Management Ltd was founded in 1997 by Directors Amanda Heathcote and Sally Burns. Initially working in cricket, the company expanded its sports expertise to cover a wide range of sports from rugby union to boxing. Today, the business has an entertainment's division with clients including the World Wrestling Entertainment, Inc. and BBC Music.

Maiden Management has particular expertise in producing and directing awards shows, creating spectator events and are leaders in producing a variety of events that have a strong fundraising element.

Our strengths relating to event management include strong communication and interpersonal skills, combined with an ability to deal with people at all levels and excellent organisational skills.

We have an excellent network of personal contacts in the sports and entertainment industries. These range from sports stars and celebrities to tv and media personnel to suppliers and service providers and commercial brands for sponsorship and fundraising contra deals.

To compliment this we also have very good long term relationships with the majority of large UK venues that enable us to negotiate excellent rates and benefits for our clients.

In addition to our management skills, we also negotiate and implement any marketing, sponsorship and PR associated with these events. Sponsorship exploitation and brand awareness are also associate services provided which play a crucial role in the success of events.

Technical and creative production expertise including audio visual, set design, sound and lighting allow us to recommend the appropriate service providers and equipment to suit the event. Our capabilities mean that we can fully project manage this including floor management and full direction.

We always seek to create unique events for a client to suit their commercial profile. 

In 2002, Maiden Management created the Double Wicket World Championship which is a highly entertaining International Cricket Tournament which will be held annually at the National Cricket Ground in St Lucia, West Indies.

Description: New man joins Benchmark Sport

Paul Newman, former Director of Communications at the Football Association, has joined the marketing and events agency, Benchmark Sport, as Consultant Director.

Newman, 46, will focus on developing Benchmark's PR and personality management businesses and started work at the company's London office this week.  

Benchmark Sport owns and runs the Sport Industry Awards as well as managing leading sports personalities including the Rugby World Cup winners Will Greenwood and Richard Hill and Olympic Gold Medalist rowers, Steve Williams and Ed Coode. 

Newman was Media Chief at the FA for three years until the Summer of 2003. He previously spent two decades as a broadcaster, including three years as sports correspondent for BBC News. He supervised all media relations around the England football team and built a close relationship with the head coach, Sven Goran Eriksson.

Since leaving the FA, Newman established his own consultancy, Paul Newman Communications, and was hired as media adviser for Eriksson's partner, Nancy Dell'Olio. He also spent nine months in the public sector as Interim Communications Director at Cardiff County Council. 

Today, the managing director of Benchmark Sport, Nick Keller, said: 'We are delighted that someone of Paul's credentials has joined Benchmark Sport. Obviously Paul brings with him significant experience and heavyweight contacts in both the media and public relations. There is no doubt that his arrival at Benchmark Sport marks a huge step forward for the business and gives us a more balanced offering in terms of creativity and big brand delivery.'

Paul Newman said: 'I'm delighted to be working at Benchmark Sport. As one of the most innovative agencies in the industry, they have a great reputation and I'm looking forward to help build the business with such a talented group of people.'

* Benchmark Sport: 020 7240 7700.

Description: About Us  

Founded in March 2003, iBetX is a superior betting exchange specialising in horse racing and sports betting. The Company is licensed as a bookmaker in England and Wales and holds a valid Bookmaker's Permit issued by Petty Sessional Division of East Central. iBetX does not however operate as a bookmaker, the company does not accept bets itself, but acts as a broker, matching customers' bets with one another. In return for this service, IBetX ' charges a consistently low commission from net winnings on an individual betting market. 

iBetX is a well funded, joint venture of various people from different professional sectors such as I.T, Operations Management, Marketing and the Gaming Industry. Our management team has solid technical skills in addition to extensive business and gaming experience. We expect these strengths to make iBetX.com a significant online presence. All clients' money is ring-fenced with the Bank of Scotland; furthermore iBetX has substantial liquid cash with Bank of Scotland to run day to day operations. 

iBetX Limited is registered in the UK and Wales as a limited liability company. The company number is 04546485. 

Our offices in London are fully equipped with the most up to date software and hardware, allowing for smooth operations in the ever-changing betting world. Our highly qualified full-time staff oversees the day-to-day operations seven days a week from 10am-5am. 

IBetX is the fastest growing betting exchange for American races and sets itself apart from its UK competitors in accepting American customers. By making a betting exchange available for US horse racing, iBetX attracts US punters who are otherwise restricted by interstate gambling laws. 

"Our aim is to provide a competitive, secure and robust betting solution for punters looking for an alternative to the traditional bookmaker," said iBetX founder and CEO, Rocky Mirza. "iBetX odds are consistently around 20% better than traditional bookmakers. In a short time we have built up a substantial user base including many high volume punters and server capacity has been increased to handle ten times the current volume of traffic." 
 

Ibetx Limited is registered in the UK and Wales as a limited liability company. The company number is 04546485.

Description: Sports marketing PR specialist Jardine Communications has been acquired by sports event and sponsorship specialist Global Marketing Communications from Podia Group PLC in a bid to extend both companies' international reach and marketing services for their clients.

CEO of the privately funded Global Marketing Communications, Peter Harrison, explained: 'I'm delighted to have been able to find a company with such a reputation for success in sports PR and below-the-line marketing campaigns.  

'The acquisition not only strengthens Global's product offering to our clients by adding sports PR expertise, it also enables us to offer Jardine Communications' existing clients a much greater level of commitment across many areas of sports marketing including event management and sponsorship.'

Tony Jardine, who maintains his active role in running Jardine Communications, continued:  'This is a really positive move for Jardine Communications and it is great to team up with a company with a like-minded business philosophy that believes in building long term relationships with clients through delivering effective sports marketing solutions. I very much look forward to a successful partnership.'  

Global Marketing Communications has contracts with Orange, Ford Motor Company Australia, Worldcom, CART and Reuters.  

Jardine Communications' clients include British American Tobacco, Sony Computer Entertainment Europe UK and T-Mobile.

Description: MANAGEMENT 


Mike Laflin - Chief Executive

Mike founded Sportcal Global Communications Limited in 1991. Previously, Mike worked as a technology consultant to the International Amateur Athletic Federation, the International Sailing Federation and the International Tennis Federation from 1989 onwards and developed media information systems for all three sports.
In 1991 he established the first centralised calendar for sport, Sportcal, and has gradually developed the product since.
In 1997 he launched Sportcal's first online offering and within three years had established Sportcal.com as the leading business website for the global sports industry.
In 2001 Mike launched a new product called Active Data for Sport (ADS) which provides modular solutions for sports organisations who need to develop content management systems either internally or for their web sites.

Callum Murray - Editorial Director

Joined Sportcal.com in July 2000.
Callum is responsible for the editorial content of the site and the company's publications, with a particular emphasis on Sportcal.com's acclaimed daily news service.
Before joining Sportcal.com he was the founding editor of TV Sports Markets, the respected fortnightly industry newsletter on the business of television sport.
Callum's background as a journalist includes writing sports features for national newspapers, as well as editing a series of design advice guidelines for soccer clubs redesigning their stadia in the wake of the Hillsborough Stadium disaster.

Sunil Kaikini - Marketing Director

Joined Sportcal.com December 1999.
During his time at the company Sunil has had a varied role working on all commercial aspects from sales and marketing to business development.
Currently, Sunil works on the marketing strategy of the company, client management and new business.
Having previously worked at the BBC, Sunil studied law at university in London and spent a post-graduate year in Spain learning the language.

Description: ARDERN HEALTHCARE LTD


Ardern Healthcare Ltd., a privately owned British pharmaceutical company, was formed in 1997 by the former senior management team of Nycomed UK (Pharma) when Nycomed closed its UK pharmaceutical business.

Initially Ardern negotiated a distribution deal with Nycomed to market some of its prescription products in the UK and Ireland. This agreement remains in force today with the main product focus being in the area of sexual health and generic medicines.

Since its formation Ardern has developed its franchise in the over the counter retail market. Ardern sources products from both Europe and the USA. It has developed a positive relationship with Tender Corporation, a leading US manufacturer of insect bite treatment, repellents and other seasonal products. Ardern's mission is to become a leading UK supplier of bite treatments and repellents. Ardern currently supplies major pharmacy chains such as Boots and Lloyds, independent pharmacy as well as leading retail outlets such as Tesco, Morrisons, Savers and Wilkinson.

Ardern's main office is based near Tenbury Wells, Worcestershire. All warehousing, storage, distribution and invoicing facilities are provided by Healthcare Logistics Ltd, Progress Park, BEDFORD. Additional salesforce and key account handling are provided by The Miles Group, Huddersfield, West Yorkshire. In the Irish Republic, Ardern's prescription products are distributed by Newport Pharmaceuticals Ltd, Swords, Co Dublin and OTC products by EJ Bodkin & Co Ltd, Dublin.

The Managing Director of Ardern is David Perkins, who has over 30 years experience in the pharmaceutical industry including senior management positions with Bayer and Nycomed.

Description: Founded in 1973, NEC UK is responsible for the marketing, sales, installation and service of a comprehensive range of NEC's IT, communications and display technologies. With a proven track record in technical consultancy and multiple product streams, NEC UK can design, install and manage standalone and integrated solutions for corporate clients and their networks. 

In mobile communications, NEC delivers the latest handsets (3G and 2.5G) and network infrastructure. For the business market, NEC supplies converged network solutions, physical and electronic security systems and advanced IT solutions, from server and storage hardware to e-business and supply chain management services. NEC also offers a complete range of display products and managed services based on its latest display screens and projectors for the corporate, professional AV and Home Theatre markets. The turnover of NEC UK was over £300 million, year ending March 2004.



About NEC Corporation (NASDAQ: NIPNY) (FTSE: 6701q.1) (TYSE: 6701)

NEC Corporation (NASDAQ: NIPNY) (FTSE: 6701 q.1) is one of the world's leading providers of Internet, broadband network and enterprise business solutions dedicated to meeting the specialised needs of its diverse and global base of customers. Ranked as one of the world's top patent-producing companies, NEC delivers tailored solutions in the key fields of computer, networking and electron devices, by integrating its technical strengths in IT and Networks and by providing advanced semiconductor solutions through NEC Electronics Corporation. The NEC Group employs more than 140,000 people worldwide and had net sales of approximately $47 billion in the fiscal year ending March 2004. For additional information, please visit the NEC home page at: 
www.nec.com
.


NEC Solutions

NEC Solutions is responsible for Internet solutions business in enterprise and consumer markets. Focusing primarily on large-scale open core systems the division will promote E-commerce in the distribution and financial markets through NEC's Internet service provider.


NEC Networks 

Focusing on next generation network business operations, NEC Networks will specifically strengthen its engineering and technical resources in the fields of WDM (Wave Division Multiplex) centred optical network systems and next generation mobile network (W-CDMA) systems and terminals.


NEC Electron Devices


In addition to its focus on personal computer related businesses, NEC Electron Devices will focus on delivering device solutions for the mobile and broadband Internet areas. 


Today NEC enjoys global annual sales of approximately $47 billion (in fiscal year ending March 2004), ranking it as the 53rd highest revenue earner in the world economy (Forbes International 500). This has been achieved through successful businesses in 45 countries employing 140,000 staff in nearly 130 factories and offices. For additional information, please visit the 
NEC home page
.

Public Affairs News
28.06.07 PRW - James O'Keefe is in talks with other senior players in the lobbying industry, as he sets about establishing his new PA shop. O’Keefe, resigned last week as MD of Good Relations Political. O’Keefe is not acting alone, he has lined up at least two big hitters to join his new outfit, which is yet to be named.
03.07.07 PAN - James O’Keefe will be founding the new agency with backing from former News of the World editor Phil Hall which will be called Tetra Strategy. Tetra will have a ‘strategic alliance’ with Hall’s 14-strong PR firm Phil Hall Associates, which will remain independent.
13.09.07 PRW - James O’ Keefe, former MD at Good Relations, has raided his old agency for four of its lobbyists: The most senior member of Good Relations to defect to O’ Keefe’s new outfit, called Tetra Strategy, is director Lee Petar.  Senior account executives Heidi Moore and Ruwan Kodi-Kara, and account executive Katherine Nicholls will also join.
The departures mean that Good Relations’ lobbying arm is reduced to four consultants, alth­ough a major hire is understood to be in the pipeline. The most senior member left is former Britain in Europe staffer Estelle McCartney, who was recently promoted to director.
11.07.08 PRW - BPPA has lured rising star Joe Phelan from fellow Chime agency Good Relations. Phelan, currently an account director, will join Bell Pottinger as associate director. Last year, Phelan featured in PRWeek's '29 under 29'.
03.10.08 PRW - Good Relations is helping set up a trade body that will represent the UK's five biggest players in the retirement village sector. The Association of Retirement Village Operators UK will promote the industry to the public and to decision-makers in Westminster and Whitehall.

Description: Hello Lynda, 
Sorry for the delay in getting back to you. With regards to fees, I understand that you may be paying other agencies less than Hanson Search’s rates, but I’m not sure if they’re standard recruitment agencies or search & selection specialists like us – I didn’t discuss this with Emma. More importantly, we have a strong client list who has agreed with our standard fees and we also need to work in a fair manner. As Hanson Search and Ash Communications have never worked together before, I have managed to agree the following with my Director for an initial placement:
0 – 19,999 20% £500 discount 
20,000 – 44,999 25% £750 discount

I’d be happy to come to Ash Communications’ offices to meet you in person and discuss these further, as at the present time, these are the best rates I can offer.

Rainier PR is one of the UK's leading business-to-business and consumer technology PR agencies.  The founders are both former journalists and inject a passion for creating headlines throughout the agency, they have offices in both London and Cambridge, backed by an international network that makes it simple to get their message to the right market.
Rainier PR's teams have some of the strongest client experience in the UK, from the world’s largest technology brands to the smallest of entrepreneurial start-ups.  There clients range from start-up companies such as Camcon, SciVisum and Verum through to world leaders in their fields including Cadence, NextiraOne, Telewest and Toshiba.

In 2005 they were nominated for the Chartered Institute of PR Outstanding PR Consultancy award, a Holmes Report SABRE award and their Best Practise application of business systems has been spotlighted by the Department of Trade & Industry and the Institute of Directors.

They are currently looking for technology PR consultants with varying levels of experience who can stand on their own two feet and jump straight in at the deep end. You will gain valuable experience of working across B2B and B2C clients, and how to strategically drive tangible business results.  They have a strong team of 25 people and are expanding at a continual rate due to numerous business pitches.  They have excellent offices in great Portland street and a very creative and dynamic bunch of people.

Key responsibilities;
- The candidate will work on a maximum of 5 retainer accounts and a handful of ad hoc projects
- Senior Consultants will often take the lead role on at least 2 of the 5 accounts
- The candidate will also be expected to take on an internal management role within the agency e.g. responsibility for training or HR (the exact role is to be decided)

Description: About Midas / Why Choose Us 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
Experience
With 20 dedicated and experienced account managers and directors and a wider support team, we have the high level of expertise, industry knowledge and enthusiasm necessary to carry out creative and effective campaigns over concentrated periods or longer time spans.

Flexible
We are flexible in approach and our broad range of experience allows us to work effectively on a wide variety of campaigns and special projects, small, medium or large. We are highly experienced in creating and managing PR and publicity for clients across trade and consumer campaigns, with outstanding contacts within print, broadcast and new media sources.

Creative
Our creative ideas and ability to 'think outside the box' are hallmarks of the Midas experience.

Respected
We are a highly respected organisation with an exemplary reputation within media circles.

Reliable
We are always open and realistic about the campaigns we are working on. We are committed to achieving genuine results on every project.

Relationship Builders
We pride ourselves not only on our professional success in PR campaigns, but also on the strong, lasting relationships we build with our clients. We like to inject a shot of fun, friendliness and approachability into our relationships. Our client retention rate is the proof of our successful approach to client management.

Description: 
The WG Consulting team comprises a diverse range of skills and expertise, gained from a variety of backgrounds within the healthcare environment. Such breadth allows WG Consulting to deliver a unique insight into both Health Service providers and independent healthcare sectors.

WG has built an extensive network of relationships with healthcare professionals across the NHS and independent sector. This has engendered an in-depth knowledge and understanding of a constantly changing environment and authoritative insight into the complex issues facing all aspects of healthcare. 

These relationships are an invaluable and unrivalled asset. They allow WG Consulting to secure the breadth and depth of insight required by its clients.

Companies are now beginning to recognise the increasing value of ensuring core healthcare and brand strategies are developed and ratified with the NHS and other healthcare providers, and allowing this to shape appropriate medical education, PR and advertising.

WG Consulting's expansive network helps place it at the forefront of such specialist service provison.

Description:  About UCB


UCB is a leading global biopharmaceutical company dedicated to the research, development and commercialisation of innovative pharmaceutical and biotechnology products in the fields of central nervous system disorders, allergy/respiratory diseases, immune and inflammatory disorders and oncology - UCB focuses on securing a leading position in severe disease categories.

Vision

To build a global biopharmaceutical leader, based on unique blending of innovation, entrepreneurship and proven experience bringing to specialists first, new medicines to treat patients suffering from severe diseases.

Values

Passion and Performance
We are passionate about what we do and about UCB's performance.   

Care
We care for the patient and for people. 

Accountability
We require accountability as an individual and solidarity as a team member for achieving UCB's objectives. 

Entrepreneurship
We embrace resilient entrepreneurs that show initiative.   
       Integrity and Quality
We act with integrity and ensure flawless quality in our core processes. 

Innovation
We foster innovation from inside and outside to be smarter than our competitors. 

Focus and "Act Now"
By focusing, we make things happen immediately, identifying the right opportunities and acting swiftly.

Description: 25 May 2017 10:30 RS:

 Axicom 

150 people across EU - 60 in UK

Acquired by Axicom 9/10 years ago, with founders to remain for 9 years after acquistion as part of terms - that ended last Summer and founders left, replaced by Cathy Pittham

Biggest account over the years has been Dell - Dell merged with EMC meaning UK implementation of Dell account went to B2L and most of work is now EMEA project coordination

Dell was 1/3 of revenue, now the P&L has been rebalanced with EMA merger, new business and Axicom push more into digital with digital team, content editing team etc.

Clients are generally in cybersec, hardware, electronics, IoT, telecoms and enterprise space

Also work on consumer tech as clients overlap 

B2B tech - Dell, Red Hat (Linux), Proof Point, Nokia, Cisco IoT, Micro Battery, Alevo etc.

B2C - Dell, Nokia, Orange

Focus for future of the agency is around global expansion into US, more digital and social media services offered, and further exploration of content/ web designer service

Activelty investing in digital and training of current directoral staff to be digital leaders - Google Squared (6 month digital course for directors)

Benefits - invest a lot in training, can move around the group under the banner of Cohn & Wolfe, access to great deals and gym membership etc. as part of WPP, dental/ health eye insurance, possible exchanbe programme with offices in other locations

Jobs

 Associate Director/ Director:

UK is 50% of Axicom business - currently have 3 Associate Directors, 5 directors

Role is still bit of an open brief as not sure if they want one of each, or either or - and internal movements of current senior level staff will directly effect the remit of the role

- Salary - £80-£100k
- 10+ years experience
- needs to be a leader/ inspiring so that people follow
- experience coordinating cross geography projects a big bonus as will most likely work on Dell coordination
- exposure to social/ digital big plus due to forward looking nature of agency
- experience in BD also big tick due to need to balance and develop P&L
- B2B + some B2C experience in tech space a positive
- candiates with US experience a plus due to plans to expand into US

company-note:
Description: 06 Nov 2014 09:09 JB: Finsbury - Client Meeting
100 in London office

2014 Homes Report winner - top agency
Recent clients:
- Astra Zeneca
- Green King
- Col Com

International network, global footprint Roland Rudd - Senior Partner & Founder Entrepreneurial feel - lean structure, open to ideas & trying new things

Areas:
Fin Comms & IR
Corp Affairs

Teams cover all areas alongside digital teams (have a basic understanding e.g. Twitter) Attention to detail is key - a lot of FTSE work

Work hard, big, intense global clients - key issues.
No to regularity, standard in-house feel, or hand holding - rather a pragmatic/ results approach.
Pro bono work with communities
Global clients - across offices
IPO & M&A work

Wants Associate level
Top Academics - from normal 2.1 + or 2.2 and above Do a lot of work under time pressure - exam like! Russell Group Universities.
Bath & St
Not to UWE or University of Westminster

Teams:
PR
Reg - led by Will Turner

Work across teams - specialism in an area & other areas IR, media relations, digital

Skeleton staff over Xmas

Send: CVs to all three - Katie, Keryn and Laura ** MUST PUT CANDS NAME & JOB TITLE IN SUBJECT **

Candidate name in email title
Sal. On & LF
Notice Period
Permission to work in UK
Sponsorship license - but complicated in EU to do it.

NB on fee notice with invoices

If they are Journalists - float name over before sending

Interest in media & news is key!! Big campaigns. Must follow big issues in trade press.

Interview process:
3 (poss 4 stage dending upon level)
1st - fairly standard - competency based. skills, strengths, experience, why Finsbury?
2nd/ 3rd - Katie involved
Senior Partner at final

Test
Write under time pressure - press summary / advice letter

One lady off to Dubai
Going in house LT project - poss come back Both perm

Associate level
Coming in - need to reflex both sides
This building is odd

Hoping for a NEW YEAR start date.

Entrepreneurial - interested in business.
Self starter, make an impact
Introvert than extrovert
Industrials team - big characters
Confident but not arrogant
Team players
Wholesome, well rounded
Thinking independently but working collaborative Integrated b/w teams Competitive nature.
Hard working

Friday - drinks, dress down - professional but fun culture.

Contact: Email best generally. Send CVs to all.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Package & Benefits
•Base Salary, competitive according to merits of the candidate
•Participation in discretionary Company Bonus Scheme (dependent on the performance of the individual and the performance of the company) 
•Gym membership (Virgin Active Moorgate)
•25 days leave + 3 days to be taken between Christmas and New Year
•1 day a year for optional charity work
•1 week additional holiday for those getting married
•2 days extra holiday for those not taking a sick day in a calendar year
•Up to 5 days optional unpaid leave
•Day off for moving house
•Private Medical Insurance
•Private Travel Insurance
•Pension (8% contributed by RLM Finsbury, 3% by individual)
•Season ticket loan (recouped over 10 months and only after completion of probation)
•Unlimited access to cereal, toast, tea, and coffee; cakes on Friday at tea-time
•Shoe cleaning
•Bi-monthly massage on-site at own cost
•Parental leave: entitles all eligible employees who have completed one year’s qualifying service to take a period of unpaid leave to care for each child born or adopted on or after 15 December 1994 (on or after 15 December 1981 in the case of a disabled child).
•6 week sabbatical after 6 years, 3 weeks of which are paid
•Childcare Vouchers: All staff are offered access to childcare vouchers through Kiddivouchers. Details can be found at www.kiddivouchers.com <http://www.kiddivouchers.com>. 
•Eye tests: All employees who regularly use a VDU are entitled to a free eyesight test once a year. The Company will contribute an amount (currently £50.00 in total) towards eye test/the cost of new glasses/contact lenses should they be required specifically for VDU use as recommended by the optician.

Salary for the company

£27K to £35K executive 
£35K to £53K Associate 
£50k to £75k  Senior Associate 
£70k - £85ish Associate Partner 
£90k + Principle
Partner on more 

Bonus -  paid 20% of salary can go to 30% healthcare and gym also

Description: **Spoke to Nigel on 5th Nov 02. They do hire graduates to become trainees, but have just had their quarterly board meeting to discuss hiring and have decided to roll it over until the next board meeting on 20th Jan. Call again beginning of Jan**

Company 15 years old, specialists in IT, Management Consultancy, Telecoms, Accounting/Audit, and Financial services.

Spoke to Nigel on 13th Jan and he said they aren't doing the trainee route at the moment, but will take experienced consultants (min of 2yrs exp). Have to call again tomorrow - 14th Jan.

Experienced permanent consultants - at least min 3yrs in IT - must be able to hit the floor running. Pretty big, don't discrimate - want someone with a short commute. It's going to be a demanding year. Their nearest station is putney bridge or putney br. They've got the work, but always a bonus if they bring business with them. Not fresh out of college. 20-30K basic. Rewards quite attractive - haven't had consultant leave in 4 years

Also, someone with permanent and contract experience, but where the contract skills will be more utlised. Traditionally a permanent company, they are developing the contract side. Want someone to increase the contract book - someone motivated to grow the book and earn off it. High reward for growth of book. This is a new position, so renumeration will be discussed nearer time.

Haven’t got any other agencies on books at the moment - haven't had to recruit for a while.

Counsel – public relations
Founded in 1969, Counsel provides a results-oriented service covering corporate, business-to-business and consumer communications. We have strong FMCG and food sector expertise as well as crisis and issues management teams.

We are committed to PRCA best practice in our delivery and ways of working as well as measurement and evaluation. It means our clients realise added value from their PR budget. 

We are proud to work with some of the biggest and best-known brands that rely on Counsel to help build awareness, grow brand reputation and make more sales.

What we do
Counsel public relations excels at creating national news stories, which is why many of our clients come to us to help reposition and re-energise their brands and services. 

Our clients enjoy a greater share of voice because we employ experienced communicators from careers within agencies, client marketing and journalism.

We help our clients build their brands often via the media; using imaginative PR. Our teams’ creative energies are focused on one thing – exceeding client expectations.

Nelson Bostock Communications (NBC) is one of the UK’s leading PR agencies, with parallel strengths in consumer and B2B markets.  The company’s client portfolio ranges from innovative start-ups, through industry associations, to global blue-chip brands (Canon, Toshiba, Bacardi, Bollinger, Swatch).

NBC was the proud winner of 3 Gold and 2 Silver Awards at the prestigious PRCA FrontLine Awards 2006 in Corporate, Creative, International and Sponsorship categories.
http://www.prca.org.uk/sites/frontline.nsf/images/2006/$file/FL_Awards_Supplement06.pdf
NBC was also recognised as a ‘Top 10 European Agency Employer’ in the 2006 Holmes Report 


Candidate ownership:

But in any event, I thought it might be helpful if I set out our general philosophy, which - I stress - is subject to the various subjective conditions which can affect any particular case.
 
·	We will normally consider that if you have sent us a strong candidate, who was a realistic contender for a role (even though unsuccessful) you will ‘own’ that candidate’s relationship with us for a period of 6 months from first introduction


·	However, if we issue a new brief to you, and you have not made a connection with that previous candidate and re-recommended them to us within 5 working days of you receiving the new brief we will not feel that you own the candidate.   


·	If another agency proactively presents that candidate to us specifically for the new brief after that 5 working day period, we will consider that they own the candidate.  


·	If you send us a speculative candidate which clearly doesn’t match any current or foreseen need at all -  not even at a pinch (and I’ll tell you this clearly at the time!) we will not feel that you ‘own’ that candidate if they are presented to us by a different agent, in less than six months, for a job which is clearly new and different from anything we had at the time you sent us the CV.  In this case we will consider that they are ‘owned’ by the second agency

Innovex Medical Communications (IMC) 

There are many powerful forces shaping the future of a pharmaceutical brand: market forces, environmental forces and competitive forces. To create a future that you control requires the power of a truly global communications company. A company with the proven ability to develop, shape and penetrate these markets. A company that can successfully harness the forces that make a real difference to your brand. 

IMC (formerly Medical Action Communications) is a world leader in global healthcare communications, a company with the power to help you decide upon a future and then make it happen. 

The power to create a future requires an ability to understand and control the complex interaction between influencers and prescribers, between evidence and actions, between market shaping and market development and between the various media through which your messages are delivered. 

IMC delivers this power to you through a unique synergy of science and marketing expertise, an unrivalled heritage of success, global reach and powerful proprietary process.

About TNS
TNS is a market information group. We are the world’s largest custom research company with a specific focus in a number industry sectors, and a leading provider of social and political polling. We are also a major supplier of consumer panel, TV audience measurement and media intelligence services.

TNS operates a global network spanning 70 countries and employs over 13,000 people. We provide market information and measurement, together with insights and analysis, to local and multinational organizations.  

We combine our specialist sector knowledge with expertise in the areas of new product development, motivational research, brand and advertising research and stakeholder management to bring our clients up-to-the minute, internationally consistent information.

We think differently to help our clients build a competitive advantage, making TNS the sixth sense of business.

Description: Headquartered in Basel, Switzerland, Roche is a leader in research-focused healthcare with combined strengths in pharmaceuticals and diagnostics. Roche is also the world leader in in-vitro diagnostics, tissue-based cancer diagnostics and a pioneer in diabetes management.

Roche’s personalised healthcare strategy aims at providing medicines and diagnostic tools that enable tangible improvements in the health, quality of life and survival of patients. In 2010, the Roche Group had 80,500 employees worldwide and posted sales of 47.5 billion Swiss Francs. Genentech, United States, is a wholly owned member of the Roche Group. Roche has a majority stake in Chugai Pharmaceutical, Japan. For more information see: www.roche.com.

company-name: CIPFA (Chartered Institute of Public Finance & Accountancy)
company-note:
Description: 3 Robert Street
London WC2N 6BH


CIPFA is one of the leading professional accountancy bodies in the UK and the only one which specialises in the public sector. It is responsible for the education and training of professional accountants and for their regulation through the setting and monitoring of professional standards. Uniquely among the professional accountancy bodies in the UK, CIPFA has responsibility for setting accounting standards for a significant part of the economy, namely local government.

CIPFA’s members work, often at the most senior levels, in public service bodies, in the national audit agencies and major accountancy firms. They are respected throughout for their high technical and ethical standards, and professional integrity. CIPFA also provides a range of high quality advisory, information and training and consultancy services to public service organisations. Our weekly magazine, Public Finance, is widely read by elected representatives and officials in all tiers and corners of government. As such, CIPFA can justifiably lay claim to be the leading independent commentator on managing and accounting for public money.

Description: Alcon Laboratories was incorporated in the United Kingdom in 1969 and moved its offices to Watford, Hertfordshire in 1976.

Since the beginning, the objective was to ensure that Alcon products and services were made available to eye care professionals in both the United Kingdom and Eire.

Alcon's operations grew rapidly and in 1993 we purchased a freehold site in Hemel Hempstead, Hertfordshire, where the company relocated to purpose built facilities in 1995.

Today, we are pleased to say that the building incorporates a complete Training Centre and Library, in addition to providing offices for our employees. The business has grown, the number of products and services have multiplied several times over, but the objective remains the same: developing, producing and marketing the most advanced ophthalmic products and technologies available in ophthalmology and optometry today.

Our agency comprises a mix of experienced healthcare consultants with an expertise in most therapy areas.
We can provide integrated communication support through specialist teams in:
• Media relations – medical and consumer, UK and international, strategic planning and coverage delivery

Previous Experience :

• We successfully organise many innovative medical education symposia attended by capacity audiences both internationally and in the UK

Intro to Harvey Nash:


Harvey Nash

Harvey Nash is a superb company to work at:

http://www.harveynash.com/

Harvey Nash is an International Executive Search firm who place candidates in the 80-160K range across IT, Health Care, Technology, Public Sector, Financial Services, Not For Profit and Market and Industry.

Progression:
 
Business Developer -12-24 months.  Marketing Harvey Nash out to new prospective clients with the goal of making 2 appointments per week.
Candidate Resourcer - 3 months.  Training and dealing with candidates for those roles.
Junior Consultant.  - You're on the team now! 


Earnings:

1st year c. 35k	) 	As a Business Development 
2nd year c. 40k	) 	Consultant and Resourcer
3rd Year c. 70-90k	as a Junior Consultant.


Challenge:

Dealing with Executive candidates means that you will constantly have to be updating your expertise in your given sector.
Dealing with Senior Managers will mean you are constantly mentally challenged.


Retained Recruitment:

Harvey Nash works on a retained fee basis, which differs from the standard or Contingency fee.

Contingency means that the client pays the Consultant once the Candidate has been accepted and has accepted the client's contract.

Retained means that a percentage (30-40%) is paid upfront before the project begins, further payment (another 30-40) is paid upon presentation of the short list (list of suitable candidates for the job) and the remainder once the placement has been made.

The huge advantage is that your payment is spread out and that typically fee percentages are higher!


Niche:

The candidate level that they deal with is senior to the larger recruitment firms such as Michael Page, Parker Bridge and Badenoch and Clarke whilst they have the same number of people and arguably a stronger International presence.

The style of their work is more akin to smaller sized Executive Search Firms such as Corn Ferry, Egon Spencer and Russel Reynolds.  The advantage that they have over these firms is the ability to provide a shortlist in 22 days compared to a market average in 2 months.

Hence they are highly dominant in their sector.


1st Round Interview:


What to expect from the Interview:

Simon Ball is quite a stern interviewer and will probably spend most of the interview trying to put you off to see how you deal with it.  Don't be put off.  What he is looking for is a calm, confident, mature considered reasoning that you can and want to do the job.

The sort of questions to be asked will be:

Why do you want to work in Recruitment?
Why Harvey Nash?
Why do you want to work in your chosen sector?
What is the difference between Contingency and Retained Recruitment.
How will you handle the first 6 months (which will be tough but worth it!)?
What do you hope to achieve in the next three years?
Why work in Executive research?

I would like you to be prepared with your own good answers for this which we will go through before the interview.


At the end of the interview:

Thank the interviewer/s for their time, then CLOSE THEM!

Ask them the following questions:

1.	Am I a good personality fit for this company?
2.	Do you think that I

John Saundres background
John Saunders has spent 20 years in the communications industry. He was managing director of two public relations consultancies before founding Fleishman-Hillard Saunders in 1990. He is now one of the firm’s longest serving employees in Europe.
 
He is a former staff presenter with RTE, the Irish national radio and television service. He is a member of the Public Relations Institute of Ireland, The Irish Marketing Institute, and the U.S. Chamber of Commerce in Ireland.

He was Chairman of the Public Relations Consultants Association of Ireland in 2001 and 2002. He is currently a member of the Executive board of ICCO – International Communications Consultancies Organisation.

Mr. Saunders specialises in corporate communications and crisis management. He has handled many major downsizing operations on behalf of different multinationals operating in Ireland.

Since its inception in 1990, he has helped develop Fleishman-Hillard Saunders into Ireland’s largest corporate communications firm. The company has also won more awards for its client service than any other agency in Ireland.

Mr. Saunders is a former winner of the John D. Graham award.

They are based in the heart of Covent Garden and have excellent offices.

rates agreed on 26/01/05 with Anna Parftt

We are delighted to announce that Virgo HEALTH has been ranked 8th in the Great Place to Work® Institute’s Best Small Workplaces Programme. 

The award, announced in last week’s Guardian and FT, is specifically designed for organisations who aspire to sustain a great workplace culture.  Two thirds of the score which determines a ranking in the list comes from the Trust Index® Employee Survey ensuring that it is based firmly upon the voice of employees and a Culture Audit® management survey, and is therefore a clear reflection of the time and energy dedicated to recruiting, nurturing and developing the Virgo team.

We always aspired for Virgo to be a great place to work from the outset and demonstrated this by appointing an HR director in our first year.  We ensure our team are looked after from the moment they join with tailored inductions, extensive internal and external training with the highest training spend per head of any healthcare communications consultancy, buddying and mentoring schemes along with regular performance reviews and appraisals.  Our employees share in Virgo’s success with positive reward and recognition, a range of benefits including a Virgo V wellbeing allowance plus a host of team days and social events.

The real credit goes to Anna Parfitt, HR Director, who comments: “We are thrilled to receive this prestigious award.  We have a longstanding commitment to putting our people first and the fact that this award is based on employees’ feedback makes it even more significant for us.”

The Great Place to Work® Institute results will also be featured in the July issue of the British Airways in-flight magazine ‘Business Life’.

The healthcare communications firm based in Richmond in London, has been recognised in the Great Place to Work Institute’s Best Small Workplace Programme for three years in a row.
Tom O’Byrne, chief executive of the Great Place to Work Institute UK, said: “Virgo Health has continued to perform at an outstanding level.”
Virgo has been awarded the accolade for the last three years, but this year achieved a spot three places higher than 2011. Tom O’Byrne added: “Employees voice strong approval of the organisation’s flat hierarchy with room for open discussion, the serious investment in the development of its people and the honesty and fairness with which it conducts its business practices, both internally and externally.
"Staff respond to the responsibility entrusted to them and they take pride in the organisation’s open culture. Engagement and trust work hand-in-hand at Virgo Health.”
The criteria specified for a great workplace are that employees must trust management, take pride in their roles and enjoy working with their colleagues.
Anna Parfitt, HR director said: “Our aim is for Virgo to continue to be a great environment for people to work, and to nurture our team to provide our clients the very highest levels of expertise and service. We are extremely proud of our bright and passionate team, and are overjoyed at the results of this year’s Great Place to Work survey.”

Description: Pope Woodhead offers a unique blend of business skills and communications expertise.

We provide a wide range of support services to the global healthcare industry; from high-end strategic thinking and research to internal and external communications'

Our core services are: 
• marketing process and change engineering 
• market and brand consulting 
• organisational communications 
• brand communications and PR 
• risk management/appropriate marketing programmes. 

Our people are drawn from a diverse range of technical and marketing disciplines, cultures and companies. Each team member is valued for their broad experience and international exposure. 



THEY OFFER HEALTHCARE AND PENSION. But pension only comes to junior positions on their second aniversary. Senior positions get 5% pension when they start. 

Annual turnover of £2million. Main clients are medium sized pharma such as Novartis, GSK, Roche, top 10 pharma/mid size biotech, medical device companies. Clients are mainly European more than US. 
 
They're are three main teams:

1. Risk Management & Regulatory
2. Strategic Insights - Barriers to access, product related/portfolio, market strategy, market access, market research, evidence based marketing, value demonstration
3. Process Development
4. Communications

They plan to grow the Risk Management and Market Access (value demonstration) divisions. Will always remain boutique. Their clients usually go to them after they've worked within initial stages with bigger consultancies. 

Travel depends on position: 
Practise Head's travel 50% of the time. 
Support Consultants travel 10-20%
Analysts - Office based - once every two or three months.  

Benefit Risk Management, RiskMAPs, REMS
The goal of RiskMAPs (risk minimization action plans) and benefit risk management is to enhance appropriate and effective use of drugs and devices and to prevent adverse events due to their use or misuse. Pre-approval studies often provide important clues as to potential risks of products after launch. However, some risks and benefits are not apparent within the timeframe in which most clinical trials are conducted, and some risks and benefits are so small as to be virtually undetectable in modestly sized studies.
Regulatory agencies, such as the FDA and EMEA, are looking for sponsors to build post-approval risk management programs as part of the approval process. Risk minimization programs should be built to address key regulatory concerns, using a multi-modality approach, whether designed to impact education or behavior, detect a special event, or to monitor off label use. Outcome has developed a number of risk minimization programs using a standardized and measurable approach to key elements, such as education, monitoring, and performance linked access. Each element is part of an integrated, measurable, and ultimately defensible strategy.
REMS: Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategy (REMS)

Description: Actavis, the Iceland-based generic pharmaceuticals company, has acquired the human generics business of Alpharma, making Actavis one of the five largest generics companies worldwide.

 

Actavis has one of the broadest product portfolios and pipelines in the industry, with over 350 medicines available and approximately 300 in development. Description: Employing over 13,000 people world-wide in over 50 countries, Organon makes products that contribute to the health of people and their quality of life. It is this that ultimately determines our existence and success. We are committed to innovation and have developed some of the most innovative prescription medicines for gynaecology, mental health, anaesthesia, and for cardiovascular disease.

 

Organon’s commitment to innovation is apparent here in the United Kingdom. Since 1996, a multi million pound investment has transformed Organon’s drug discovery research complex at Newhouse, Scotland, into one of the largest installations of its kind in the country. Together with our other main research facility in Oss, The Netherlands, we are exploring the boundaries of pharmaceutical research, in the hope that generations to come will enjoy a more secure and healthier future.

 

We employ nearly 600 people in the UK, more than half of whom work in research and over 19% of our global sales turnover is re-invested in research and development. Research and development cannot be fully effective if it happens in isolation, however. It is important that we understand the needs of our customers. To this end, in the UK we are engaged with healthcare professionals, providers and policymakers, as well as patient associations.

 

Organon provides support for medical and health education in the UK. We support numerous medical professional bodies and charities, including the following patient or consumer organisations.

Our focus is on helping clients on where to go - strategy - and how to get there - operations, organisation, technology and mergers and acquisitions. 

Our approach is to focus on fact, not opinion: we start by defining the right question, then we dig deep into the numbers as the basis for creating solutions.

Bain people in London have a wide range of experiences - with large corporates, private equity and venture capital firms and start-ups; this diverse experience and approach enables us to find solutions that others miss. 

We look at a business from a Chief Executive's perspective, as an integrated coherent whole. We help management make the big decisions: on strategy, operations, mergers and acquisitions and organisation; if they want, we then help translate decisions into actions to get results - which may mean fundamentally changing the company.

How do we do it? We start by defining the right question; then we dig deep into the numbers, as the basis for creating solutions. Bain people work across a wide range of industries - with large corporates, private equity firms, and start-ups; we are pragmatic and open-minded; that's why we find solutions that others miss. But we realise that helping an organisation change requires more than just a recommendation, so we try to put ourselves in our clients' shoes and focus on practical actions.


THEY DO NOT HAVE A HEALTHCARE DIVISION IN LONDON.

Set up by Andrew Grant in response to frustration at the way financial PR was conducted at the time.
Claim to employ the best people in the sector and include a diverse mix of senior financial journalists and former investment bankers and Corporate brokers to complement PR expertise.  

Unique structure - have built two teams to support consultant – one of analysts to provide constant intelligence to clients and consultants and an administrative team to provide support to clients, to free up the time of the consultants, to focus on client issues.

Description: TEVA is among the top 25 pharmaceutical companies in the world, and undoubtedly the biggest in generic products. 

TEVA UK Limited package and market one of the widest ranges of generic products in the UK . We offer generic products in all major therapeutic areas in a variety of dosage forms, from tablets and capsules to ointments, creams, liquids and injectables. From our headquarters in Morley near Leeds, we deliver direct to customers through our wholesaler partners. Since 1998, our Hampden Park facility in Eastbourne has been a Centre of Excellence for Packaging. The investment in this Centre allowed us to be the first generic supplier to convert our range into patient packs. 

The logic behind this expanding range of products and pack sizes allows us to meet the needs of all our customers: from community pharmacists and dispensing doctors to hospital pharmacies. It gives you a single authoritative and well resourced source for the vast majority of your generics needs.
