will only take people with UK experince.


size of most of our existing client base and our fee income was up by 45%. Since end 2004 our fee income has gone from £2m to £4.2m at end 2006 - an increase of 113%. Our headcount over the same period went from 19 to 41.
As well as the simple ‘numbers’, we were named PR Week’s Consultancy of the Year, were shortlisted for CIPR’s Consultancy of the Year and moved to our lovely new home at More London where we are right on the River Thames and have space to grow to over 100 people (our 2010 target). 

Key clients are now:
• British Gas
• Coca-Cola
• CTPA
• eBay
• Energy UK
• Facebook
• GSK Nutritional Healthcare
• The Industry Trust 
• Sainsbury's 
• Shell
• Unilever UK & Ireland
• UNUM
• Veolia
• WRVS

In addition, we have a large number of COI/public sector clients including the Home Office, Department for Education and Skills, Department for Communities and Local Government, Department of Health (we are on their roster) and City & Guilds. 
In 2007 we aim to grow our fee income to £5.5m and have around 58 people. By the end of Feb, there will be 47 of us so we are looking to add a further 10ish, probably a few more as it already looks likely that we will beat our £5.5m target and there will always be some departures to replace. 3 of our new joiners will be graduates but we already have a scheme in place for that. We remain as flat as we possibly can be and look for breadth in candidates as we continue without practices or divisions and will do so for the foreseeable future. Our hierarchy is Account Exec, Consultant, Senior Consultant, Associate Director and Director. We also have four grads. 
We need people at all levels (other than Director) but are really in need of great Consultants. People with from three year’s experience that might be Snr Acct Exec/Account Mgrs/Snr Acct Mgrs elsewhere. 
We aim to pay at a little above market rate to help us recruit the very best. We also bonus very well (typically 10-12%) and we have a range of benefits including healthcare, 25 days holiday, mobile phone, cycle scheme, sabbatical after five year’s service and flexible working. We will have a pension in place by mid-year.

They don't recruit with a specific brief or client in mind as they find if they do that by the time the person has joined the need has changed. What they look for is people who can work across public sector, corporate, consumer and issues based work.  They DO NOT want people who just want to be a corporate person or a consumer person.  They want people who want to be all round communication professionals - who are open minded and open to accounts and areas.  They see themselves as communications experts rather than sitting in specific boxes. It doesn't matter if you come from a specific background, so long as you are open to work on diversity.

They offer communications including branding and compete against FH, Interbrand, cake etc.

These questions are essential when screening candidates for MSI:

You need to make sure that he really asks himself the question is consultancy right for him?
What specific areas of strength/competence does he have that make him worth a client paying 2k a day for? 
Does he have the interest and skill to train new product managers and experienced ones in areas of marketing? 
Does he know best practise thinking, does and don’ts for all the key areas of strategic and marketing thinking? 
What happens if we need to send him over seas for 4 weeks? 
What happens if he is out 2/3 days each week for a 3 month period? 
Does he think he can knock down doors in terms of BD, we tried with him and got no where when he was client side, therefore what makes him think that he will do a better job? 

markeing training is a very new industry. There aren't many trainers out there who have specialise purely in marketing.

Another position is with an agency called Kaizo who are a very creative and dynamic pr agency.  They work across several sectors in the pr arena and have 50+ employees in their London office (oxford circus).  The role is to work across several interesting B2B and B2C accounts, two accounts are B2B with Quantum and Necaps storage and their is a big EMEA consumer tech account with Palm Europe, and a general consumer account with RHI (Robert half International) who are a recruitment firm.  This is an excellent opportunity to diversify your portfolio and work on a real mix of accounts, Kaizo are looking to grow and more new business is on the cards.  They are currently reviewing CV's and I know they would be very interested in your background.
 
Kaizo
Central Court
25 Southampton Buildings
London, WC2A 1AL
United Kingdom

Another position is with an agency called Kaizo who are a very creative and dynamic pr agency.  They work across several sectors in the pr arena and have 40 employees in their London office (oxford circus).  They are looking for a SAM in their Tech B2B team to work across a mix of accounts and are looking up to 40k for the right candidate.   www.kaizo.net 
 
 

Job Title – Senior Account Manager (B2B Tech)
Salary – Up to 40k Depending on experience
 

Clients -           

·        RSA Security

·        Cipher Trust – Spam security

·        Quantum – IT Storage

·        Network Appliances – IT Storage

·        BMC – Systems management

 

Total Portfolio = £30,000 per month

 

Reports to - the Associate Director and Managing Director

 

Essential Experience:-
·        4 – 6 years PR experience 

·        a good mix of B2B and tech PR experience (tech is the priority)

·        PR agency experience or a mix of agency and in-house experience

·        Ability to sell additional projects to client base

·        Budget management experience

·        People management experience

 

Person Spec:-
·        Results-focused and driven

·        Confident

·        Ability to advise clients at a strategic level

·        Ability to sell an extra £100,000 per quarter to existing clients

·        Someone keen to join a growing tech team at a senior level

·        Someone looking for a fast paced, commercial, client focused role

 

If this is of interest then I shall look forward to hearing from you.

 

Kind Regards

Aliya

Litmus:
Med ed offering headed up by Elaine Ferguson (background: neurophycisist and PR), been going since early 2005 as a result of client requesting other services, but now also winning itsa own business, type of work they do: KOL, advocacy. symposia, 360 doctor (need more info on this), patient group work, they are currently 5 people in the team  (which of half work accross CCA and Litmus accounts), they are looking to take on 2 new candidates: 1) 2-3 years experience and 2) with 6-10 years experience, no salary bands -they pay what they think the candidate is worth basically, culture: have to be driven by results not status i.e. they will have to make their own coffee, book their own travel, lunching with clients-TEAM players.

big account: pfizer
interview process: meeting up with teammebers, then 2nd stage will be meeting up with sam dosseter and elaine ferguson (no presentations

Biosector2: (biotechnology PR), has been going 4-5 years in the UK, this has been very sucessfull offering in the states (NY), with 25 people in a separate office, here in the UK not so good as the market place is different and they have aslo had weak leadership on this side of the business, biggest account is novonordisk, , looking for someone with 6-10 years experience to head up and win business. 

Benefits on top of basic salary:

I23 days holiday per year (we are increasing this for everyone in 2007 to 24 days per year) 
Private healthcare and dental care 
2 x life assurance (after 3 months) 
Pension – 5% matched employee and employer contributions (after 3 months) 
Interest free season ticket loan (after 3 months) 
Notice period is one week on either side for the first 3 months and after that is 3 months on either side. 
There is an on-going possibility for bonuses and staff are reviewed on a quarterly basis. 
 

In addition to the above we also offer ‘soft’ benefits which do change over time but are currently:

Manicure/massage once every couple of weeks in the office 
Lunch each week in the office 
Free soft drinks, tea, coffee etc 
Fresh fruit delivered twice a week 
1 innovation day per year

Since it opened in London in 2001, Waggener Edstrom has nearly doubled in size every year, and its revenues have grown by nearly 2,000 per cent. Staff have flourished with the agency, enjoying flexible hours, working from home, subsidised sports, overseas secondments and volunteer days. Being part of a global company has its benefits too – staff can go on exchange to other offices around the world.
All staff follow a learning programme that includes in-house training and £1,000 a year to fund external professional development. Wag Ed is supportive of alternative working hours, working from home or going part-time to support work/life balance.
Executive V-P and general manager EMEA, Chris Talago, says: ‘People are our product; developing and retaining them drives everything we do.’




IMPORTANT - LEVELING

AE £22-29k
SAE £28-37k
AM £35-45k
AD £46-60k

ASD £58k + (this one is a bit of a guess, but they offered an ASD of mine £58k!)




·	Lump sum bonuses upon promotions from SAE and up (as well as salary increase)
·	Offer alternative working schedules for people with young kids etc
·	Weekly meetings with line managers about your progression as well as the full review system
·	Possible exchange programmes with both their international offices (number around 15 everywhere from the US to Asia) and those of their affiliates

Waggener Edstorm they have offices in London, Paris, Munich, and the US.
They are a fantastic agency and have recently won the "Best Big Agency to work for" award for 2004.  They also are the 4th largest agency in the world to work for according to PR week. They are a forward - thinking company, and work in the areas of technology and science with some of the worlds most prestigious clients i.e. Microsoft, Alcatel, MasterCard etc.  They have professional education and development opportunities and a real opportunity to make a difference.  They have a very energetic and dynamic culture and there are at present 100 employees in the London office.
An incredible agency: With an infrastructure that has been building for 20 years, Waggener Edstrom has a stellar reputation based on its commitment to continuously redefining themselves, staying nimble and staying on the cutting edge.

Description: Technology
Contact personnel manager with CV's 

Your fast track to the media
AD Communications is the leading international high-tech communications agency in graphic arts and packaging.
With over 20 years experience, nobody knows these fast-moving industries better than we do. We work for companies of all sizes, from start-ups to multinational corporations.
In the graphic arts sector, our clients represent every stage of the production process, from image capture and processing, through digital workflow and offset or digital printing, to finishing and logistics.
In the packaging arena, our clients’ solutions address packaging workflow automation, processing, coding and marking, labelling and RFID, in vertical markets from food and beverage, to fashion, to pharma.
We work nationally, regionally and worldwide, advising on strategy, deciding tactics, and managing operations. We work with direct and indirect channels, with other agencies and with partner and affiliate agencies in Europe, the Americas and Asia.
We know our industries and understand their technologies. Our proprietary database covers over 2500 magazines, online publications and international opinion-formers. We track advance editorial features so that clients don’t miss opportunities for coverage, provide the most comprehensive specialist digital press cuttings service available, and post news on our best in class media web site.
As the world’s leading independent buyer of advertising in our sectors, we can plan and manage clients’ advertising campaigns to create highly effective integrated media relations strategies.
We deliver our services to the highest professional standard – we are the only specialist agency in these sectors to be a member of the PRCA (Public Relations Consultants Association) and to hold its Consultancy Management Standard. For more information about what this means to our clients, click here <http://www.prca.org.uk/assets/pdf/CMS2.pdf>.

Description: Caudex Medical Ltd and TMG Healthcare Communications - a merger of excellence:

TMG Healthcare Communications have merged with Caudex Medical Ltd. Both companies are medical communication agencies within the TL McCann Healthcare Group. Both companies have been successful for more than 10 years, with a varied and loyal client base of international pharmaceutical companies. Our new company, known as Caudex Medical Ltd, will be a major player in the medical communications market. Our core values provide clients with high-quality work and service allied to cost-effectiveness in products such as medical writing, editing, publication planning, meetings and conference management, creative design and production, multimedia solutions, training materials and strategic consultancy.

We have an effective mix of expertise and highly qualified people to ensure successful and creative design and implementation of our client programmes.

We are a forward-thinking and dynamic company and actively embrace change to ensure that we can meet our own and our clients' needs. The merger will help us continue to develop and move forward.

Description: Chez Accenture, nous aimons nous confronter à de nouvelles problématiques, trouver des solutions, repousser nos limites et réaliser ce qui n'a jamais été tenté. Entreprise internationale de conseil en management, technologies de l'information et externalisation, nous recherchons des collaborateurs talentueux pour relever ces défis. En rejoignant nos équipes internationales, vous innoverez et participerez ainsi à accroître la performance de nos clients. 
Responsable Relations Presse h/f, Paris 
Rattaché au Directeur de la Communication France-Benelux, vous avez un rôle de conseil et d’accompagnement en tant qu’expert des Relations Presse.

A ce titre, vous prenez la responsabilité de toute la communication avec les médias : stratégie, plans d’actions, media training avec les dirigeants, rédaction des communiqués… Vous assurez le suivi budgétaire, le contrôle des dépenses, l’évaluation de la performance et le retour sur investissement des opérations.

Diplômé d’une formation supérieure (Sciences Po, Celsa, ESC…), vous avez au moins 5 ans d’expérience dans une fonction similaire, en agence RP ou grande entreprise internationale de conseil/nouvelles technologies. Qualités relationnelles et rédactionnelles, autorité naturelle et capacité d’influence seront les garants de votre succès. 
Procédure de candidature : Merci de postuler en ligne sur www.recrute.accenture.fr en précisant la référence : ENT/RRP/CB/0406

Description: CITIGATE DEWE ROGERSON - Financial PR, Corporate Communications and Investor Relations

Financial – financial services, consumer identities, natural resources, industrial together with telecoms, media and technology and biotech/pharma

IPOs, M&As

Corporate reputation and crisis and issues management



PUBLIC AFFAIRS NEWS

01.05.07 PAN - Have won Multiplex account from Weber.
24.05.07 CDR website - formed 1999, merger of Citigate & Dewe Rogerson
31.05.07 PAN - Simon Nayyar joins to build a ‘full-service public-policy and regulatory practice’ for the financial and corporate comms agency. Start 11 June. He said he will have staff “from day one” and wants to open up in Brussels and Washington ASAP. He will report to CEO Jonathan Clare and run the new Citigate Dewe Rogerson Public Policy.
03.07.07 PAN - John Mullin is poised to team up with his former Edelman colleague Simon Nayyar at the new Citigate Dewe Rogerson Public Policy. Mullin will be tasked with launching an office for CDRPP in Scotland.
04.07.07 PRW - Edelman’s vice-chair of Brussels PA Thierry Lebeaux will oversee a new Brussels office for CDR Public Policy.
26.07.07 PRW - Simon Nayyar, recently installed MD of fledgling agency Citigate Dewe Rogerson Public Policy, was poised this week to find out if he will be a Conservative candidate in the next general election.  Nayyar has spent the last few weeks fashioning a bid to be the Tory candidate for Sunderland Central - a constituency that has been newly created as a result of boun­dary changes.
02.08.07 PRW - Lobbyist Simon Nayyar has vowed to continue with his quest to win a Conservative seat in the next general election after he missed out on becoming the party's candidate for the newly created seat of Sunderland Central this week.
30.10.07 PRW - Citigate Dewe Rogerson Public Policy has unseated Edelman to win the public affairs account for Lloyds TSB.
14.12.07 PRW - One of former deputy PM John Prescott’s key advisers is moving to public ­affairs with a senior role at CDR. Mick Halloran will join as a director.
07.03.08 PAN - The Freight Transport Association (FTA) has handed a major account to Citigate Dewe Rogerson Public Policy.  The appointment comes as the body fights the planned 2p rise in fuel duty that is scheduled to be brought in next month. The FTA previously used Edelman to handle.  Nayyar and Mullin report to FTA strategic policy and campaigns manager Jo Ingham

Description: Hi Nick, here is the clause:
13 ENGAGEMENT OF OUR STAFF 
You agree that you shall not engage or seek to engage any members of our staff. If you do engage a member of our staff within six months of their leaving our employment then you will be liable to pay an introduction fee as if this member of staff had been introduced to you as a candidate.

Thanks 
Katherine

Description: THE INCENTIVE GROUP OF COMPANIES LIMITED 

The Incentive Group of Companies Limited is located in London, England and has been in existence since 1977 

The core business is the supply of Business and Promotional Gifts to a variety of companies ranging from local businesses to major international household names. 

Current revenues are approximately £7m ($10.5m) per annum mostly generated within Europe Africa and the Middle East. 

The company acts as a prime importer of products and holds approximately £750k of plain product for marking, most of which is carried out in house by our own Operations and Print department. We have in-house capability for : 

Screen Printing, Pad Printing, Transfer Printing, Laser Engraving and Die Blocking. 

As a result we are able to respond promptly and effectively to client orders for standard items. In addition our internal Studio is able to generate designs, layouts and mock-ups for clients prior to product commitment, as well as generating product ideas to meet Individual client requirements. 

With many international customers we are experienced in handling difficult shipping tasks and our London location means we are ideally placed for obtaining documentation from international embassies and shipping by airfreight via Heathrow. 

With only a representative sample of items available on the web site please contact us with a detail of your requirements or ask for a catalogue.

company-document: com_CandidateBriefing.docx,com_Ketchum - signed terms Jan 2016.pdf,com_Ketchum candidate info.docx
company-note:
Description: 
http://2015ketchumyearinreview.com/ - useful link for candidates


Ketchum is part of the Omnicom group of communications companies – they are an international network with offices throughout the world. In terms of PR communications they have a number of different divisions including Food & Nutrition, Corporate, Technology and Healthcare. The consumer team is large – probably about 40 people and beauty makes up their biggest accounts. They have excellent training and HR facilities and offer continuous training at all levels. They also won the FT Best Working Environment award last year. I have attached a copy of their Benefits guide, as it is quite substantial and really sets them apart from some of the other agencies. I have also attached a recent newsletter that they sent out – just so you get a feel for the type of culture they have in place!  It would be advisable to have a good look at their website – www.ketchum.com

Consumer team: approximately 35 people

Ketchum Brief – Retained Business, March 2006 

Ketchum is a large, global Public Relations agency based in London City. They are part of the OMNICOM network. They have owned and affiliate offices around the world and work in the following sectors; healthcare, consumer, corporate & technology and public affairs. Most industries are represented. Healthcare is the largest team in the London office, with about 50 perm team members. 

•	Mostly ethical healthcare accounts, although some have a consumer focus (consumer media-focus) 
•	Main clients in healthcare are Roche, Wyeth and Proctor & Gamble for 2006. 
•	MD of healthcare team is Avril Lee. 
•	Large, open-plan offices, very trendy, Glass-building, good location. 
•	Roof terrace, with bar/restaurant, meeting rooms, great in summer. 
•	High-profile, ground-breaking accounts. Very large budgets. 
•	Healthcare division split into teams – about 5 people on each account.
•	HR function – good training & development, promotions, international opportunities. 
•	Cross-divisional brainstorming sessions. Try to integrate agency as a whole. 
•	Very sociable – company parties/drinks etc. 
•	Formal career development advice.
•	Opportunity to get involved with new business
•	Excellent benefits – see guide
•	Open to flexible working arrangements e.g. 4 day week
•	Friendly team, young and career-driven. 
•	Known as work-hard. Play-hard agency but this isn’t the case. Very flexible, rewarding. 

What positions are we working on? 

2 x Account Directors - £45K average
2 x Account Managers - £35K average

Accounts available to work on: 

•	Roche, Mab Thera drug. 
o	Launched product to treat non-hodgkins lymphoma
o	Global account
o	Post-launch work, including issues, consumer awareness, global outreach programmes, and disease awareness programmes. 
o	World events, including national lymphoma awareness day. 
o	Very creative account, US/European travel involved

•	Roche, transplant team – 2 products
o	Global account
o	Briefing local Roche teams around the world
o	Patient meetings – including children’s skiing events etc. 
o	Congresses planned in Rome. So travel involved. 

•	Martek, baby-formula. 
o	UK & Global account
o	Nutrition-based work – very popular area and account
o	US client
o	Lots of issues-based work as not allowed to promote baby formula over breast-feeding
o	Third party work – midwives/nurses groups
o	Lots of consumer media (glossy/womens)

•	Proctor & Gamble, intinsa-patch (women’s Viagra) 
o	Very confidential as not yet announced for launch. 
o	UK & European launch work
o	Very high-profile, media-focused. Ground-breaking to increase female sexual desire.
o	First product to ever be launched in this area. 
o	Launch at end of year, so lots of influencing to do before then
o	Consumer press, issues management and co-ordination with European affiliates, then actual launch. 
o	Massive account.

•	Wyeth, Embrel (drug for rheumatoid arthritis) 
o	UK & European account
o	Biological therapy – very cutting edge, post-launch
o	Creative work – consumer awareness
o	Third-party work

NB: 
•	Ketchum are open to what accounts people work on
•	ADs and AMs can decide if they want to focus on UK or International work
•	Other work includes
o	Sanofi Aventis, consumer work
o	Roche, Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) programme – worldwide, Access to Care and Treatment (HIV, Cambodia etc)
o	Tygacil – MRSA drug. UK/global. Lots of media work. Controversial subject. 

Things to focus on when selling: 
•	Variety of accounts
•	Lots of issues, awareness, consumer-focus, CSR work
•	Not just product-launches, lots of media influencing
•	High-profile P&G Intrinsa launch – this is set to be massive! 
•	Fast-paced, exciting work. Very rewarding. 
•	Travel or UK-based – very open to both. 

Type of Person: 
•	Out-going, interested in all areas of business, fun, career-focused.
•	Will consider people from most backgrounds: medical education, healthcare PR, in-house communications, even financial services! 
•	AMs get involved with line management of AEs, training and apprasials. 
•	ADs involved with directors meetings, training, recruitment, line management. 
•	Both report into a group account director or associate director.

Description: Munro and Forster is one of London’s leading independent PR agencies. Established in 1984, they are now 60 people strong, and have won over 60 industry awards. (They are the 2nd ‘most-awarded’ agency in the UK, according to PR week).
At the moment they are split into 4 main teams: Healthcare, Consumer, Political and Stakeholder Counsel, and Public and Voluntary Sector. Their client base focuses, broadly speaking, on health and wellbeing clients across all these teams. Main clients include Pfizer Consumer Healthcare, Kellogg's, Nestle, the Department of Health and the British Thoracic Society, to name but a few.
In recent months they have developed a very ambitious business plan, and are considering expanding their offering into more corporate comms. They will always be faithful to their status as a healthcare agency, but are looking to add to their team and take on people with broad corporate experience, and knowledge of CSR. The fact you have experience in both public and private sectors will probably be of interest to them.
The company culture is excellent. Staff are self-starting, imaginative, motivated and dynamic. Their offices in Vauxhall are open-plan and very friendly. Have a look at www.munroforster.com <http://www.munroforster.com/> 

Sam Mercer

Description: Resolute Communications is an award winning independent company established seven years ago in 2002 by Anna Korving and Paul Blackburn. They offer integrated healthcare PR and Med ed at a strategic level. With offices based in London and New York their work focuses predominantly on the European and Global market, they remain one of the top independent consultancies within the Healthcare sector.  Having recently sponsored the Digital Healthcare awards, Resolute are constantly looking for way to push forward and improve within the Healthcare space. Just 18 months ago Anna and Paul launched Purple Hat - a pure Medical Education consultancy.

With a thriving London and NY office they see 2010 as a growth year and hence looking to hire a senior level healthcare professional to sphere head a new unit within the business and help to grow and develop the overall offering within Resolute / Purple hat.

They focus heavily on creativity and drive and also primarily on managing and supporting their growing teams well in order for expand within the company. Anna and Paul are two dynamic leaders who have successfully carved a name for themselves within the Healthcare/Medical Education space. They are now looking for a creative, dynamic senior level strategist to join their team and drive the business forward.


 he office is large, open-plan and relaxed. The team is sociable, fun and close-knit, having experienced much success over the last few years. The atmosphere is relaxed and supportive; they put a lot into training initiatives, away-days and brain-storming.

Description: Fees: AS NORMAL

It is with leading agency Hill and Knowlton who are recruiting for their Consumer Tech and Entertainment arena. Hill and Knowlton are a leading PR agency based in central London. They are part of a larger group called WPP, which is an international communication PLC. They have an outstanding reputation in the fields of Healthcare, Public affairs, Technology, consumer and sports. They have a very strong client list with leading UK and international companies with leading block buster accounts to work on. They have fantastic training and are very supportive throughout your career. They offer good career progression, excellent benefits and share options. H&K are based in Soho square so it is a fantastic location and environment to work in

The nearest station is Tottenham Court Rd, Turn left onto Oxford street, and then 1st left again which should lead you into Soho Square.  H&K is on the left not far from Coffee Republic.

Sarah is the HR Director, so the interview will be more focused on your abilities, experience, ambitions and personality than it will be on strategic Technology PR questions. She will probably give you a good overview of H&K, their culture, type of work and the Consumer Tech team. She will really be looking to see of you would be a good cultural fit, so be prepared to give good examples of teams you have worked in, clients you have worked with, and any achievements. You will also be asked about what you enjoy most about your work and how you have overcome any problems/ challenges – work related. She will go through your CV, so be prepared to talk about you key achievements in Firefly and Kaizo. Also, why you want to move and what you want in the future.

 The best piece of advice I can give you is to have lots of really probing questions to ask her about H&K. Sarah is impressed by candidates who already know a bit about their work – any recent PR campaigns etc and who want to know more – i.e. seem interested in the company. As a company, H&K are very successful. They are part of the WPP group, and have two separate tech divisions.  They work across UK & International accounts, and work on big name accounts. They are young, vibrant and trendy and invest heavily in personal development. They like their employees to be down-to-earth, professional and not scared of taking on responsibility; they have office's around the world, and offer excellent international prospects – a good thing to “probe” about perhaps!

Agency IGrasp User Guide

Getting Started
•	Access site from internet address http://gs.globalsuccessor.com/agencyaccess
•	Type in ‘User Name’ and ‘Password’ – these will also have been supplied to you. They are case sensitive. You should now be in the IGrasp Homepage.

Accessing Job Information
•	Click on ‘Current Work’- this brings up a list of all the assignments you have been given.
•	Click on the ‘Ref No’ of the role to access details of this position
•	From the right hand menu 
o	click on ‘Position Details’ – this gives the basic overview of the position. 
o	click on ‘Description’ button will give further information on the role that may be supplied to the candidate
o	click the ‘Questions button to see if there are any Screening or any Application questions to be answered by the candidate
 
Adding Candidates to Jobs
•	Click on ‘Current Work’ to return to the jobs screen
•	Click on the ‘Ref No’ for the position you wish to add a candidate to
•	You may either add a ‘New’ or ‘Existing’ candidate.
o	To add a new candidate simply select this option and complete the form with full details. Press Save.
o	To add an existing candidate select this option and select candidate from drop down list
•	You will now be asked to ‘Upload CV’ for this candidate ‘browse’ to find the CV from your files and click ‘Attach’ Remember to SAVE once you have added a candidate.

	Please Note that all CV file names should contain letters and 	numbers only – no other characters or spaces should be used.

Changing your Password
•	To maintain security of data, you are requested to change the provided password to one of your choice. To do this click the ‘Your Details’ button and then ‘Access Details’ button. 

Additional Information or Queries
•	Click on ‘Client Dialogue’ this will allow you to add any further information regarding the candidate – remember to click on the Save button once you have done this.

New Positions
•	You will receive an e-mail informing you when a new role is available for your attention. Please remember to inform AstraZeneca if the e-mail account details change.

‘HELP’ ON RIGHT HAND MENU HAS DETAILED INFORMATION ON THE SYSTEM FUNCTIONALITY AND SHOULD ANSWER ALL YOUR QUESTIONS OR YOU MAY CALL THE ASTRAZENECA RECRUITMENT CO-ORDINATOR ON 01582 836288.

Do not use the back space arrow along the tool bar – please use the I Grasp navigational buttons instead

Description: Standard Terms & Conditions  11/09/2014

Amendment
	
3.	NOTIFICATION AND FEES

3.1	
	c)To pay the Agency’s fee within 30 days of the date of invoice.


3.4	The fee payable to the Agency by the Client for an Introduction resulting    in an Engagement is the amount equal to: 

Flat rate of 				20%
of the Remuneration applicable during the first 12 months of the Engagement.  VAT will be charged on the fee if applicable.

The above fee structure is subject to a minimum fee of £5000.


4.	REFUNDS 

4.1	In order to qualify for the following refund, the Client must pay the Agency’s fee within 30 days of the date of invoice and must notify the Agency in writing of the termination of the Engagement within 7 days of its termination.

4.2	If the Engagement terminates before the expiry of 16 weeks from the commencement of the Engagement (except where the Applicant is made redundant) the fee will be refunded in accordance with the Scale of Refund set out below:

	1, 2, 3 and 4					60%
	5, 6 and 7					40%
	8, 9 and 10					20%
	11,12,13,14,15 and 16			10%
4.3	In circumstances where clause 3.6 applies the full fee stated in 	clause 3.4 is payable and there shall be no entitlement to a refund. 


If the Engagement terminates within the first calendar month, the Agency will find a replacement Free of Charge (Clause 4.1 applies).


Bell Pottinger: Natalie Barone
Hanson Search: Alice Weightman

part of omnicom, like PWTDDB is one of the leading advertising agency networks in the world with 206 offices in 96 countries delivering creative business solutions across multidisciplinary platforms.

 

The network serves a range of multinational clients, among them McDonald’s Volkswagen, Royal Philips Electronics, Clorox, Anheuser-Busch, Johnson & Johnson, Henkel and ExxonMobil.  DDB offers its clients a full set of skills, ranging from traditional advertising to direct marketing, sales promotion, strategic consulting and digital marketing, through such business units as Rapp Collins and Tribal DDB.

 

DDB was founded June 1, 1949, by Ned Doyle, Maxwell Dane and William Bernbach as Doyle Dane Bernbach.  In 1986 it merged with Needham Harper Worldwide to form DDB Needham Worldwide, and in 1999 simplified its name to DDB Worldwide in recognition of its heritage and the global import of the DDB brand.

Jigsaw Research Limited was formed in 1998 by Ann Morgan, Sue van Meeteren and Jo McDonald - all of whom previously worked for Research International UK.

Jigsaw Research now has 16 staff: 14 research professionals and 2 operations executives.

Jigsaw Research was set up with 4 main objectives:

To provide excellent research and advice services of which we could be proud

To  work closely with a small number of select clients, who would value us and involve us in their business

To get back to focusing on client needs and doing market research (the reason we entered the business) 

To enjoy our work.

Established 1997

Description: Taken from meeting 9th Sept 2005

Company

-	Offices very modern open plan, funky with about 10 WPP companies in same building and own bar etc down stairs.

-	Part of Ogilvy Healthworld  group - oglivy pr is still a separate group.
-	Ogilvy Healthworld Med ED is moving to London.
-	They retain a small company feel but part of large company infrasture and benefits- therefore best of both worlds.

-	SHI have office in NY and London, but all report into the London office.  They share their P&L so work closely together rather than against each other as can sometimes happen.

-	London has 30 people and NY has 12 people

-	They have $5 million fee income

-	Established clients, with over 3 year’s relationship, therefore they offer a great consultancy service, where they can offer strategic long term advice.

-	60% of employees are AD and above as they want good senior people working on client business.

-	People work 2/3 accounts, so consultants can really get to know there clients.

-	Clients include Lilly, Pfizer, AZ, BI.  Most business is grown organically and SHI is the main agency for AZ.

-	Holmes report – they came 7th in Europe with PR companies for staff satisfaction

-	People can work for different companies – advertising, med Ed, Pr or different sectors.

-	10% of company is made up of people who have previously worked there.

-	Antonia the MD rejoined as she felt they were more client focused rater than fee focused.

-	Flexible about Part time people

Training 

-	At a senior level the offer fantastic training. – MD is on a 2 years management course where they go abroad for 2 weeks a year and meet with other directors / MDs in other companies.

-	HR run core skills – time management, social style, coaching
-	Ogilvy courses for creativity, mini MBA, live client projects

-	Also individual pharma marketing specific for SHI

Structure

Senior people are involved in client relationships and on the management board - they get involved in marketing, training, internal environment, specific training needs.

Currently looking for Ass £50 to £70K and a SAM person - £30 to £40K

Would look at people from med Ed or industry background.

Description: only tend to do meetings and write ups - not a full communication agency.

Description: Founded & founder background:
2001. I’m 31 and worked at one of the UK’s top tech/internet focused agencies before setting up Wide PR. I’ve also written for The Daily Telegraph as a freelancer
Client base:
Clients range from dynamic entrepreneurial companies to billion dollar international groups. They are concentrated in the areas of digital marketing/new media (e.g. online video advertising, email marketing, web design, online media buying) and business services (e.g. research, recruitment and even car valeting).
Clients are often the biggest in their field and past/present clients include:
1. The UK’s fastest growing research consultancy 
2. The world’s largest VoIP peering network, linking VoIP providers across the world (an international launch campaign) 
3. The UK’s first hazardous waste-only landfill operator (at the time of a controversial change in EU level - case study on our website) 
4. A top engineering recruitment company 
5. An industrial espionage specialist (always controversial - case study on our website) 
6. The UK’s most popular rewarded shopping portal (at a time when online shopping is booming) 
7. A world top ten real estate company (focusing on its post Tsunami reconstruction work in Sri Lanka and entering international awards) 
8. The UK’s largest outsourcing conference and exhibition 
9. The world’s top participation TV company (at the time of the national-level debate about phone in scams in 2007) 
10. Two top ten UK digital marketing agencies 
We’re doing more B2C work for them, which makes life more interesting. For example, we now do the consumer facing work for Motorclean, the UK’s second largest car valeting company (£19m turnover), which has included stunts targeted at a national and local media.
We also do international work - for example we conduct the US & UK PR for engineering recruitment specialist EPCglobal (£80m turnover), which has the largest database of engineers in the world.
Media relations is central to most clients although the weighting of activity varies. For example, for some clients arranging speaker opportunities, entering awards and copy writing is a substantial component of the mix.
Clients commend Wide PR on its intelligent and proactive approach (their testimonials are on our site).
Awards:
In the two years that we’ve entered the CIPR awards (2003 and 2006), we’ve been finalists. We’ll be entering again this year and will be looking to win after a run of campaigns with excellent results.
Direct to candidate brief:
Summary: 
Well paid, lots of variety and responsibility, promoting businesses in the UK and overseas using media relations and more. Clients love the agency’s intelligent and proactive approach.
Detail:
- You’re looking for more variety and responsibility at a central London agency recognised by its peers for outstanding work. 
- You want to deal directly with CEOs at some of the largest companies in their fields, and shape opinion about issues that make the national news agenda. 
- You’re just as keen to devise a communications strategy as implement it and are enthusiastic about harnessing digital channels for campaigns. 
- With 1.5+ years of experience agency-side of B2B, corporate, technology, marketing or internet sector PR, you’re highly organised and can write and think like a journalist. 
If this sounds like you, then get in touch and join a small team with a big agency attitude. You’ll have a salary review every six months and responsibility for developing junior

Description: We started with a staff of two from a flat in north London in 1997 - at about the same time that a computer first beat a human world champion at chess <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IBM_Deep_Blue> (random factoid for you there).
Our mission then was to get our clients to understand the power and potential of the web - and to send spinning globes down the drain - which were everywhere :)
That mission remains the same, though instead of spinning globes we're now helping our clients to get rid of senseless, gratuitous use of Flash and get real benefits from Web 2.0. 
We're now providing the best digital communications to clients around the world with a staff of more than 150 working from offices in London and Manchester in the UK and Sydney and Canberra in Australia.
Find out more about how you can benefit from our unique approach to digital communications - look at examples of our work </portfolio/default.html> or contact us </contactUs/>.

Text 100 is one of the most successful Global Technology Public Relations companies in the world today. We are currently expanding both domestically and internationally, and as a result of this growth we are looking for ambitious and tenacious candidates at both AE and AM levels for our UK office, which is based in West London. The successful candidates will have a proven track record in public relations, experience in the technology sector, and a general passion for the technology industry. In return, not only will you join one of the world’s largest technology PR agencies and work on some of the best-known technology brands, but we offer you a fun, creative and challenging professional environment where having a laugh over the pool table is as much a part of how you work.

DARWIN GREY OPENS LONDON OFFICE 
17 February 2007
In response to client requirements for integrated services, Darwin Grey has opened an office in London, at the home of Grey Healthcare, our sister advertising agency. 

Grey Healthcare London is home to a talented team of creative thinkers and strategists. By adding high-quality medical education capabilities to our London office, we can provide a truly integrated service and develop programs to meet the needs of our clients' brands.

Darwin Grey and Grey Healthcare are currently building breakthrough brands for Pfizer, Novartis Oncology, Ortho Biotech, Baxter, Nutricia, Organon, and Mundipharma, on a global and European basis.



Darwin Grey is a medical education company that provides the knowledge and experience to conceive and implement creative and effective communication solutions. You'll find us as ambitious for your brand as you are. We have expertise in cardiology, CNS, dermatology, endocrinology, haematology, HIV/Aids, immunology, infectious disease, medical devices and oncology. From our headquarters just outside Oxford, UK, we develop and implement strategies and programmes for preparing new products for market and driving their growth beyond launch. We also revitalise existing brands, unearthing and expressing the qualities that will set them apart from the competition and boost 

Darwin Grey is a UK-based, international medical education company. We're part of the Grey Healthcare Group, one of the world's largest healthcare communications agency networks and part of the WPP Group of companies.  We conceive and implement creative and effective communication solutions. You'll find us as ambitious for your brand as you are. From our offices in Oxford and London we develop and implement strategies to prepare new products for market and drive their growth beyond launch. We also revitalise existing brands, unearthing and expressing the qualities that will set them apart from the competition and boost sales.  We're a talented team of strategists, scientists, medical writers, designers, digital media experts, exhibition and event managers, working together to give great products all the support they need to become successful brands. As part of the Grey Healthcare Group, we're able to develop your brand nationally, regionally and globally, and position medical education within a comprehensive communication plan. 	
Service Overview
Few healthcare practitioners are genuine pioneers. Most are happy to continue to recommend and employ well-established therapies and treatments until evidently superior alternatives achieve widespread acceptance.  It's your job as manufacturers to develop these alternatives. It's our job as a medical education agency to present a compelling case for these products - a case that will persuade even the most conservative practitioners to adopt them. It starts with a coherent strategy, informed by a detailed understanding of the science: the condition your product treats, its effectiveness, and the performance and standing of your competitors.  If it's a product that's still in development, our role is to prime your target market for its arrival. Through a programme of events and publications, we'll raise the profile of the debate around the condition, identify the limitations of current therapies and, when the time is right, present the data supporting your product, with the endorsement of key opinion leaders.  To prepare your product for launch, we'll give it a distinctive, attention-seeking brand and a range of supporting materials. If it's an existing product that's underselling, we'll find out why. It may be that clinicians have misconceptions about it. Or it may be that other brands have marketed more effectively. But if it's a product you still believe in, we'll devise a re-launch strategy to set it on its way to capturing the market share it deserves.

Description: About Us
Burson-Marsteller is a leading global public relations and public affairs firm whose knowledge, strategic insights and innovative programs help drive strong corporate and brand reputations for its clients. We provide our clients with strategic thinking and program execution across a complete range of public relations, public affairs, advertising and other communications services. Through our proprietary research, we lead the industry in knowledge of and insights into the relationship between communications and the reputations of companies and their CEOs. These learnings are applied to our many and varied corporate clients. 

We concentrate on our clients and the industries in which they operate. Our diverse resources and unrivaled global network enable us to bring insight, innovation, creativity and superior value to every client assignment. Our clients benefit from a wealth of communications resources, state-of-the-art technologies, and award-winning professionals from a broad range of disciplines and backgrounds. Burson-Marsteller has a deep commitment to research, providing client teams with a strong understanding of their clients' industry and environment. 

We focus on delivering measurable business results to clients through a full range of consulting and communications disciplines: strategy development, corporate/financial, brand marketing, technology, healthcare, employee relations, media, public affairs, crisis management, advertising, Internet development and integration, and production. Burson-Marsteller companies include Marsteller (advertising, interactive, design and production), Direct Impact (grassroots marketing) and BKSH & Associates (lobbying).

Description: J D Associates is an established multimedia company with more than twenty years experience providing award winning communication solutions for leading UK and international healthcare companies. 

Founded in 1982, we originally focused on film and video production for the pharmaceutical industry. In the following years the service has expanded to include a whole spectrum of interactive software, Computer Based Training, Health Economic Models, Data Capture projects, ETMS systems, IPAQ Sales platforms, Company Dash Boards, Internet and Intranet systems, together with video, audio and print projects. Many of our programs are produced in numerous languages for distribution to the five continents.

The people we employ have mirrored this continuing growth and development of our activities. We now boast an in-house pool of experience covering strategic communications planning, health economics, project management, training, copy writing, design, animation and 3D design, software engineering, film production and web mastery. 

This highly motivated and enthusiastic team has contributed to a large number of award winning productions from bodies such as the British Medical Association, the New York International Film Festival and Communiqué. 

We are committed to innovation, to technical craftsmanship, and the achievement of a quality product that truly exceeds its objectives. Put us to work on your next project!

Description: Part of ENGINE GROUP.

SEE ATTACHMENTS FOR COMPANY PROFILE


NEWS

04.07.07 PRW - The agency has poached Connect Public Affairs lobbyist Theo Blackwell and Conservative aide Bill Morgan. Blackwell started at AS Biss this week, after less than a year at Connect Public ­Affairs, which he joined as a senior consultant.  Morgan, who joins next week, served for two years as special adviser to shadow health secretary Andrew Lansley.
04.07.07 PRW - won Network Rail account to promote its multi-billion pound station redevelopment programme for Eus­ton, Cannon Street and ­Victoria.
12.07.07 PRW - John Fraser joined AS Biss in April as a senior consultant, but left suddenly last month. He was formerly joint head of corporate and PA at the Energy Saving Trust. He is now freelancing at Westminster Council, saying: ‘I returned to agency life but found it wasn’t for me’.
06.08.07 PAN - The 30-strong UK consultancy has recruited US national Matt Decker to run the office, which is already open for business.  They are also planning to open an office in Brussels within the next few months.
30.08.07 PRW - is to lobby ministers to tackle spiraling insurance costs in the engineering industry on behalf of the Association for Consultancy and Engineering (ACE).
15.11.07 PRW - The AS Biss moniker is set to disappear from PR as the highly renowned public aff­airs agency merges with Rep­ublic PR.  ‘Mandate Communications’ has been launched this week and aims to be a ‘high-level corporate and stakeholder communications agency’. It has been formed as part of The Engine Group, which acquired Republic PR on 6 November. The Engine Group has owned AS Biss since 2005. It also owns Slice and advertising agency WCRS.
18.01.08 PRW - The organisers of the London 2012 Olympics have finally appointed Mandate following a four-way pitch. They will work closely with London 2012 Organising Committee of the Olympic Games (LOCOG) head of PR Joanna Manning-Cooper.
17.07.08 PRW - has a new account director; Katherine Morgan joins from the Treasury, where she was a senior policy analyst.
05.09.08 PRW - Business Link London has appointed Mandate Communications to promote its services to the capital's small businesses in the wake of the credit crunch.  Selected after a six-way competitive pitch, Mandate will provide both PR and public affairs support.  The eight-month cam-paign will be overseen by Mandate director Jonathan Lomax, who leads a four-strong team.
15.09.08 PRW - The National Federation of Property Professionals (NFOPP) has called in Mandate Communications for a major six-figure brief.  The agency will provide PR support to the trade association’s four divisions - the National Association of Estate Agents, Association of Residential Letting Agents, National Association of Valuers & Auctioneers and the Institution of Commercial & Business Agents.
07.10.08 PRW - The National House-Building Council (NHBC) has turned to Mandate Communications for a high-end five figure brief.  In 2001 Mandate won the public affairs account with NHBC. John Williams, associate director at Mandate, will lead both the PR and public affairs account.
10.10.08 PAN - Sarah Walker joins E.ON UK as senior PA Executive.  She was an AM at Mandate.

Description: 

The position is to be based out of Wimbledon, with our Corporate Accounts team, and will involve managing the accounts of our big Consultancy/Financial clients.

This will involve a high level of client facing work, going out, meeting the clients to agree SLA`s, tenders etc. This person will then be responsible for distributing their requirements out to all the consultants at Progressive, fielding their response, and pre screening for the client. This person  will also be incentivised to fill the jobs themselves via advertsing and cv sourcing.

The position is very similar to that of a Recruitment Consultants, but instead of the business development/cold calling element, there will be much more relationship management.

We are ideally looking for candidates with around 12-18months+ Recruitment experience who are interested in moving into a more client facing role. However, will will consider candidates with no recruitment experience, if they have over 12-18mnths sales and are very client focused. They must have a good level of business acuman, maturity and the abilty to give a polished, professional client meeting etc. But we are also needing them to have excellent organisational skills and be able to liase with consultants and screen cvs.

The basic will be between 18-22k with OTE of around 35-40k for the first year, with the potential for a car too

If you have anyone please send them to me asap as this is now my no1 priority!!

Thanks

> Lucy Morgan
> Internal Recruitment 
> Progressive Computer Recruitment
> Tel: 0208 971 8686
> <mailto:l.morgan@progressive.co.uk>

Description: Established: 1998 Status: Independent 
Number of Staff: 7 Staff 
Working on Healthcare Accounts: 6
 Non-Pharmaceutical Sectors

Our individual approach to medical education includes creating a wide range of targeted resources. These materials can be:
• International consensus documents and position statements
• Sole-sponsored journals, supplements and books
• Resource files and practical management guides
• Product guidelines and literature
• CDRoms and web-based initiatives
• Conferences and key opinion leader meetings
Written by health professionals for health professionals
Our rigorous editorial process and attention to detail guarantee that all materials have long-lasting clinical value with identified benefits for clinicians, patients and the sponsoring company. The independence of these materials is central to their acceptance by health professionals as credible and respected resources, enabling sponsors to build a strong partnership with the target audience. Current Client List:


3M Healthcare: Wond Care
 British Geriatrics Society: Conferences
 Coloplast: Wound care
 ConvaTec: Wound care
 Eli Lilly: Diabetes
 KCI Ltd: Wound care/therapeutic support surfaces
 Mölnlycke Health Care: Wound care
 Smith and Nephew: Wound care
 Stiefel Laboratories: Dermatology
 Wellards: Dermatology Portfolio of Opportunities: Medical Education Partnership would like to talk to you about your specific medical educational needs to develop long-term positive customer relationships and to enhance your healthcare communication strategy. We deliver intelligent medical education, written by health professionals for health professionals. We are committed to working in partnership with clients and health professionals to produce independent medical education resources that are fully compliant with the ABPI and used in practice. Previous Experience: <ALIGN=LEFTOur experience over the past 10 years covers a diverse range of clinical areas. Many of our medical education resources are intended for a global audience involving translation into multiple languages, including Japanese. In addition, we work with professional bodies to gain endorsement for international dissemination and to provide consensus on developing clinical expertise. The excellent relationship we have built with key opinion leaders creates opportunities for transferring expert knowledge into practice.<ALIGN=LEFT In-House Expertise: <ALIGN=LEFTWe have a wealth of practical experience across many therapeutic areas including cardiology, diabetes, dermatology, lymphoedema, neurology, obesity and wound care.

Description: Pacific International

www.pacific-international.com

Allan Smith and Richard Yorke are the MDs
Mike Sweatman is the Sales Manager

They were set up in 1997 in IT contact recruitment, there was rapid initial growth and they did really well during the .com era.

Now there are 4 main areas.
1)	Risk and Compliance 
2)	Business transformation (sigma) 
3)	IT tech, spot business (need 1 more person)
4)	IBM permanent account - need switched on good grads to learn (need 2 more)
5)	Health sector - technicians (radiographers etc) maybe someone in the midlands (maybe someone in the Midland

They have some big clients including Zurich, Bank of America, IBM, Sun Microsystems.

Very strong peer group ethos, and the environment is very much one of achievers.

Development is exceptionally good
-	mentoring 
-	record calls and go through them 
-	communications development
-	weekend away doing external training for the sales group
-	support network is strong within company right up to directors etc.

Company is in an evolutionary period, it is an exciting time to join, there are great opportunities to grow with a company that is growing into a significant player in the market place. 

There is a choice as to whether you build a team of work independently.

They deal with high value business, it is not an account management role.  It is a challenging environment, it is not just a sales role, you have to know the market and you will be trained within your sector.

They are looking to expand to Hong Kong / Sydney and there  are opportunities to travel to Germany, Switzerland etc.



The interview process consists of 2 stages.

1st Assessment centre
-	Presentation
-	Debate
-	General knowledge
-	Profiling questions

2nd Interview (2 hours)
-	1 hour on sales floor with consultant
-	1 hour interview

Don't delay after an offer has been made, they are looking for people who really want the job.

Salary

£17 500 - £20 000 (capped at £32 000)

Expected OTE - Year 1 = £35-£40
-	Year 2 = £70-£80

Commission structure
5000 = 5%
10 000 = 10%
15 000 = 15%
25 000 = 20%
25 000 + =25%

One second Year grad has taken home £180 k in his second year!

Description: red mat pay: 

 
All female employees with over 2 years service at the company ending with the qualifying week (ie the 15th week before the expected week of childbirth) are entitled to:
• A 10% top up on the government SMP pay of 6 weeks at 90%, so that you benefit from full salary for the first six weeks.
• 8 weeks full pay for all employees
• Full pension to continue for additional maternity leave
 
i don't know if the 8 weeks full pay is in addition to the 6 weeks statutory though? If it is that's pretty good!

Red meeting 

Send overview of who does what - JE action point 

Becky joint MD for Red
Always looking fir good people 
Am to AD mainly 

Do the full spectrum of health - want more ethical health currently but look at consumer background too.
Pharma - Candlemas cardiovascular, seriirsus , corporate, health innovations, data and access stuff, drug launches 
Currently more UK but also do global
Disease awareness and patient welfare
3/4 awards at communique
UK NHS blood work, online drugs campaign

Red Health is all Pharma and consumer but they do some on this wit the consumer team
Boots Is a big client that spans health and consumer

People that do well. Small and tight team within 
7/8 people without boots - core team 
Around 20 in total that focus on health in one form or another
Becky and Sophie Taylor-Roberts run it
Like a blend if uk/global/Pharma/consumer
Seperate divisions and targets but not PandLs, that is shared.
Although part of Huntsworth they operate very independently 

Desire to be and AD if they truly can demonstrate they have the skills to operate at that level.
They can get promoted at any point in the year
Training; ABPI training, info gathering, welhards come In to do talks, Inhouse training from CEO to board members, how to pitch, how to deal with tricky clients. Lunch and learns on various topics; how to get a drug to market, quite informal sessions. Health curiosity every quarter - go and do something as a team to meet their healthy curiosity, pop ip gigs, sexology exhibition, picnic i n the park 

Self defence classes, intro to coding, nutritionist - do company wide
Probono work with centrepoint / do sleep out every year, 10k run this year too,

This company has been created out of the MARTIN PALTNOI ASSOCIATES Group to cover the special services emerging from the identification, presentation and interpretation of key business intelligence in the public domain such as patent and product licence information.

Martin Paltnoi Associates (MPA) was established by its principal in 1973 offering over 40 years experience in field of market research and business intelligence.

Before creating MPA, Martin Paltnoi was one of the original team to set up the UK office of IMS in the early 1960’s as well as holding senior market research positions with leading pharmaceutical companies like Smith Kline & French and Lederle Laboratories.

When the MPA consultancy was set up it was not long before involvement in key business intelligence for the pharmaceutical and healthcare industries was established.

This resulted in the current reputation gained by Martin Paltnoi in the identification and interpreter of pharmaceutical patent intelligence on an international front.

MPA’s main driving force is to provide a “Value-added service” ; not only a provider of data, but also guiding clients in the interpretation and placement of that data in the marketing and corporate strategy framework. 



Martin is 69 years old. He is not recruiting at the moment and will not be for the next six months. However, he might be looking in six months or so.

Description: SEE ATTACHMENTS FOR COMPANY PROFILE

MEETING
AG and met Claire Sherry 
Happy with how we are servicing their account. Healthcare, Advocacy and Corporate PR/Consumer teams are doing well. Seem well stocked on healthcare, their advocacy team is very busy at the moment, lost Dan Gilbert to BIS as a Special Advisor. Really bright and will be hard to replace at the AD level. 

PA NEWS
18.05.07 PRW - Won Nationwide account
25.05.07 PRW - Won NHS Cancer Screening Programmes account from Trimedia HC, in a 4 way with Kinross Render and 90TEN.
30.08.07 PRW - hired two new lobbyists on the back of major account wins in the health sector earlier this year.  They have brought in Neil Gadhok (previously a senior PRO at the National Audit Office) as a senior consultant and Katherine Clifford as consultant.
21.02.08 PRW - The National Institute for Health and Clinical Excellence (NICE) is losing its communications director, Louise Fish, to Hanover.  She will join as an associate director.  At NICE she runs a comms team of 56.  She was previously at Fishburn Hedges.
19.05.08 PRW - Hanover has won Medical imaging firm Alliance Medical - currently the largest provider of MRI and other diagnostics to the NHS.  They will handle the company's press office, media relations, NHS marketing and public affairs activity.
09.06.08 PRW - won a contract to support Monitor, the independent regulator of NHS foundation trusts, to handle its communications activity.  Hanover is charged with handling media and stakeholder relations, and providing support in drafting and editing publications. It was awarded the account following a 7-way pitch.  They will report to Monitor director of public affairs and communications Rebecca Gray.
29.08.08 PRW - forming a financial advisory service.  The financial services arm will be headed by new hire Laura Chisholm. Chisholm joins as an account director from Cicero and is a former public affairs executive at HBOS and environment desk officer in the shadow cabinet.
10.10.08 PRW - hired a new senior consultant from Labour Friends of Israel. Rebecca Simon makes the switch to Charles Lewington's agency, having been deputy director at LFI.
13.10.08 PAN - Hanover have rejoined the APPC after controversially leaving in 2005.
